title: Space Jam: A New Legacy

reviews.content: I've been waiting 20+ years to the comeback of space jam, The first movie back in 1996 was a classic movie.And that is the most disappointing movie sequel I've ever seen. So shallow, so lame, where is the storyline?What about acting classes? What about respect for the audience?WB got lost with the years 👎🏻

The acting in this movie is so inauthentic. The whole film felt like one big money-grab. They knew the movie would do well financially because of the title and the characters. The finished product is just a huge mess.

reviews.review_title: Captures None Of The Fun Or Magic Of The Original
reviews.content: In 1996, the original Space Jam "had something", so to speak. Seeing Michael Jordan on the big screen interacting with the Looney Tunes was a first-of-its-kind sort of experience, and despite the ridiculous concept it worked perfectly. Sadly, this long-await sequel captures absolutely none of that magic or fun.For a very basic overview, Space Jam: A New Legacy sees Warner Brother's sentient artificial intelligence Al G. Rhythm (Don Cheadle) hatch a plan inside the "server-verse" to finally get the recognition he feels he deserves. Central to that mission? Abducting LeBron James and family to play in a high-stakes basketball game that pits father against son. Along the way, James must root out the old Looney gang for the epic court contest.I will readily admit that nostalgia for the original got me into the theater to see this sequel. Absolutely no doubt about that. However, I will not concede that the same nostalgia is preventing me from giving this one a better rating than 3/10. "A New Legacy" is just a bad movie, plain and simple, for numerous reasons...-Whereas Michael Jordan just had to show up and be himself in the original, here LeBron James is given the emotional heavy-lifting tasks. Predictably, it does not go well. He cannot believably convey a single emotion.-A lot of people are criticizing the decision to showcase so many WB properties (Harry Potter, Superman, Batman, Matrix, Game of Thrones, etc.) in this film. That didn't so much bother me, and I actually enjoyed the concept of a tongue-in-cheek poking fun at those topics. But it all comes crashing down when the finished product looks suspiciously like an algorithm-created property that the plot was trying to skewer!-The "Looney Tunes playing basketball" concept is no longer new (by virtue of the '96 effort), and nothing is done to spruce that avenue up whatsoever. Same old gags just replayed again. Also, the way we interact with athletes is so different now that James simply cannot command the cultural cache that MJ once did. Just having him physically present isn't enough like it may have been in the mid-90s.Overall, "Space Jam: A New Legacy" is a clunker, no two ways around it. It isn't the worst film I've ever seen (it got me to chuckle a few times), but it is almost completely devoid of any real emotion or fun, in stark contrast to its predecessor that is still considered one of the most fun films ever made.

The first Space Jam was corny and goofy, but it had its own unique charm and a simple yet acceptable plot that made the involvement of Jordan and other NBA players make sense as much as a cartoon basketball game movie could.This however is straight trash. It feels like one part feeding Lebrons ego, one part nonsensical abysmal story, and ten parts promotional work for everything WB owns.The plot involving a computer algorithm as the main antagonist that somehow sucks LeBron and his kid into a server and then forced them to play the sons video game creation is the most half baked idea I ever heard. The acting by almost everyone involved is the furthest thing from believable possible. The whole thing is a lot of cgi flashy nonsense and nothing of real substance. This is just an embarrassment through and through.
Nothing more than an idiotic vanity project. Don't waste your time or money.

So awful. Completely a self-serving vanity project with no thought for the paying public. Sad to see my favorite Looney Tunes charcters being degraded by their association with this movie.The story and characters are so superficial you don't care for either. LeBron could have been substituted by a piece of wood with voice-over, and it would have had more personality.Agree that the original Space Jam wasn't some deep profound artistic achievement, but it was at least quirky and fun. This new version was so commercialized and shallow, that became intolerably annoying when it became evident why this movie was made.It was made ONLY for grifting purposes by a bunch of grifters. So if you don't want to give your hard earned money to opportunistic billionaires, then skip this money-grabbing scam project (can't bring myself to call this a 'film').

Bow down, you are about to be brought before the KING. This movie is all about why you should love and praise LeBron. Forget about story telling, let's gather to witness the greatness that is LeBron. With a capitol G. This is a huge middle finger to the original Space Jam. Michael didn't have to shove his reputation down your throat because his reputation preceeded him. He's the best, that's it. LeBron tries to recreate that here artificially. He doesn't have the weight or presence that Michael had, so he's over compensating. Why make a second if it's not for story? Can Hollywood really profit off of such a failed story if they throw in some characters you know? Get ready for the commercial about LeBron that is space jam 2. Hollywood has become the employee that everyone hates because they hate their job and do barely enough to not get fired.

Not well scripted or acted. Hollywood needs to learn that highly paid pampered privileged athletes are not commanding endearing moments from audiences. If you want to waste money because you love LeBron go ahead...guarantee you will walk away feeling like you put money in a shredder!

Where as the Original Movie had a really cool spin to it combining the Toon World and the Real World this movie just...
stinks.First of all LeBron doesn't have any charisma or acting skills what so ever
second where as the first hat an intersting premise the premise of this is just terrible.Furthermore this movie feels like Warner Brother just wanted to Jam every single Character they own into one movie for the sake of nostalgia.Just: No.

Let's be honest: the original Space Jam was not a great movie. It holds nostalgia in our eyes because it starred the greatest basketball player of all time next to some of our favorite cartoons. However, the original Space Jam looks like a classic compared to this overly produced mess of a sequel.First off, let's get something straight. LeBron James is an amazing basketball player and he's very popular with young adults. However, he does not have the same aura about him that Michael Jordan did. MJ came at a time when being a celebrity wasn't so ubiquitous like it is now with the Internet and social media. Also, media is so fragmented now that we really don't have those "shared" experiences like we once did. EVERYONE knew MJ and the Chicago Bulls, basketball fans or not. I'm not sure LeBron has that same appeal. Also, even if people didn't like MJ, they respected him. Maybe it's because he gets political, or maybe because he switches teams, I don't know why, but LeBron is much more polarizing. Maybe it's just the cultural climate we live in today, but there are a lot of people who straight up don't like the guy.The second thing is how corporate this movie is. So many product placements and pseudo commercials all over the place. It takes people out of the story and makes it feel like you are just watching endless commercials for 120 minutes.Third, 120 minutes is way too long for families. 90 minutes or less. Kids loss attention after that. So do adults.This movie is fine if you are looking for something to do for 2 hours, but there are better ways to spend that time than watching a lukewarm, unnecessary, over the top commercial showcase designed as a sequel to Space Jam.

reviews.review_title: I just feel sorry for the actors
reviews.content: WOW.... I had gone into this reading all of the reviews, saying this was a terrible movie. They were right. This was hands down the worst movie I had seen in a long time. LeBron, please promise the world this is the last movie you will ever be in. Nothing in this movie is believable. I really feel sorry for actors like Don Cheadle and Michael B. Jordan who somehow got roped into doing this snooze-fest. My guess is that they were fulfilling some clause in their contracts or just owed someone a favor, because no one in their right mind would have read this script and used it for anything other than toilet paper. I will leave you with my last thought, as I was going to rip apart all of the scenes, but I thought I would leave this as a no spoiler warning. Anyone over the age of 10 should walk, no, run away from this movie.

This may be the most patronizing, soulless corporate hackery passed off as a movie instead of the near-two-hours commercial that it is for WarnerMedia IPs and its product-placement partners I've ever seen, and I've seen the first "Space Jam" (1996), as well as Steven Spielberg's "Ready Player One" (2018) that this sequel crassly rips-off. I was under the impression that I subscribed to HBO Max for new movies--not for advertisements to subscribe to the streaming channel I'm already subscribed to. At least, the original "Space Jam" made some sense; it was about basketballer Michael Jordan playing basketball to win his right to be paid for his brand against a slave-capturing amusement park, Moron Mountain... I said it only made some sense. In the pretentiously-titled sequel threatening a franchise, "A New Legacy," basketballer LeBron James plays a video game to win his right not to be digitized and turned into an obnoxious movie brand, but that's exactly what the real King James did in agreeing to do this obnoxious, digitized branding movie. Oxymoron Mountain.Besides Warners pretending to be against the very thing the fictional Warners is doing in its movie and what the real company did in making it--i.e. A faux indictment against what movie culture has become as brought to you by one of the biggest multinational conglomerates behind said culture--and James playing a character with more apparent character than his brand really has, we get the stupidest of father-son relationship dilemmas. Stop wasting time creating a game, son, and concentrate on playing this other game instead, and stop having fun, 'cause I'm the grumpy old man of throwing a ball through a hoop. All of it would be more tolerable, too, if the Looney Tunes were allowed to remain traditionally-animated cartoons instead of computer animations that are, then, turned into even-uglier computer animations. Or if weren't so cloying. Or overly hyperactive even for Looney Tunes. Cartoon basketball was bad enough, but overwrought video-game cartoon basketball as observed by every IP in WarnerMedia's vault--and that move as convincingly as the generic fans in an NBA 2K video game--manages to be so much worse.Even if a joke here or there is almost funny, it doesn't matter. (The best may be the Michael Jordan cameo, which I saw coming, but still wasn't bad. Most of them, though, involve more branding, such as cartoon James's fall creating a hole in Looney Tunes land the shape of the Nike swoosh logo, or his attempts to recruit DC superheroes, which are also owned by Warner.) That's because the entire thing is so ugly, hackneyed and ultimately insulting to the intelligence of the viewer-customer that it cannot be redeemed. A movie must have some underlying value--it needs a soul, to be forgiven. This one doesn't.

reviews.review_title: Inauthentic and unoriginal. Don't waste your time
reviews.content: Don't waste your time watching this. It's genuinely terrible. I struggle to understand how an actually awful film like this can get released. Surely executive producers/producers/writers etc couldn't actually have finished this and thought, "hey, this is great".It's a money grab and nothing else. There's nothing to save it either. The acting? Terrible. Direction? Terrible. Porky Pig rapping? One of the worst things I've ever seen.I wish I could give it 0 stars.

reviews.review_title: No laughs and no heart. Just a CGI salad
reviews.content: Barely coherent "comedy" that's not funny. Not thrilling, not suspenseful, not fascinating. There is no positive adjective to describe it. Just a B movie storyline with terrible acting. They could have made 5 blockbuster movies with that budget. Maybe if the "hero" of the story was a little more likable...

LeBron James worked hard to be the greatest and he's not about to let his son Dom be a slacker. Instead of basketball, Dom only wants to be a video game designer. WB's new computer algorithm Al G. Rhythm (Don Cheadle) wants to use LeBron's popularity to dominate the social media space. After LeBron rejects the offer, Al G. Rhythm kidnaps LeBron and Dom into the computer world. LeBron has to play a basketball game to win freedom for himself and his son. LeBron is sent to Tune World where he finds a lonely Bugs Bunny.LeBron is a functional actor and I like the older style Looney Tunes cartoon world. I love the Michael B. Jordan bit. I like some bits in this movie but it's way too long and too much of this is below par. The best part of this movie is Bugs Bunny in his Looney Tunes world and then they go off to various franchises to search for the rest of his friends. I like all of that. I like the animation style. Quite frankly, an animated LeBron James allows him off the hook for his acting. His voice is unique and works well for animation. Turning him in cartoon is a good thing. He doesn't have to act. He should stay a cartoon until he wins the game.His son Dom is a big problem. He's a brat. The excuse is that he gets enticed by Al G. Rhythm but it's a sorry excuse. At no point is he concerned about being in a computer simulation or about his father. The solution lies in Al turning Dom into a monster. When LeBron has his big emotional speech, Dom can slowly turn back into a boy looking to hug his father. That is much better characterization and progression in his story arc.Finally, this movie is hella busy and way too long. It is almost two hours long. The game is almost an hour long. They need to cut out at least fifteen minutes if not more. There is so much chaotic action that the long game section grows tiresome. People are excusing this for being a kids movie. Some of these references are going right over those kids' heads. They are not going to get A Clockwork Orange. For people who get all the references, this is bad for them. For kids who don't get the references, there's no point to it. This movie has fun bits. I love the Looney Tunes animation section. I don't like them digitized into computer animated. The plot is bad simplistic writing. The father son conflict could have been done better. This is way too long and that pushed me over the edge.

Possibly one of the worst films I've seen this year.LeBron can't act to save his life, and it feels like the film was just made to appease his massive ego.I only gave it 2 stars because the animation was well done, and Don Cheadle as the villain had some chuckle-worthy moments.

Space Jam was the epitome of the 90's child life. It was corny, Michael Jordan couldn't act, but it had its charm. This movie was absolutely atrocious. LeBron is so wooden it's just obnoxious. I can honestly say this was one of the worst movies ever made out side of the way they pieced together the other Warner brothers properties. Still would never watch again.

reviews.review_title: This "film" epitomizes everything that's wrong with the film industry today
reviews.content: Films today rely on quick plots, with little to no character development to draw in movie goers who'll spend their hard earned cash on some awful excuse for a picture, so that the movie studios can make their profit. They don't actually care if the story is good or not, just what will they get back for their investment.And that's what this film is in a nutshell. Not a single person who worked on this "film" cared if it's good or bad. I can literally picture them sitting around a table at one of Warner's offices saying "how are we going to steal their cash?". There's NO saving grace. The acting is awful, and that's putting it nicely. The direction (or lack there of) is just as bad. It's a directors job to push the actors to get the most out of them. However, Malcolm D. Lee evidently didn't care, as the final product is trash. Then again, what was I expecting from the director of Scary Movie 5? Oh and don't get me started on the "comedy" (palms face).Lets call this what it really is, a cash grab. I even took my nephews and niece (who're young) to see this and they didn't even like it. They threw Looney Tunes in there because hey it worked once, why not spoil an old films legacy like Hollywood loves to do with lame remakes.I feel most bad for Don Cheadle. This Is a huge stain on what was a respectable acting career.Please do better.

This trash is hardly a movie. Just one long commercial for LeBron, advertising, and product placing. Simply put, it's all a money grab for the elite companies to cash in on. What a shameful world Hollywood has become. Sad part is, Lebron's ego won't let him realize how bad this is. He will literally think it's Oscar worthy. How many times does he have to have his name mentioned!!

reviews.review_title: One of the worst kids films I've seen
reviews.content: The cinema was full and for 2hrs not a single laugh. Dead silence in there. Poorly written and could've been so much better. LeBron James should never act again. However after all that, my kids said they liked it! If you're an adult that remembers the wonderful Looney Tunes characters, i feel you'll be so disappointed. Get your partner or babysitter to take the kids and dodge this.

reviews.review_title: Obsession with pop-culture overrides everything else in this forgettable adventure
reviews.content: There wouldn't be many proclaiming from the rooftops that 1996's Michael Jordan/Loony Tunes starring Space Jam is a cinematic masterpiece, but there was an undeniable and energetic charm to that real life/animated hybrid that ensured it became not only a box office hit, but a beloved childhood favourite for many children of the 90's.Operating at the peak of his world dominating powers, Jordan made for a fun leading man in the chaotic toon filled basketball filled escapade and established his legacy as a once in a lifetime athlete and pop culture phenomenon but wanting to prove his metal as a claim to the throne of the true GOAT of the NBA world, Lakers superstar LeBron James spearheads this modern day take on the Space Jam brand with A New Legacy, a likely box office beast that sadly lacks any of the charm or spark of the original, as you can't help but feel as though Malcolm D. Lee's film is nothing but a James love-fest moulded in with a dream Warner Brothers marketing department idea that is going to make some serious money for the company over the coming months/years.To be fair, A New Legacy isn't a complete write-off, upon initially hearing about another Space Jam taking shape under the guidance of James and Black Panther director Ryan Coogler's hand as a producer, one would've been sane enough thinking things could only turn out very badly for all involved but Lee's film isn't bereft of decent ideas and fun moments that come and go through its close to two hour run-time and there's a nostalgic joy getting to once more see the Loony Tunes gang get a moment in the spotlight but thanks to James's atrocious acting skills, a big collection of flat jokes and an incessant push from the film to cram in as pop culture references as it can allow, A New Legacy is more often than not a chore to sit through and one that potentially will bore its young audience rather than capture the imaginations of them.Seemingly taking inspiration from Ready Player One's rulebook, once James gets sucked into a computer-verse run by Don Cheadle's delusional A. I Al G. Rhythm and forced to compete in a world changing Basketball match against his own son whilst reuniting a disbanded group of Loony Tunes members, there's an obsession with A New Legacy to throw everything at as from a cameo point of view with everyone from the Joker, Mad Max and Harry Potter getting a run (or strangely enough for a kids film Austin Powers or A Clockwork Orange) and when the film resorts to scenes such as Porky Pig in a rap battle or James and Bugs Bunny going into the Matrix you really do start to wonder what the film is trying to do or who its trying to do it for?Thankfully for us and for James's reputation he ends up spending half of the film in animated form, saving us from more high school level of acting talents that would've further dampened A New Legacy's struggle to find itself and stand on its own two legs, as it ends up feeling like nothing more than a reminder to us all that James is the greatest athlete on the planet (did you know?) and that you should probably buy some his or Warner Brothers merchandise if you haven't already.Final Say -Saved by a few imaginative scenes and a welcome return from the Loony Tunes gang, Space Jam: A New Legacy suffers badly from Jame's poor screen presence/acting ability and an inability to find its own identity amongst its endless procession of nods and winks to other properties and brand names.2 cases of mistaken identity out of 5.

This is (for sure) the worst movie of 2021. It would a be Herculean labor to make something worse to this. It's like watching a new "Live Service" Movie-era. The reason that I dislike Fortnite is the reason that I dislike this movie. Boring and soulless !The "greek salad" type-movies need to stop. Only Wreck-It Ralph (2012) managed to do this just once. Ralph Breaks the Internet (2018), Ready Player One (2018) and Space Jam: A New Legacy (2021) are just an ode to corporate dominion and greed. They imprison IP names created with love and pathos and mash them together to earn money. Nothing more, nothing less.
My kid is getting kidnapped and I will "play" basketball to get him back? Gtfoh 👎👎👎 bad script bad acting...
This film is unnecessary. The original had heart and humor. This is just loud and obnoxious. Bron's acting is unfunded high school play quality. I'd give it a negative grade if I could. Stay away.

reviews.review_title: Good animation but pretty lame movie.
reviews.content: This movie was absolutely AMAZING at being lame. Movie had good animation and that's all so I'll give it that. The acting and lines were just bad. Actually it was horrible. No joke, even the Looney Toons acting was bad. How do you screw that up? Wasn't even funny. I seriously don't think I laughed once. The first Jam was WAY better and this was nothing like it. This movie is literally probably good for kids under 5 years old who laugh at anything and wouldn't notice the horrible acting and hack job they did on the Looney Toons. Not good enough for me to watch it again that's for sure. We watched for free on HBO Max, It's definitely not worth paying theater money for.

This honestly, was the worst Big Budget movie I have watched in my life I kept thinking throughout the movie as they went to different Warner Bros Properties, what will they interfere with next? And then I heard the Wonder Woman theme and and I almost had to turn of the TV because I was disgusted to watch.I disagree with people saying the movie was just a 2 hour advertisement because it wasn't. The movie was just a complete Cliché.The plot is so generic and boring that I can not tell if the writers were trying to make it a cliché or they were just that bad. This movie is going to make a lot of serious movie fans angry. Mad Max Fury Road Cameos, Matrix Cameos. Only one good thing I can say about this movie because I wanted this review to be fair. The CGI was great. Some of the best I have seen in a while. But still not worth it. This is the kind of movie that people Boo at the credits in the theatres which I guess is good for Warner Bros Because nobody is going to see this Vile Garbage in a Movie Theatre because its free on HBO.

Overlong and unfunny, Malcolm D. Lee's 'Space Jam: A New Legacy' is no slam dunk. In contrast to 'Space Jam' (1996), which successfully integrates Michael Jordan with Looney Tunes cartoon characters, the screenplay for 'Space Jam: A New Legacy' frequently ignores the presence of Bugs Bunny and his companions. These animated figures are just referenced in passing and never play a significant role in the storyline of the film.

Self praising LeBron, you LeBombed👎
A New Legacy, you mean a TERRiBLE Legacy!What was this? MJ would be splashing Tabasco in his eyes after this.
The visuals are great but the story is droll and I lost interest pretty fast, no nostalgic ties and Don Cheadle who is a phenomenal actor is a terrible villain.

reviews.review_title: Michael Jordan was a WAY better basketball player AND and actor, not even CLOSE!!! THIS IS TERRIBLE!!!!
reviews.content: Lebron cant act I mean its embarrassing to watch, Michael Jordan wasnt a great actor either but he had charisma and a presence and he was the ultimate showman in pretty much everything he did. The NBA doesnt have an MJ, or a Doctor J, Karl malone. They were great at basketball AND great showman!! Or and MAGIC!!!! Do yourself a BIG favor skip this cash grab garbage and go watch the original. 25 years for this????? We still have pixar and DreamWorks!!! Warner brothers is making some seriously BAD decisions might be to little to late!!

reviews.review_title: Trash WB quick money grab keeps bashing on fans
reviews.content: No soul on this one, it's the new WB order all over again making fun of the fans and making quick money for those super villain executives.

Like really? So much advertisement and commercial put about this film, how's going to be great, even the name " A new Legacy" and everything for this? Really disappoited. It didn't bring anything new, whole concept looked really poor and average, the only part which was kind of nice that they've put whole DC Movies personages here, I liked this idea. But everything else, despite this, was hideous. If they didn't have idea how to create second part maybe it wasn't necessary? One of the worst movie of 2021 so far.

reviews.review_title: The movie itself was terrible. LeBron was just another reason why
reviews.content: One of the worst movies I've ever seen. Nothing redeemable about it. A few people giving it a good score claim the people not liking the movie are just anti-labron, but the truth is the movie is just really really bad.My guess is the people giving it a good review are just woke people who don't understand how movies are supposed to work.
Lebron already said it in the movie, "it's the worst idea I've ever heard", but, you see, nobody believed him ...

It's a rare occurrence when the kiddos and I aren't on the same page when it comes to movies. It seems as if animation studios have learned to cater to adults as well as children when it comes to kids' movies, and that's a great thing as a parent. But then a movie like Space Jam: A New Legacy comes along which gives parents nothing to grasp on to and makes you feel every minute of its excessively long two-hour running time. As for the kiddos though, they absolutely loved it!In Space Jam: A New Legacy LeBron James basically plays an exaggerated version of himself, treating his two boys like basketball teammates, rather than acting like a father, in a very overbearing and demanding way. Although one of his children likes playing basketball, his youngest Dom (Cedric Joe) would rather stay in his room building video games. LeBron is having none of it and demands that Dom constantly practice as well as attend an upcoming basketball camp. It is then, after a series of strange events, Dom & LeBron get sucked into a computer program run by Al G. Rhythm (Don Cheadle), with their only hope of returning to the real world if LeBron can beat Al G. In a basketball game. It may sound easy, but with James only having Looney Tunes characters as teammates and Al bringing in NBA & WNBA stars on his team, this may be a game that LeBron can't win.THE GOODNot a penny has been spared in making this one of the most colourful, beautifully animated features ever seen on film. Animation has come a long way from 1992's original Space Jam and in this sequel of sorts, all the usual Looney Tunes characters return, but this time, have been given a 3D-style makeover. If only some of that money was spent on producing a decent script!Mr. 10: This film was awesome. I loved seeing all the Looney Tunes characters come to life and seeing Porky Pig rap was my favourite. There were also lots of funny jokes, which was good too.Mr. 7: All the Looney Tunes characters are so silly and it's really funny when they're constantly fighting with each other. I like how they all team up together to play basketball against the bad guys.THE BADWith a script that sounds more like a Public Service Announcement, rather than an entertaining movie, I actually thought I was listening to something that a bunch of sixth-graders had put together rather than a Hollywood movie. While a lot of animated movies may cater to adults this film does not even bother, keeping everything low-brow and very childish from start to finish. I have no problem with this because my kiddos loved it, but what I don't understand however is just why you'd bizarrely put in scenes from The Matrix, Mad Max, and Casablanca. Mr.10 and Mr. 7 were continually leaning over in their chairs asking me what all these strange scenes were. Not only were kids not born when these films were originally released but they're not even in the age range to watch these films NOW!Mr. 10: The only part of the film I didn't like was Al G. Rhythm because he didn't make any sense. Sometimes he's really strong and then sometimes he's really weak. If you run the computer program shouldn't you always be strong?Mr. 7: I didn't like the bad guy because he kept changing the rules so he could win and LeBron would lose. It didn't seem very fair.THE UGLYIf you want to see a film whose main reason to exist is based wholly and solely to market toys to kids, then Space Jam is that film. From start to finish there is always a product brand, toy, or game perfectly positioned on the screen to face the audience with a character on the screen saying something along the lines of "hey will you pass me that LeBron James branded basketball?" 'Yes, I can pass you this LeBron James branded basketball'. This may be a slight exaggeration but watch this film and you'll get my drift.I knew that Space Jam: A New Legacy wasn't going to be good but I just didn't expect it to be that bad. From wooden acting (by the human cast) to Looney Tunes characters with voices completely different than the ones I grew up with, this movie was quite the slog to sit through. In saying that though, my kids enjoyed every minute of it and I'm happy to admit that not every film is made for me.TWO AND A HALF LEBRON JAMES BRANDED BASKETBALLS OUT OF FIVEMr.10: This film was awesome. The Looney Tunes characters were really funny and it was great to see them all team up together. Porky Pig was the best. Four and a half out of five.Mr. 7: I liked seeing all the Looney Toon characters turn from cartoon to 3D and they were all really funny. But I didn't like how long the film went for or the bad guy. Four out of five.

reviews.review_title: Only for kids and those easily suckered into crossovers
reviews.content: As someone who grew up with the original, I was very disappointed with this so-called "sequel". LeBron James is a horrible actor (Michael Jordan was as well, but at least he made it believable), the film is basically a shameless crossover, which becomes its only selling point, and unfortunately, the film lacks the heart and charisma that made the original Space Jam a cult classic. Only recommended for kids or those who are easily suckered into crossovers.
Wow. What a miserable movie. I've never seen anything like it in my life.I also hope to never see anything like it ever again, and I wish I could unsee what I HAVE seen.

reviews.review_title: I've never seen anything like this film, and I hope I never do again.
reviews.content: This was honestly one of the worst things I've ever seen. I'd rather watch 2 hours of literally anything else.Not a LeBron hater, but this kind of made me want to be.

Space Jam: A New LegacyBasketball wiz LeBron James is having problems with son Dom, who is more interested in computer games than basketball. On a trip to Warner Brothers, computerised mastermind Al G Rhythm sucks them all into the WB server to play Dom's computer game version of basketball.If you saw the original Space Jam then there are no huge surprises here. Let me start by saying that the animation - both traditional hand-drawn and CGI - is terrific, as is the integration with live and CGI backgrounds.LeBron James can't act and doesn't come across well as the fictional version of himself. It takes forever for the story to get going - I had a couple of small boys in front of me, hyper with excitement, and Mum took them out after half an hour because the film simply hadn't captured their attention at that point.I didn't dislike the film, but it did a Ready Player One with characters from various WB franchises and, during important sequences, I was concentrating on spotting characters in the audience for the game rather than concentrating on plot.

"Space Jam: A New Legacy" was not a movie that I was in any particularly rush to get to go and watch. But since my 11 year old son wanted to watch it, of course I found the time to go watch it with him.And while my son definitely enjoyed the movie, I must admit that I was not overly thrilled with this 2021 movie from director Malcolm D. Lee. "Space Jam: A New Legacy" is definitely a movie for the youngsters.Needless to say that this 2021 movie turned out to be as I had initially expected it would. And "Space Jam: A New Legacy" didn't really offer me much of any worthwhile entertainment or enjoyment.Visually then "Space Jam: A New Legacy" is definitely spot on, because the animation and art style used here is good and pleasing to the eyes. And there is no secret about the fact that it is the animated cartoon characters that carry the movie singlehandedly. It should be said that there are so many interesting characters and things going on in the background that "Space Jam: A New Legacy" could actually be watched twice; the first time for the movie alone, and the second time to take in all the background stuff. There are so many cameo from lots of different movies.Storywise then "Space Jam: A New Legacy" wasn't really impressive. And it certainly didn't manage to entertain me in a wholehearted manner. However, it is sort of impressive that six writers could collectively manage to come up with so little. The storyline told in "Space Jam: A New Legacy" just failed to captivate me and didn't offer much of any enjoyment or entertainment in comparison to the 1996 "Space Jam" movie - which was no masterpiece, but at least it fared better than the 2021 movie.As I mentioned above, then it is the animated cartoon characters that carry the movie, no doubt about it. But even with the likes of Don Cheadle and Sonequa Martin-Green on the cast list, there wasn't much to do. Then there was LeBron James instead of Michael Jordan; and boy that was just horrible to witness because he was fully stripped of anything even remotely to an acting talent."Space Jam: A New Legacy" is a movie for the youngsters, pure and simple, and aside from being nice visually, then there was nothing much to behold here.I am rating "Space Jam: A New Legacy" a less than mediocre four out of ten stars.

reviews.review_title: A bombastic mess with great animation
reviews.content: Computer animation and special effects sure have come a long way since '96 because this movie looks fantastic. Unfortunately that's all folks (for the positives) because this '21 sequel is a bombastic mess, void of anything new and aside from the "server-verse" angle, it's not good.The original was never a masterpiece but it was just that - "original". The six writers decided not to actually write a movie and instead just copy "Ready Player One" by scouring and unloading the entire Warner Bros intellectual property catalogue on the audience to overload the senses and mask how unoriginal, unnecessary and contrived this all is.Lebron James and the cast put in a solid effort with what they've got to work with, especially Don Cheadle as the villain.The trouble with "A New Legacy" is that there isn't a story to warrant a sequel, let alone the whopping 115 minute runtime. The original was a swift 87 minutes which served as a celebration of Michael Jordan's return to basketball at the height of his popularity - it was lightning in a bottle!Kids and basketball fans who love LeBron James will surely like this movie. As previously said it looks great. It does hit the funny bone more than once, it has a soundtrack too and for some people that might be enough to call this a good time. If this were original and the first one I'd be more flexible in my rating but it's not. I've seen this movie before - it was better the first time.Bill Murray, you the real MVP!3/10.
LeBron is not MJ and this is a mess. Product placement over plot. Kids wanted to leave 10 minutes in.

reviews.review_title: Daffy Duck Needs A New Agent
reviews.content: This didn't need to be nearly 2 hours long.LeBron James makes Michael Jordan look like a good actor.Needed less LeBron James and more Looney Tunes.More Daffy Duck required.

Space Jam: A New Legacy (alternatively Space Jam 2) is a 2021 fantasy comedy sequel starring Lebron James,Don Cheadle and Zedaya as the new voice for Lola. Lebron James plays himself who's son Dom is a whizz at creating video games. However when Lebron and his son visit the Warner Bros world they are both sucked into the Warner Bros software by an A. I named Ali G(Cheadle), Lebron must team up with the Looney Tunes to get his son back before its too late.There is alot of hidden references from this film from past and present Warner Bros films from Wonder Woman to Batman to even the likes of Iron Giant,The Flintstones and of course The Mask. As well as this we have hidden worlds from Game Of Thrones to Harry Potter to Gotham City. It was nice too seeing hand drawn animation too as well as CGI animation.If you love Ralph Breaks The Internet and Ready Player One than you will love this film.There's a hidden cameo from Sarah Silverman and Micheal B Jordan as well as Mike Myers as Austin Powers.

Space jam a new legacy is a pretty ok movie. I wasn't really a fan of the story that much. In my opinion not as good as the first movie but I recommend watching if you've seen the first space jam or if you love the looney tunes 👍

reviews.review_title: A drug trip that feels more like a nightmare
reviews.content: "Space Jam: A New Legacy" has so much stuff in it that it just makes a film that feels tiring.The good in this movie is of course the visual effects. They are fantastic, and are just popping with color. Some of the jokes also got a laugh, and I loved how there was so many brands being put in with the characters. It made it so funny.But that's about it with the positives. This movie drags on for so long that I started to get very bored at times. Most of the jokes are pretty unfunny, and the cameos are just too much. Lebron James unfortunately, didn't give that great of a performance. He tried way too hard and it didn't work. The brands too just got very annoying. It feels like that was all the movie cared about and it just got very annoying.Overall despite some fantastic effects, and some cool scenes, "Space Jam: A New Legacy" is too long, not very funny, kinda cringe, and also at times can be very boring. This is not a slam dunk.
Lennon is the worst actor , not in the least bit engaging , the rest of it is ok at best .

reviews.review_title: I wish I would have gouged my eyes out with an Ice Cream scoop and plugged my ears with them...
reviews.content: It's trash like this that makes Game of Thrones Season 8 look like it had a great script with tight narrative logic.Lebron: just only ever play Basketball. You don't need anything else. ISN'T THAT A THEME IN THIS 2-HOUR LONG COMMERCIAL FOR YOUR EGO?!!!

This movie sold products and movie franchises from beginning to end. Hardly a space jam movie. Mentioning Warner Brothers studios several times is a horrible look. WHO CARES... stop selling ads and create an actual movie. Only highlight was a Bobby Knight reference that I bet 1% of all viewers actually recognized. Horrible acting, subpar character development, and skimpy plot. So sad to see Space Jam fall so far.

NBA Champ LeBron James goes on an epic adventure side by side with Bugs Bunny and a whole gang of undisciplined Looney Tune characters. It is a manic mashup of two worlds trying to show staid parents how to try and connect with their computer savvy kids. A basketball gem between LeBron and the cartoon characters against a heavy powered roster of pro ball players.Along with James appears, Jared Sullinger, Don Cheadle, Sonequa Martin-Green, Cedric Joe with announcer Ernie Johnson doing the play-by-play. Zendaya is the voice of Lola Bunny and Jeff Bergman voices Bugs Bunny and other cartoon characters.Is there a hidden agenda here to change attitudes and opinions of LeBron?

reviews.review_title: Not as good as the original film with Michael Jordan but kinda fun
reviews.content: LeBron James isn't that good of an actor but the rest of the film was kinda fun. Love seeing the looney tunes and all the pop culture references, it was kind of like Ready Player One.But the original 1996 film will always be the best.

reviews.review_title: Possibly one of the worst movies I've ever seen
reviews.content: The title says it all. A complete mess from top to bottom. Nothing saves this calamity. Horrific.
That's all that matters. That first one wasn't all that great either. It's a kids movie that the kids might enjoy if they're into basketball or pop culture.

This is beyond awful. Unless you want to raise stepford children I'd pass. This is what happens when you get too many egos and too much money together and not a wit of ingenuity and talent. Plus, they're playing off the success of a film that was 25 years ago. The target audience of then are now young adults. Any adult that finds this entertaining should seek professional help immediately. And even worse, space jam of the 90s went a long way toward bridging race relations. MJ was a hero to my youngest and the main reason why he got interested in basketball but without the genes, it was more passion than personal reward. Still it was funny to watch this little white kid go up and hug a full size posterboard in the mall. Kids from everywhere, who probably knew nothing of basketball and MJ's record, fell in love with the movie and the characters anyway because it was a genuine story, not a marketing gimmick. Will this remake appeal to children, sure. Same as a diet of pop tarts, chips, soda and candy.

reviews.review_title: LeBron's new Space Jam falls short of the original
reviews.content: Space Jam: A New Legacy trades the heart and soul of the original film for what seems like a corporate tour of WB's IP branding.

reviews.review_title: Terrible, terrible, film. Two hours of your life you won't get back.
reviews.content: In short, this makes the first installment, which was no masterpiece by any stretch of the imagination, look like The Godfather.Everything about this movie is just wrong. It only exists to highlight the greatest hits of Warner Brothers and its subsidiaries.Don't waste your time and/or money on Space Jam.

reviews.review_title: Space Scam: The 2 hour Warner infomercial/LeBron ego trip
reviews.content: I turned it off after 20 minutes!(surprised myself I stuck around THAT long)I am glad I caught this on HBO Max, otherwise I would have asked the theater manager for a refund!To get the bad taste out of my mouth, I am now canceling HBO...again and HBO Max...again!!

Warner Brothers have been itching to do a sequel to 'Space Jam' for years, perhaps even more so since the following Looney Tunes film ('Back in Action') didn't really capture the publics imagination in the same way.So here we go, 'Space Jam 2', that pits LeBron James now against cartoon bad guys in a Basketball game for reasons far too complicated to go into here.The first film wasn't great, but it had a charm about it. This one instead goes for all out tech trickery and shoving lots of Warner Brother's IP's down our throats in the hope that something sticks. The less said about the new version of Lola Bunny the better too.It's fine, it's enjoyable enough, but certainly not memorable.

reviews.review_title: i was forced to watch this
reviews.content: All I'll say is I told you so...Last Words: It's complete hash.

Ok, was it the greatest movie? No, but come on! It's not a 1/10 either. It was entertaining enough. Was it MJ? No, but it was still an ok movie. It had all the Loony Tune characters, plus several other Warner Brother characters. It was a little long, but I think it's better than what people are giving it. I am glad I saw it, just give it a chance.

reviews.review_title: Not great but what do you expect from looney tunes
reviews.content: My wife and I enjoyed it for what it's worth. You can't take this movie to serious because it's a cartoon! For those of you who didn't like this. What did you expect from this? Even the real actors didn't take this that serious and they had fun with it. They weren't going for the Oscar they were going for entertainment. If that's how you would look at it then you would enjoy this just like you enjoyed the original. I do wish that Micheal Jordan would've showed up but I still enjoyed it just the same.

Live-action/animated comedies fall into two camps.For every Who Framed Roger Rabbit there is a Cool World.Space Jam: A New Legacy is a belated sequel to Space Jam which was released in 1996.The story line is LeBron James is a great basketball player but a dumb dad. He wants his son Dom to follow in his footsteps even though he is too short to be a basketball player.Dom wants to have fun and be a games designer. LeBron wants to just drill his sons to be the best like him, all work and no play.Al G Rhythm (Don West) is a rogue artificial intelligence program that abducts Dom leaving LeBron and the Warner Brothers cartoon characters playing an epic and upgraded basketball game.The story is for Bugs, Daffy and Co to come on the scene as LeBron tries to get a team together. He was hoping to get Superman and Batman. Instead it's Tweety, Taz and Foghorn Leghorn.It's an exercise on WB using its intellectual property to show Disney that it too has assets. So you have Harry Potter, Hanna Barbera cartoon characters, Justice League to Looney Tunes. Incongruously for a movie aimed at kids. It also has characters from Game of Thrones, It, The Devils and Clockwork Orange.It is frenetic and colourful. I found myself laughing a few times and I watched this movie with low expectations given the bad reviews this movie has had. The film is a little too long and the plot makes little sense. I wonder if LeBron James banned his kids from playing games consoles in real life!
Wasn't expecting expecting much.But this is horrible.Animation was great but that was it.Hardly any major celeb cameras like the original.Not y recommended.

It's Definitely an improvement over the first movie. Sure he's not a.great actor but as good or better then Jordan in that department, side characters were funny and toons had some good jokes/Gags as well. Def worth the watch , bought the 4k and looks/sounds incredible.
Not compatible or comparable to the 90s jam...stupid.....boring....acting is bad.....even cartoon characters are not funny.....skip it.

It's not the greatest, Lebron James can't act that is very clear, i watched it with my 3yr old and he enjoyed it which is their target audience. They were going for an update to the original but it's not as entertaining as the first one, it starts to lose your interest because of Lebron's wooden performance the story is also kinda meh. All in all i think kids will enjoy it but parents might get a bit bored.

reviews.review_title: Look at all this stuff we own!
reviews.content: While not the absolute worst movie ever, Space Jam: A New Legacy is terrible regardless. It's far too long for what it does, has numerous plot holes, and has so many things within it that just make zero sense.

Movie constantly tells you that LeBron is the greatest basketball player ever...but that's not the only bad thing about this movie though... I like Don as actor but he's really annoying as the villain in this movie. WB wants to remind you what franchise's they own. If WB owns it it will be mention. WB also spent good money to put in a crazy amount of product placement in. *spoiler*The Looney Tune's don't show up for the first half hour very boring starter. Once the Looney Tunes show up it finally gets entertaining though LeBron ruins a good amount of the humor. Though it also takes them awhile to get to the other looney tune characters it's lot of Bugs. (Note I'm not against him but he's just gets on my nerves in this movie. ) On top of all that the actual basketball game is a cheap video game with terrible point system. It's easily the worst part of the movie. All in all it tries but falls flat I wasn't expecting it to be better then the first movie but was hoping for something instead of nothing.

reviews.review_title: This movie belongs on Moron Mountain
reviews.content: Terrible acting, makes little to no sense, been waiting for years and was a huge let down.Let me start by saying I am NOT a Lebron hater on a normal day, but purely a hater on him in this movie. He made the movie purely centered on him and his horrible acting. The script was weak. What's with all these WB characters? It's Space Jam, don't ever complicate it.I'm trying to find the words to explain, but basically... my wife and I (who both grew up loving the first movie) turned it off 2/3 the way through and put on the original simply to see if it was us who aged or if it is the new movie that is terrible. Ten minutes into the original, we immediately realized it's the new movie.... as well as Lebron who ruined the "legacy" for a new generation.3 rating is for Michael B. Jordan joke and a few other chucklers.Fully butchered. Go watch the original for the 100th time over this garabage.

Another FX film for kids and a belated follow-up to the first. I thought Michael Jordan was a bad actor but LeBron James takes the biscuit! The whole thing is an exercise in CGI, and it's impossible to get a hold on any kind of basketball game because it's all just overwhelmingly detailed crowds and CGI supporting characters littered across the screen. Even the old cartoon characters don't have their charm anymore. Some of the crowd cameos (the droogs, for instance) are interesting but this feels more like a commercial than a film.

Took my kids it was fun for them ...I see so many reviews clearly attacking lebron and probably haven't even seen the movie ... this is for children not for your old grumpy self ... calm down .. look at the insane 1 votes ... haters have arrived and oh it just beat black widow.

reviews.review_title: Space Jam a new legacy is a dead legacy.
reviews.content: The original space jam was no masterpiece although it has some good music, but this one is even worse, lebron james aka lechina james is so bad, he makes all of the others look sane, the animation is dreadful, pepe le pu is missing, every single scene in this movie is so bad, that it deserves to be on my list of the worst films of 2021, what a stupid pathetic joke of a film, the original was terrible(which i gave 1 star) and this is just plain pathetic.Space jam: a new legacy is a horrendous onei gave it a big fat F.

reviews.review_title: Movie is so lame and pointless.
reviews.content: The acting is so bad. One of the worst movies i have seen.

reviews.review_title: I for one welcome our Chinese Overloads
reviews.content: Everyone involved should be ashamed of this commercial of a movie they made. Lebron should be ashamed of that as well as his acting.

Whatta selfpromote pile of shiet is this for Warner Bros and Lebron.. There is a big reason why MJ got in the classic. Lebron is 3 leagues bellow so this have no sense.Also new generations have no idea what or who bugs bunny is or L tunes world is so this makes no sense at all.Long story short this is 2 hour Warner Bros and Lebron advertisement.Also this movie promote all wrong valiuables of todays world and i dont like it at all. Actually this is offense to the original movie and human brain.

reviews.review_title: Does this stink more than Pepe LePew?
reviews.content: Now this or rather the original was not going to be cancelled because of one character. Whatever your feelings are about this character ... he is not included here - and if you actually check how his appearance would have gone down in the movie - you may change your perspective or your feelings about him not being included.But this "outrage" of some, who thought the character was deleted because of any backlash that might flush over the movie ... well it seems gone now. People are rather quite sad and mad about the overall outcome of the movie. And I would argue that LeBron is not really to blame for that. His acting abilities are better than those of MJ (and I say that as a big MJ fan).I think one of the biggest problems of the movie is how long it is. And how much "other stuff" it tries to push and pack into the movie. So many characters (and yet no Pepe - had to mention him once more for fun) and a 2 hour run time. As expected this looks way better than the original.And it tries to make more sense than the original too. While we had Aliens in the first one, this is closer to home. It also has Don Cheadle ... what a wonderful bad guy. But while it tries to make sense ... it falls flat on its face - no pun intended.The young ones might not mind and hopefully take the message this has (be yourself) and run with it - again no pun intended. The big ones may get a bit annoyed after a while I reckon. Still there are some good jokes in here (half time surprise guest/cameo), but also some really bad word puns/jokes - you may fall for them ... or not.The soundtrack overall is not as great as that of the original. There are some really good/updated/tweaked versions of some classics - like flavor in ya ear. So overall I have mixed feelings about this - I'm still a bit surprised this has such a low score right now (under 4 overall)

reviews.review_title: Nominate LeBron James for the Raspberry Award
reviews.content: This is a very bad movie. It has bad writing. Bad acting. The comedy is extremely unfunny in a weird way. For example, Marvin the Martian has a ray gun setting that goes to "Ray Charles," I mean...what is funny about that? The animation isn't terrible but it is not enough to hold the movie together. LeBron James himself gives a truly awful performance. He should never act again.

As a fan of the first Space Jam I knew they wouldn't be able to recreate the magic. I did enjoy all the tie ins with other WB characters. The set up of the storyline was not great but I extremely enjoyed the basket ball game (which is almost half the movie)My kids (6 and 8) said it was better than the first. They are use to great computer graphics so compared to the diets that obviously had number 1 beat.If you go in to it not expecting much I think you'll enjoy it.

reviews.review_title: A disgrace to the Space Jam name
reviews.content: LeBron's acting made Shaq in Kazam look like Daniel Day-Lewis. The Looney Tunes voices were all kinds of wrong. I have never seen the Looney Tunes so dull in my life. Every single scene felt like a neverending cringefest. The best thing about this movie was the special effects. The visuals are amazing, the animation is immaculate, the transition from animated to live action is seemless. But that's literally the only good thing you can say about this film. But worst of all, there is no Bill Murray!
LeBron James a big try hard. Should just stick to flopping in the NBA.

First of all i'm not a fan how they changed and dumbed down Lola bunny nowadays you can't have any classic cartoons cause people say its violent or whatever guess no jokes allowed anymore. I loved the first Space Jam but this is just trying make money off of a successful name. Seems like you failed this time. You changed so many things thinking its for the best yet we wanted to have that classic nostalgia. Like Cobra Kai did with Karate Kid. Sorry i'd rather rewatch wreck it wralph.

Now I am a massive basketball fan, I loved space jam as a kid loved Michael Jordan. With all the bad reviews I was expecting to hate this! I'm not a fan of lebron James but I must say for a kids movie this was great! Different (needed to be) entertaining definitely and the graphics were great.Please give it a go the kids will love it.

LBJ isn't the worst person to ever try their hand at acting but I can't recall anyone more awful. Absolutely ruins this movie, he should just stick to bball or maybe try gardening but please not acting. Hollywood can not help this guy, he has about as much on screen charisma as a safety cone. Please do is all a favor LBJ; hire someone to punch you in the face the next time you think it's a good idea to buy yourself a role in a movie.This movie is so bad I don't don't just want my money back, I want money back; dinner and another movie paid for just to feel I broke even.

As a kid I loved the first Space Jam. I mean the Looney tune characters get in way over their head and challenge the basketball game to a bunch of small aliens and then they become amazing. This.... His son gets kidnapped and the only way he can save him is by winning a basketball game? Really? It's so unrealistic and it's just a horrible premise. I know LeBron wants to exceed Michael Jordan, but maybe he should stop piggybacking off of his successes and make his own.

reviews.review_title: Who Ordered Space Jam 1996 From Wish.com?
reviews.content: Yes, Space Jam: A New Legacy is not as good as the original. Sequels rarely are better. However, the nostalgia we all wanted with a Space Jam sequel just wasn't there. Michael Jordan would've been great, but we got Lebron James; a product of the times and his popularity with younger audiences.The animation of this "sequel" was subpar, compared to the original. It didn't need to be 3D. We wanted it to look like the original as much as possible. We didn't get that!This sequel was like if we had ordered Space Jam 1996 from Wish!My favorite sequence was the ending, with all of the WB owned characters making cameos. That scene alone is worth the watch.

The film is only fairly entertaining, but it is very predictable. There's quite a bit of advertising in it, the logo of a sports brand is prominently displayed on two occasions. The inclusion of other Warner brothers films are too hard sell as well. Overall, it is a brainless film that is not very brilliant.

reviews.review_title: Life is too Important, save 2 hours of your life
reviews.content: Watch the original, MJ is the GOAT. This movie is painful...my kids fell asleep during and my wife wondered how this got past production. Just awful.
5/10 - I'm one of the few that actually enjoyed the cross-over of all the Warner Brothers properties, but all in all, this movie is not memorable enough to warrant a rewatch.
Overdone and thoughtless attempt be James trying to show he is the best!!! He isn't!!!

reviews.review_title: 25 years later this movie achieved nothing
reviews.content: This movie wasn't going to be good from the start, but somehow it ends up being even worse than the original. We see LeBron James as a kid playing a Gameboy he gets called out by his coach who tells him that he needs to truly apply himself if he wants to succeed. Cut to the present LeBron wants his sons to follow in his footsteps. He pushes them specifically his youngest son Dom. The Problem is Dom is a game designer and doesn't want to play basketball. From that, you know what's the arc and the resolution. How the looney tunes factor in is that while at Warner bros talking about a movie deal LeBron and Dom are under surveillance by the studio self-aware A.i Al-G Rhythm(Don Cheadle) who digitized them into the server verse a universe where all the Warner bros characters exist on different worlds and blah blah Son's kidnapped LeBron meets the toons and all their fate's rest in the hands of a basketball game. LeBron doesn't offer anything outside of his stardom. He is a horrible actor giving terrible line delivery almost as bad as Shaq. I'm not going to lie like most and say Michael's performance was gold material, but Michael was likable. Despite his bland attitude, you could a least enjoy his presence he knew what kind of movie he was in and made the best of it. Regardless of where you stand with LeBron, he's not that he is a Jerk who wants things his way the whole movie. An ass to his Son until the end when he gets the obvious lesson. The Toons are alright just as much as they were in the original but they don't get much screen time before the game. The animation on all of them is good, The 3d design looks great I would've preferred those to a 2d redesign Honestly. The servers are just a big advertisement for Warner. With DCEU posters everywhere, a whole ready player one scenario with all these Studio characters that most casual audiences probably aren't even going to recognize or know. With terrible cosplayer standin on a repeated loop. Overall this is a disaster of a film while it could've offered something with the server verse but the tired message, The product placement combined with LeBron's acting makes this a sleeper to get into the end with very few jokes that worked this film can be forgotten* Spoiler/Plotholes* starts the basketball game starts too soon and last too long like 40 minutes. It's not even really a basketball game as opposed to a video game version of dom's creation. I guess also the first movie doesn't exist in this continuation because the toons live in a server not the center of the earth. They have no memory of Michael but they make jokes about him. Even the Nerdlucks show up. The defeat of Al G Rhythm has no repercussions he's supposed to be the algorithm for the studio servers and controls the whole server verse wouldn't his death destroy the servers and all the characters? The whole bugs death is pointless, he's fine and how did he get into the human world?

Why is it so difficult for Hollywood to do something NEW, not a reboot, remake, or a regurgitate? This was one giant commercial for Warner Brothers. I think a cardboard cut out would have more depth of being an actor than LaBron James. King James, not just a court jester.The original was campy and funny, this is just plain garbage. Save your money and go watch paint dry.

I'm 10 minutes in and I already know this movie is made for Lebron James by Lebron James, and you can't tell me otherwise.He is stiff, has weird line delivery.. but by God he is the greatest man ever born!!! He has flaws, but by the end, you know he will be what he needs to be : a self-named King (sarcasm).And with that, you know this can't be a good movie. It's passionless.The plot is simplistic and almost non-existent. A game to solve a family problem, period. Magical technology with ugly CGI of animated characters (Lola looks SO bad). Worst of all, is that they show you they have access to all the Warner Brother properties.. but aside from cheap references and background characters (ala "Ready Player One"), they just end up drafting the Looney Tunes to be underused. It's not even fun at doing what they wanted to do. I can't imagine this being even for kids to enjoy.It's sort of embarrassing.

reviews.review_title: 10 year old me would have enjoyed this!
reviews.content: I was 10 years old when the original Space Jam appeared in theaters. As a kid obsessed with basketball, I thought it was amazing. I rewatched it many times throughout my childhood. I have not watched it for the last 10 years because I knew it would ruin the memories for me. I am 35 years old today, having just watched Space Jam New Legacy. Was it bad? Yes. Were there any good moments? Not really. But this movie isn't made for 35 year old me. It's made for the kid in me. And I'm sure the young me would have thought this was a great movie. I don't think I'll ever watch this movie again. That being said, it kinda brought me back to the young me. Sometimes... I wish I could go back to that.

reviews.review_title: Fun, Just Like Family Movies Should Be!
reviews.content: This is exactly what my title says, it is FUN! It's what family movies are meant to be! Its silly, dumb, amd nonsensical and it WORKS! Watched it with my husband and little son and we enjoyed the silly jokes and callbacks that we as adults who grew up with the OG movie got! The music is good the characters are great, and it was a good watch!

There is so many things wrong with this movie and it's an embarrassment to the original. The acting of LeBron for starters. Also why are they having LeBron play himself but have a fake wife and kids in the movie.

Remember that time when Jarrett Allen completely humiliated and embarrassed Lebron James by blocking his dunk attempt? Well, believe it or not, this movie is even more humiliating and embarrassing. I know, I know... "that's not possible," you're thinking. Yes. It is.To be fair, Lebron is obviously a great player overall. Truly. But he should probably stick to playing actual basketball (not space basketball) and confronting pa announcers at children's basketball games.
Why so many bad scores. Half of the move is so boring. Second half it's just gr8. Great animation and even better crossovers with WB brands.

People are way too critical for what is literally a movie for children, I watched it and yes it's not great, but 1 star? Seriously? If you think this movie is 1 star you are quite honestly bias and just plain ignorant towards all the actual garbage movies out there, the animation I thought was actually really good and I believe if I was a kid I would have enjoyed the movie.Don't take it too seriously.6/10.

I thought it was rather entertaining to watch. People are being overly harsh rating it 1/10 and it certainly doesn't compare to bad movies I have watched before. I enjoyed warner bros recycling preexisting characters and picking out other recognisable characters in the crowd from other shows and movies.

Story - 2/10
Acting - 1/10
Screenplay - 1/10
Graphics - 9/10
BUT THE MCDONALDS SPACE JAM MCLURRY - 10/10No words can describe how much i enjoyed the limited time mcflurry. Without this movie I wouldn't have such an experience. Thank you LeBron :)

I just don't understand how this movie had such horrible reviews. I should start off by saying I am 42. It was not great, but definitely not a 1 or 2. I wonder if most of the people giving it very low grades are just disappointed because it didn't hit the same feeling that it did 20 years ago. Remember, you are an adult now. This is a kids movie. My kids know nothing about the Looney toons, but they f*ing loved this. Shut your face weirdo's.

This movie is just a meme and an advertisement for WB productions. Lebron James is a terrible actor. His relationship with his son in this movie is shown so emotionlessly, but a Lonney Tunes are still fun and made really good. The main villain is fun...yeah it's weird but fun. A big + for Bigchungus and Notorious P. I. G scene. A big - Lola looked better in the first one.

I will never understand how some movies get made. Furthermore, I'll never understand how legitimate stars and respectable actors attach themselves to these films. Favors? Cash grabs? I'd be embarrassed if I we're Done or Zendaya.LeBron is awful. The writing is awful. I suppose the effects are okay? None of it is enjoyable. My kids-who wanted to watch it-quickly lost interest.Do yourself a favor, and don't watch this. It's not even worth the background noise.

reviews.review_title: I wanted to give it the benefit of the doubt, but ultimately its exactly what you would expect
reviews.content: A somewhat fine film overrun with commercialism and forced antics in an attempt to remain relevant- Space Jam A New Legacy could have easily been something special, but instead- its just rather lazy. Lebron James steps in to take over the basketball all-star role this time around, and he's honestly pretty corny, but fine all in all. James 'character' in the film is just so thinly written to make way for the film story, ultimately weighing down what could have been another fun adventure with a different star. James is hardly the films biggest problem though, and out of all of it, I oddly have to name Don Cheadle as the worst thing about this film. Not only is his character a poorly written and constructed device (that's also kinda a perfect metaphor for Warner Bros oddly) but his over the top performance and wooden delivery make for honestly one of the worst villains i've ever seen on screen. The film is thankfully entertaining, although it can be kinda cringeworthy to watch at times. They try really hard to appeal to the kids of this generation, and it is so incredibly forced that it can honestly be quite hard to watch. I enjoyed seeing all my favorite tunes again, but the CGI overkill in the second half of the film is a bit too much to bare- and honestly just feels like one huge commercial. Yes, there are commercial elements in the films first half, but I felt like it still had some heart and tue humor to it- it wasn't trying too hard or shoving products in our face. In the end, the film had a few funny moments, and didn't bore me (as some may say it did) but it's far too shallow to be a decent film- and far too forced to gain any sympathy.My Rating: 4.4/10.

reviews.review_title: Another recycled story made only for financial gains not from passion for material
reviews.content: I necessarily dont even have a problem with recycling a storyline, its sort of an homage to the original and a legacy project. However when one can see from space that the recycling has been done only and 100% for monetary gain and it is a PRODUCT not a film, then its bad. I mean, you can make it both, quality and return for the investors.But I guess, except here and there, hollywood bank doesnt even bother anymore hiding it. Woke/diversity commitee to make people feel good about themselves, accounting to make money and a few big names to draw suckers in and youve got yourself a product.I guess writers are so passee. Story is simply made up from generic building blocks and checks the boxes,nothing new, nothing witty.Makes you cherish the few quality things that do come out here and there. If you want a cute animation that came out in the last few months check LUCA.

Space Jam: A New Legacy was a lackluster sequel not a remake but this time it stars Lebron James as the NBA hero pulled into a animated basketball game to save his son from the rogue AI played by Don Cheadle. The story lacked originality but it was an ok family friendly movie with a message to young adults to always believe in your yourself and not to give up. The animation was top of the line but you feel as though you are watching a lego movie that is commercialized with all on WB movies they have ever created like Harry Potter, LOTR, and DC characters. The rest of the cast included Lil Rey, Sarah Silverman, and Anthony Davis. The characters were voiced by Rosario Dawson, Zendaya as Lola Bunny, and Gabriel Iglesias. Of course they did try to tease us to recruit Jordan but he ended being Michael B Jordan, such stupid jokes. Overall it was ok, I would not watch it again.
Uninteresting mess ,Bad movie , nothing to do with the original Space Jam and Michael Jordan which is absolutely great.2/10.

I'm amazed at how so much happens in this film and yet nothing really happens at all. There's a decent if pointed set-up where LeBron James wants his son to pursue basketball but his real talents lie in video game development. The execution of this story is a strangely contrived adventure where the antagonist traps both LeBron and his son in a virtual world for very thinly defined reasons. That's the main problem of this film - the character motivations and plot conflicts seem very thin, as if the screenplay were unfinished. For example, the backstory of the Looney Tunes characters leaving their world for other movie worlds was badly explained and I was still wondering why they were scattered and why they decided to come back. The skits on the other movie worlds were neat individually, but they didn't add up to much. The thin plotting and aimless animated sketches are a flaw shared by this film's predecessor, despite what the nostalgists may claim, but this time it's too chaotic to be fun and the plot was muddled up.
The movie wasn't terrible. It was no OG Space Jam so you can't compare it to that. It was entertaining, corky, fun, and had a good message. Give it a shot! Haters gonna hate.
I dont know why the reviews are so bad its not better than the original but it was still good.
Oh man it is really bad this movie. The one of Michael Jordan it is a millon times better. I didn't laugh not even once. It seemed like they were promoting hbo max by showing all of their characters.

They also market this movie as a family film yet Lebron uses foul language. Not a family movie or even an enjoyable one. I say skip it.
In a day and age of reboots and remakes, this sequel should've never happened. Absolute garbage. The first one was fun. Im sure LeBron got payed well though.
I really don,t have words to describe it!Waist of another classic ideea.

reviews.review_title: Basically a Remake of a Film that Wasn't Great to Begin with
reviews.content: I'll be honest right off the bat and say that I've only seen the original Space Jam a total of two times. I find it to be mildly enjoyable, but it wasn't a film I ever latched onto. The nostalgia of the 90s is all over it and that's what makes it entertaining to this day, but I still don't think it's great. When I heard they would be making a very loose sequel and Lebron James wasn't going to be filling the shoes that Michael Jordan left, I was intrigued. With the technology today, this concept could be big and fun. Well, Space Jam: A New Legacy definitely had its moments, but it's ultimately just the same concept all over again. Here's why, unless you're showing it to your kids, it's really not that special.Here's the premise in a nutshell. Lebron James is having issues connecting with his son Dom and has nothing in mind for him but that he wants to make him a basketball star just like himself. After stumbling across a room on the Warner Bros. Lot, Lebron and his son are sucked into what the film calls the "server-verse". This is where all the worlds from the movies Warner Bros. Have ever made all exist. Being sent to the land of Looney Tunes by Al G. Rhythm, who runs the so-called "server-verse" and has challenged Lebron to a basketball game in exchange for his freedom, comes across Bugs Bunny. Bugs then helps Lebron assemble the rest of the "Tune Squad" and the second half of the movie is basically the basketball game.Other than some incredibly impressive visuals and a fun soundtrack, there really isn't much substance here. It's really just a story of a father winning the love back from his son. For that, this film is not that engaging and the screenplay is very, very standard as well. The final act of the film goes on way too long and it just felt like a massive commercial for Warner Bros. As a company. At least all their famous movies are good and have memorable characters, right?As far as the positives go, Don Cheadle as Al G. Rhythm completely held the movie together for me. His over-the-top and campy performance made me smile and he's in a lot more of the movie than I expected. I also really enjoyed the portion of the film where Lebron became a cartoon character with the rest of the Looney Tunes. That aspect was not a part of the original film and I found that to be a very nice addition. Other than that though, Space Jam: A New Legacy really doesn't have anything that suggests it needed to be made.In the end, the life lessons for kids throughout this film have all been done better in other family films. The aspect of meshing Looney Tunes with live-action Basketball still kind of has its charm, but again, the movie just feels like a giant corporate commercial. Lebron James is fine in the movie because he's in his element, but he's not the best actor overall. I smiled a few times and loved a cameo that occurs in the latter half of the film, but it wasn't enough to warrant a recommendation from me. It's just not that good of a movie. If you're a fan of the original, I'm sure you'll find moments to enjoy here, but it ultimately feels like a tired premise when looking back.
Even being aged this movies are the kind of entertaining someone who was a kid likes to watch.After Space Jam with MJordan this series have to fit in the records of fun to watch all over again.

Garbage with a capital GAR!Goes from 0-100 is the first 15 minutes. No build-up, no backstories, no explanations.95% of the movie is just the screen full of bright lights and loud sounds.No real plot to speak of. People just accept that they're zapped to Toon Town...and just get on with it. No sense of anything being at stake. It never just stops to breath...it's non-stop and relentless!Overall an absolute shambles!2 stars given purely for the cameos.Wouldn't even recommend it to Michael Jordan to watch!
This is not classic lonney tunes not fun like cartoon worst.

reviews.review_title: This movie is a whole lot of fun

The pop culture references in this are a good reason to watch until the end. If you enjoyed the original and aren't expecting the acting prowess of Shawshank Redemption, give it a go.

When you see lebron and his son you expect to be at least engaging. But even that feels formulaic.And being a blockbuster, no one want to see inside a machine...is too boring and the jokes are flat, like the kevin hart joke(who asked for that)
ive tried to watch but is too much vfx, and not so much story, even bugs say''a nba star needs my help, i feel like happened before''...when a movie jokes about itself, you know is bad.lebron cant play.is a bad actor.

This movie was made to make money without much thought about the story.The film is full of incongruities, conveniences and it is very implausible, there is no good development of why things happen, there is no good development of the characters, the film has no logic, it does not make sense, it is predictable, it ends up being tedious and very long and the performances are bad.
