The only noteworthy thing is the special effects, but they don't add anything to the story.It is a shame that Warner continues to make these types of products, these cannot even be called movies, it is a shame that this studio only wants to profit from nostalgia and affection for various characters.

reviews.review_title: It doesn't know what it's appeal is...
reviews.content: The original 'Space Jam' wasn't a good movie at all but it benefits from being the time capsule movie of the 90's. The color palette, the pop culture references, the product placements and Jordan cement it as a classic, an undeserved classic but a classic nonetheless. 'Space Jam: A New Legacy' pretends the original never existed, a fatal flaw. The prime selling point of the picture is nostalgia. It doesn't do LeBron James any favors pretending that he isn't in the shadow of Michael Jordan. It's debatable who the better basketball star is but 'Space Jam' is Jordan's.We live in a nostalgic age. We're constantly revisiting 90's IPs and I don't have a problem with that. The only thing relevant to the original is the title. It's a shame too because I think a lot of humor could have been generated by being Meta about the comparisons between James and Jordan and why there needed to be a new 'Space Jam'.LeBron James is the star of the film. I know that he is reviled as much as he is loved and brings a lot of baggage with him. I think a lot of the hate he has received is totally unfounded but 'Space Jam' too isn't going to help his reputation. Jordan wasn't Brando but he looks like it in comparison to James who is awkward and wooden. It doesn't help that the moral of the story about being yourself is so heavy handed and LeBron doesn't stop hammering it in. I'm sure this isn't the case but he looks like an egotist because there is no selfparody or sense of humor to his performance. He spends a great deal of his screen time lecturing the Looney Tunes. I'm sorry but not only is this going to strike out with the millennial but the kids are going to hate it too.The set up to the ball game is overly complicated and Don Cheadle's villain is given no reason to hate James or exist. We just see Warner products everywhere. I don't mind this in theory as a few of the film's only laughs come from revisiting these properties. They don't join the game or comment on it though. They just are there for you to pause it and gawk at them.They needed to bring back Jordan. The movie doesn't work without him. It could have been the perfect opportunity for the two NBA legends to celebrate both their achievements and show they had a sense of humor. Instead this is probably LeBron's biggest disaster since 'The Decision' while Jordan's legend grows with 'The Last Dance'

I gave this a shot but it's pretty rough. The acting is much worse than the first and the script is bad too. My wife liked the pop culture references and my almost 2 year old was drawn to the colors but that's about it.
Animes Nice, but stories is not normal. Half of film is praying for ending.

reviews.review_title: Movies so bad, they should pay you to see it instead. LeYawn Lames is terrible.
reviews.content: I had no interest in this movie. But my friend said it couldn't be "that bad", so he took me to see it and paid for my ticket. After about 30 minutes we walked out and a got a refund. First off, LeYawn Lames is a terrible actor and it feels forced. The story of the movie felt cringe as well. This movie is an insult to MJ who was in the first. That man was a really great man, LeYawn Lames is good at basketball and thats about it. He is no where near as humble or kind as MJ is. Ashame because the Looney Tunes themselves are great, even some camoes of other properties. Sadly I'll never know how it ends because we left. I don't care how it ends either. Save your money and brain cells.

LeBron James isn't a great actor but I was looking for a basketball player. He is the straight man to a delightful cast of hilarious characters.I laughed out loud and had a great time. That's what I wanted and the movie delivered.
Least diverse movie ever. Not what I expected in a movie that was meant to be entertaining. I didn't like it.

reviews.review_title: two hours long promotional poster for warner bros roster of characters
reviews.content: The actors are not to blame. La Bron James, Don Cheadle, and others do a reasonable job.The characters are not to blame, although it doesn't do the classic toons any favor being mixed with more recent and much less iconic.ones.The technic is not to blame, the special effects and animations are good.But one can't make a story of a catalogue. And this is what this film is, a catalogue of WB franchises, rather than closing credits it should end up with streaming and blu rays price lists.This is a little disheartening, the original holds great memories of watching it with my children.

reviews.review_title: Slightly tarnish the name of the studio itself.
reviews.content: Michael Jordan was challenged in 1996's "Space Jam" to join forces with Daffy Duck, Bugs Bunny, and Elmer Fudd to win a basketball game that would secure the Looney Tunes' release from an evil corporate ruler. The film was the result of corporate overlords banding together like the Harlem Globetrotters to monopolize children's attention spans."Space Jam: A New Legacy" is a jumbled mess of rainbow sprinkled gibberish that, unlike the original, manages to hang together as a film. Once again, an NBA legend enters a netherworld populated by imaginary characters who must assist him in winning a basketball game in order to escape. This time, the villain is Don Cheadle's Al-G Rhythm.The digital collection of Warner Bros. Allows Malcolm D. Lee to expand the playground to include Superman, King Kong, Voldemort, and others. There's a terrific scene in which LeBron and Bugs round up the rest of the Tune Squad. In keeping with the times, the character of Lola Bunny has been thankfully desexualized in this sequel. "Space Jam: A New Legacy" is a passable family film. LeBron James' arc is to rediscover the joy of the game with the help of his anarchistic colleagues. Unlike Michael Jordan, he lets his inherent LeBron-ness become the punchline.
You cant make a good movie with just good animation.Story was trash, acting was trash. Lebron is trash for pandering to the CCP going as far as to say that free speech is bad.

reviews.review_title: The magic of Space Jam is missing
reviews.content: For those of us who grew up watching Space Jam of the all-powerful Michael Jordan we will surely not like this new version very much. And it is that nothing can be reproached to LeBron James who made a great effort to ignite that magic but rather the error comes from the excess of excess computer production.The plot is loose, chaotic in colors, chaotic in production and with little or very few moments that make you laugh. It is hateful to compare but in this case it was necessary to compare it with the first film, so this new version leaves much to be desired.

I watched the original live-action cartoon hybrid twice at the cinema when I was a kid, and many times after on video, it was always rumoured there would be a sequel, and it came twenty-five years later, directed by Malcolm D. Lee (Scary Movie 5, Girls Trip). Basically, basketball player LeBron James (as himself, Razzie winner) wishes for both of his sons, Darius (Ceyair J. Wright) and Dom (Cedric Joe), to follow in his footsteps. But Dom, a child prodigy in computer software, instead dreams of becoming a video game developer. LeBron shows an interest in the arcade basketball game Dom has developed, but a glitch from a certain move causes his character to be deleted, which crushes Dom. Meanwhile, at Warner Bros. Studios, Burbank, state-of-the-art A. I., Al-G Rhythm (Don Cheadle) has secretly become self-aware and desires more recognition from the world. LeBron is invited to the studio to discuss a movie deal, taking Dom with him. While LeBron dismisses the idea, Dom shows an interest in the studio's software. Dom expresses his interest in software development, leading to a blow-up argument with his father at basketball camp when LeBron refuses to let him give up on the sport. Al-G lures the father and son to the studio basement and traps them in virtual reality. Insulted by LeBron's refusal to recognise his potential, Al-G takes Dom as his prisoner, and tells LeBron his son will only be released if the basketball star assembles a team together to beat him in a game of basketball. LeBron is then transported through the virtual space where he is dumped in Tune World. LeBron finds the animated world is deserted, with only cartoon character Bugs Bunny (Jeff Bergman) remaining. Bugs explains that Al-G persuaded the rest of the Looney Tunes to leave their world and explore other realities. Meanwhile, Al-G manipulates Dom to turn him against his father and helping him to develop and upgrade himself and his game, which he secretly intends to use against LeBron. Bugs wanting to help LeBron form his basketball team lures Marvin the Martian (Eric Bauza) to landing his spaceship in Tune World and he and LeBron steal the ship to travel to different worlds based on Warner Bros properties. In DC Comics, they find Daffy Duck (Bauza) and Porky Pig (Bauza) trying to be superheroes. In Mad Max: Fury Road, they find Road Runner and Wile E. Coyote. In Austin Powers, they find Elmer Fudd (Bauza) and Sylvester the Cat (Bergman), and Tweety Pie (Bob Bergen) when Sylvester spits him out. In Casablanca, they find Yosemite Sam (Bergman) playing "As Time Goes By". In Game of Thrones, they find Foghorn Leghorn (Bauza) riding a dragon. In The Matrix, they find Granny (Candi Milo) and Speedy Gonzales (Gabriel Iglesias). LeBron is unconvinced by the playing capabilities of the Looney Tunes; he insists they find a character with genuine talent. Finally, back in DC Comics, Lola Bunny (Zendaya) is with Wonder Woman (Rosario Dawson) to prove herself as an Amazonian, but Bugs convinces her to join the team to save LeBron's son. LeBron ignores the objections of Bugs and insists on coaching the "Tune Squad" on the fundamentals of basketball. When the time for the game arrives, the Tune Squad meet with Al-G's team, the Goon Squad, consisting of upgraded avatars of several active professional basketball players with superpowers and led by Dom. The Looney Tunes are surprised when they find themselves also upgraded, to become computer-animated beings, with more realistic features. To further the stakes, Al-G livestreams the game and abducts countless viewers, including LeBron's family, into the virtual reality while summoning all the Warner Bros. Characters to watch the game. Al-G announces that if the Tune Squad loses, all viewers will remain trapped in the "server-verse" for eternity and the Looney Tunes will be deleted permanently. With Dom Ball being a video game, LeBron and his team must contend with scoring high bonus points for style and execution, and the superpowers of the Goon Squad easily dominate the first half of the game. During the break, Sylvester attempts to recruit former Tune Squad member Michael Jordan, but finds actor Michael B. Jordan instead. LeBron realises that traditional basketball skills will not be enough and allows Bugs to devise the strategy for the second half using their cartoon physics to catch up with the Goon Squad. The Tunes manage to regain points until the teams are close to tying. LeBron confronts Dom and tells him he no longer wants to stand in the way of his dream. Dom forgives and trusts his father, and he abandons the Goon Squad. Al-G assumes control of the Goon Squad and uses his own abilities to make them seemingly unbeatable. Dom realises the only way to win the game is to use the glitch move, even though whoever does so will be deleted. During the final seconds of the game, Bugs sacrifices himself by performing the move, helping LeBron score the final point, winning the game and causing Al-G and the Goon Squad to be deleted. The James family and the abducted citizens are returned to the real world, while the Tunes gather around Bugs as he bids farewell before disappearing. In the real world, LeBron becomes closer to his family and supports Dom's decision to become a video game designer. After dropping Dom off at a video game trade event, LeBron is delighted when Bugs appears, he can't really "die", being a fictional character. He asks LeBron to put him up for a little while until he can find a way back to Tune World. Also starring Sonequa Martin-Green as Kamiyah James, LeBron's wife, Khris Davis as Malik, Harper Leigh Alexander as Xosha James, Xosha Roquemore as Shanice James, Stephen Kankole as Young LeBron, Gerald 'Slink' Johnson as Warner Bros. Security Guard (as Slink Johnson), Sarah Silverman as Warner Bros. Executive, Minari's Steven Yeun as Warner Bros. Executive, Ernie Johnson as Game Announcer, and Get Out's Lil Rel Howery as Game Announcer, with the voices of Jeff Bergman as Fred Flintstone and Yogi Bear, Fred Tatasciore as Taz the Tasmanian Devil, and Justin Roiland as Rick and Morty. Other Warner Bros. Movies and TV references and characters that can be spotted included: King Kong, The Wizard of Oz, The Flintstones, Yogi Bear, The Jetsons, What Ever Happened to Baby Jane?, Batman (1966), Wacky Races, Scooby Doo, Where Are You!, A Clockwork Orange, Captain Caveman and the Teen Angels, Superman (1978), The Shining, Gremlins, Thundercats, The Goonies, Batman (1989), Batman Returns, A League of Their Own, Batman: The Animated Series, Animaniacs, The Mask, Superman: The Animated Series, Mars Attacks!, Batman & Robin, Men in Black, The Iron Giant, Harry Potter and the Wizarding World, The Lord of the Rings, Ben 10, 300, The Conjuring, Dunkirk, It (Pennywise), Aquaman, and Joker (2019). James is likeable enough, Cheadle relishes being the villain, and of course Bugs Bunny and his cartoon friends are delightful. I was hoping for something entertaining, but it does not have quite the same charm as the original. The biggest problem is, it tries too hard to be clever, it is not all that funny, it tries too hard to imitate the wonder of Ready Player One cramming as many references as possible from Warner Bros. Properties, almost forgetting the Looney Tunes, and is much more style over substance. There is not a bad word to say about the animation, going from traditional hand-drawn to fantastic special CGI effects to make Bugs fluffy and so on, and any geek watching will have fun spotting the movie and TV characters. It is unfortunate that it is a bit of a let-down, a disappointing but not completely terrible part-animated fantasy sports comedy. Wacky Races was number 100, Captain Caveman and the Teen Angels was number 90, Yogi Bear was number 80, Foghorn Leghorn was number 61, Thundercats was number 54, Scooby-Doo, Where Are You! Was number 49, Road Runner was number 48, The Sylvester and Tweety Show was number 35, Daffy Duck was number 30, Looney Tunes / Merrie Melodies was number 20, The Iron Giant was number 12, The Flintstones was number 11, and Bugs Bunny was number 10 on The 100 Greatest Cartoons. It won the Razzies for Worst Remake, Rip-Off or Sequel, and Worst Screen Couple for LeBron James and any Warner cartoon character or Time-Warner product he dribbles on, and it was nominated for Worst Picture. Okay!

reviews.review_title: I turned it off 20 minutes in
reviews.content: Horrible movie. I felt like it was a commercial for Warner bros and product placement. Labron can't act and is stale. Calling himself king James is just silly. Stick with the original.

I saw Space Jam: A New Legacy today on HBO Max & I thought it was a Good Movie. Like a lot of 90s Kids I Grew up With The Original 1996 Movie & I thought this was gonna be Great & it was Just as Good as the Original. The Movie has a lot of references to The Matrix & a lot WB Movies & Tv Shows. LeBron James did a Good job as Himself & Zendaya did A Awesome Job as Lola Bunny. People where Complaining about how Porky Pig Raps & I will admit that was A little Cringey but besides that I enjoyed this Movie so 8/10 from Me :)

I don't have much good to say about this film, so let me start with the bad. Space Jam: A New Legacy, feels like a bad rip off of Spy Kids 3: Game Over. The concept is fun, but very formulaic, while not being totally cohesive or consistent. Id be lying if I said the film doesn't have heart and creativity, but it's severely overshadowed by the corniness, and the plot being all over the place. Space Jam: A New Legacy has countless cliches, and easter eggs, where it gets super distracting. I expected a few fan service moments, but it seemed like this whole film was catered to that, leaving it to run thin. Malcolm D. Lee knew what they were going for, being a simple, and silly film, so you cannot take this serious at all. Lee did his best to embrace his goal, but he over-did it, creating way too many cringey moments.I can totally see why Lebron James is a basketball player, because he cannot act. Maybe it was the way his lines were written; he just seemed uncomfortable, and not genuine at all, which is one of the biggest dampers of the film, considering this was more of a "lebron james" film, over a Space Jam film. The Looney Tunes served their purpose for the most part, but they felt more like a side attractions to Lebron.Although I have a lot that I didn't like about this film, there were a couple of qualities that made it somewhat enjoyable. Even though the Looney Tunes were mainly side characters, it's always a pleasant treat to see them on screen, doing their thing. The cinematography and animations were done fairly well. Everything was very bright, and clear, being visually pleasing. With the film totaling almost two hours, it definitely overstays it's welcome, but it does have a good pace, keeping me engaged almost the whole time.Overall, this was mainly just a nostalgic grab! It was definitely made for the younger viewers, and I believe if you go into this film with an open mind, some of the older crowds could enjoy it for nostalgic purposes.

This is really not that bad. Certainly better than the reviews it's getting. It was a very ambitious project with a lot going on but I think they pulled it off while keeping a fairly cohesive and engaging storyline together. Lebron is a terrible actor but honestly still probably better than Michael Jordan.I may be a bit biased because I'm a big blazer/dame lillard fan and his parts were great, but I do think it was a solid 6.5 type of movie. And for a kid this is like a 9.5.

Although the looney tunes seem to hold there own...Lebron is still chasing the ghost of Michael Jordon and falls short yet again. Movie does have some laughs provided by the tunes but a weak plot and villains that didn't measure up to the monstars of the original. This movie has just tried too hard to capture the magic of the previous movie and with Lebrons acting it's just a poor movie. Wait on this one.

If you are looking for a story or a logical reason for this basketball game, You will not enjoy this movie.However, you will laugh because it's as funny as hell , albeit the Weird Basketball rules.I enjoyed The Michael A Jordan and Michael B Jordan scene. Good One 😂

A crazy adventure movie
It is again about the return of the Loney Tunes to play with the great Lebron James, but this time it is the player who seeks them to recover his son after offending a digital system, sending him to the land of the Tunes and Bugs helps him to put the team together.Quality.Spectacular animation combines various styles.Completely copy the previous movie in this reboot, everything happens as is, only now they give it the technological touch, it feels totally implausible.It feels like a lot to sell, Warner brings out all of their licenses and characters in this movie for you to see on screen. Which gives it the most hype, that's what half the movie feels like.Typical jokes of the characters, but in less intensity.Ideal for the previous generations, the new ones do not entertain so much.Talk about the importance of family and the importance of listening and letting others be.An option to see if you like movie reboots.

Would give a 0 star if I could. Everything about this was terrible. Was corny the entire movie and horrible acting. I actually cringed many times. Is a total disgrace and tarnishes the image of the OG space jam. Stick to basketball LeBum.
Anything with LeBron James in it is just going to be nothing but utter trash. I am more then sure that Mel Blanc is rolling in his grave right now after Crying LeBrown just dumped all over this.

reviews.review_title: One of the worst movies I have ever seen
reviews.content: It's just a shameless and soulless piece of garbage that is essentially a giant Warner Media commercial. Also, why is Ryan Coolger producing this?!

reviews.review_title: Not that Bad as People Say
reviews.content: When I go on this site for Space Jam 2 reviews, they were all saying that the film sucked. So I went to see the film for myself, and my expectations were pretty low for this film. However when I saw in on HBO Max, it was still pretty bad, but it did have some good elements to it. My least favorite part of the film was the first 30 minutes. During that time, it seemed less like a movie and more of a commercial for HBO Max and WB. It was pretty boring, and almost served nothing to the film. LeBron James isn't a very good actor, and how he says his dialogue is very still. The next 30 minutes do get kind of better, but still not very better. IT still felt like a commercial, but at least it was fun seeing LeBron and Bugs recruiting the Looney Tunes Gang. The Wonder Woman one was just stretched out too long. The moments with Al G. Rhythm and Dom were dull. Even the Basketball game was annoying because the stakes were really low and just random. In the second half of the game, we finally see the Looney Tunes in their true form ( aside from Porky Pig rapping). And in the 2nd half of the game, it was pretty fun to see how the Basketball game played out. The story and characters were all pretty bad. But the animation and the visuals were stunning. The reason this has 4 stars and not 1 or 2 is because of the great visuals and solid animation for the Looney Tunes, both in 2d and in CGI. In all, it's a long, HBO Max commercial with a dull story, low stakes, and bad comedy. The animation and visuals are stunning, and some of the basketball game was fun. It may have some fun parts, but it would've worked better as a commercial for HBO Max.

What a boring movie, my 6 yr old kept asking why was she not laughing. She said it was horrible, this movie couldn't even keep a 6 yr old happy. Movie has really good graphics, yet it's too long. Lebron is still a bit dry with not a smooth delivery. All the corky moments that made the first one good. This one has none.

reviews.review_title: I guess i am not the target audience, nor suffering from nostalgia
reviews.content: I do remember the original Space Jam. It was a light entertainment movie that was kind of fun to watch - but certainly no more than once.This new movie felt worse .. significantly worse .. than even the Emoji Movie (if anyone remembers that train wreck)No effort in story, characters or personality/creativity. No original message, nothing.Now, this is more a movie for Americans, i guess, because i have no idea who the protagonist is. Possibly a basketball celebrity like the last one? (that Micheal Jorden at least was known internationally) - anyway, never heard of him.But even unknown actors might do good movies of course - so lets look at the storytelling. A flash of loosely connected scenes that portrait Warner Bros pop culture property - or in short .. a movie length advertisement for WB - how .. erm .. subtle.I can only hope the movie hit the nail in the USA - because it certainly missed it BIG time here in Iceland. Its references simply do not hit the mark at all, its protagonist is unknown and the toons seem not to adhere to the established personalities that they had in the shorts.All in all - a terrible waste of time - that does not satisfy nostalgic adults, nor teens/children at all.

I rewatched the first Space Jam since I hardly remembered it and it was a nice compact fun goofy looney time. Sure it's showing its age but it has been 25 years, so that's a given. This new one, though, is mostly BLEH!It's too long, it's too bloated. The looney tunes take a massive backseat, which is the biggest mistake this movie makes. The personal human story is not what we came here for, and it's cringe. It's basically WB flexing itself and giving you a big advertisement of their streaming service HBO MAX and all their major properties but whereas before, the core idea was having fun, here, it's all corporate first. Just goes to show how much the pop-culture landscape has changed in these 25 years. Also, HBO and WB, you ain't doing any favours for yourself by reminding us of Game of Thrones.Sure, there were some moments and some scenes, no matter how short relative to the entire runtime, that were fun, I'm not gonna lie. It wasn't all bad. That one Michael Jordan joke was the best part, I laughed out loud. But stuff like that was so few and far between, it pissed me off why they didn't let the writers and the animators etc just go full ham like that. You'd still get your marketing and advertising but instead of being bland and boring, it would have been so much fun.Anyway, I'd recommend watching the old one again. And if I were to rate it, I'd give it a 3.5/10.P. S The 3D looney tunes were the stuff of nightmares. NO.

This "film" is basically just Warner Bros saying: "Hey everybody! Look at all these things we own the rights to! Aren't we freakin' awesome?!?!"You might enjoy this if you're five-years-old and can look past the terrible script and Warner Bros shoving everything they own in your face at every opportunity. I find it's usually the stuff aimed at the younger demographic that's always stuffed to the brim with logos and big names; they just love shoving it all in the faces of those young, undeveloped minds, don't they?Space Jam 2 goes down as another example of the many failed reboot cash-grab attempts that have flooded the industry in recent years.That's the reason I always find myself seeking out indie films these days, far more originality than anything the mainstream can muster up (no product placement either).Want a tip? Just forget this film ever existed and go and watch the original. It's 25-years-old and is still far more fresh and gripping than this drivel, it actually had focus on the Looney Tunes as opposed to the ball-bouncing protagonist; and the story was far more entertaining.

reviews.review_title: I don't think it's as terrible as everyone says...
reviews.content: ...Maybe that's because I just saw the original space jam for the first time right before the sequel. So I carried literally zero expectations. I'm thinking that may have helped me out some.It was fine. Lebron plays a real a-hole for a lot of the movie. Why he signed up for this script is a little beyond me. I wasn't mad at the concept of traveling around Warner Bros films. At least they were overt in plugging their stuff rather than slipping product placements throughout and thinking we all won't notice. It was a relatively cute idea but also cheesy as all get out.I will say the Looney tunes gang was missing some of their original zing which was disappointing. If they'd been acted and written a little better I may have even bumped up my rating a little bit.

reviews.review_title: Warner Brothers Presents: Hey look at all the stuff we own!
reviews.content: On the eve of a merge, Warner brothers struggles to keep its intellectual property afloat despite some interesting moments in the acting, writing, and direction.

LBJ can't act even his life depended on it. No charisma, not entertaining, can't act. Just an awful cash-grab for a guy that needs no cash but food for his ego, and that's coming from a LBJ fan.Delonte West would have been a more suitable choice.If you love your kids show them the original.Peace.

The original Space Jam was a popcorn movie that benefitted from an original plot concept, taking the most popular athlete in the world at the time and grafting animated Looney Tunes characters into an ensemble cast. It worked, though no one considered the result anything more than a Thanksgiving movie pleasure.There was never any real urging for a remake.So, the entire basis of this production appears to have been how can another highly talented basketball player glorify himself and chase the ghost of the player most consider the greatest of all time? The answer seems to have been to set him up in the same theatrical vehicle, and allow him to prove to the world that he too, "Can Be Like Mike!"Sadly, if that was the goal, it failed as miserably as the movie itself did.It seems as if the production team knew it would end that way, and so little effort was made to do anything other than put a movie on record and show it in theaters. Any effort at quality scripting, good production, solid directing, and getting the most out of the casting, seemed put aside, so that the resulting failure would at least have consumed very little hard work and ingenuity.The result was hammered in the press, and is one of the few times the critics got it right to lampoon a movie.

The movie is great and if I dare to say even better than the original. The movie is full of pop culture references and it's really funny if you belong in the adult audience. It has its fair share of 3D and 2D animation and the main idea is more promising than the original. It's actually less stupid and more satisfying to watch because everything in the plot is built with much more care than the original space jam which is cool and all but it barely fills its 90 minute duration. Space jam a new legacy is 2 full hours and you have something cool to watch every minute. I really wasn't looking forward to watching it but I'm glad I did. It's a very nice family movie with respect to the original.

reviews.review_title: Should have been called Space Jam 2
reviews.content: 2 hour long advertisement for HBO Max2 good jokes the entire movie2/10This movie was made solely so WB can show you all of the properties they own and all of the great stuff you can watch on HBO Max. All of the references and "jokes" appear aimed at 90s kids who were fans of the original, taking their kids to see this movie, but all of them are dated or just purely unfunny. There's really nothing to like here other than good performances from Don Cheadle and Zendaya.

reviews.review_title: This shouldn't be named space jam
reviews.content: There's only one Space Jam and it's the one with Michael Jordan. Too many useless remakes nobody asked for and this is one of them.

It's just a LeBron commercial. I watched 5 minutes and couldn't believe how annoying it is. The movie is not about making a movie. It's about LeBron. Everything is about LeBron. I don't see the point in this. Call the movie LeBron or whatever but not Space Jam. The original Space Jam wasn't this annoying. Every character had his part. It wasn't about Michael. Michael was just part of the whole thing.

This film started well but was far too long at almost two hours . The basketball match went on for close to an hour. Don Cheadle was good as the villain Al G. I like now the film included characters like King Kong, Penguin, Mini Me etc. Michael B Jordan had an interesting scene .

reviews.review_title: Space Jam is for the Children!
reviews.content: The original Space Jam was one of my favorite movies as a kid, because when it came out I was 11 y/o. Looking back, it's a bad movie with bad acting. But I still give it an 8/10 for the nostalgic factor because it was made for kids from the mid-late 90s, and not for 30+ y/o men. In retrospect, it's probably a 6/10.I tried to watch The New Legacy with the same perspective and realized that it's even better than the original because it has more heart, better acting, and the artstyle and special effects are second to none. The cartoon segment has one of the best animations I've ever seen. Mind you, I've watched in 4k on a 65" inch TV.Although it is a kid's movie, it does have an underlying respectable message for parents. Especially African American dads, the importance of being present but not overbearing, to hug your kids, and to say "I love you."Lebron's acting needs some work, but it's better than I expected. If he is patient enough by accepting small roles, he could develop into an action star.Don Cheadle, Mr. Kung Fu Kenny himself, is back on his BS, did a good job for the most part of the movie, BUT, I'd personally prefer Kevin Hart, Samuel Jackson, Andy Serkis, or Johnny Depp since they are also known for goofy and eclectic characters.P.s.: I had to overrate the movie a bit due to the haters giving it 1/10. Why would you sit through an unwatchable movie?

reviews.review_title: What did you expect? Its a cartoon!
reviews.content: Its fun, applying all of Warner Bros IP in one movie still maintaining all the needed absurdity, that is indeed Space Jam. Don Cheadle performance was the most exceptional of all, but on the downside Space Jam has a very expensive universe which was no properly utilized.
This movie knew my weaknesses and I enjoyed it a lot.

reviews.review_title: Not Great by any means - but very pleasing to watch.
reviews.content: I will start this review by calling out the vital thing holding this movie back. Lebron James's acting. Now, to be honest, I thought he would be even worse than he turned out being. And for the most part, the writers did a great job of, almost, hiding his lack of acting skill, by not giving him to many emotional lines etc. But that being said, whenever Lebron did need to perform these types of scenes, it sometimes became hard to watch, notably at the start of the movie.That being said, I did find myself enjoying this movie. No, the plot isnt one of great twist, amazing originality, and amazing character development - But it didnt need to be. What the movie does well, is implementing good references and jokes without them feeling forced. Especially as somebody who watched basketball, i really found myself enjoying all the easter eggs during the game. Keeping me entertained and maintaining my focus.There is alot the movie does poorly how ever, but overall, im satisfied, i didnt expect them to reinvent the wheel, nor blow me away, but i was entertained and can see myself watching this movie again down the line. I feel it will have the same nostalgia factor as the original.

My son loved the film but to me it sucked! Don't waist time in the theaters watching this garbage, watch it on HBO MAX so you can leave the room. If you do watch it you're kid will LOVE this film. I hate the goon squad, the Monstars are way better at least the toon squad isn't the looney squad. Finally as much as Teen Titans Go is garbage I would watch Teen Titans Go see space jam. P. S. The Micheal Jordan you wanted was Micheal B. Jordan how stupid at least my kid is happy and that's what I wanted for ME and my child but NO, doubt you can't make it through the 2 Hours of seriousness not a looney movie!

reviews.review_title: That's going to be a 1 for me dawg
reviews.content: I love space. I also love jamming. Much to my surprise this movie's title left me wanting more. The main character, Lebanon James, was, to put it mildly, a terrible actor. I think if he took his talents to south beach he could potentially have a basketball career. But Miami will always be D Wade's house, big ups to my man D Wade.Are you really surprised/10.
Easily the worst movie in history, Lebron cant move like Jordan he just dont have the charisma or charm. Joke ting.

Plot - Fail
Build up - Fail
Closing - Decent save.The hype leading to this movie maybe it's greatest downfall. Lebron is better than MJ with comparison to the 2 movies.For the fans - you have to watch this irrespective of how bad the experience is.The movie needed more ball playing.
It is a children's movie I will not judge it by a simple plot.

reviews.review_title: This whole movie was for sure written by an algorithm
reviews.content: Everything is just so meh, there is no soul , the film is way to long . The people that made this have clearly never worked on or played a video game before . I would have rather watched the emoji movie again.

Well, good thinking on WB Studio using only in-house supporting characters (Bugs, Daffy, Elmer, Road, Sylvester, etc.) - saves a lot of money.Not sure that I like the message of "Be the best basketball player ... focus on the game of basketball & not (tech) distractions." The problem is that the odds of making a life long living from bball is statistically very much lower than being tech comfortable (e.g. Programming; repair; innovation; application). And, likely to be less serving/helping to humanity & the Earth.
Communist China advocate LaBra Shames drops the ball and loses the game, again.
Story line up basically normal but Cartoon character great join a legacy 🙂

reviews.review_title: LeBron James is my favorite basketball player
reviews.content: While watching this movie I couldn't believe how bad it was. It was a 2-hour commercial advertising how great LeBron James really is. LeBron told us so over and over and over again. I used to be mad at the LeBron haters. I don't hate him but now I know what the haters mean. If you like LeBron like I do don't watch this movie it was nauseating.
Don't believe the hate. Movie could have been 30 mins shorter, but it was cute. The cameos were fun.

reviews.review_title: I wish I could give 0 stars.
reviews.content: Within the first 20 minutes of the film, we knew this was going to be horrible. My husband looked at me and asked, "Is this a LeBron James documentary? Or... what?"The short answer is yes.The original space jam worked because it was less of a focus on MJ and the gang and more of a focus on the basketball and animation.This wasn't even "Space Jam", this was "Computer Jam". But really more of, Computer YouBetterDontChargePeopleForThis.Take a note from the comments. Everyone is SICK and TIRED of remakes and series continuations of classics that don't stay true to said classic.This movie was a disgusting cash grab. Even if you have absolutely nothing left to watch, this still wouldn't satisfy your TV needs.

reviews.review_title: This is a Decent okay sequel to the Original Space Jam.
reviews.content: LeBron did his part in this Space Jam 2. And It was kinda corny and Lola Bunny wasn't all that sexy cute Like She was in the Original Space Jam and that part with Michael Jordan and Looney part was funny.2021 got the corny Space Jam 2 with LeBron himself. And the son Dom then sticks with his Dad LeBron. Bugs and Tune Squad forever til the fans and i die.

reviews.review_title: Space Jam 2: Welcome to the Slam
reviews.content: Lebron can't act. Look, MJ wasn't gonna win any awards for the original Space Jam but at least he was giving it a shot. Lebron in this is just a hunk of wood with a beard drawn on, he brings nothing to it. They call him King way to much for it to feel natural. The story makes no sense and doesn't even follow it's own premise all that well. The turn the tunes into 3D characters which feels like a mistake. The color tone is way too dark and ominous for a Space Jam movie. Don Cheadle's character makes no sense at all. The ending is ridiculous and the scene at the very end just made me angry.

Wow! What can I say? I took my grandson to see this movie and even he hated it. I hope Lebron has another plan after he retires because the movie biz is not for him. He's definitely not the next Jim Brown.

reviews.review_title: Paying $15 for ad-free HBOMax to watch a...2hr ad!?
reviews.content: It felt like 2 hrs of easter eggs and name-dropping other popular WB/HBO tv shows and movies. You're either going to geek out at these references or you'll get annoyed of these references in the first 5 mins, and find the rest of it to be straight trash.This was one of the most anticipated sequels in the past 25 years, and it was just...horrible. There was scope to do SO MUCH and build up on the 1997 nostalgia, but no, they had to make an ad. I get mentioning Harry Potter and Game of Thrones ONCE, but again and again...!? This is a Space Jam sequel. Stick to THAT!Stay away from this, and save 2 hrs unless you have to babysit a 3-5 yr old at home and you can't find anything else to calm the kid down. I mean, I get that you paid $15 for your HBOMax, but you didn't pay to watch ads, let alone a 2-hr ad. And oh, surely not waste your time going to a theater.I get calling LeBron 'King James' in real life, but the first 15-20 mins felt like they over calling him 'King'. I get it, it's LeBron! You calling him 'King' in the movie 53 times isn't gonna change LeBron haters. His acting was OK for an athlete but that's totally fine, nothing against that. But animated LeBron was better than the real one. Don Cheadle was better, but duh!? He's an actor.The story was ehh. There are a few chuckles here and there, but there's nothing else outside of that. Don't watch it. But if you have to, watch it at home, only if you have NOTHING ELSE to watch, which, you know it's true.
Everything that's wrong with the american film industry summed up in 90 min movie. Full of commercials, so politically correct that you wanna turn off the TV.

reviews.review_title: Another Remake, slam dunk strait into ther trash
reviews.content: I hope hollywood goes bankrupt so new exec can take their places and pump new material... Non stop PC REMAKES are trash.

Disjointed, sparratic and heartless. Jokes felt like a adhd nightmare with out of touch humor. So many moments of warner just flexing, it completely rips the storys flow and coherentness. Maybe deep down it has something genuine, but its covered by so many excecutive adjustments its nowhere to be seen.2/10: terrabad.

reviews.review_title: Great film if you're out of sleeping pills
reviews.content: This film sucked. It was boring. Incredibly boring. This could have been a great film if any effort was put into the story. What a snooze fest. There's literally nothing good to say about this film.

reviews.review_title: Space Jam, a legacy of worst in film
reviews.content: This movie is the epitome of how not to make entertainment. There is not a single good thing to say about this, the acting is below high school play, the vfx is 2003, story is nothing new and what's up with the cosplayers right off of hollywood Blvd? Was the budget for this movie $90K?This is just the laughable level Disney has sunk to trying to please the leftist agenda that just keeps backfiring at them anyway.

Wasted an evening watching this movie. Not only was it awful by itself, but for the whole movie I could feel the cloak of communism floating above the theatre because of LeBron James's role. Political Correctness is also very apparent.

reviews.review_title: Who is this movie meant for?
reviews.content: Now I loved the original Space Jam growing up and I was excited to hear there was a new one finally being released but this was just WB showing off their properties.First off the villain, AL G. Rhythm, (really? That's his name) feels like he forces the start of the movie by choosing LeBron to be the center of this WB collaberation. But why? What makes LeBron so special that it warrants this? Because he knows how to dunk a ball?Now the first movie had a ridiculous villain too but at least it made sense to me as to why he was going after the toons.The movie is your basic "parent doesn't understand child" cliche story in every kids movie. It isn't bad but it is hard to like the kid when he doesn't see he is obviously being manipulated.Speaking of manipulative. Bugs Bunny, while I understand he is the original troll of the cartoon universe, tricks LeBron into recruiting the toons when he already had people he wanted to recruit. Bugs basically said "oh your kids in danger? Well forget that I gotta get mah buddies back."Next are the references which makes me ask, "who is this movie for?" Kids? Adults? Furries? I don't know, because while it looks like it is for kids, it has references to movies and shows that they are either too young to recognize and too you to still watch to this day.If you have a kid or are a kid you'll enjoy it but this will not age as well as the original did in my book.The original cost $80 million to make and made back 3 times as much. This movie cost $162 million and I doubt it will even see half of that. This is a flop.

reviews.review_title: The biggest difference between LeBron and Jordan
reviews.content: LeBron in "Space Jam: A New Legacy": Buggs, you gotta take basketball seriously. This is a serious game, not a simple fun. Why don't you follow the rules!?Jordan in "Space Jam": Oh crap Buggs, why didn't you tell me I could lengthen my body? Hehe, my arm is so long.

reviews.review_title: Awful...Jordan was and is the best of all time.
reviews.content: Hey LeBron...shut up and dribble. No, seriously...don't ever "act" again...you're an uneducated moron.

reviews.review_title: Warner Brothers can't seem to get anything right lately
reviews.content: Warner Brothers has been one bad decision after another lately. Save your time and your money.

reviews.review_title: Guess everyone hates Le Bron for the low rating
reviews.content: I guess the low ratings are there due to the recent hate against Le Bron.This was actually a fun movie.Some great moments.My son loved it.And so did I.Some good pop culture moments such as Austin Powers, Matrix etc etc.If your are rating this low because of the recent hate against Le Bron you are sad individuals.
Simply terrible. It's bad enough that Lebron James is so unlikable and cannot act, but this is just pathetic.

It sucks. I couldnt even finish it. It exist solely as an ad. Marketing other better films. I honestly dont know why this film was made!The first film thou not perfect, was way better and memorable. This film is fgorgetible. I honestly hated it. Regretted wasting my time on it. I did not finish it.

reviews.review_title: LBJ please keep your day Job!
reviews.content: As so many before me,, WHY??Nobody needed this movie at all.

I went to see this movie as a joke and for laughs after seeing all the 1 star reviews which are hilarious but after watching the movie I have to disagree I know the original has a special place in people's hearts and in their childhood but this movie is made for the new generation so of course you might not find the jokes and movie as good as the original which is great but I love this movie yes it's an advertisement yes the acting is not great and yes porky pig rapping almost made me die of cringe but this movie was fun and the animation was great! It was just a fun movie to watch and the soundtrack was fire. I know some people didn't watch this movie because of LeBron but you don't really think of it when you watch it at least i didnt but I think all things aside it was just fun.

I necessarily dont even have a problem with recycling a storyline, its sort of an homage to the original and a legacy project. However when one can see from space that the recycling has been done only and 100% for monetary gain and it is a PRODUCT not a film, then its bad. I mean, you can make it both, quality and return for the investors.But I guess, except here and there, hollywood bank doesnt even bother anymore hiding it. Woke/diversity commitee to make people feel good about themselves, accounting to make money and a few big names to draw suckers in and youve got yourself a product.I guess writers are so passee. Story is simply made up from generic building blocks and checks the boxes,nothing new, nothing witty.Makes you cherish the few quality things that do come out here and there. If you want a cute animation that came out in the last few months check LUCA.

For as great as Space Jam was...this was 1000x horrible. James has proven himself a souless human being and it shows. This movie is nothing but a Lebron James ego show. Don Cheadle and the special effects were pretty much the only bright point.

I'm not sure why the ratings are so low for this. As an adult, is it the best kids movie I've seen? No. Was LeBron's acting terrible (as expected)? Yes. Did my 4 and 6 year old nieces like this? They LOVED it. It's a movie for kids that every kid I know who's watched it has actually enjoyed. If you're an adult and are looking for a great movie to watch, this isn't for you. That being said, for adults who do tune in, Don Cheadle makes the movie. He's hilarious.

Space Jam: A New Legacy is a sequel 25 years too late. Trying to bring back the nostalgia and success of the 1996 original, this new one lacks the charm and charisma of the original. In the end, this one feels desperate on throwing so much crap at the wall to see if something lands and sticks, and it lacks the heart and ambition making it a big cashgrab without direction.That being said, I don't think it has zero merit. When the Looney Tunes Classic 2D Animation sequence of the film comes up, it looks pretty good and has a bit of fun with what it does with slapstick humour and references. There are Warner Bros. References to franchises everywhere, which makes it feel like Ready Player One, so at first it's kind of cool but then you realise it's going to throw this at you non-stop and starts to get tedious. Little glimpses of humour are okay and the voice actors do a good job with the characters.All the live-action/human actor sequences however are really bad. To be fair, Michael Jordan was kind of bad too, but he had more depth to him than LeBron James did and was acting at cartoon sequences to nothing. Don Cheadle is really the only actor seemingly having a blast with it. Everybody else acts poorly and there's not really a Bill Murray or Wayne Knight equivalent here to add in some good banter. I didn't buy the kid was a computer genius either, not helped by poor acting.Its Soundtrack was lacking here too. It's one of the very best things going for the original Space Jam and fitted well with the themes and style of the film. Here there's nothing memorable and just seems generic and forgettable. The film relies mostly on CGI visuals and by the end becomes complete and utter nonsense of going too far off the rails for my liking personally, especially with no firm rules.In the end, it wasn't the worst watch in the whole wide world, but it felt like it was trying too hard and lacked what made the original Space Jam appealing and become a Guilty Pleasure. Yes it was nice to see the Looney Tunes again, but this is not the great big comeback for them and all the money in the world and cameos in it don't mean alot if the film isn't hitting the right notes for new and nostalgic fans.4.5/10.

Space Jam: A New Legacy isn't good, it takes a little too long to get going, it's over reliant on brands and IP which is very distracting in final battle, especially as they look so cheap and most of the jokes aren't funny. However, it's still fun with lots of hilariously bad moments throughout. LeBron James gives a good lead performance and Don Cheadle is really fun to watch in an extremely unhinged performance. Most of the CG is impressive and it's relatively well paced.

reviews.review_title: Space Jam 2 is Good. Deal with it.
reviews.content:
This movie was panned. I know that. But guess what when it first came out so was the first Space Jam. This Space Jam has a Rotten Tomatoes score of thirty-seven percent. Guess what the original has a Rotten Tomatoes score of forty-four percent. "But this movie is just a commercial for Warner Brothers."Need I remind you that people said the exact same thing about the first Space Jam. Doug Walker (in character as The Nostalgia Critic) complained that it was just a commercial for Nike. It's a critique with which I disagree but it was never an uncommon one. This movie was bombarded with the exact same critiques that the first one was when it first came out."But what about the pop culture references?"
The first Space Jam also had those "I didn't know Dan Aykroyd was in this picture".It's exhausting to have to go through all the illegitimate critiques before you get to the legitimate ones.My biggest worry when I saw this film was that it would be a blind rehash of the original. It wasn't. Instead of being about Basketball it was about video games (albeit sports influenced ones). Instead of having themes about standing up for yourself it has themes about trying to bend others to your will.Bugs Bunny has a great moment towards in the end of the film and I love what they've done with Lola as a character. The humour was genuinely funny and I for one enjoyed the Easter Eggs to every Warner Bros movie ever.The Algorithm's plot to force Lebron to play against his son in apocalyptic Basketball actually was clever in its cruelty. And I do think the characters are well-acted. And to keep this a Spoiler free review I'll just say if you're paying attention it wasn't a Deus Ex Machina. (I can't give more details).What did I not like about this. I don't love the transformation of the Looney Tunes from cartoons to live action though to the movie's credit neither do they. And the early part of the film spent too much time trying to advertise Lebron James (where the original didn't with Michael Jordan). The Algorithm could have had a more fleshed out motive but Cheadle played it well enough that I don't care.When the merits of this are measured against this first, I like the first better. But I still greatly enjoyed this film and find the attacks against it unfair.Space Jam 2 is good. Deal with it.

reviews.review_title: This is the epitome of Corporate Hollywood
reviews.content: One giant WB advertisement injected in a horrible script, with a contrived plot and pathetic performances. The irony is this just makes me hate WB even more. This studio has completely lost touch with it's customers.Space Jam was a fun silly movie of the 90s that never took itself seriously. "A New Legacy" tarnishes that name in the most embarrassing way possible. Seriously who approved of this disgrace.
LeBron is NOT the GOAT. This movie was worse than Shaquille's Shazaam.

There's no legacy here, just a series of weak CGI and contrived storytelling. This 'New Blunder' managed to ruin my childhood memories of the excellence and artistry I cherished seeing in "Space Jam" 1996.This review is written keeping in mind (and heart) the real legacy of the 1996 "Space Jam" movie.I adore every one of the 'Loony Tunes', which made me that much more disappointed to watch how they used them in this disaster-sequel. I guess LeBron James did his best with what he could. I liked what Kamiyah James (played by Sonequa Martin-Green) brought to her role. I also liked Don Cheadle's portrayal of Al G. Rhythm.They barely used the extraordinarily talented Steven Yeun (who played a Warner Bros. Exec). Malik (played by Khris Davis) was so funny but, sigh, under-used. I half-expected him to be 'teleported' into the cartoon-court and give us some fine LoonyTunes-inspired hilarity. But he was 'benched' throughout.Sadly, all the characters came across as 'inadequate' within the confines of this particularly ludicrous script.I think the filmmakers were trying to strike the perfect balance between the original 1996 "Space Jam" and the 1988 "Who Framed Roger Rabbit" film. Whereas those two excelled, "Space Jam" 2021 - more like 'Space Ham', and I'm not looking at you, Porky Pig - turned out to be an epic train-wreck.I sincerely pray they do not show a screening of this movie to Bugs Bunny and the rest of the Loony Tunes gang. The 'Tune Squad' will just freak their freak! Some of them will seriously wonder what encouraged the animation artists to make them look and move the way they did in 3D. Even Tweety might have been urged to use a few censor-worthy words after seeing the 'final out'.Over the years, I have enjoyed Basketball - I am not a diehard fan but am familiar with the game's various elements. Many a friend and cousin of mine have actually played Basketball at an official level. I take this time to hope and pray that these friends and cousins do not end up choosing to see this movie over the weekend.I have a feeling that even some sports-gamers won't appreciate some of the elements they integrated into this film, which felt like a strange unappealing version of 'Fantasy Football', only with Basketball and upended beyond belief.The voice-casting for each of the 'Tunes' was great. The references to various WB IPs was brilliant. The characters' full-cartoon designs were superb compared to their frightfully inferior photorealistic (almost) 3D-CG counterparts.The 'classic cartoon' scenes were literally the only ones in this film I enjoyed watching. The nostalgia I felt there should have carried over into the rest of the movie, in keeping with the excellence of the 1996 original. Alas, that wasn't the case with "Space Jam: A New Legacy".The whole 'teleport everyone who tunes into the live-stream' part was overkill. After a while, every real person in the digital realm seemed to have forgotten their perilous circumstance, and were happy cheering the teams on (!).I wish they didn't transform the Tunes into those semi-realistic 3D renditions. That was the whole charm behind "Roger Rabbit" and the original "Space Jam". They should have kept the toons looking toony and merged them with the 'real world'.Only the 'Goon Squad' got a worthy 'upgrade' in this re-design, and even then they didn't come close to touching the presence and intimidation value that the original 'Monstars' brought to court in the 1996 version. Oh, and they gave the Monstars' tiny versions a few seconds of screen time by way of cameos.I was enjoying all the 'WB easter eggs' they included in the audience more than the game itself. However, they all looked like real-world cosplayers who were 'teleported' into the game. Even King Kong seemed confused about the whole thing, and I don't blame him.The kid Dom James (Played by Cedric Joe) seemed completely oblivious to the Matrix-level implausibility of the situation, let alone his father's more than reasonable concerns about Al G's ambitions. It was literally fun and games to Dom, when all he had to do to cease Al's 'reign' was stop playing ball.He did in the end, late as it was. I could practically see the big red 'convenience-button' glowing and a lazy screenplay writer smacking it with hypnotic glee while another one pulled down on the 'predictable-lever'.Don't even get me started on that major Jordan-cameo let-down. It quite frankly broke my heart.There is not much good to say about the sheer 'Loony' atrocities, and predictabilities, that have been committed in this highly anticipated sequel. The movie defied credibility, and not at all in the exceptional way the original 1996 film did. I ended up highly anticipating the movie to finish so I could begin the arduous task of writing this painfully truthful review before attempting to heal myself from the Toony-trauma of it all.The legendary Warner Bros. Studios (!) worked on this supposed-to-be-brilliant sequel, and not a one among them stopped to suggest, "Hey, we can do better, way better." In the 'Age of Streaming' where all sorts of IPs and Studios (even WB, for that matter!) are upping their game, this crew decided to go low. The final result? A grand slam dump in lieu of a dunk.I don't think I will ever forgive them for what they tried doing to my all-time toon-hero Bugs Bunny. If something untoward had happened there, there'd have been hell to pay."That's all folks!" Wait, let me rephrase that... "That's it, folks, I've had it!"

reviews.review_title: Space Jam 2, How we inserted every Warner Media character into this film
reviews.content: Ohh boy. I just saw Space Jam: A New Legacy. My head is still spinning from what I just saw. Granted, the first wasn't a Oscar winning piece, but it was watchable and exciting.We open up with LeBron as a child, more interested in his GameBoy. Coach takes his video games away as it isn't helping and say's basketball will help your mother.Mr James ( or King James, uggh as he is called over and over)asks his son, who is developing a video game, if he wants to tag along.to the Warner Brothers lot to listen in on a supposed project. At this time, we meet Don Cheadle's character inside the computer (yes, it is really that confusing.)Don Cheadle wants to play a basketball game. If you win, you are free, I win, you stay with me in here forever. So, James and Bugs Bunny go on a search to find the Loony Tunes characters.That is the movie. Assembling the "team" then playing a game. The movie is chocked full of every single Warner Media character. It got to a point where it was super frustrating seeing so much brand product placement. Sure, Disney does Hidden Mickey's, but that is less subtle. Seeing It the clown and The Mask were too distracting in the crowd. In fact, there was an overly long, awkward Austin Powers bit which did not fit except being owned by Warner.. At one point, I figured I'm watching a giant ad for HBO Max.One more thing that annoyed me, Lebron can not act! I wanted to leave, but I forced myself to watch this. Couldn't Warner Media have picked a NBA star who can well, act?
No idea why this movie has such a low rating. It was a lot of fun. Maybe all the bad reviews are by basketball fans who root for another team?! As a kids movie it was great fun!

This poor movie did not have a chance. Just months before it's release, the liberal cult of snowflake-crybabies, decided to cancel a cartoon character named Pepé Le Pew. He was my favorite character. I know that if you are a liberal that you don't have a sense of humor, I get that. I know that if you are a liberal that you have to be told when to laugh. But if you can't see the funny in a smelly skunk who wants to get in close with hugs and kiss', maybe cartoons are not for you. Maybe instead of getting a cartoon cancelled, you should try to figure out how you are going to move out of your mothers basement.And then they cast LeBron Lames as the lead? Lames is the main reason I missed this movie. Putting money in LeBron Lames pocket is the same as putting money in Communist China's pocket. I refuse to support a Communist loving, police-officer-hating, ignorant-race-bating-bigot, like LeBron. And judging from the reviews and response this film has generated, everyone else feels the same.There is a reason that Michael Jordan is the GOAT. Not only did Michael revolutionize the game of basketball but he also revolutionized the icon status. The reason Michael was so great, was because he was just as good off the court as he was on the court; Meaning he had class.

reviews.review_title: Probably the worst movie in the last decade.
reviews.content: This has now made it into my top 5 of worst movies. Don't waste your time. So ridiculous...

Go into this with low expectations and the intention of having a good time and you will enjoy it. Inside jokes were great and only recognizable to an NBA/Lebron fan and although the story is not exactly original per say the animations were fantastic.I have a feeling the bad reviews are coming from bitter Lebron haters. I'm not a Lebron fan on the court but off the court he's great. The new Toon Squad jerseys/unis are outstanding and I was entertained from start to the finish. I won't spoil it here but the movie even had a moment where I got chills. All I'm going to say about that.This is not the place to show your hate for Lebron or debate the Lebron/MJ GOAT status. Just enjoy the movie for what it is. Having said all of that what's missing is a soundtrack like the original or even a hit song but long gone are those days of movies producing chart topping songs let alone soundtracks.

The 1st was tragic, but in a fun, tongue-in-cheek way- but this? I can't fathom for the life of me why anyone felt this was necessary or needed, but it most definitely was not.It feels like a whiny, narcissistic need to be something, but unless the goal of that something is a hot pile of garbage, the filmmakers/actors/producers missed the mark by a hot mile.You cannot spend every waking minute lecturing from your ivory tower; telling us lowly plebs what horrible, deplorable people we are, and then have the gall to expect us to toss money your direction for something because, once again, you seem to be laboring under the delusion that you're the GOAT, and guess what? You are not the GOAT.I'm delighted to see the rating as low as it is- currently hovering around 3.5 stars- that tells me a large swath of film watchers also find this hackneyed gobbledygook a complete heIIscape of worthlessness. The only way this rating comes up is troll armies arriving to prop up this ridiculous nonsense.Maybe try China, Mr. James. You seem quite focused on their approval, along with the rest of your league.

I honestly didn't expect LeBron James to be that bad at acting. Like really bad. I thought he pretty much ruined the movie. After this I don't see him having much of an acting career. On the brighter side it was definitely cool seeing all the old Looney Toones in the movies again. I especially liked seeing all the Warner Bros characters in the stands. Not a totally terrible film because of all the old characters, but damn LeBron was horrible. 5 stars.

Souless showcase if WB properties. The movie substitutes a plot for parents fan fare on movies/tv shows that aren't even for kids. Mad Max Fury Road, Pennywise from I. T., and Game of Thrones have no place in a Space Jam Movie.Toss this movie in a fire and watch the original. Your kids will thank you.

reviews.review_title: Dumb Fun; See Back In Action
reviews.content: This movie is pretty stupid at times, but overall it's just a fun time. The plot is horrible, but it provides a vehicle for funny moments and jokes. The story and character development present in the original Space Jam are not here, and are instead replaced with fun references. For people who have only seen Space Jam before this, this turn may come as a surprise. But, for those who've seen Looney Tunes: Back In Action, this is more of the same. Loose/nonexistent plot with really fun comedy set pieces. This movie was enjoyable, but if you want to see this type of movie turned up to 11, watch Back In Action.

reviews.review_title: Awful, stop trying to recreate classics
reviews.content: Awful movie from start to finish, I'm sick of Hollywood trying to recreate classics they only ruin them.

reviews.review_title: but another movie that could soar into the clouds but for having a bad script fell by parachute
reviews.content: The movie is good but focuses on the villain and not the protagonist lebron james.Final grade 3.

I can see why some people actually like this movie knowing how hyped up it was in the trailer with the cameos and action-packed elements this film wanted to provide. But I genuinely cannot like this movie. The first Space Jam didn't rub in this much of a cash grab like the sequel does. Space Jam, like many people have said, is basically a good movie because of how it was produced for its time when basketball was popular and animated commercials were always worth watching since they were very creative with what they would come up with in the making of them. Space Jam was definitely not a perfect movie, the only thing oscar-worthy was honestly the animation, but I still liked it for what it was from its time. But this sequel didn't need to happen. Instead of Michael Jordan we have Lebron James in the cliché father and son bonding plot which actually would've worked okay atleast with this movie if this was the only flaw. But this movie makes Lebron unlikable to his son manipulating him to be an athlete instead of what he wants to be which is a video game creator. Which is annoying to the audience. Michael Jordan never appears in this film which would've been forgivable if this movie was atleast okay. But since MJ told WB he didn't want to, WB hypes us up with Michael B Jordan in this movie instead, some people find it funny but I find it disgusting to anyone who wanted to see MJ. Atleast don't talk about him at all if he doesn't want to be in the film, seriously. We're focusing on someone else this time. The villain Al-G, who is also a live action character, is cringeworthy who plans to make the world his own game. The acting is noticeably bad unlike the first film. Lebron isn't just too chill, he's usually too awkward at times and so are many of the other live-action characters involved in the story. And this is a common problem with live-action animation hybrids but here it's a lot more noticeable since the Looney Tunes don't appear until later. And of course speaking of the Looney Tunes, even the Looney Tunes are a problem. Yes, I'm not kidding. The stupid controversy desexualizing Lola Bunny is honestly a sexist thing to do with a character. Compare Lola Bunny to Jessica Rabbit from Who Framed Roger Rabbit atleast, Lola wasn't even sexualized in the first place. But anyway, most of the Looney Tunes hardly get any roles. It's mostly Bugs Bunny and sometimes Daffy, Granny, and Sylvester. Pepe Le Pew was not even in this movie at all because of another dumb controversy about him sexually harassing women. This is the Looney Tunes like what do you expect? They were from a time when cartoons got away with a lot of things that wouldn't be allowed in cartoons nowadays. In the first Space Jam he was just teaming up in the basketball tournament like there wasn't even a joke about him chasing Penelope Pussycat who doesn't like him. And the animation is also problematic. Not only is the CGI too furry and realistic on the Looney Tunes but the idea of it makes no sense. They enter the live-action world hand-drawn but are "turned into" CGI and will be released back to 2D if they win the game, like what sense does this make? I mean yeah the CGI looks unsettling but still, this doesn't work. And even though this movie brings back traditional animation as well, the traditional animation in the first film did an outstanding job with the Looney Tunes, here it's noticeably downgraded, overly saturated, and less fluid as if Warner Brothers didn't make the budget. The only animation I was fine with was the robot that helped Al-G Rhythm. The only thing I can really like from the Looney Tunes is the voice acting (except for Lola) and maybe a few creative jokes in the Looney Tunes world that actually feel like the Looney Tunes. And no I am not talking about the Big Chungus joke where he apparently becomes canon. And of course, the cameos in this movie are all a lie. They all stay way back in the game's crowd blurred away doing nothing but spectating. And the movie's soundtrack is just too cheesy with constant rap and pop songs. This sequel was truly a mistake, I'm sorry.

reviews.review_title: Feels more like an advert of Warner Bros. promoting their properties
reviews.content: The original Space Jam was a childhood favourite of mine. Even though that film doesn't hold as well now, it's still much better than Space Jam: A New Legacy.Space Jam: A New Legacy follows LeBron James as he works with the Looney Tunes to win a basketball game in order to save his son from a rogue artificial intelligence.Looking back at Space Jam now, it's not very good but there is a certain charm that film possesses and a level of nostalgia for me which makes it a guilty pleasure. However, I found no joy watching Space Jam: A New Legacy. I was interested purely because of nostalgia but this film disappointed me on so many levels. It doesn't even feel like a film. It's more of a 2 hour advertisement for all the properties Warner Bros own. We're taken through franchises like The Matrix, Austin Powers, the DC universe and many more throughout. It felt like a cheap way to promote and sell their properties. Even the audience of the basketball match is made up of characters Warner Bros own. The huge amount of characters and references were so distracting and took away my focus on the actual game. The story of the original Space Jam was very cheesy and predictable but it came from a time where it was more acceptable. Here, the premise is so outdated and predictable all the way through. Aside from one, every single joke fell flat. The only aspect of Space Jam: A New Legacy that I thought was well done were the effects. Clearly a lot of effort went into them and the film indeed looks great.The performances are also pretty awful. Michael Jordan's performance in the original was not good and the same goes for LeBron James. This film revolves around him more than the Looney Tunes themselves but James isn't able to carry this film. He is very wooden especially during scenes that require him to show emotion. It's evidently clear that he's not an actor. Don Cheadle looks like he's having a lot of fun playing the villain but the script unfortunately doesn't work in his favour. The Looney Tunes were fine but I felt like they weren't utilised to their full potential here.Space Jam: A New Legacy is a film to forget. The script is very cringey and predictable, the acting isn't good and it lacks the charm and fun of the original. This is simply a massive promotion for Warner Bros and nothing else.

This is perhaps not the worst movie I have ever watched but it's close. The less said about it the better. You only live once and spending part of your life watching this is something you will regret bitterly.

I think some people are not going to like this movie but I thought it was fantastic. The humor worked for me, This is the first movie this year where I laughed out loud in the theater. I went there with a friend and we sometimes had a chat when a character from another movie came along and that was really nice. I think this is a movie you should see in the theater.The story is of course a family story but they say it in its way that it is fresh, of course it does have its family movie ending but that doesn't matter, because I had a good time with the movie. The CGI is very good and I'm happy with what they put it in.This movie is definitely a 9/10 and I would recommend it for old space jam fans young and old as it wouldn't disappoint. NEED ANOTHER SEQUEL.

This film had all the looniness you'd expect from a loony tunes movie. Its very fast paced, it's often stupid but thats kinda to be expected. I was entertained and never bored that's all I can really ask for. Worth checking out not amazing but passable.

reviews.review_title: I'd rather slam my foot in a car door than watch this movie again.
reviews.content:
It's actually painful to watch this terrible garbage. I feel so passionately about hating this movie. The story is garbage, the acting is garbage,
Warning: trash can not included.

This move is a full on praise of Lebron and how great and wonderful he is. Don't get me wrong, I'm a fan of basketball and I'm a fan of movies.. yet this drivel was over the top. It was a full on slobberfest on how the mighty king Lebron is. I'm sorry, I do not want to be hit over the head with that. It's like he spent money on this to be like: "look how great I am!" And I'm not having it. There was some really great elements and some actual potential to make this movie enjoyable, but it falls way to flat. I seriously wanted this movie to be better because it could have been fun. I'm thoroughly disappointed. I'm just glad I didn't pay to see it.

reviews.review_title: Some fun moments, but definitely NOT a worthy sequel to the first classic! :-(
reviews.content: Not Lebron's finest acting (he has done much better in other movies), a ridiculous sci-fi twist to something that can only work as total fantasy (like the original), way too long for the content, and cheesy live-action extras for certain Warner Brother movie characters! :-( However, it was nice to see high-quality 3-D renditions of the Looney Tunes and so many cool Warner Brothers movie and TV characters! :-)

reviews.review_title: CLASSIC CULT IN A FEW YEARS!!
reviews.content: LeBron James soars in a Looney Tunes adventure that will delight generations of fans.

reviews.review_title: U can't even laugh at it for being bad.
reviews.content: LeBron has the emotional range of a brick wall. The biggest facial expression he makes the entire movie is the photoshopped smile on the poster. This was an abomination of blasphemous proportions. I dunno what blasphemy even is, but this is probably it.

reviews.review_title: One of the worst movies I have ever seen
reviews.content: I mean seriously wtf is this pile of gargabe???!!! This movie wasn't just boring, it was excruciatingly painful. Everything about it was just downright awful. The acting was some of the worst Ive ever seen and just the overall plot was ridiculously stupid. Most movies I can manage to finish, even the really bad ones, but I had to force myself to go to sleep to stop myself from witnessing the cringe. I can't even think of a single good quality this movie has. Id rate it 0 stars if that were an option.

This new movie has great special effects, that's probably the highest praise I can give this CGI fest, which is forgettable at best, a waste of time at worst.The Michael Jordan movie might not be a classic, but this one is a bad movie.

reviews.review_title: I can see why the critics hated it
reviews.content: It's a giant bragfest for Lebron, rubbing his wealth in everyone's face, his basketball success, making his kid look like a super genius...oh yeah, he's also a super basketball player.No one is sympathetic, but quite honestly in this world, that's probably the most believable thing about the movie.Hard pass. No good.

reviews.review_title: Souless, vomitous, mass. The entire movie is an algorithm.
reviews.content: Other reviews do a much better job at explaining why.
Nothing to say.Just Chungus.A Masterpiece. Fantastic. Brilliant. Bold. Excentric and Magnific. LeBron is a terrific actor. The CGI and the WB references are pure gold.

reviews.review_title: WOW....worst movie I have seen in years
reviews.content: This is one huge ego trip for Lebron James and a huge advertising platform for Warner Brothers. Lebron's acting is some of the worst I have ever seen. He lacks any depth and personality. The plot is terrible. Not even close to the original. Whoever had the idea to create this piece of garbage should be fired. DO NOT waste your time and money on this.

"Space Jam: A New Legacy" is not a masterpiece, but is not a bad film either, just fun and nostalgic about "Looney Tunes", also is full of cameos of famous Warner Bros. Characters (animated and real ones). The script is not that original, but the special effects are good and the animation is cool. A fun film for nostalgic people like me.
If you want a film that gives you the experience of cancer watch this, but if not don't waste your time. No comedy just references to other properties.

reviews.review_title: It is what it's supposed to be C+
reviews.content: Wait, y'all actually acting like #spacejam isn't a kids movie?AND y'all acting like the first one wasn't poorly received trash. Don't do this revisionist history. For the long form commercials that both space jam movies are- they're good for what they are. Solid C+ mindless entertainment. It's a movie about cartoons and y'all acting like it's supposed to be giving the secret to curing world hunger.
