Space Jam: A New Legacy is an entertaining and nostalgic movie. It does a pretty good job at presenting the world of the Looney Tunes along with some great Easter eggs. However, that's pretty much the only good thing about this movie. Basically every other aspect in this sequel is just plain bad! The acting, the story, the plot and everything all around.It was fun watching some of the characters we grew up loving, but this movie misses a lot more than it hits.

Don't watch this thing! It's just trash and doesn't belong anywhere. I really wish space jam 2 didn't happened and so does the rest of the world, so do yourself a big favour and stay as one of the people who didn't ruin there reputation by seeing this trash.

reviews.review_title: Welcome to the Jam and the Looney!!!
reviews.content: The first Space Jam will always be my favorite movies of all time.I love Space Jam so much, and I also love the Looney Tunes. The Tune Squad vs The Goon Squad was a pretty cool idea if you think about it. The movie was alright, but they also have a little bit of drama and there's also hilarious cameos as well. I love how they tell the story of LeBron James and his son, because this movie is like a father and son story, and the Looney Tunes will do anything to help LeBron get his son back from an evil super villain who played War Machine from the MCU, Don Cheadle. Space Jam: A New Legacy was alright, but still I really enjoyed the original Space Jam more and the Looney Tunes all together.Thank you for bringing the best Space Jam movie ever made!!!

I expected acting to be bad given the lead is a basketball star not an actor and to his credit he did fine. However the story was not well developed. Characters were not well developed. All of a sudden you would see random toons added out of no where. Nothing about it brought back the original vibes that were exciting and fun. It was all cgi and fake. WB clearly wanted to say how many franchises it owns rather than focus on the movie and who ever promoted that idea should get demoted. This was a 2 hour marketing campaign rather than what if a basketball player played basketball with looney toons characters.

A couple of scenes made me chuckle in my head but otherwise just awful. It's made for children while trying to appeal to the older generation who enjoyed the original in the 90s. It falls flat in every field on every level. Congrats, WB, you did it again.

reviews.review_title: Shamelessly rehashes the original film and makes a poor attempt to appeal to all audiences
reviews.content: "Space Jam: A New Legacy" is a standalone sequel to the 1996 animation/basketball themed film "Space Jam". Starring NBA player LeBron James in the lead role alongside Don Cheadle, it shamelessly rehashes the original film and makes a poor attempt to appeal to all audiences.In Burbank, California, NBA superstar LeBron James and his son Dom (Cedric Joe) are sucked into a virtual world by Warner Bros.' high-tech A. I. program Al-G Rhythm (Don Cheadle). Taking Dom prisoner, Al-G promises to return him if LeBron is able to assemble a basketball team consisting of Warner Bros. Characters and beat him in a match against his own set of players. LeBron hastily agrees and is sent off flying into the virtual universe where he lands in "Tune World", meeting with a solitary Bugs Bunny. LeBron informs the famous cartoon rabbit of his predicament and they both agree to recruit the rest of the Looney Tunes to form their own unique basketball team to defeat Al-G once and for all.I suppose it's just my own morbid curiosity but I have a habit of greatly anticipating sequels to films that have been in development for an extended period of time. They can be worth the wait, like "Blade Runner 2049", which added so much more to its already established lore, or a complete disappointment, like "Independence Day: Resurgence", which was little more than a cash-grab rehash. "Space Jam: A New Legacy", or as I'm calling it, "Ready Player LeBron" is the latter example, doing what the original did that made it something of a cult favourite amongst 90s kids but simply applying to it a deceptive new paint job.I'm not going to act like the 1996 film was perfect, as watching it back today made me realise how badly it has aged. It was basically just a giant ad filled with Nike shoes, McDonald's Fries, and bottles of Gatorade. It also doesn't help that the now disgraced R. Kelly sang the film's theme song. With that said, it was still an amusing concept for the time, and besides, ads can still be fun to watch if they are marketed correctly. This follow-up, which comes to us a quarter of a century later, is also a giant ad, albeit, in a different sense of the word. Instead of consumer items, here we are being advertised various different IPs (Intellectual Properties) belonging to Warner Bros. Such as Harry Potter, the DC Universe, Game Of Thrones, and even The Matrix. Oh, and the Looney Tunes are in there as well in case you didn't notice by now. Normally I would love to see all of these IPs crossing over but here it's handled so poorly that I ended up dreading seeing all these different universes merging. This is because there's no sense of organisation with combining everything together, it is all carelessly thrown in there as a means for Warner Bros. To show off how many of these IPs they own the rights to. In other words, the company appears more preoccupied with being dominant over what its audience should enjoy rather than merely wishing to entertain us with some of its characters.The film is at least decent to look at, with state-of-the-art CGI effects that do a serviceable job of combining 2D cartoons with 3D environments. However, the parts I liked best were the ones where an animated LeBron James was in Tune World interacting with Bugs Bunny and the others. It's so rare to see traditionally hand-drawn animation these days, or at least a style that replicates it efficiently, so I guess that's why scenes like these stood out to me the most. That's not to say the 3D animated Looney Tunes looked terrible, although they did look a bit creepy at times, I'm just more of a fan of old school animation and the charm that comes with it.Additionally, I can't tell if it's the lazy script or bad comic timing but the film just isn't that funny. Considering the Looney Tunes are supposed to be some of the funniest cartoon characters of all time, it's a huge shame to see all their antics fall flat here. Taking the place of the slapstick humour we are used to are dated Matrix parodies, which haven't been relevant in over twenty years, and Porky Pig rapping, calling himself "The Notorious P. I. G.". Of course, I am aware this film's target audience is young children but how many of them are actually going to understand any of these references? Surely the filmmakers can't expect to have their parents explain every single pop culture joke to them? In total, I think there were only two parts of the entire movie I found amusing, one was a reference to a certain meme of Bugs Bunny impersonating Elmer Fudd and the other alluding to why Michael Jordan declined to return to make this sequel. The reason I am not elaborating further is because in the event that a parent who is reading this ends up dragged along to watch the film with their kid and wants something to laugh at won't have it spoiled for them.Although he's obviously not an actor by trade, I think LeBron James was able to hold his own throughout the film. I don't follow basketball so I'm not sure what type of person James is off court but here he seems like a sincere person at heart who cares about other people. His acting is surprisingly better than I expected too, which gives the impression he must have taken some lessons in order to effectively play this fictionalised version of himself. As for Don Cheadle, his character is just a generic cartoonish villain wanting nothing more than for an excuse to show off his excess power (sounds a lot like Warner Bros. Itself if you ask me). He only exists to set up the big basketball match at the end, never really feeling as though he is huge threat in the long run. Though to Cheadle's credit, he at least looks like he's having fun playing the role.In the end, "Ready Player LeBron", sorry, I mean "Space Jam: A New Legacy", was not worth waiting the extensive twenty-five years it took to get made. It does exactly what a sequel shouldn't do in rehashing the entire basic plot structure of the original while trying to pass itself off as something completely new. Upon some research, there were apparently some spin-offs considered in place of this film such as skateboarding with Tony Hawk or golfing with Tiger Woods. Those would have been much better ideas than what we got here so if there's another follow-up in the future, let's hope they follow that format instead.I rate it 4/10.
If VHS was still around, this would have gone straight to it. What a pile of ....
If they give out an award for worst movie of the year bet the ranch on this one.

reviews.review_title: A s*it sandwich is still a s*it sandwich
reviews.content: Poor garbage and quite frankly should NEVER been made. Seriously, stab your eyes out now, and save yourself the trouble of watching them bleed out from watching this pure rubbish! Put it in a black hole and DELETE it from this world!

Most unoriginal story. Worst acting. Every character possible referenced for merchandising and sales exposure. Zero charm. Seems like everyone involved believed that the audience was in love with them as much as they are in love with themselves. No redeeming qualities.

reviews.review_title: Ignore the bad ratings and make your own judgment.
reviews.content: I wasn't into the first Space Jam movie. Jordan wasn't a good actor and the story wasn't that interesting. Now this one was totally different. It had a simple plot, funny scenes, plenty of cameos, and overall wholesome family fun. Also Lebron acting was good.I don't get the huge backlash. Just watch it and enjoy it.

I guess on a larger scale of rating this would be a higher 3/10. Something closer to a 4. The original space jam wasn't great, but it felt good. It had fun with its self and it did justice to the Looney toons franchise. It wasn't a masterpiece but it's a beloved classic. Space Jam A New Legacy doesn't do any of that. It feels like a stretched out advertisment that lasts 2 hours. There's maybe 1...2??? Jokes that made me at least grin. They make the Looney's 3D for no reason and nothing quite makes sense. The acting across the board is bad. Don Cheadle played about as good as he could with his character and it lacks any soul or purpose other than basically stroking Lebron's ego. There was no reason for a sequel, but the fact they got 6 writers to write and come up with this is beyond amazing tbh. Worth a watch if you have HBO Max already I guess but don't pay anything for this.

reviews.review_title: My son and I left the theater.
reviews.content: You can tell that this movie being made is trying way too hard. At least the first one was funny and had a decent storyline. Wayyyy too futuristic.

reviews.review_title: Studios Need To Step Their Game Up
reviews.content: Why call it Space Jam when it has nothing to do with space? Besides a couple of laughs and some half decent visuals, this movie is pretty bad. The whole father and son arc was incredibly weak and predictable, and used as a device so Lebron didn't have to actually carry the weight of acting, because damn his acting was wooden, and so was the dialogue, and the story for that matter. Don Cheadle couldn't even bring that terrible writing to life. The film takes so long to get to where the audience wants it to go, and then it tries to bedazzle you with lights and characters galore, the background characters (like Pennywise, Batman, The Mask) looked so awkward. Why are audiences becoming happier with mediocre films these days? I think Netflix is lowering peoples standards.

Pointless movie made just so hollywood can ripoff consumers and rake in more money for delivering mediocrity. LeBronda is a joke and not a role model like Michael Jordan was and is. Maybe hollywood will one day realize the majority of the public doesn't buy into the media's propaganda and virtue signaling crybabies.

reviews.review_title: I'm sorry just a cash grab for WB and to feed Brons ego
reviews.content: I know a bunch of these reviews have to be filled with lebron hate without even seeing the movie and I went into this wanting to like it. But I'm sorry it's just a 2 and a half hour long commercial for all the Warner's property with plenty of dialogue describing lebron as the greatest player of all time and more than a ball player. reviews.review_title: So shockingly bad it makes me sad to even rate it this low very cringy movie.
reviews.content: Within the first 2 minutes it was cool, within 5 mins of the movie it was just like a video tribute to him just with creative editing not a good look at all, within 15 minutes clearly they promo for Nike was to extra like ok we get he is apart of Nike, now the acting from James himself was awful very cringy most of the time clearly whoever decided to make this movie didn't factor that in at all they could have use it's real wife n kids to draw more of a real emotion out of him ijs, then the way Don Chino look like ugggh I personally hate the upgrade to the jerseys that's just me AD as a hawk or eagle then to use the WNBA players like they did was awful I hate that part with a serious passion they could have use them better alot better and actually use them as the women that they are very distasteful the voice for Lola threw me off big time the way they even use some of the looney toons was a head scratcher they could have kept Pepe Le Pew frfr they when they got to the actual game jaw dropping back to back cornball lines very basic ABC-ish it's a kids movie I think but woooooow this was awful the acting was so bad it took away from the plot of the movie in my opinion it just seem like a movie gear more towards James then I guess whatever the point was suppose to be I didn't even finish looking at the movie I was so ashamed of it I like the call back to the mon-stars but other then that I can't say I like anything about the movie then the son walking away from him while he talking to him at that point I was saying to my self bruuuuuh Hollywood need to stop it lol no way in the world that's happening without putting a hand or hands on him to stop him slow him down or you know but that's how unrealistic this movie came off as at least with the original space jam you wanted to or felt like you could be in the movie or that could happen to you this one was very cringy.

This was sad to watch. Like Warner Bros took every successful franchise they had, put it in a blender, add some popular basketball players, hit purée, drank it up and vomited it all over this movie and basically using the space jam script. It's just sad. Even bugs noted that the story sounded familiar in the movie.Great if athletes try a stab at acting or singing. Great follow your dreams. But sorry to say, this was not great acting.I do not recommend watching this to anyone.

reviews.review_title: Ignore the hate, this movie is a lot of fun
reviews.content: There's a lot of hate on this thread for this movie; a lot due to the idea of a sequel ruining the first. If you're like me, and the first came movie was released when you were a child, this will bring back a whole lot of nostalgia, and that to me, is priceless.First of all, remember that this is geared towards a young audience; one where Looney Tunes is not as prominent and Warner Bros. Knows that. The use of other films to show the various time travel exploits of the Toons is real fun, and makes you wonder just how much Warner Bros actually owns. It's impressive.The movie itself is your standard hero-villain type we've always known and the storyline of LeBron James' relationship with his son is a pretty good one. Sure, there's a few plot holes and weaknesses but it's Looney Tunes where cartoons explode and are alive the next scene - take that at face value.If you're looking for something fun and enjoyed the first Space Jam, this does not disappoint. In fact, A New Legacy brings back all the fond memories of seeing the first movie and is great for kids too.

reviews.review_title: Are you kidding me with these low reviews?
reviews.content: This movie was a real surprise. I have no idea why so many people hate it. LeBron is a much better actor than MJ, and the jokes in this movie are great. Don't get me wrong, it's not a perfect movie, there are some bits that drag or that I'd change, but overall this was a great time. People need to take their nostalgia glasses off and view this movie by it's own merit. The acting is better, graphics are better, writing is better, it's a better movie. Ease up on it people, and allow yourselves to have fun.

Space Jam: A New Legacy is a movie that starts with Warner Bros dropping their IP like Lebron James dunking baskets. The pacing seems fast in the beginning but it gets slowed down in the middle so that Warner Bros can show off their properties correctly and perfectly. Don Cheadle looks the most polishing one when it comes to acting, LeBron James have done it ok but Michael Jordan did a really good job when it came to getting mixed with the cartoons. In terms of story you can summarise it with just two words which is showing off IP's and making you a little emotional like it's hundred's of predecessors. In terms of fun there is loads of fun in the whole movie. Every scene of this movie is filled with characters that we cherished through our whole childhood and teenage years. Warner Bros did manage to make this movie a watchable one with your family on a weekend with their IP's but they definitely failed to catch our eyes with the story and the other stuff. Overall if you have time on the weekend and if you love Warner Bros characters, otherwise there are other films to watch on the onlineverse.

Barely 20 minutes in it becomes abundantly clear that Warner Brothers is only interested in promoting themselves and seeing how many times the name "King James" can be said within in their 2 hour window.And if you can look passed that, you also have to get through 2 hours of a terrible story line and horrible acting.

Not worth watching! Micheal Jordon was better! With the actor Lebron James, he has a bad reputation for wanting a cops to be killed. So no one is interesting in actors who hates cops. So therefore makes the whole movie not worth watching. Lebron James sucks and is a huge LOSER!

Just a horrible movie don't watch it and it had a lot of swearing in it to the point they bleeped out the swear words so the kids didn't know what swear words was said and that ... just a horrible movie at the end of the day.

reviews.review_title: A dull witted sequel that shouldn't have been made
reviews.content:
Is this a promo ad for Lebron James? Sure felt like it.Sat down with the Fam and I was the only one who really didn't like it. I got the references
(including the Bobby Knight reference) and saw all the WB characters. Some of the jokes were funny but most just felt awkward.Judge it for yourself, just don't expect anything spectacular.

I admit that I enjoyed the original "Space Jam" movie when it came out in its day, but I also have to admit that during the subsequent 25+ years that have passed since then, my viewpoint of it has diminshed substantially; I now see that it greatly betrayed its classic characters and had them act in a way contrary to their classic images.However, I will give the original SJ this: It is a MUCH better movie than this "Did anyone want this?" follow-up. Where to begin? Well, here's a list of some things about this follow-up that rubbed me the wrong way:The toon characters are written in an extremely shallow manner - they hardly show any personality or depth. Any one of their classic seven minute cartoons showed more of them than this almost two hour movieThey cut out Pepe LePew from the movie for politically correct reasons, even though anyone with half a brain will see that LePew is such a broad character that's it's hard to take him and his viewpoint seriously.The voice artists for the toon characters are extremely amateurish. Now I know that voice artist Mel Blanc is long dead, but you would think that by now, Warner Brothers would have found some adequate replacements.There is no warmth in the narrative or the characters. Yes, this is supposed to be a wild raucous comedy, but you have to still have heart so the audience will care about the characters and what they are going through.The relentless bombardment of plugs for various Warner Brothers IP properties is so extreme that it goes beyond embarrassing and becomes shameless.The movie feels both too slow (such as with setting up the whole basketball challenge) and too fast (lack of character development, lack of explaining how things are in a certain situation, etc.)The decision to turn the classic Looney Tunes characters into CGI creatations for much of the movie, instead of their classic hand drawn style.I could go on, but those above points are the biggest beefs I had with this travesty. Is there anything GOOD to say about this fiasco? Well, I will admit that the movie is more technically accomplished than the first movie. There are a few small gags here and there that did make me chuckle a little. Also, the live action cast does work hard despite the shabby script given to them (even LeBron James puts in a great effort, and manages to be adequate.) It's hard to believe this movie took SIX writers to put together, but it's easy to believe that this is a case of too many cooks spoiling the broth.

reviews.review_title: Movie was so bad it made me sick.
reviews.content: Title speaks for itself. Dont pay money for this movie. Garbage.

One star for the "let your kids be themselves" message. When this comes out take a shot each time they say LeBron James. How could a 2hr long movie feel so rushed? Black Captain America's acting was the only saving grace.

Why? Just why?It seems we are doomed to have one of these nostalgia-bait, blatant cash-grabs each year.The special effects are an improvement on the original, except worse somehow.All the charm and soul of the original are gone here, and with no fun lead or compelling story, what you're left with is a handful of broken characters and ideas.If you like the original, don't watch it.If you don't like the original, definitely don't watch it.If you haven't seen the original, watch that instead.Please don't waste your money, spend it on one of the actual movies out now.

What a terrible movie! It was not funny, it has no storyline. I really did not like it. Lola bunny was a complete different character, her deep voice and tomboy style wasn't it. There was no basketball. Terrible.

reviews.review_title: Okay, seriously. The hate needs to STOP!
reviews.content: Unbelievable, just unbelievable. So much hate on one film? That's cold. Like it's okay to dislike a film, but ya know people worked hard on this movie Right? Jeez at least let me see like 30 or 50 good reviews on this movie.Anyway Space Jam: A New Legacy is just AWESOME! Possibly one of the best movies of the year in my opinion. The story is very interesting that LeBron James teams up with Bugs Bunny and the rest of the Looney Tunes gang to win a game of basketball in order to save his own son. I really love everything about this movie, the visuals is rather beautiful to look at and the mixture of traditional animation, CGI animationa and live-action is very impressive and the humor is very good. And in my opinion, all the Warner Bros references is very incredible which made Space Jam: A New Legacy a one gigantic love letter for Warner Bros and that is awesome.I am serious, Space Jam: A New Legacy doesn't deserve all the hate and all the scorn from anyone and it is so much better than the first Space Jam film, even thought I loved the first Space Jam film. I know this movie is not for everyone but please, don't give this movie so much hate, it doesn't deserve all of that terrible stuff. Please at least just give it a chance and give it some good reviews.I give Space Jam: A New Legacy a 9.8/10.

Worry about telling an actually story instead of being worried about Pepe LePue and Lola Bunny being offensive. Man this is as sooooo bad all around, from it's obvious woke agenda, to it's just terrible acting/story. In the middle, I thought it was dragging a little. Another problem, the first Space Jam was only 88 minutes, this one was almost 2 hours. Unless I'm watching Braveheart, no need for a movie like this to be 2 hours. What is going on in Hollywood today????
LeBron tries hard to be like Mike. Fails everytime.Can't catch 6-0.Can't catch air Jordans.And now Space jam... another souless shameless attempt at being the man.You not the man, lebron.

reviews.review_title: If Family Guy can keep turn the tables on Quagmire, they could have kept the Skunk.
reviews.content: I'm gonna keep this quick:Father-son narrative among the live action characters doesn't out-stay its welcome.Lola Bunny back to her classic personality after the (admittedly funny) obsessive in the Looney Toons show. A bland character but it makes sense creatively. She seems to be missing a couple of things...Live action, traditional animation and CGI blend self-consciously but very enchantingly. I actually enjoyed the three-dimensional looney-tunes.Excellent classic looney hijinks with plenty of references to other stuff but with a ton of swell more modern actiony stuff too.It's not a direct sequel; more of a spiritual sequel as these looney tunes are sort of artificial intelligences based on meta-fictional characters.Loved watching Granny be badass, Porky lay down some beats and an animated Lebron, whoever he is.

reviews.review_title: garish but ultimately blah and gratuitous
reviews.content: NBA great, family man, entrepreneur, and social media superstar LeBron "King" James wants to use basketball to bring out the best in his sons, an inherently difficult task with his youngest son who's a tech-savvy gamer. When Warner Bros. Studios pitches LeBron a film deal, a perfidious algorithm (aptly named Al-G Rhythm) seizes the opportunity to lure him (and his son) into the "Serververse," a virtual matrix where LeBron has to team up with the forsaken Looney Tunes to take on the nefarious nimrod and his Goon Squad in a basketball game for all the stakes. Neat animation and amusing in-jokes, but did so much of the running time really have to be dedicated to all the shameless WB product placement? It's not that much fun until the climactic game, with a good message thrown in as well, although Cheadle's larger-than-life persona never quite comes off. **
Product placement taken out of control. Not much of a film to review really. My official review for this film is to avoid it like the plague. And even the soundtrack is weak.

reviews.review_title: Clever writing - comedic and zany at times; wholesome and realistic at others
reviews.content: Space Jam: A New Legacy, the cartoon sequel, brings the whole Looney Tunes gang back to the court, only this time with the reigning king of basketball, Lebron James. This comedy combines live action with animation and is filled with life lessons, funny catch phrases, loads of glitzy digital effects and a glimpse of Warner Bros. Cinematic library.When LeBron James and his son, Dom (Cedric Joe) get mysteriously sucked into the Warner Bros. Digital world by a rogue AI supervillain (Don Cheadle), nonsense and chaos ensue. Dom is kidnapped and LeBron is challenged to a high-stakes basketball game by the evil AI. Lebron must form the most winning team to get his son back and, a loss could leave him and all those he loves, stuck in the server-verse forever. Lebron and his Looney Tunes pal Bugs Bunny meet up for a wild adventure through the server-verse. Will he win, or be trapped there forever? Watch to find out.The writing is clever. It is comedic and zany at some points; at others, it is very wholesome and realistic. The animation is outstanding! The movie combines traditional animation with three-dimensional computer graphics and live action. LeBron's cartoon character is spot on. The tour through the server-verse is so enjoyable. Seeing iconic characters like Yogi Bear, Pennywise, Iron Giant and King Kong is every movie junkie's dream! Eric Bauza plays a very important role in this movie as he voices Daffy Duck, Foghorn Leghorn, Elmer Fudd, Marvin the Martian and Porky Pig. Jeff Bergman is also instrumental in this film as he voices Bugs Bunny, Sylvester and Yosemite Sam. Both Eric and Jeff voice their characters so well that it's like listening to the original cartoons! Space Jam: New Legacy also features Don Cheadle, who is the rogue AI AL. G. Rhythm. His villainous role features a wide range of emotion and I give him two thumbs up for his outstanding performance. My favorite character is Granny because she is a good-natured, protective, spunky old woman that has some epic moves.The messages of this movie are that family is everything and there is power in chasing your dreams. Sometimes, we need some loony things in our life to make it better. There is mild language and a lot of action.I give Space Jam: A New Legacy 5 out of 5 stars and recommend it for ages 7 to 18, plus adults. It's a great family movie. Fans of the original will love this, too. This movie releases July 16, 2021 in theaters and on HBO Max.Reviewed by Katherine S., KIDS FIRST!
The jokes fell flat; more comedy at a BLM protest to defund the Police.
There was once a time when cinema was great,original and fresh. Those days are gone. Im 35 and am so thankful to have been able to enjoy an era of great cinema. Its just sad what has happened!

IN A NUTSHELL:
A rogue artificial intelligence kidnaps the son of famed basketball player LeBron James, who then has to work with Bugs Bunny to win a basketball game. There are some entertaining moments for sure, but it's one gigantic commercial for Warner Brothers IP properties, which is a huge turnoff for most viewers. The target audience is definitely kids. Their parents who grew up watching the original movie might be annoyed and let down.The film is directed by Malcolm D. Lee. Are you Team Tune or Team Goon? This is a spoiler-free movie review.THINGS I LIKED:
If you're a LeBron James fan, you'll love this movie because it features him, showcasing a bunch of real-life clips from his historical career.If you're a Warner Brothers cartoon character fan, you'll love seeing all of your favorites. Berg Bergen is the only voice actor to return from the original Space Jam movie of 1996.Academy Award nominee Don Cheadle is great, as expected. He was just nominated for an Emmy for Outstanding Guest Actor in a Drama Series. Good on him. He's a wonderful actor and he seemed to have a lot of fun with his role in this film. He plays AL G. Rythm (algorithm)
There's a lot of humor, although not all of it lands. LeBron is good about letting them take a lot of jabs at him and his career.Tons of fun movie references and clips of film classics like Superman: The Movie, Batman (1989), Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone, THE MATRIX, The Wizard of Oz, Mad Max: Fury Road, Wonder Woman, and soooo many more.If you're not that much into basketball, there are still plenty of non-basketball shenanigans to enjoy.TONS of fun Easter Eggs! Look closely!Lots of entertaining cameo performances and voice talents from other sports stars like Sue Bird, Anthony Davis, Draymond Green, Damian Lillard, Nneka Ogwumike, Diana Taurasi, and so many more.There's an awesome Michael Jordan gag that actually made me laugh out loud. Loved it.It's super entertaining to look at the audience during the big game to pick out all kinds of characters from zillions of Warner Brothers movies.I've always loved movies that combine animation with real-life actors. I enjoyed the different animation styles.The movie features the huge E3 conference. One of my sons competed in that when he was in college. He now does art design on video games at Blizzard!If you love basketball, you'll get a kick out of the "server-verse" version of the game.THINGS I DIDN'T LIKE:
Warner Brothers promotes itself HARD in this movie.As great as LeBron James is at basketball, he's not a very good actor. I don't think anyone is very surprised by that, but it's a shame because LeBron is in almost every scene in the movie.The movie tries to cram WAY too much into every scene.Visually, it's sometimes hard to catch everything because things fly by so fast and furiously.The explanation at the very end of the movie about the demise of a certain character was incredibly lame and lazy writing.There is some super cheesy writing as well.Warner Brothers cartoon fans have already been complaining that we don't see enough of the cartoons. I disagree. There is plenty of cartoon chaos.All of the Extras in the audience during the game don't always react correctly to what's actually happening in the game. It just looks like they were filmed cheering to be inserted into the scenes later, which of course they were. I'm just saying that it really looks like it.The soundtrack isn't as good as the first movie.The plot is just silly with ridiculously high stakes.TIPS FOR PARENTS:
Lots of cartoon violence.Mild profanity. One character is obviously spewing profanities in one scene, but they humorously get bleeped out.There are a lot of references to R-rated movies that kids won't understand or recognize.You can see my full movie review on my Movie Review Mom YouTube channel!
This is absolutely horrible. I can't believe any studio in their right mind would release. Total flop!

reviews.review_title: No humor, no fun, no looney tunes
reviews.content:
Every five minutes you'll be hearing this:
"PlAy baSkEtbAlL!!"
"Daddy doesn't understand me"
"I nEed tO SaVe mY soN"
"KiNg jAmeS is So cOol, he is KinG, kinG jaMes, KinG, KING JAMES"
I'm serious, EVERY FIVE MINUTES. They repeating the plot, this simple and stupid plot, over and over again.Looney Tunes will show up only in the MIDDLE of the movie, before that you'll be watching how kInG jaMeS is forcing his gENiuS son to play basketball instead of making games about basketball.This is trash. No match to the original with true King.1/1000.

Ook so the movie...for lack of better words sucks Lebron off so hard that he must have directed the movie thinking he was a god!I mean jesus christ king james? King lebron. How does Labron james show off that he has money...A basketball return...oooh...But if you can make it to 20 minutes you wont want to stop watching. The animations are gorgeous..the designs are flawless and the toons are hilarious.

reviews.review_title: Space Jam: A New Legacy (2021) feels like a long SNL sketch that just bombs hard.
reviews.content: It is always trying too hard to overachieve, that it ends up constantly under delivering. There is a scene early on in the movie where James says to WB executives - "Athletes acting, that never goes well. ... With all due respect, this idea is straight up bad." And that in itself is the review of this movie in a nutshell.In another scene later on, where James and Bunny are making a team, James starts naming DC characters that would make for a great team - Superman, Iron Giant, King Kong, etc. Now that would've been a fun and new twist to the original legacy of Space Jam but instead what we end up getting is a bad mish-mash of the old movie with the same old Loony Tunes characters.Throughout the movie I was so distracted by all the WB Easter eggs and that made me realize how uninteresting the actual movie was. It just did not make me feel anything. I re-watched the original Space Jam before watching this one and Oh! How much fun that movie was! It was silly and goofy and yes a little loony but I thoroughly enjoyed it. I would suggest you re-watch that one and just skip this one.If you thought Michael Jordan's acting was bad, wait till you see LeBron James' acting.

reviews.review_title: A Poor Film That Fails The Franchise
reviews.content:
When I was younger I used to watch the Looney Tunes and I loved and the original Space Jam is a guilty pleasure film for me so I had a tiny bit of excitement for the sequel New Legacy and I had the chance to watch it today and here is my review for it. The premise of the film sees Lebron James sucked into an artificial world where he must unite the Toon Squad to win a game of Basketball.Main Character
As mentioned above, Lebron James plays himself as the lead character and he seems like a pretty charismatic guy in real life but that is not the case here. He is so boring to watch here, and for the majority of the film he is just reacting to what is going on with the whole world. The film forces him to deliver some emotional scenes and he just can't do it and it really makes the film fall flat.Supporting Characters
Don Cheadle plays the bad guy in the film and he just looks like he is having a really fun time with the role, this is no great villain performance but he is possibly the most entertaining part of the film and that has to count for something. Onto the toons and they are pretty entertaining, the old classics are there by Buggs Bunny, Wile Coyote and Foghorn Leghorn and memories of my childhood came back. But they also get put into the background for Lebron, I never really got Zendaya voicing Lola Bunny and guys like Semmity Sam and Daffy Duck have little to do and the biggest negative is giving my favourite character Marvin Martian barely anything to do. I didn't really care for Lebron's onscreen son and Sonequa Martin-Green is really wasted as Lebron's wife.Story
The story offers very little. The whole theme of fatherhood is let down by weak performances and a weak dramatic script. The first film had the looney tunes in the forefront but here they feel like afterthoughts, in favour for Warner Bros very clear poor marketing and they try to cram all these franchises that they own in order to try and convince you to watch them. This is despite the demographic of young kids will have no idea what half of these franchises even are.Script
The script does have a few chuckle worthy moments and although I complained about the obvious marketing ploy, a lot of the cameos were quite funny to me as a big film fan. But the drama really isn't there and a good chunk of the comedy feels like it should have been left in the prime days of the tunes.Style
The animation for this film is pretty great, it looks exactly like it should for the majority, until it goes to more CGI instead of animation and it becomes a bit strange. Also this film felt really long, the last basketball game itself feels like an hour long and I shouldn't be feeling like that in a family friendly film with Looney Tunes characters.Overall
Overall, Space Jam: New Legacy is a bad film. It will have some people who grew up with The Looney Tunes and the original film but they will not like it and kids shouldn't be bought up watching this garbage of a film cause it has some nice visuals.Rating - 3/10.

Spent more time on the characters in the crowd which was more interesting than the plot. Few funny moments with throwback lines from space jam. I'd watch it just to see what 150 million dollars gets you and to complain about it with your friends and how Jordan will always be the GOAT.
That was a fun film, with humour for all. Lebron pulls it off as well as MJ did.Nice simple storyline, with some nice nods to the original movie and some great nostalgic jokes!

reviews.review_title: i think WB has ruined the original with this movie
reviews.content: I know it's not a movie for older people who were fans of MJ but even some kids movies have some humor that will keep the parents amused.This movie has none of that.

reviews.review_title: No more sequels to good films
reviews.content: Thus was a disappointment compared to the original Space Jam. It appears to me that this one is one side story rather than a fun tribute to the first one. The toons were ok CGI instead of classic us up to viewers presence, I preferred the animation of the original. Glad it was on HBO as I wouldn't pay 20$ per ticket to see in a theater. Check it out if you are bored and nothing else to watch. My 3 rating is being generous.

reviews.review_title: Not a lebron fan so not biased!
reviews.content: Okay so, I think most of these bad reviews are purely because it's lebron James. Which okay he's not the best actor but damn I've missed the toon squad. Me an my wife both loved the movie and both had some really good laughs. The only thing I don't like about the movie is the fact that bronny James who's he's actual son doesn't play his son in the movie but that's the only thing I didn't like. But a solid film, I recommend.
I read lots of reviews and thought l shouldn't watch it but my family and l absolutely adored this movie!!!

reviews.review_title: Space Jam: A New Legacy Review
reviews.content: A ironically hilarious film but an absolutely terrible film none the less. Everything about this film doesn't work. The story, the acting, the CGI, the references, the script. All of it feels terrible compared to the first film. The first film isn't that great either but at least it was self aware. This isn't. The film doesn't understand when it is making fun of itself and it shows. I enjoyed the references in the first film as they felt natural but this was Ready Player One on steroids and if you don't like Ready Player One like me, then this will be a nightmare. Sometimes there are cool Easter eggs in the background but some of it feels weird. I love A Clockwork Orange but it still feels weird to see a bunch of characters from that movie watching a Basketball Game. The humor is unintentionally funny. I never laughed at a joke they were trying to make but I laughed at almost everything else because it was so bad that it's funny. I enjoyed watching this movie but that was probably because I was with friends. I feel like watching this on your own is a painful experience. I did find myself being painfully bored during points but the jokes my friends were making and their reactions helped keep my interest. All of the performances are AWFUL. Lebron James did an awful job. Michael Jordan wasn't great in the first film either but his performance felt intentionally funny but this was just painful to watch. Don Cheadle was really weird as well. The only reason I kind of enjoyed his performance was because I was joking about him the whole time. The script is the most predictable boring story ever. The first film's script was predictable as well but the journey to get there was fun and this wasn't fun. The visual effects look kind of decent at times except Live Action Lola Bunny. Her eyes look really really weird for some reason. I would really only recommend this if you watch it with friends. It's a lot funnier to watch this with other people than on your own.
Really? I love Space Jam 1996... this not work in any level...

reviews.review_title: Absolute steaming pile of hot garbage
reviews.content: Save your cash....and sanity, watch the original Space Jam as that has everything you're expecting from New Legacy.....like a believable plot and comedy.New Legacy has no redeeming features, it's absolutely terrible and a clear cash grab for WB and ego stroke for LeBron. Lame plot lame acting....zero laughs from anybody for the whole 2hrs.I don't know LeBron and I feel this movie has made a lot of people not want to meet him either....comes across as a dim wit that has no sense of humour and is ignorant of his kids and their ideas/ dreams/ aspirations/ hobbies.....you know, because he's soooo busy working long hours at the factor.....Oh wait, he just plays basketball for millions of dollars.....Yeah he's a bad father. Didn't like LeBron with his political blm nonsense but he's actually smashed it out the park with reasons to dislike him.LeBron would be my first choice for a live action Pinocchio, as his "acting" was incredibly wooden.... king James 😂 talk about ego....they could have used a mop instead of LeBron and it would have been just as believable.Feel sorry for Don Cheadle having this smearing his career, as he's generally a good actor in good movies.I'd rather pull out every hair on my body with tweezers, than to watch this painfully dull movie again. 1 star for Don Cheadle and the effects team.
Please stop trying to redo everything. Michael Jordan was made for the movie.

reviews.review_title: A Dumpster Fire Mess of a Movie!
reviews.content: Despite some pretty good animation, the rest of the movie overall is a hot garbage mess with abysmal writing and direction, flat unfunny humor, references that most may or may not get, subpar soundtrack, sluggish editing and pacing, bad acting, a nothing story, etc.This so-called Space Jam movie is just pretty much a crappy carbon copy of Ready Player One with Looney Tunes in it. I rather just go watch the much better Ready Player One or even the first Space Jam movie than this dumpster fire ever again.If it weren't for Cosmic Sin (my #1 worst movie of 2021), this would definitely be my absolute worst movie of the year!Lastly, Michael Jordan > Lebron James.

The movie was funny, family friendly, and a good message. I'm not sure what people expected it to be who are all giving it such a bad review. LeBron isn't going to win an academy award but neither did Michael.It's worth watching if you will just relax and let it be what it is. If you want to hate it you probably will. If you want to like it you probably will.

reviews.review_title: Ok sequel that doesn't capture the spirit of the original
reviews.content: This is by no way a better movie than the original but Im watching Looney Toons play Basketball again but with upgraded animation. The story is simple but its a kids film, Dad has to save his son from an evil computer AI by playing basketball. The original former basketball player has to help Looney Toons after their world gets invaded. Both are so simple but people expect character development from a bunch of Cartoons and a Basketball player. We know who Lebron is and the Toons aren't going to change.The positives of the movie is that the Don Cheadle is goofy and a likeable villain who just wants to be human and appreciated. No one can deny the toons aren't likable same as Mickey Mouse just transcends every generation from their first introduction. As mentioned before the final game makes for great animations and shows how far these animators have come! Feel like a true video game not just Toon World. There's far to many cameos and nods to other films throughout the movie, recurring the Toons is just fun for old and young! Never thought i'd see Mad Max and a Clockwork orange in the film film let alone a kids animation!Then this is where we get the issues with the movie, no matter how simple the film is it doesnt hold you throughout the middle section of preparing for the game. Never really bought the father/ son relationship but didn't land. They tried to re-create Wayne Knights characters in Khris Davis but its the same script just played by a different person but not as well! A positive can also be a negative when having such adult characters being apart of the movie but changing Lola bunny for no reason for being to adult but keeping them involved, you literally have Pennywise next to the group that coined the phrase "Ultra Violence" just an odd choice from the WB execs. Flintstones, Yogi and Booboo, all DC characters and Harry Potter are all perfectly fine for kids but imagine having to explain what Game of Thrones is to a 4 year old!Overall its simple fun with some good laughs but can see why people arent happy with the remake and being disappointed!

I see the armchair critics and nostalgia hounds are taking this WAY too seriously..1) Did you really expect Schindler's List or something? It's an NBA star playing basketball with the Looney Tunes. It is what it is.2) The first movie wasn't anywhere near to being the cinematic masterpiece that people think it was.But nostalgia makes things look shinier than they were, so meh..
It was essentially an extended Nike commercial/self-fellating Michael Jordan adventure.3) If you go in expecting the first movie, you'll be disappointed. Don't expect spectacular acting either. Again, it's good for what it is.If you go in with the very simple "Well, it's just a kids movie, so it's gonna be simple,goofy fun." Then that's what you'll see.It's still strange to me, seeing grown adults panning a kids movie, as though they're the target demographic. 20 years ago, sure. Your opinion on a movie like this was way more relevant. Not now.It's like a kid reviewing Grey's Anatomy or something. They're gonna think it sucks because they're not the core audience.

reviews.review_title: More fun than I thought it would be
reviews.content: Honestly, this movie wasn't as bad as people are saying. I thought it was a fun, entertaining way to spend two hours.

Ok. First of all, I never really liked the original Space Jam. It was over all a very weird idea. Michael Jordan and Loony Toons.....doesn't that just sound weird? So, I at first was not planning on even watching the new one, but I heard here and there that it was a decent movie. I watched it. I hated it. It gave me a headache. I at least was hoping for it to be better than the first one, but it wasn't even close. Lebron James is as interesting as a brick wall. It seems like half of the movie he forgets that he's fighting for his and his son's life. Other than a couple scenes it just all about playing the game "right". Zendya as Lola just felt.....odd. The cgi was trash and it felt like I was watching a cheap Netflix original. I wasted my time watching this. Pure trash.

reviews.review_title: I know it wasn't supposed to be a masterpiece but still..
reviews.content: So yeah it wasn't boring, but like it felt empty, even the cameos felt unimportant, it was definitely a movie, still entertaining and a good time with your buddies.

reviews.review_title: Big looney fun but it needed another rewrite
reviews.content: No, Space Jam: A New Legacy doesn't need to exist and no it isn't the worst movie in the world either, however, there are some things that need to be addressed - First, LeBron James is no Michael Jordan, he is not as skilled an athlete nor as charismatic or as likeable as them, either. Second, the plot is a little too complicated and much of it feels very first draft level as a screenplay. The original movie had a much more simpler plot and despite its length had better focus and pacing. Third, it's not as immersive as the original. In that movie you had a better played out basketball game whereas here the court is too overpacked with very noticeable background characters who are definitely extras dressed as iconic characters from Warner Bros. Film and television history that probably should've been blurred out to hide the phoniness of it all. Fourth, the opposing team is not memorable or as intimidating as the original's The Monstars. Those things aside there are some pretty effective jokes and meta commentary on display and each of the Tunes get enough to shine and their voice artists all seem to be bringing plenty of energy. LeBron James is LeBron James, can't really say anything else because he is playing himself. Don Cheadle seems to be having the time of his life playing the villain, and there is lots of creativity on the screen that illustrates that the filmmakers were having a good time making it. The problem again is the screenplay: too many cooks in the kitchen, and not enough time spent on ideas that would've had more emotional impact if handled better or had more time spent on them. There is a lot of things you could have done with this that would've actually made it a vast improvement over what had come before but alas most of everything is so first draft level the best it succeeds at is as just being an entertaining but ultimately forgettable family film.

Is LeBron James the best actor?? NO... however neither was Michael Jordan.. James was funny and entertaining and even showed a bit of range with emotions. It wasn't supposed to be a scene for scene copy of the original (at 33 I still love the original) it's literally A NEW LEGACY. . It had the original animation mixed with a new 'upgraded' animation which was a STORY PLOT and one that even annoyed Bugs Bunny in the movie. The movie was entertaining and funny and Don Cheadle stole the whole freaking show. Bunch of real cool cameos and an AMAZING VILLIAN. All in All 8/10 domt listen to the hatr. It wasn't perfect but it was a good movie and I even laughed hard at a few spots with Don. Go see it!!

reviews.review_title: Its not as bad as reviews say it is...
reviews.content: After I saw the reviews I almost didn't go to watch the film, but I'm glad I went because the movie is nowhere near as bad as the reviews suggest. In the beginning it's a bit cringy but later on it's actually quite funny, unless you're a LeBron hater or you didn't watch any of the Looney Tunes so you don't get the jokes and that Looney Tunes vibe.

reviews.review_title: This is sweeping the Razzies this year.
reviews.content: As the worst movie maybe of the decade that has actually been a wide release in theaters and online at the same time. No reviews have been good that weren't paid for. Space Jam more like Boring old man who walks out on his team just like he walks out on these beloved characters with his not so good acting skills. Your not GOING to like it. You notice how they throw everything in at the end they like if you don't like looney toons or LeBron you'll like this.
I kinda interest to me about this film has been hilarious to see in the previous precious years.

Space Jam: A New Legacy is a soulless and joyless experience that doesn't even succeed at being entertaining in any way. While the original Space Jam (1996) was also a corporate cash grab, it at least had a distinct sense of charm and fun that is severely lacking here. The film felt more like a 2 hour long advertisement for the various properties that Warner Brother own than an actual film. The references to R-rated properties such as Mad Max, The Matrix and Game of Thrones seem out of place for a family film (cynics could say the film is targeted at millennials)The plot centres around the strained relationship between LeBron James' relationship with his youngest son Dom, who wants to be a video game developer rather than a basketballer like his Dad. After the two are sucked into the 'Warnerverse' they are pitted against one another in a game of basketball based on the game Dom has been developing ('Domball'). This is not an emotionally investing storyline mainly due to James' stilted performance which may be worse than Michael Jordan's in the original. I guess there is a positive parental message here regarding letting your kids chase their own dreams rather than impose your own onto them. It could have been executed much better though.I like to find the positives where I can, and the animation and CGI in the film is really vibrant and pops off the screen. It's easily the highlight of the film but unfortunately it has nothing to back it up with - I found the film exceptionally tedious and the jokes were mostly cringeworthy and unfunny. The most humour I got out of the experience was how awfully brazen and out-of-place a lot of references were. Pennywise the Clown and the Night King enjoying a game of basketball? Rick and Morty dropping off the Tasmanian Devil onto the heroes? What even was going on in this film?Really I can't recommend this film in any capacity. It's an overly long and thoroughly dull slog through Warner Brothers self-congratulatory vanity project that seems to lack any sense of self-awareness. I couldn't wait for this one to finish.

How this got made is a fricken mystery. First thing I'd like to point out is that this movie is just Jam and has nothing to do with space at all. Second issue I'd like to point out is the fact the whole movie is an ad for Warner Brothers. And third and final issue is that this movie has the worst acting, plot and overall understanding of technology I've seen in years, and I watched Plan 9 from Outer Space last month.

reviews.review_title: It's not funny, it's not clever, it's not interesting, it IS NOT ANYTHING
reviews.content: I mean what was the actual point of this movie. There is absolutely no story. There is an idea - maybe. More of a saying -"you get what you put into it"?. I mean it's said a bunch of times, sooooooo yeah.I wanna say if bad acid trips are your thing then go for it? Even thenIt was a ridiculous Hodge podge of trailers for old movies that Disney ownsThe only thing I can see this movie being was a way for Disney to tell kids what movies Disney owns that came out before they were born???Oh dear lord!!!!!!! What on Earth did you do to Bugs Bunny's voice? Run over it with a truck??????Only plus is it's visually appealing. Part of the time. Nothing special mind you. And LiL Rel Howry was consistently good. And Marvin the Martian made an appearance so it gets a 4.

reviews.review_title: Nice mixup of Warner Brothers Movies with Looney Toons Characters
reviews.content: My family enjoyed the movie. It started off slow but, improved once they got inside of the cartoon world. It was fun to watch and had a good family positive message.

Story was cheap and the jokes were corny and lebron James can't act. His son acts better than him. To many references and not like the first. Michael Jordan come back please. Also CGI was baaaddd. My childhood ruin....thanks Warner bros. Give my girl bunny her boobs back!!!

From start to finish this was an absolute disaster. Lebron can't act, even as a cartoon. This is a 2 hour long ego stroke for him where he is still in the shadow of Lebron. Somehow this movie ruined looney tunes and basketball at the same time.

The whole movie feels like stitched together short clips, like writers were sitting at the table and thinking:
"What is this character gonna say in this scene, what about that one? People, we need a dialog here, think think."
There is absolutely no fluidity. And majority of the things make no sense. And making Looney Toon characters in 3d was as cringe as Sonic he Hedgehog the movie 3d character. I know everyone is about CGI these days, but here: NO. Would have worked fine with 2D characters.Basically a pure waste of time :(
Terrible. Couldn't finish it. Watch the original, it's much better!
Like Don Cheadle supposed to save this horrible mess. 🤣

reviews.review_title: The best film with the Justice League in I've seen all year.
reviews.content: Similar to the first film; NBA superstar plays in animated environment against a team made up of copied and toonified NBA superstars, to ultimately learn a lesson about how he should treat his family. Oh, and his kid does some wild tapping on a keyboard/scanning stuff with his phone and there is a risk with giving AI too much control. Fun in places, nostalgic in others, but ultimately too much crammed in for one film.First of all, LeBron may be (I don't follow the sport) a great basketball player, but he never appeared comfortable on screen. There was basically zero chemistry between him and Cedric Joe, who's playing his son, and even the emotions associated with being toonified - like the crux of the film - looked pretty underwhelming to him. At first, this fits with the films message about family, but his best scenes come when he's turned into a toon and the animators cut loose. Why they didn't use his real family for the brief live action parts and increase the animated parts, I don't know.Secondly, this as a montage advert for a studio that's trying to gain new audiences (or other studio to buy them) for their back catalogue. With the number of films/shows/characters they've shoehorned in, it's worth a second watch; from Harry Potter to Batman (animated and live action) and the Justice League. From the Flintstones, Jetsons, Animaniacs and the old aliens from the first Space Jam, through King Kong, Game of Thrones, and - weirdly for kids film - the Matrix, Mad Max: Fury Road, Austin Powers, and Casablanca. They even had the Wizard of Oz and Clockwork Orange characters. Most of these made no sense to my under 10's, and the film executives - Sarah Silverman and Steven Yeun - scene was so meta it completely lost their attention. The Harry Potter parts got their attention, but I couldn't see them leaving going "I really want to watch Iron Giant" because of this film. Could see WB making a series with crossovers like this, sure, but here it was too fast to fully appreciate but too slow for the action of the film. Who were they actually supporting?Even the bad guy seemed derivative. An Artificial Intelligence; Al G. Rhythm! It's a name that made me think of the Animaniacs space episode where Al Gore is Al-5000 (2001: A Space Odyssey take off). They could have at least had him dance a bit more? For Don Cheadle this is easy money; he doesn't have to move much and after his years of Marvel CGI he's probably very used to acting to nothing, in front of a green screen. It was all very clever, but, again, why they didn't have a fully animated bad guy, I don't know.That's what saved this film and made it enjoyable; it's toon craziness. In a world sick of lockdown and Covid, job worries and family crisis, and where film goers are still asking who can pick up Thors hammer or why can't DC find enough light bulbs so their films aren't so dark, seeing an animated duck with its bill on backwards or randomly blowing stuff up with a truck load of dynamite is just fun. The Toon Squad training, the animated physics of falling, and simply all those cameos of old characters made me smile. It's just annoying they included so much annoying live action to get there.
Why they decided to make this a remake is beyond me. Loony Tunes have pretty much died off and Lebron acting??? Don't know where to begin.
Not sure who this movie was made for. It seems as if Lebron is forever chasing Michael. And that is just sad.

reviews.review_title: Bugs Bunny is the MVP - Not Lebron. This is why MJ is GOAT...
reviews.content: This just shows why MJ is GOAT/better than Lebron. Lebron might have taken acting lessons from Shaq's Kazaam tapes.The original Space Jam story made a lot more sense, feels like a documentary compared to outrageous things that happen in Space Jam 2. I loved how it actually related to MJ's baseball career/retirement. It actually really made great use of other co-stars like Charles Barkley, Larry Bird, Bill Murray, and who could forget the original Space Jam had the GREATEST, MOST AMAZING soundtrack ever!! (I even bought the CD at the time... if you know what CD's are...)There isn't even any good music in this new Space Jam 2 movie. Not to mention we all know the controversy with Lola Bunny getting a major downgrade as well. (Thanks Karens and overly sensitive World today)It's funny how NBA today is just high scoring over 120+ points/lack of defense; where in the 90's, it was normal for a lot of games to be held under 100; even in the original Space Jam, the final game score for the ToonSquads were under 80 points against the Monstars. And then we got Space Jam 2 where it's a ridiculous video game, with video game looking CG loony toons, with outrageous scoring rules going over 1000 points.... okay.It's true, Warner Bros really just wanted to self-promote and show off their catalog, in a Ready Player One-like scenes that really makes no sense.I have to admit, the "MJ" cameo during half-time was hilarious though. And the little twist with Bugs Bunny was actually touching, I think it made cry (LOL), but overall you knew it was never going to top the original GOAT.The original Space Jam really felt like a theatrical blockbuster movie with great story, cameos, and unforgettable soundtrack - and of course the greatest basketball player of all time. Space Jam 2 definitely has a straight to stream quality TV-Movie. Space Jam 3 with Jeremy Lin on YouTube is actually better than this.

reviews.review_title: Fun movie being review bombed because of garbage politics and salty armchair critics
reviews.content: Very fun movie. Saw it in a theater with a nice audience. Everyone had a good time.Ignore these reviews. This score is gonna go up exponentially as actual people see it and review it for what it is instead of trying to soapbox about LeBron.Lots of solid gaga and good animation. Its looney tunes, turn your brain off and enjoy it. Giving it a 10 to counteract the BS reviews but its more like a 7.5.

reviews.review_title: My 5yo liked it but it's bad
reviews.content: None of the charm of the original, the plot was weak and the comedy moments were few and far between. It steals some pieces from Wreck it Ralph.The product placement was just too much. I understand why they tried to include even brief references to other franchises in the WB stable, but IT and Game of Thrones doesn't belong in a kids movie.
This movie was just pure terrible. Lebron is a great basketball player terrible actor. This movie was a disaster.

reviews.review_title: I wish I could give it zero
reviews.content: MJ must be laughing at this pathetic remake.I have never seen worst acting choppier story line and more shameless promotion.This is truly new low in cinema YUCK.

This was honestly one of the worst things I've ever seen. I'd rather watch 2 hours of literally anything else.MJ was not actor too but Space jam 1 got thats 90s vibe and movie was funny to watch and laugh. This new one got few jokes that is so bad that i asked myself is someone really got bunch of money to write this story and scenario??Dont bother to watch this,instead just go watch Space Jam 1 again!

reviews.review_title: A kids movie that is targeted at adults?
reviews.content: The film, itself, isn't having any fun, and its barrage of nostalgia, easter eggs, and WB franchise cameos is basically the filmmakers asking us every few minutes "Are you having fun yet?"

I loved the original one even though it certainly had it's cheese but at least it had heart and soul mixed in.This movie on the other hand was a discombobulated mess from beginning to end! Michael Jordan wasn't only better on the court but also better at acting when compared to Lebron James. (And that's saying alot because Michael is certainly no actor.)

Movie is so lame it's not even funny!Story line was told around 1 million times already, cliché on cliché!Acting,lame and lamer
Vililans are uninteresting, boring and without any character.Hard pass on this, rather watch original one mort time!

A very bad movie and one that only young children or Lebron James apologists will even slightly enjoy. The beginning of the movie before it all goes into the toon world is atrocious. James' acting is terrible and the written is beyond cliché. There is some enjoyment in just seeing the classic Looney Toones characters and brief appearances from some DC Superheroes, Scooby Doo, Space Ghost and other Warner Brothers characters. But the actual movie is garbage. The original Space Jam isn't high quality but it is at least fun. This is just dumb and you don't need to shove how great Lebron James is down my throat. Greatest athlete in the world? I suppose it's arguably true but I think it's a stretch to say he is still the greatest basketball player in the world let alone greatest athlete in the world. We all know Michael Jordan is a more legendary figure, in his personality and his game, and Lebron's Space Jam is just a cash grab on what was a beloved kid's film. My wife did cry when Bugs Bunny "died" so I guess it did something right.

The main thing this movie had was the 90s nostalgia, reminding most of us of our child hood. We have been waiting for the sequel for almost 20 years now, and we finally got it. It does lack a lot from the original due to upgrades in CGI and characteristics. But through it all and I'm speaking for 90s kids alone through this movie and many of the Easter eggs in it got to relive our childhood, one last time.

We attempted to watch this as a family. My 9 year old daughter gave up less than halfway through. Her opinion was the plot was all over the place. She said it felt more like a commercial. She loved the original Space Jam but this one was so bad we couldn't finish it.

Okay, acting isn't great. Story line isn't great. But my kids LOVE this movie. LeBron James is hilarious and pokes fun at himself. The Toons have funny banter. The scene where they get the wrong Michael Jordan is funny as hell, I LOL'ed. Lil Rel Howery as an announcer was great. It's overall message (to me) is to accept your kids (and people in general) for who they are and to appreciate their different strengths or passions.My kids have watched this movie three times already and my 4 year old daughter now wants a "LeBwon James birfday pawty". Most kids nowadays haven't heard of or aren't familiar with the Looney Toons characters, and this movie has helped bring 'em back in the fold.Once again, it's a kids movie. If it entrances my young children, I call that a win and a good kids movie.

This is one of those movies you ask yourself how a room of "professionals" could have possibly come to the conclusion that the ideas, themes, plot, script, etc... were a good idea. My kids were bored and unamused, and I obviously was as well.

reviews.review_title: Lebron James as a role model? No thanks.
reviews.content: I have kids they are target age for this movie. I will not mention or endorse this film in anyway. Lebron is an absolute moron and I hope this movie ranks so he realizes he doesn't have the infinite star power he thinks he has. Check yourself, Lebron.
I like Lebron James but this movie was absolute trash. Please save your money and spend it on a nice dinner for your family instead. At least that won't give you indigestion.
So sick of half hearted, poorly executed remakes like this! Hollywood needs a major reboot!

Even though this movie didn't get a good report but I thought it was very funny I laughed quite a bit at a lot of the parts in this film the ending was a tiny bit sad but overall it had a good happy ending.

reviews.review_title: For a Family Movie it deserves a 10
reviews.content: I don't know why people expected Lebron to start acting like Christian Bale, but this film is a basketball and kid oriented film, for a family as a whole to watch. Lebron did better than I expected with his acting (obviously not the best or close but still good enough) and the visuals and use of other warner bros intellectual properties made the movie just that much more fun to watch. There were a few moments where I even laughed out loud. It's not the best, it's not the worst, just appreciate a good, fun film instead of bashing it because Lebron knocked your team out of the playoffs. This is coming from a Clippers fan btw.
Hey guys, this movie is not that bad, my kids got the jam! Maybe its not our era, but it's our kids era! Thank you warner bros!

Even worse than the first one just a bunch of stupid references to other Warner brothers properties to disguise the thin plot. Most of the loony tunes would taste good on my plate not as 3 dimensional characters they're as flat as flapjacks. This movie is boring as hell I was not all interested it's just shiny gimmicks made to make small children want to watch it like dangling keys in front of a baby.
This movie is good. But I still think Tom and jerry 2021 movie is better.

reviews.review_title: For the very very simple minded
reviews.content: The acting and plot is straight garbage. This is for anyone who like Lebron James and loves everything he does. Everyone else will have a horrible time.
This was a fun movie .Great to see Bugs and Daffy back on the big screen.Some funny moments and special effects are cool.The only criticism is that there is a few similarities to the Jordan version .

reviews.review_title: A long, distracting WB commercial making a slam disappointment.
reviews.content: Yes, I have seen the first Space Jam and it was... meh. But certainly better than what we got here, especially as a smaller filmmaker.I do have good things about the sequel, though. The animation is great! I like how it keeps the usual charm of the Looney Tunes and is the best part of the movie. More specifically the 2D animation... the CGI is okay.I also liked the last 25 minutes, that being the basketball game's final quarters where the Looney Tunes get to be their usual selves which is entertaining and sometimes, even funny to watch.With that said, there are problems that make this a slam disappointment.The acting isn't the best, but hey, at least it isn't like 2003's The Room.The plot is like the first film, mixed with a message hammered into your head: Looney Tunes gathering together to play basketball with a superstar, the team wins, etc. The message of being yourself is fine enough, but what seriously bothers me is that every 5 minutes of the movie, it's "You've got to get your son back!". I know this is a kids movie, but that is a poor excuse for any movie. Kids have more vivid imaginations and would get the point after just one or two times, let alone nearly 10.Sooo, what gives the movie a 4 out of 10 for me? The overuse of IPs! I am not kidding when I say this but I kept getting very distracted by these pop-culture references (although the cartoons being added into WB films like Mad Max: Fury Road or The Matrix sounds like a cool idea at first) as well as Warner Bros showcasing every franchise, brand and character they own! Even getting Rick & Morty (a show intended for Adult Swim, btw) to have a cameo. Kids aren't going to get every reference and the fact they play specific music for Harry Potter or whatnot feels rather cringy to me. It feels like I'm watching a 2 hour long WB commercial for their stuff; that it's my biggest issue of the movie.Yeah, this is a 115 minute film! Imagine Warner Brothers shoving their IPs into your face for that long, including smaller details in the background for money to get their products or see them. Sure, kids may enjoy the animation and other aspects but honestly, WB shoving in their IPs (including their own logo seen at the start of their films) just makes me not enjoy it enough to be called good. There are some good stuff but everything else was distracting or just plain not good.With that, a 4/10 is good in my book thanks to the repetition (including the plot) and Warner Bros making a hammering, promotional commercial rather than, oh idk, a true Looney Tunes sequel. I don't care for huge promotional stuff, I'd rather entertain with something actually fun, like a live basketball game.

This was an absolute tragedy. They had a huge budget for this film clearly, so why not hire some actually decent writers and come up with a good and funny story? Ya know, maybe throw some good jokes in there? Some actual looney tune comedy? It can't be that hard...you have literally ALL of Warner bros property to work with. It's supposed to be corny, so was the first space jam...but this? Omg. Worst story premise on the face of the earth and then it had the nerve to try to make you feel something at the end??? You know what I feel Lebron? Anger. Anger for you wasting 2 hours of my life with this hot garbo. I moderately like Lebron as a person and an athlete and I just find there is no earthly way he watched this movie and thought it was good and ready for release - no sane person could have. I'd be interested to hear his true thoughts. This was honestly one of the worst movies I've ever seen in my life and I'm not even exaggerating. After the opening scene, pure cringe pedal to the metal all the way through. I physically cringed watching the movie. Every scene belongs on r/cringetopia - as a matter of fact I wouldn't be surprised if I went to the sub right now and it was all clips of this movie. Shame on you Warner Bros. This was worse than I could have ever even imagined. Just wow.

Why did they even try to redo Michael Jordan's Space Jam? This was no good. I wanted to throw up. They tried to slip in clips from other movies like Austin Powers and the Matrix... don't waste your time.

reviews.review_title: Did they get a robot to play Lebron

Having watched the original Space Jam in theaters too as a kid, this is the furthest they could've gone from the original MJ legacy. Maybe just let certain IPs die.

Terrible, just terrible. The Mrs. And myself got that this wasn't aimed at our age group when we started watching, but what we got was a horrible mess, putting The Last Jedi to shame in both the number of nastily leaking plotholes and overall bad screenwriting.Not worth an actual review I'll suffice to say we got out when the movie turned cartoon style. We figured the movie would become watchable at this point. It didn't.I managed to avoid the original, despite buying hundreds of original movies a year on VHS when that came out. Figured it wasn't for me. Should have kept my guard up I guess, getting old made me weak.I hope this Le Bron James fellow (not sure I spelled that correctly, I'm European, so to me he's just a name I've vaguely heard of) got paid his weight in platinum for this. Surely he'll never get another paying job as actor?I think I'll go take a shower now, watching (part) of this "movie" made me feel kinda gross.

I heard this was bad but gave it a watch to see for myself.I turned off after 40 mins. It was awful.Acting/direction was some of the worst I've seen.Don't waste your time watching. I'm confused with all the high star reviews, definitely WB making accounts and rating it themselves.
Such a horrible movie. Just another example of Lebron not being able to hold a candle to Michael.
Y'all keep paying to see these movies and it's why they keep making them. They don't care about how bad the reviews are when they're still #1 in the box office.

Great stuff.
Movie doesn't deserve all the hate, it's fun and enjoyable to watch.

reviews.review_title: Doesn't take itself seriously, neither should you.
reviews.content: This movie was meant to be just for fun, I don't understand everyone's big expectations or crushing reviews. We went back and watched the old Space Jam to show our 5 year old before watching this. She loved both of them. We saw this at a drive in and I was dreading it after reading the reviews. The acting sucks in both, because they're basketball players, not actors. We all got some good laughs in. The premise isn't supposed to make sense. Suspend disbelief, have good snacks on hand and just be silly and it'll be just fine.
