reviews.review_title: Take the Torch and Make it Burn Brighter
reviews.content: This movie is insanely good for a 90s child if you ask any guy at that age. Like one critic said in the review for Avengers: Endgame-'The final chapter is for someone who has read the former stories.' This draws for the following arguments I represent. The movie is almost like a hip-hop version for Ready Player One. You can watch so many Easter eggs in this fantastic movie. I'll cite some that I can remember or I can recognize, The Matrix, Batman, Rick and Morty, Jobs, Superman, Wonder Woman(of course with her famous BGM), Joker, Pennywise, King Kong, Kevin Hart, AD, Klay Thompson and the most stunning one-Michael Jordan(with the Sirius BGM).Without doubt, all these lined with LeBron James made it a masterpiece and of course, the performance of Don Cheadle is professional as always.For those who grow up with those characters or players, I can say we all share an amazing feeling like 'Gosh! Finally someone put all those things in a 110 minutes movie.'The group of Wonder Woman and Lola Bunny, Superman with Daffy Duck and Don Cheadle as Jobs really impressed me, but if you ask me which scene is the most incredible one, I can say it's the MJ's show up. When LeBron's team are all depressed with no hope in the half, the Sylvester said he found Michael Jordan to help them, and as the Sirius went on, we saw his shoes , we felt his airness and his power! And finally, here was the Michael B Jordan, even Daffy Duck roasted that 'we couldn't get Michael A Jordan, so we got Michael B Jordan?!'The look on LeBron is very funny, we could see his complexion changed from expectation to shocked and last, disappointed. This punch line has got me too, my face was exactly like the LeBron at that time.One man's meat is another man's poison. Unlike 1996, Space Jam made its best in that age. People in this time have a severe sight on everything, sometimes even mean especially when you try to take to flame from the legend, but I think LeBron made a different, outstanding, and impressing performance that could only be achieved by him not just in the court, but off the court, and in this film.
What's Hollywood doing to all these movies?! Don't waste your time on this, just play the original classic Space Jam.

I may be a bit biased because I have a 3 year old and it's a nice bridge movie for both of us, but this movie is just okay in its execution. I definitely don't have nostalgia bias, as the original space jam is honestly not that great either. But this one is just okay.

reviews.review_title: Y'all MF'ers need to lighten up
reviews.content: I saw a review that gave this movie 1-star because it was "an unrealistic premise." REALLY? It's SPACE JAM. Of COURSE it's unrealistic. Does this movie match its predecessor? In tone, yes. In story beats, yes. In special effects, A New Legacy WAY outclasses the original.LeBron obviously had some big shoes to fill. LeBron is not an actor, and he knows it, and it shows. However, neither was Michael Jordan. I feel like nostalgia speaks for a lot of people who think Michael was a better actor than LeBron. They are equally bad, but considering the circumstances they both had to act under - alongside imaginary, animated characters - they didn't do a terrible job, either. Honestly, LeBron's acting was better alongside the Looney Tunes than with his fictional family.Does it mean it was a great movie? No. It was a 2-hour ode to Warner Bros. Studios and its many properties. It was a cookie-cutter plot taken straight from the original. But the movie did enough different to make it its own, and kept it relevant to the time it exists in. Space Jam: A New Legacy may not be for those seeking a "realistic premise," but it's fun enough that it holds its own and makes for a wild ride.

The negative reviews seem to be made by individuals who either dislike Lebron or dislike animated kids movies. In that case this movie wasn't for you. If you watched this movie with an open mind you would've enjoyed. I watched old looney tunes cartoons growing up and I've also been a basketball fan my whole life. What some critics described as blatant advertising for other WB movies I thought was pretty creative and entertaining. The references weren't exactly to unheard of movies. And it's important to view this as a looney tunes movie with Lebron NOT a Lebron movie with looney tunes. Obviously Bron isn't the greatest actor but he did fine and it wasn't as bad as people are making out to be. At the end of the day this movie is for the kids, and not adult critics and movie reviewers. As long as you keep that in mind you'll be able to enjoy it. So ignore all the 1 ratings from haters.

reviews.review_title: Just an add for WB...Dame s/b the hero
reviews.content: I'll never buy LeBron as a hero, he has too much ego. Terrible overall just to shove the WB catalog down our throats the whole time. I found Don Cheadle more charming than a bad guy and the Dame Time scene was great. Dame is the hero personality this movie needed and he would've been great if WB wasn't so worried about putting the "name" in the lead role regardless of the best fit. Also, did they run out of money for a decent script? Only about 3 chuckles in the whole thing and it was just bad. Space Jam: Dame Time now that I'd "watch."

reviews.review_title: Slam Dunk or a Technical Fowl?
reviews.content: Is this movie a Slam Dunk or a Technical Fowl?"Space Jam: A New Legacy" is fun!Sure it's impossible to top the original, but for the most part this sequel 25 years later works.Whereas the first one was on two levels for children and adults this new edition is more for the kids.Which is probably why my two offspring who loved "Space Jam" in the 90's are not warming to this latest incarnation.Congrats to all involved in this project on and off screen especially King LeBron James and Don Cheedle who is having a ball as "Al G Rhythm".The soundtrack is not as strong as the Michael Jordan version.The effects are a bit hit and miss.The storyline is not very original.But the ball game between the Toon Squad and the new Monstars is brilliant.I loved how so many of my fave Warner Brothers cartoon characters, whose voices I've been mimicking since I was a child and now I get paid for it, are filtered throughout this movie.Also loving the references to other WB movies in the audience at the big game.But let's leave well enough alone and NOT make a third instalment after Brisbane host the Summer Olympics in 2032.

I'm very surprised by all the hate on IMDb. I watched this back to back with the original with my 14 and 10 year old boys. Not only do I disagree with all the sentiment that this is not as good as the original, I think it's better. Maybe all the haters should go back and watch the original again.A New Legacy is a movie, first and foremost, about family - and a beautiful one at that. But it's also absolutely hilarious at times, and unlike so many movies these days (ESPECIALLY family movies), it's continually surprising.I particularly loved all of the cameos in the crowd at the basketball game. Who would've ever thought Hanna Barbera characters would stand shoulder to shoulder with characters from The Matrix, Gremlins, Wizard of Oz, Harry Potter, LOTR, GOT, and the DC Universe? And Lil Rel, naturally.If you're looking for a fun movie to watch with your kids, you really can't go wrong here.

reviews.review_title: Great Effects, Good Animation, Boring Storyline
reviews.content: Rating movies one star is purely stupid. Movies have several elements: storyline, casting, acting, sound, effects, directing, camerawork, etc. Though 'Space Jam: A New Legacy' is not memorable as the first one, has poor acting, and the storyline is cheesy, it's definitely not a one-star movie.It's easily a three to a five-star movie. It's a three-star movie because it did not live up to the first one, which is still my favorite but has some of the amazing effects and animation a movie has to offer. Kids aged 6 to 12 may enjoy this movie. But LeBron needs to stick to balling. Acting is not his strong point.

Only gave it a Ten so that it could eventually reach a more honest ranking than what it currently has. This film deserves at least a 6. People are judging this film as if it could have been Oscar potential but dropped the ball. It's just a kids movie. Let's appreciate LeBron for agreeing to do such a film. He knows he's not a great actor and he even jokes about it in the film. He was aware that Space Jam means a lot to others and had big shoes to fill. Over all this film was far better than I expected. So many fun fictional character cameos. The original Jumanji was great. The remake with the Rock was great and was a reimagining just like this space Jam. It was a fun film if you leave unreasonable expectations at the door.

I'll start by saying that Space Jam (the original) is one of my top 10 favorite movies of all time! I keep seeing people talk about the "acting being bad" and "being the worst movie ever made", but honestly I think people are letting nostalgia get the better of them.To me, this was an enjoyable movie that pieced in so many more properties from Warner Brothers, in a way that made it its own. It has kid-esq humor that can still be enjoyed by adults, and it had a mixture of new wave enjoyment with peppered moments of Nostalgia. It wasn't the most intricate story-line you're ever going to see, but you can tell there was an effort put forward.A Corny, Fun, over the top movie...I think if people forget that this is suppose to be its own entity...it is something they will truly enjoy. And Lebron James's Acting? Not as bad as people say...but its also not going to be an Oscar worth performance when you're in a Looney Tunes movie!

reviews.review_title: Great Movie. You Guys Need to Loosen Up. 😷
reviews.content: Great Movie, had a Great Vibe to it. LeBron is a little stiff in the acting Department but he did loosen up in certain parts and The Movie Was Completely Enjoyable.I don't care about product placement, I don't care about commercials and advertisements the movie has, I want to see if a Living Legend in LeBron James👑 can be part of a Good Movie, and he did it.Don Cheadle was Great and of course the Tunes did their job.

I don't like the Luney Tunes, Basketball or LeBron (I dont even know the guy). But I liked this movie. The first half was boring, as we see LeBron and his family trying to find an excuse to get to the toon world. But once they get there, the madness begins!To me this was like YuGioh. They play a silly game, with high stakes. They have to combine all kinds of styles one way or the other. So we have live action, then live action and 3D, live action and 2D animation, live action with 3D and 2D animation... every combination is there. Just like in YuGioh the monsters are real, or they get sucked into the game and so on and sto forth. So in my book this is fine, even if it has been done over and over in various media.Many reviewers complain about this movie being a big advertisement. But that was Batman the Lego Movie, Ready Player One and Ralph Breaks the Internet. They all have product placements, King Kong and Iron Giant. But they don't have Rick and Morty!Some others complain about the 3D Looney Tunes. I was fine with that, as the movie explores and experiments with a bunch of different graphical styles, like Into the Spider-Verse. My fav style was Wonder Woman/ Lola Bunny.The story is stupid. But the premise is stupid to begin with. What is the challenge of competing with a pro in their own game? If the protagonist was a soccer player that was forced to play basketball, then I can see the challenge.But yeah, it's a silly cheesy movie. What do you expect? It's the Looney Tunes. Check out common sense outside the door and you should have fun.

There are also funny references to old Space Jam movie,but these references cannot save the movie. The same goes for music. In short, Space Jam: A New Legacy is a movie for me that I was really bored with expect for 6-7 minutes.
Maybe don't take my advice considering I turned it off after 25 minutes. But IMO this is a disgrace to the greatness that was Space Jam.

reviews.review_title: Ok it is worse then first but there both the SAME!
reviews.content: Listen it is a good film but every body is like "When I was a kid I saw space jam in theaters and it was great! Then this came along and booo!" The reason it was bad to you is cause you watched the first as a kid and you watched 2nd as an adult! So maybe watch the movie with a grain of salt.

reviews.review_title: I wanted it to be good so bad.
reviews.content: I went into this with a very positive attitude but.... no just no.
Music was the best part of the whole movie, the father/son storyline was pushed/cheesy/felt so fake.

Honestly, MJ is royalty. By contrast Lebron is an anti-American goon who would have played for the bad guys AGAINST MJ and Bill Murray in the original film. Having noted that, this animated misstep would have been bad in any era. It is shallow, nonsensical and not fun in the least. Unless you are under the age of four, there's nothing that will captivate you in this waste of time. That is a guarantee.

This movie is great from a kids perspective. The adults in the reviews are upset because the movie didn't bring them the joy that the original did without realizing that they were children at the time. Let your kids watch without your input and let them decide. My kids have watched 4 times already and love it.
Doesn't deserve that much hate, the movie was ok 6-7 starsGiving 8 because it currently has 4.5.

I dislike the way how they milked references to the Matrix, it was funny once and it wasn't funny anymore.There was only one funny joke but the rest of the jokes in the movies weren't really funny to me.

So I gave this a chance tonight because I didn't want to see that Joe Biden speech. First, the goods:
Nice animation and special effects. With the exception of a few redesigns of central characters I kept an open mind. I mean it's not 1996 anymore
Don Cheadle is in it and makes it's watchable when he's on screen. He's formidable as a cartoony type bad guy.The bads: story is the most cheese I've ever seen in a movie. Right down to the very end with the happy, feel good ending that's just plain ole dumbAt almost 2 hrs long (115 min) this could have used sharper editing to make it shorter. Most of the long scenes added for filler are of Lebron James. He doesn't come off likeable as Michael Jordan and doesn't appear to be having any fun here. I'd say had they cut out 30 min of Lebron this could have been better paced.Lebron's son gets kidnapped by toons and their reasoning is explained to James. After getting the okay to proceed to face off with Cheadle and his band of toons we get to see Lebron animated. There's a few speeches and some vanity moments by James. That's the whole movie. Cheese and corn to the max. While it's not bad, it's just not that good. Misses the magic of the original and it's a by the numbers money grab. Anyone over 9 years old will dislike it.

reviews.review_title: Space Jam: A New Legacy Of Trash Movie
reviews.content: The storyline is lame as hell, do they really think nowadays kids still fall for that kind of plot. And does Disney really know who is the most popular player among in the NBA now? LeBron? Really?Maybe they made this movie 10 years ago it will still popular with fans, and people may still interested in watching it. Another serious mistake to use LeBron as an actor is his acting skills are really bad, you might say that he is an NBA not an actor, then you should go back and watch the first Space Jam played by Michael.

Of course, it had the same boredom and lack of substance like the first one, but... from the half point of the movie it started to have meaning, message and getting looney, like they said. Yeah, they kept that and made it better. I laughed more at this than the other and Bugs motives and acts meant something, almost cried at the ending. I really would want one day to see my childhood heroes and hug them, I miss them. I'm really hoping to see more of these ideas and why not, another sequel with the next legend with my kids. Well done!

reviews.review_title: WHY DO PEOPLE HATE THIS MOVIE SO MUCH ?
reviews.content: I was in the cinema for this movie and I was pretty much happy (and surprised). I don't understand how people can hate this movie so much. It's one of the funniest movies ever. Please try to understand why I like this movie.

This movie is just a blatant commercial by Warner Brothers, made for the soul purpose to sell their products, and it is kind of hilarious. It's not hilarious in an intentional way, but in an unaware way. While there are still some good jokes throughout the movie, it doesn't distract from the fact that this is only a feature length commercial disguised as a movie. I want to give this movie a lower rating, but I just enjoyed how bad this movie was, and how it lacked any subtlety when selling it's brands. Additionally, the 3D interpretations of the "Looney Toons" characters speak for themselves in how bad they are. If your looking for a deep and engaging film to watch, steer clear from this, but if your looking for an enjoyable mess of a movie to watch, then this may suffice.

Obviously doesn't deserve a 10 but have to offset the trolls and people comparing it to their childhood. It was an enjoyable movie that you can watch with your kids or enjoy without as a little nostalgia trip.People saying LeBron can't act, you're right. Neither could Michael. Doesn't really hurt the movie because you should expect that a professional athlete doesn't know how to act. There's a lot of WB referential humor which can be a bit much sometimes but doesn't become overwhelming. Great self-deprecating shots at LeBron throughout. Felt like the other NBA/WNBA players could have had more screen time but they were probably busy with something else.Overall it's a funny and heartwarming cartoon basketball movie. What do all the haters expect? Casablanca (which does make an appearance)? Sit back and enjoy the goofiness... or Loony-ness. Eh? Ehh?

Just really lame, boring movie.Nothing to do with liking or hating Lebron.The movie was hard to sit through.Very few redeeming qualities, other then the graphics, story was weird barely made any sense even for a children's movie.Just one of the worst movies I've watched in a while.

reviews.review_title: I Can't With Most of You
reviews.content: First and foremost, let me begin with that this forum is for reviewing movies and television, not for the MJ vs. LBJ GOAT debate, or to degrade and express your hatred for LeBron. There are other forums for that, so seek those out and debate and express to your hearts content.Now, with that being stated, to all of the adults trashing this movie, just lighten up and quit taking it so seriously. To quote the Joker, "Why so serious?!" Animation shouldn't be taken so seriously. I'd explain, but it should be common sense. I admit that I do it from time to time, but then reel it in as I remind myself what I am watching. To me animation falls into 3 categories: 1. Animation for kids only, 2. Animation for adults only, and 3. Animation for adults and kids alike (and this sometimes happens because the writers throw in little something somethings for the adults). I see this movie as falling under category #3. For those who were looking to just be bathed in nostalgia, the nostalgia is there, you just missed it because you were too busy complaining about all of the modern touches and WB placements. Bugs and the gang are on point with their looniness, and I found heart where no one else apparently found heart. This movie is what it is and what it was supposed to be - just mindless fun- just like the original was.And for all of you harping on Lebron's acting and all of WB shameless plugging, I have this to contribute: MJ was also no prize winning actor either, and the shameless plugs are part of the humor and a way for WB to poke fun at themselves (these are the jokes people). And as a bonus, the script takes shots at LeBron too.Is this an Oscar worthy movie? Definitely not. Is this the best movie ever made? Nope. Is this the worst movie ever made? Once again, no. Critiques and criticisms are fine and welcomed, but it definitely doesn't warrant the comments of those just spewing their hatred and contempt for LeBron. This movie was obviously made to satisfy a new generation, not to satisfy the older generation, and to that, I would say success was achieved.THAT'S ALL FOLKS!!!

reviews.review_title: Why is that WB doesn't know how to honor the first movie?
reviews.content: I'm lost in words on how to describe this movie. The first space jam was amazing. When I first saw the sequel I was excited but with a small hint of questioning they're method of showing as many characters that WB has. This was literally Ready Player One, and Ralph Breaks The Internet again with all of the references to games and movie characters. It just too much, like really Warner? You couldn't think of any ideas for the sequel but instead of advertising. Like the part where the Looney Tune characters go into different movies, that could literally be split into shorts and put onto HBO Max. The acting wasn't really great and I'd rather have the Tunes stay in 2d as like the original. This movie hurts my head.

reviews.review_title: As of right now it's underrated
reviews.content: I made a pretty good choice to see this movie it was awesome but not as awesome as the 1992 Tom and Jerry movie.

I thought that Tom and Jerry's movie would be the worst cartoon made. Thanks to WB and LeBron, you guys just took over that category! LeBron had the nerve to be happy about a $31 million opening. The money they shelled out to make this mess will NEVER be made back! Your acting career is finished!

reviews.review_title: Cash grab - Lebron is no MJ
reviews.content: Not a bad movie if you haven't seen the original.Unfortunately feels like a Warner Bros movie with Looney Tunes in it - not a Looney Tunes movie.(With all the same IP cameos they forced into the Lego Movie 2)Who framed Roger Rabbit + Ready Player One - worked because they were designed to have the multi brand IPs. That was their charm.Also feels like a cheap rip off version of the original with a couple of twists (different Basketball player and updated graphics) unfortunately = no heart.Like on the court, Lebron is a cheap version of MJ.

There are 4 types of people that are leaving these 1/10 reviews: butthurt conservatives, MJ fanboys, Lebron haters, and people who genuinely didn't like the movie (the first three much more prevalent than the latter).Is this movie great? Not in the slightest, but nor was the original, just how it was supposed to be. This is literally a kids movie, so don't read into the negative reviews left by grown adults hahah. It's an entertaining movie with many hilarious references, and it'll be sure to keep you and the kids happy as long as you don't have ridiculous expectations!

reviews.review_title: big chungus almost saved this movie
reviews.content: Big chungus had a small cameo that almost saved this movie.

The quality of this movie is off the charts, in terms of computer graphics. I'll give it that much.However, it's just not that watchable (it literally took me 4 times because I just kept wanting to do anything but keep watching this movie, in most scenes, not to bash it, but just to be honest).Also, is LeBron that special? I see people who are great at lots of things but they sure don't get THAT much praise. A movie just shouldn't praise one guy so much unless it's a documentary.The ending with all of the different Warner characters is pretty good, however, but not great.Don Cheadle does a great job in his acting and role, also (as usual), and this should be noted. He really is a great actor, and sells the part of the villain nicely (I can't see anyone doing it better, actually). If Hollywood has any more bad guy roles, there's your guy (or at least a very solid one)!I feel like Six Flags could've made it into the movie more, besides one funny line, though.
I think it's a really good produced and funny movie. It's perfect for a Saturday evening with the kids. People give this 1/10 because they hate LeBron. Don't listen to them.

Repeated mentions of other more successful franchises and LeBron James constantly just comes across as a narcissistic, self promoting waste of time. About a half an hour passes before we actually meet any if the Looney Tunes. I just could not get into this at all. Not appealing to fans of the original, kids, or looney tunes or basketball fans. I don't know who this movie is for, but either way it sucks.

reviews.review_title: doesn't reach even the lowest of expectations
reviews.content: Forgot it was a movie to be honest, between the product placement and rigid 'acting' it just seemed like a long and terrible commercial. This never should have been made.. it tarnishes the space jam legacy. 0/10.
Good Looney tunes references but that plot SUCKED. Its non-existent.

Space Jam: A New Legacy was quite a thrill coaster. It was filled with fun and energetic feeling. There's was a little bit of something for everyone. We even got a little bit of nostalgia from the first movie which was really nice to see. It was different from the first film which I thought was okay seeing as it's a new Legacy of Space Jam. My family and I give this movie top ratings because that's what it deserves.
I am from Akron and I am a lebron fan. This is just garbage I watched this movie with my 6 year old and she said it was bad. Do yourself a favor and turn on the original one.

reviews.review_title: Most boring movie of the century!!
reviews.content: The plot is horrible. The acting was really bad. I fell asleep an hour into the movie. Please don't waste your time watching this movie. It's a waste of $$$$

I had to balance my rating between what I would give it verse what my kids would give it. Being a father of 3 boys (1 really into Lebron) I watched this because they wanted to. Obviously it is not the amazing Space Jam we remember but...On it's own it's not terrible like people suggest. I don't know if it was Warner Bros. Decision or Lebrons but he does get hyped up as "The King" way to much in the movie. The story line is pretty wacky and goofy as a Looney Tunes movie should be and I think that's where I keep it in positive light. I personally would give it a 4 or 5 but taking into consideration it's a kid's movie and my boys all loved it, i'll compensate for that. It has jokes, basketball, cartoons and it shows a relationship between a father and his son (I can appreciate that). In all honesty it teaches a good lesson about following your dreams as a kid and as a parent to not force your kids into the same path you followed.On a side note, I can only imagine how hard it is to be a super stars kid. They have to grow up with so many expectations because of their parents. In this case, it makes feel bad for Lebrons kids, painting a real picture of expectations passed on to kids that follow in their parents footsteps.

reviews.review_title: Not even so bad it's good, it's just bad.
reviews.content: The one star is for the animators who put in a lot of work into such a terrible film and nothing else. Everyone is phoning it in. It's an ego trip for LeBron. Even when he's not around people are asking "where did LeBron James go?" and "Gosh I sure do love King James." You know this.Here's the one moment I had a slight glimmer of hope for the film.Very early on there's a scene where out of touch execs pitch a dumb movie with star power to LeBron. It's stated these dumb film concepts, made by a soulless AI, are not a good idea. And for one single moment, I hoped that this was meta commentary, a glimmer of self awareness in a film about to dunk on itself.No.This is a vanity project for LeBron and WB, it's as crass and commercialised and soulless as the film concepts it pretends to reject.Don't waste even a second on this film.So much wasted time and effort.Enjoy your new pool or car or whatever, Cheadle.It really bugs me as well that so many people are making this about "wokeness" or the latest culture war nonsense. Or even their personal opinion of LeBron. I don't care about that. I don't care about The s*x*u*l assault Skunk or people misremembering a rabbits assets. This is based purely on the film I endured.No exaggeration, I didn't even know nor care who LeBron was. This movie was my first introduction to the man. And based on how he portrays himself in a movie he produced? He's a terrible human being utterly out of touch with reality with a desperate need to be validated and a massive over inflated ego. I don't believe this was a caricature of Mr. James because his acting isn't good enough to be an exaggerated version of himself.Days later, I came back wondering if I'd been too harsh, I mean the Fury Road Runner part did make me smile. But that could easily have existed as a silly skit totally removed from the film and still be fun.Literally everything else, every other scene, despite being bombastic and colorful and sometimes weirdly OVER animated, had the same flaw. They were boring. I don't know how you can have such a wellspring of creativity or at least a wellspring of franchises to draw from, and manage to make it utterly boring, tedious, monotonous. An endurance test.The first film was no masterpiece, but this is just a waste of everyone's lifespan.
A new legacy!! A great ride filled with Looney action and comedy. Great family message, interesting villain, great Easter eggs. Totally recommend!

Unlike the original, A New Legacy isn't about pitting the Tunes Squad and LeBron James (LBJ) against a host of nigh-invincible opponents. It's purely an LBJ ego-fest with a handful of cartoon sidekicks to prop up his silly antics. And BAD acting. Don't forget that.

Space Jam A New Legacy was a beautiful sequel to the first movie, I heard all the comments from the critics and I was not happy, this movie was gorgeous and it made me feel like a kid again. I will admit, it is not better than the original, but if your a nba fan, you will love it. Don't believe the hate from the critics. Go see it...

reviews.review_title: A letter to the Sound Department
reviews.content: Dear Sound Department. WTH?I mean, honestly the effects, quality, etc are well done. But the volume between the vocals and the effects make it almost unbearable to watch. You have to turn your sound system to max to hear the vocals and prepare to have your eardrums blown as soon as a sound effect comes up.Or learn to love subtitles.I rated this what I did because other departments did their job.

Idk why everyone is hating this movie so much I mean yes the acting is kinda bad and maybe it feels like a advertisement from Warner bros but I actually liked the movie that they go to different universes I like that the CGI looks great too overall I just really like this movie and I can see why some people don't but in a way I can't see it because it's just great and don't forget this movie is made for children too so that's a reason too overall I liked space jam a new legacy maybe it's a cash grab but for me it's a good one.

reviews.review_title: This was disastrous even with low expectations.
reviews.content: An unoriginal script and very bad acting is an understatement.The movie industry has proven again how to deliver a bad product and an excessive use of advertisements.There was only one thing I liked about the movie and that was the dressing room part at half time. Go watch that on youtube.My advise is; don't waste your time/money. Skip this one.The original Space Jam is King! Not LBJ.
This movie made me want to put my fingers in my eyes and swirl them around.

reviews.review_title: Worst animation WB has ever created!
reviews.content: Ok we can agree this movie is an abomination. Bad acting, dumb story, no space etc. Etc.But my god the animations are WORSE than its predecessor in like 1996(?).150M budget and you mess that up????

Good:
Was smiling from ear to ear the entire time to see the toons back on the big screen and to finally get a sequel to one of my favorite kids movies.Lots of references really hit the point and there were quite a lot of heavy laughs to be had.Lots of creative ideas and moments when the movie got very aware of itself on the meta level.The "Hook"-like plot about the relationship between a son and his dad was pretty well told.Knowing the toons for a long time gave you the chance to laugh a little earlier than everyone else whenever a characteristic scene was set up.The "Mad Max" sequence.Bad:
Didnt have the excitement, the well-done editing or the awesome score of the original.The 2D animation was too clean and not as charming as the classic Looney Tunes stuff.The CGI felt weirdly out of date.Lebron isn't a very good actor.The crowd of many WB characters present at the game mostly looks like people in bad cosplay.Quite alot of cringe and cliche.

reviews.review_title: These reviews make absolutely NO sense.
reviews.content: HOW CAN PEOPLE SAY THIS WAS BAD???Do any of you have a childhood! This was perfect! I literally could not stop watching this.The story was pretty awesome, Lebron was so funny in this, all the little call backs were so perfect!This is seriously such a perfect nostalgic movie for right now.
Don't watch it. My soul hurts now and no amount of alcohol could ever fill the void.
I LOVED IT IT'S A GREAT FUN MOVIE LONG LIVE THE LONNEY TUNES.

reviews.review_title: Light and fun for casual viewing
reviews.content: Not sure why this movie has such bad reviews. The animation was done well and it's nice to see my fav characters from looney tunes again! It does have cheesy dialogue but it's a Disney movie so I expected that! It's a good movie to turn on for casual viewing.

I don't get all the hate on this movie.I liked it. I loved the first one as I grew up with it and I think they made a nice one out of this one. Don't expect the biggest plot. After all it's looney toons. I would watch it again.

reviews.review_title: People Are Expecting Too High And Take It So Seriously
reviews.content: People are expecting too high and take it so seriously on this, what would you expect? It's already says LeBron James, but you guys are expecting Leonardo DiCaprio type of acting in this film, and then people are thinking that when they showing all the Warner Bros. Property is just for advertisement, but i found it as a fun cameo, what happen to people?, Space Jam A New Legacy isn't fills with the greatest acting of all time especially for LeBron James, but for a debut from a basket player is good enough, the movie fills with an amazing animation, visual and special effects, Space Jam A New Legacy is a very fun movie, it's entertaining, it's enjoyable, just watch it and enjoy it, and if you wanna review, judge it and give a score, please don't expect too high, at in the end is LeBron James.

Be wary, viewer! You've heard this movie sucked, yes? You're expecting it to be so dopey and goofy but a little endearing. This film is not that. It resembles a slave auction, where the evil master WB puts all their slaves (IPs) up for a humiliating display? It is a brutal, demeaning, animal process, which is what this movie ends up being, too. If you've ever liked a fictional character, seeing them in this movie makes you like them less. Insulting on so many levels of the filmmaking process. Corporative slave auction. It freezes to the touch.

reviews.review_title: Warn a Brother! Do not watch this product placement excuse of a movie!
reviews.content: While I was watching this soulless trash receptacle of a product placement promotional movie I wondered how can anyone effffff up such an simple concept of Looney Tunes and basketball?No more comments, I'm speechless.
Just absolutely terrible and predictable. Plot line is absolutely boring and acting is just not worth a watch.
Wish I could give it less than 1 star. Going back to watch the original. Maybe. I think this may have killed it for me. 😫

I didn't fully understand the plot or what the movie was trying to do. I got lost and the character of Algorithm doesn't do what an algorithm does in the real world, like how is he suggesting a movie? And is it basically a big wah that LeBron rejected his idea?The part I enjoyed most was trying to see which WB movie characters I could spot in the finale crowd.Original was much better. My biggest laugh was when they said Michael Jordan was coming and it was Michael B Jordan.
Who ever thinks this movie is garbage it's not. This movie might actually be at the the same level or better then the original. I recommend watching this movie if you have the chance.
I enjoyed it, it was a fun family movie, 7/10 watch atleast once.

SPOLIRR: movie is a child of AWFUL and TERRIBLE!I have only walked out of two movies EVER. One from the mid '80s and this PoS. I asked for my money back and used it for another movie.I was a huge fan of the first one. It was the literally the second movie I got digitally. I didn't go in expecting this to be the same or better, but this was SO far below any reasonable expectation I had to leave.This explains why LeBron bowed to Chinas demand he apologize for his comments on Taiwan being a country. The only place this would be considered a bad more (no hope of being a good one) would be in a communist country used to being devoid of any quality.His "acting" was terrible and they used him for tvr name I guess. At least MJ had a personality!
Some parts were funny. It's a kids movie. Can't believe adults are saying some of the most negative things about this movie. A must watch for your kids.

It was full of awesome referneces from whole WB rooster, The story was decent but the concept was bad although the music/soundtracks were amazing, The animation and the visuals were just stunningly beautiful its colorfully brilliant, the father son relation was good and the whole game was entertaining with wierd and awesome stuff and the ending with bugs thing it was amazing, Overall it was not that bad or not that great but entertainingly awesome.

reviews.review_title: A movie made for no one
reviews.content: There were two ways Space Jam: A New Legacy could have succeeded: as a kids movie for today's kids, or as a nostalgic homage to the original. It fails at both.It's far too long and slow for a kids movie, and the Looney Tunes don't appear until something like 1/4 way into the movie. Kids don't care about Casablanca, The Matrix, and A League of Their Own. Kids aren't nostalgic for MC Hammer. They don't care about lines from Training Day. Kids sure as hell don't go to a movie for references to A Clockwork Orange.So is it for nostalgic adults? No. This movie has nothing to do with the original Space Jam. It doesn't acknowledge the previous jam. It doesn't even play the signature song. There are no clever jokes for adults. All of the properties I listed above (and hundreds more) are used as mere props to remind the audience of how many properties WB owns.It's a total waste of film.

I watched Space Jam for the first time when i was 5 years old so i have it on my mind with good nostalgic feelings.But man, how i enjoyed this movie. I've seen many people complaining about the cameos and refferences... but that was a good part too, Ready Player One has a lot of that and no one says nothing bad about it; references and cameos appart, the animation and overall story is good and pretty enjoyable for everyone; classic humor can be seen everywhere with the Looney Tunes and many other jokes told. And the match had such action and intense moments alongside the 3D animation characters that are very good (yeah, that's for the haters of Lola's redesing, she's still good).But as this had all that good, there was only 1 thing that tooke me out of the movie completely and it was everytime Lola talked... let me explain. In my country (Spain) they decided to cast Lola Bunny with a Star Talent named Lola Indigo... and she breaks the moment that the movie tries to build, fun, sadness or even the speech in mid-time is runined by her Star Talent voice (Zendaya at least did it great, for sure).Ejoyable? Yes, Good Humor? Yes, Cameos? Yes please! Everything is good... just don't watch it in Castillian Spanish... Lola is a hurt for the ears.
Boring and poorly acted. Nobody will give you back the time spent on this. Think it twice before watching it.
WOW just terrible. Not much else to say. Just terrible. T E R R I B L E.

Was excited for this, being a fan of the first movie from when I was a kid. This movie was literally just an advert for the Warner bros universe to try and sell subscriptions to their streaming app. The story line was nonsense. The acting horrible. This movie does nothing to bring back the dead franchise of looney tunes and if this movie is representative of the argument of lebron v Jordan, well Jordan has got in the bag.

What the hell did they do to this franchise. Absolute garbage on every level. Lebrons acting is somehow worse than the plot. Does this review contain spoilers? Lol there is nothing to spoil in this pile of trash.

reviews.review_title: Just a very bad lame and boring movie
reviews.content:
Storywise its just the biggest bull.... ever and could easily be made up by a kid from 7 years old.Its wouldnt be that bad if the story was simple because its the looney tunes but its just bad and annoying just like the acting of lebron and his weird fake kid
The main villian who also creates most of the story is super annoying not funny at all and does not act well his robot friend looks like .... and aint funny. The goonsquad are very forgetable and you only see a couple of them doing a trick during the game and thats all. No soul no real chacter. All the cameos are not more than in the trailer just a flash of them getting by no lines no jokes nothing. Ow and half of them look like cheap dressed up comic con visitors not the real deal. The looney tunes are not in good shape. They only have a handull of real jokes in the whole movie. They get together (only all right part of the moment when they all get picked up from different movies) and than theres the game already . The game didnt had a lot of good action or exciting moments. Just a couple of goofy moves from the looney tunes but it doesnt really feels like they are playing a full game because the choreagraphy and directing is very bad. Also the whole part with the game looks way to flashy and fake with all the ugly CGI and all the real people badly dressed up on the sidelines combined with CGI characters just 1 big mess. The commentators of the game are 2 morons who are not funny at all and very annoying. The looney tunes look bad in CGI and made me sick but ofcourse they had to do it the lame way. If they just did the rogger rabbit and space jam 1 style it would be great but even in toontown they where to lazy to pull it off and made lebron into a cartoon. Ow and the music in the movie is bad as well.That looney tunes footlocker commercial they did some years ago and the other one with the monstarz both with blake griffin where much better space jam follow ups than this messed up movie.

reviews.review_title: Great family movie with a powerful lesson
reviews.content: I'm not sure why all these people are giving it such harsh reviews - it was a great movie for me and my siblings to watch; reminded us of our childhood and we also could keep up to date with the cultural references - lots of laughs. This movie wasn't meant to be oscar worthy - it was just certainly fun and entertainingGo and watch it and see for yourself.

reviews.review_title: Racism is the cause of low ratings?
reviews.content: Well that's a new one lol. I wish people would stop throwing the whole "racism" thing out there for stuff like this. LEBRON's acting SUCKS. If racism was the issue, then every film with someone of color who plays the lead would have also gotten a poor rating..... so over all this political BS.

WB seemed more interested in injecting WB branded content into a kids movie than to actually produce a kids movie. Blatant nods to the DCCU, the Matrix, Harry Potter and stretching all the back into the 90's with Iron Giant.I stopped watching the movie about an hour into the film.

The movie was really really hard to get through, most of it is a basketball game in CGI.Ok...so I've seen so many movies in my lifetime and I have to say, I can probably only count on one hand the amount of movies worse than this. Since it is under the (Space Jam) line of movies, I will compare it to the original. The original if its on TV, I will watch and remember the memorable moments and funny lines from 1996. This movie Space Jam a new Legacy, I hopefully will never have to watch again, if its on TV I will make sure to skip the channel fast. You seriously could not pay me to watch this again.Saw reviews talking about LeBron's acting, and boy was it bad.In conclusion this was a money grab that was rushed together. There is no creativity, its not funny, the animation hurt my eyes and the acting was probably the worst ive ever seen in a movie. The studio will make a lot of money off a rushed movie, and you would have thought they would try to make a movie better than the original but this seemed like it was made to be worse. I wouldn't recommend this to families, adults, kids or athletes. Yikes.

In watching this film, I got a "Who Framed Roger Rabbit" kinda vibe with Warner Brothers properties all over it. Now to be honest, I didn't watch the first one, but I didn't think that mattered. The idea was simple - a kid who didn't want to be like famous dad whose dad wanted him to be like famous dad. But it's 2020..or so and tech is big so he wants to be a tech designer. So that makes him ripe to convince that he should join that side because his famous dad doesn't care, etc.Okay, so with this when they get through the 'toon-town' thing and to the big basketball game, there is TON of HBOmax and Warner Brothers & their acquired properties in the audience and to be honest, I spent my time identifying them. "Oooh, there's Frankenstein Jr!!!" while those very young ones 6 to 10 years old and a few adults watching the movie with me were asking, "What or who is Frankenstein Jr.?" ...of which was the same kinda thing when I watched "Who Framed Roger Rabbit" and I asked some adults "Who is Betty Boop?" It's that kinda film.Be prepared - all the 'cancel culture' broo-ha-ha is not there. It's just a Warner Brothers cartoon film for kids and those who like basketball, and a B-I-G promotion fest for the adults who catch onto it all. I ranked it higher than most reviews placed here because I liked the seeing the cartoons, and putting the live and cartoon properties in the audience of the big game.

25 years following one of the most polarizing cult classic sport movies from the 90s, Space Jam, Warner Bros has finally released its long awaited sequel. Directed by Malcolm D. Lee and Terence Nance and starring NBA all star Lebron James alongside the Looney Tunes gang, the film has been garnishing countless attention from former fans of the first movie and the general public alike. As of now, it's been going rather smoothly at the box office and on HBO Max, despite not being met with the nicest critical reception. So as a non fan of the first film, let's see how this followup has been presented in 2021.The main plot centers around a fictionalized LeBron James teaming up with the original Looney Tunes cast in order to win a basketball game against a rogue artificial intelligence that has kidnapped his son. Just like the first film, the plot is utterly bizarre past the point of comprehension, especially when we consider the massive time lap. What makes the plot even worse is how rushed the pacing is just to make it to the game, and if you're unfamiliar with the Looney Tunes or much of the movie references the writers implement to signify their new presence, you'd feel utterly lost. It doesn't help that for a movie that could easily tackle how badly artificial intelligence has ruined the progress of human knowledge within the entertainment business, it would rather make it all about the cliched and predictable storyline of James trying to understand his own flesh and blood. Needless to say, the plot feels like a failure in the making.However, as fundamentally flawed as the whole movie is, it might actually be fully aware of all of its problems. As this is a long awaited continuation from a ridiculous corporate cash grab, it never takes itself too seriously enough to allow the insanity of a project like this run wild. Because this movie mostly takes place within a Warners streaming verse, much of the plot relies on the gimmick of product placements to serve the function of James and the Looney Tunes taking down an AI. While the actual game plot gets a little underwhelming due to the predictable outcome, there are still plenty of gags and bizarre turnarounds that are too unbelievable to look away from. Also, if there is any group from the crew that clearly had a ball on this, it would be the animation team led by veteran WB animator Spike Brandt, as they really capture the timeless comedic nature and poses in the lovable Warner Bros characters that we have all cherished for decades onward. Even in CGI, the talents of the gifted animators can never be outmatched with the right amount of craftsmanship and love.On a side note, while Lebron isn't that great of an actor in his own right, he does seem to at least take the movie about as seriously as it needs to be, so any hoaky underacting can be attributed to the nature of the film more than anything else. In addition, Don Cheadle must have been having a ball as the AI during the making of the feature, as he disguises his truly despicable pettiness with a sly charming persona to a believable point. Also, it's incredible to see how far famed voice actor Eric Bauza has come in voicing Bugs Bunny, Daffy Duck, Marvin the Martian and many more, as his wonderfully sharp range brings the characters to life very solidly. Other veterans like Jeff Bergman, Bob Bergen, Candi Milo fit right back into their character perfectly, but it is noticeably peculiar having celebrities like Zendaya voicing Lola Bunny, Fortunately, she does bring a certain level of charisma that was much needed for a character that had already grown better in other media. It's funny comparing non actors, in this case basketball players, to professional actors and VAs, but that's what movies like this are for.So even though Space Jam: A New Legacy is far from a great movie, it didn't really disappoint in being what it set out to do in the first place. While it's obviously not going to win everyone over, there's a good chance fans of the first film will find the most value out of it and even share them with new people like their own kids (c'mon, it's been 25 years since then). Unless you're more in the mood to check out Black Widow or you hate the first film with a passion, I'd say this wouldn't be the worst flick to take your family to on a lazy weekend. Besides, we haven't had this much fun in the movie theaters in a long time.

If you're like me and you don't take movies so seriously you will enjoy this, and if you have kids (ie; the target audience) they will for SURE enjoy it!

reviews.review_title: Space Jam: A New Legacy: A Fun Children's Movie
reviews.content: Space Jam: A New Legacy: A Fun Children's MovieDimwitted, entertaining and action filled, "Space Jam: A New Legacy" serves the purpose it needs to serve and more!In a cartoon world, famous basketball Star LeBron James and his son are trapped in a Warner Bros algorithm. To get out, LeBron James teams up with the Looney Tunes in an epic basketball match for the ages.Despite LeBron James' poor theatrics throughout the flick, the acting was phenomenal. Whether it be Zendaya as Lola Bunny or Don Cheadle playing a rogue AI, the film featured many famous actors who performed their heart out, no matter the scene.While the acting was nothing to laugh at, the plot and writing wasn't nearly as good. As it is a kid's movie, the screenplay featured many unnecessary scenes that present cameos and semi funny jokes for the adult audience. Moreover, in true Space Jam fashion, the story (although fun) was too much.In addition to the acting, the special effects were amazing. No matter the scene, the screen was brimming with life and color. Furthermore, despite their cartoonish appearance, the Looney Tunes look as though they belong in real life.In summary, Space Jam: A New Legacy is a fun movie that suffers from a horrid plot and bad writing.

reviews.review_title: Ready Player Two... err Space Jam 2 Is Pop Culture Extraordinary, Yet Short On Story
reviews.content: Almost 25 years ago, the idea of crossing over NBA legend Michael Jordan with Looney Tunes was playing on the best of both worlds for all ages to enjoy. It still remains a classic to me to this day ever since I first watched it in theaters as a kid in 1996. The self-referential, meta humor and fourth wall-breaking gags are what made Looney Tunes memorable for decades, so it adds to keep the story going in Space Jam.Now introducing this standalone sequel 'A New Legacy' featuring a new generation of people along with current player LeBron James stepping up to the court? It's not a perfect film, but it felt like it tries to remain faithful to the original despite the overstuffed use of Warner Bros-based properties surrounding it. It's like it really wants to follow off the trail left behind by fellow Warner Bros. Movie Ready Player One and many others that succeeded at crossover films in the comic book movie genre. But despite the crossover of different properties and pop cultural stuff coming together to witness the ultimate basketball game in cyberspace, there's more that can be done. I was blown away on spotting every character and reference thrown onscreen, but as for the leading man himself? LeBron James had big shoes to fill left behind by Michael Jordan, but I feel like he did his best even if his fictionalized self does come off as seemingly obnoxious compared to a chill Jordan those years ago.The things this movie did succeed in was its amazing visuals, animation, and performances (Don Cheadle did great as the eccentric villain Al G.), but fell short on the story. Lebron's son is kidnapped and must venture into the studio's computer server with the help of Bugs Bunny and co. To save him. You can place all kinds of TV and film references or characters in one movie for a cameo, but it's not enough if you can't get a great story working. A great family distraction for the kids, but looking at this sequel from an adult's perspective? It could potentially put them to sleep easy. Some audience members in my theater dozed off during the animation sequences, but finally woke up during the basketball scene, which I find hilarious than what was shown onscreen. Anyway, it's flawed, but in no way awful.
Woke, boring, all cast is black (???), political, you know where this is going. Long advertisement, absolute fail.

Folks have been way to quick to bag the movie with lowball reviews. Enjoy it for what it is, good value entertainment that the whole family can sit down and watch together.Pleasantly surprised at how well LeBron did in his role.

We loved Space Jam 2. The graphics are crazy-amazing. Watch it on a big-screen TV if you have one. One of the scenes took a year to animate, apparently. The story is predictable and very family-friendly.We were amazed at how the director was able to find voice actors to mimic the voices of the Warner Brothers toons. Bugs Bunny is perfect, so is Daffy Duck and Marvin the Martian. In other cartoons made since Mel Blanc died in 1989, no one has ever been able to get those voices right. Well, this time they nailed everyone. Even Foghorn Leghorn and Yosemite Sam, which I think would be tough.Porky Pig's rap is a high point. Since he stutters, we were wondering how he was going to pull it off, but he does!And why aren't there "style points" in real-life professional basketball??The majority of the reviews here show that people were offended by the focus on various Warner Brothers properties as part of the story. We loved it! It was so neat to see Pennywise in the crowd, or the Iron Giant or King Kong, or to see the worlds of Harry Potter and the Matrix and Casablanca as Lebron goes whooshing by them. We liked those movies back then and it was enjoyable to see them flash by throughout this film. Rick & Morty even make an appearance! If you like these characters, why are you mortally offended to see them in another movie? So weird.It is true, Lebron can't act. What were you expecting? Viola Davis level acting? It's not his focus in life. But he did okay, and the people around him (his on-screen family, Don Cheadle, toon voices, etc.) did a great job.We had a rollicking time watching this. And a big thanks to the studio for doing the day-and-date release of movies in theaters and on HBO MAX. We loved seeing this on the release night and we hope HOPE! Hope that they will continue to do this. We do not expect to ever go to a sticky-floor cell-phone-ringing people-yakking theater ever again, so having the benefit of timely movie releases at home is an amazing benefit. Thanks!!

reviews.review_title: When you stop and think about it, jam is . . .
reviews.content: . . . pretty disgusting. No one wants to get into a big jam. No one asks for second helpings of toe jam. Your morning commute never goes well when your toast is spread with traffic jam. So there is little surprise that SPACE JAM: A NEW LEGACY could just as easily be titled SPICE JAM: STEWED LEPROSY. As the latter heading suggests, SPACE JAM trashes everything that it touches, from CASABLANCA and KING KONG to Bugs, Daffy and Yosemite Sam. If NASA had launched a golden DVD of SPACE JAM 2 on Voyager One, it's highly probable that some less tolerant alien civilization would have destroyed Planet Earth by now for its apparent lack of intelligent life. Just don't blame Marvin the Martian for getting us into such a jam.

It is full of reference to the Warner universe and from the beginning makes it clear to the public, that is, a self-promotion for the studio and King, that being said, any attempt to speak ill of these aspects is unfounded, it is made for it , which is very honest. However, it lacks a lot in the story, it is shallow despite surprising in its references to The Matrix, It a Thing, Harry Potter, King Kong, Rick and Morty, Game of Thrones, Superman, Wonder Woman and the rest of the Justice League, brings excitement for that aspect.The shared universe is well done, both in animation and in CGI. Warner wanted to show its potential and got it, of course it's not a 10, but it's good. Unfortunately there are flaws in the plot, for example: spoiler: it doesn't explain the real reason why Bugs' friends leave his world and in the end decide to come back.It's not focused to be a sequel, even though it has a mention of the previous movie, it's just similar (that doesn't make the movie bad).When I went to see it I thought it would be a cheap copy of the old one, I had low expectations and didn't expect much, however, it has its original aspects, a different feel and new pop culture reference, it's not the Looneys that need help anymore, but the LeBron James.The acting was relatively good, but Don Cheadle left something to be desired because of his character without depth, a classic villain, where, it has no sense for what he does, nothing interesting, they could have at least given a little sense to value the actor. .It surpassed my expectations, but not really a grandiose one (nor is it its goal), but just a fun movie that implements good references, great to watch with the family.Film viewed from the 27th to the 28th of August 2021.

reviews.review_title: I'm a diehard Jordan fanatic but this movie won me over!
reviews.content: Screenplay is phenomenal and the plot has an appropriate depth for a kid's movie. Only negatives I can think of; LeBron isn't lead actor material (maybe just yet). Director seemed to overlook this while shooting the family-centered scenes. Where LeBron really excelled was bouncing his dialogues off seasoned veterans like Don Cheadle and Bugs. We've seen from the film "Trainwreck" LeBron is already a much better actor than Michael Jordan. Editing team could've done a better job on that small matter. If I'm being super picky maybe we deserved a game winning block since that's LeBron's signature play. Outside that I had a really pleasant time watching this movie. The CGI and music combination can only be described as euphoric. Movie embraced its corniness and dry humor. Even got a chuckle out of me with the expected Michael B. Jordan cameo. Eernie Johnson and Lil Rel "basketball commentary" was undoubtedly the movie's unsung hero. Daffy Duck referring to Al G Rhythm (Don Cheadle) as a "son of a glitch" is probably my favorite line. Innuendo jokes about LeBron's super team building skills are more endearing than you would expect. Goon squad characters even brought their own fun and uniqueness for each member (in particular Chronos/Dame was an epic character) unlike the original Space Jam Monster squad. The film's digital conscious theme is so appropriate for a 2021 release. You've got Porky Pig rapping, Tweety Bird dunking, Granny out-dueling father time and LeBron James being trolled by Bugs Bunny, what more could you ask for? Ending is logical and leaves you feeling warm, what more can you ask for? In conclusion, "Space Jam: A New Legacy" is a vibe.

reviews.review_title: It's a 6/10, but a very low one
reviews.content: (Note: This review may or may not be dated as of now. I've been taking the criticisms this film has received into account and when I re-watch this and the first film again, I have a feeling my opinions on this specific movie may change)Earlier today, I watched the first Space Jam, and I really liked it. It's no masterpiece, sure, but it's not trying to be. It's just a fun experience that knew what it wanted to be. The characters were likeable, it had good, fast pacing, the animation and 2D hybrid worked really well and it was just all-around fun.As for the sequel? Meh. I actually really liked the first half. It established the idea of a digital universe with Warner Bros. Properties, where LeBron James meeting Bugs Bunny in the Looney Tunes world and the other Looney Tunes being able to access different Warner Bros. Worlds. I can understand why some people wouldn't like this, it does feel very self-promoting and there are references to stuff for adults that kids won't understand. But on the other hand, they're only short scenes and do work as part of the concept of the Warner3000 Server-Verse. Other than that, I just thought that the film was really fun at this point. The Looney Tunes all get a time to shine and I almost thought that it would be on par with the original.As for the second half, that's unfortunately where the film starts to go downhill. It's not bad, and I like how they try and spend more time with the basketball game, but it's also where the film's biggest issue for me starts. You know how I previously criticised Maf's SuperMarioLogan Movie for feeling rushed with it's pacing. Well this film has the opposite problem. The basketball scenes feel slow and tend to drag on.Whilst the basketball stuff in the first one felt shorter in comparison, I didn't have an issue with that as they didn't overstay their welcome and the film's fast pace helped this. As for this film, I feel like they spent too much time on the basketball game. It hurt my enjoyment of the film because until then, I really liked it.I also find it funny that the last scene with the Looney Tunes that aren't Bugs have them looking sad whilst Bugs supposedly dies before he regenerates in the real world a week later.But overall, I did really want to like this movie, even with the poor reception it got. It's still okay, sure, but I was disappointed.

I watched most of this movie yesterday besides, the last 20 minutes. I had to finish the last 20 minutes today because I went to go see Cruella in the movie theater before I could finish this movie but the point is, I like Space Jam: A New Legacy more than Cruella. I know people hate this movie but being a fan of the first Space Jam, the Looney Tunes and movies in general. I had a great time. I didn't really care about LeBron James' fake son in the movie, Dom or the Goon Squad. I don't like modern music or a lot of stuff apart of current culture so I didn't like LeBron dabbing or the new jersey's but I am happy that when the Tunes and LeBron are training they wear the original jerseys. I do not like LeBron James and his acting was questionable to bad and I wanted Michael Jordan to reprise his role instead of LeBron James but I really like the Looney Tunes. I can see some problems with the movies but I just don't care, I was very surprised that this movie is actually good and I really enjoyed it.Overall, Space Jam: A New Legacy is not as good as the first but it was better than I expected. I am happy I saw it once but I don't know if I need to ever see it again. I would recommend giving Space Jam: A New Legacy a watch.

Honestly, I orginally watched Space Jam (1996) and thought it was about average and didn't have any expecations going to see this movie but boy was I WRONG! This movie absolutely blew me away. I love how it included different WB franchises we know and love such as Harry potter, DC, Matrix, Austin Powers etc and had some characters watching during the game such as Pennywise, Joker, Voldemort, Fred Flintstone, Mystery Gang, King Kong etc. But in my opinion, this movie nailed it with the plot, characters, visuals, animation and music. I also loved how the movie transitioned between live-action and 2D animation, this movie respected the original Space Jam and the original Looney Tunes characters while having a different lead in this film. The switch between Jordon to Lebron I didn't mind (also that scene with Michael Jordon in the film was hilarious but made me annoyed a bit!) but all in all, this movie really blew my expectations away and was definitely worth the money to see this. Great job to WB, the cast and the crew!

What a strange film this is. It's not wholly unsuccessful, but seems to contradict it's own ethos as it takes place and it's difficult to see exactly who it's aimed at.Having been spurned on a business deal, Warner Brothers new AI algorithm (Don Cheadle) traps Basketball Superstar LeBron James (LeBron James) and his son, Dom (Cedric Joe) inside his metaverse and challenges him to a basketball game for his release. Unfortunately, James must create his team from the Looney Tunes characters and though they do have experience in this sort of encounter, the rules of the game will be very different this time.First, let it be clear that I'm not much of a fan of the first "Space Jam" film, I thought that Jordan was OK, but that the film, even viewed through the prism of a "kids film" was unfunny and the animation work was poor. I do think this sequel, with the exception of the star, is better in virtually every way - but unfortunately not better enough to make it stand as legitimately good.When I say that the film seems to contradict it's own ethos I mean that it has LeBron, seemingly for noble reasons, rejects the algorithms plan to scan him and then have him interact with all their IP - only for all of Warner Brothers Properties to feature heavily in the film, regardless of whether the character seems to suit the storyline, or is appropriate for the target audience. This leads, for example, to Pennywise the clown featuring quite heavily in the audience for the end basketball show.That said, I'm not a kid - I'm an old man and references to "Game of Thrones", "Mad Max: Fury Road" and "Casablanca" weren't lost on me. Despite being a bit obvious, I liked some of the cameos and jokes - though again, not enough that I'd suggest for a moment that the film is actually good.If anything it made me want to watch some other, better Warner Brothers films again - and, I fear, that's all that the producers really had I mind.

reviews.review_title: An excuse for yet another CGI animated film.
reviews.content: I think this movie shouldn't have been made the way it was made. The secret to the success of the first "Space Jam" was its originality and the way it combined the drawings and a real basketball star in a movie where he could play a little with himself. Here, what we have disappoints anyone and only serves to raise money for the public without delivering a product that truly meets expectations.The film's biggest problem is obviously its script: it all starts when LeBron James, a basketball player, turns down a contract with Warner Bros. The contract was crafted by a computer algorithm that has somehow taken on a life and will of its own, and is determined to make itself noticed, even in the worst ways. By imprisoning the sportsman and his son in a digital universe, things get complicated. James will have to play basketball against the live algorithm, and he will ask the only one who might possibly have a good idea for help: Bugs Bunny. It is, as we can see, a basic script, very poorly written and poorly designed, which is not able to properly sustain the film.I don't want to be mean to LeBron James. He's not an actor, he's not expected to do a great job as an actor. I think he did a lot with what he got, which was pretty bad, but I also think he's not famous enough to support the movie the way Air Jordan did before. Maybe he's famous in the USA! Outside the US, no one knows who he is. Don Cheadle, thus, ends up being the most prominent actor in the film, even if in a Machiavellian and tiresome character. Cedric Joe does what he can, but his character is terrible, and it was very poorly thought out. Self-centered, selfish, vain and resentful of his father, the kid is nasty almost until the end.Technically, the film bets everything on the CGI of great visual effect and fails completely: if there's one thing that doesn't work well, it is the stylized and tiresome look of this film. I've acquired a special dislike for the computerized versions of Bugs and the rest of Looney Tunes. They are terrible and ugly. There are things that shouldn't be modernized, so they don't lose their essence! In addition, the film has tiresome cinematography and is excessively long, with no script or material to fully justify it. I liked, however, the many tributes that are made to the films of the past of the Warner studio: we have everything from "King Kong" to "Casablanca", with the passage guaranteed by the "Harry Potter" franchise to "Matrix" and "Mad Max". It was the part of the movie that I found most sympathetic and honorable, but I still don't recommend this movie.

I cannot believe how bad it was. I thought Jordan's acting was not that good in the original but wow James acting is bad... really bad. Honestly it gets a 5 from me because of the looney tunes (for the most part they did their thing but sometimes they were hard to stomach as well), the Austin powers scene, and the Rick and Morty cameo. Other than that it was a 2 hour waste. I'm glad I have HBO max free because I would've asked for my money back if I saw it in theaters.

reviews.review_title: COME FOR THE COLORS...LEAVE FOR THE STORY...!
reviews.content: The recent reboot/sequel/whatever to the 1996 original now stars LeBron James, playing himself, out to match B-ball skills w/the Looney Toons gang versus Don Cheadle's sinister IA whose handpicked & enhanced goon squad led by LeBron's bitter son. What leads up to this disagreement is LeBron's insistence that his boy attend a basketball camp (while the tyke wants to go to some E3 gamer conference) as they're summoned to the Warner Bros. Studios lot to hear a pitch developed by Cheadle's algorithm. Dismissing the idea as absurd, Cheadle decides to take advantage of the son's already obvious friction w/his pere to lure him into his world (sort of a matrix vision of the computer's NeuroNet). LeBron follows suit but needs to reunite the toons (already disbanded by Cheadle's program to points unknown) so he recruits Bugs Bunny to collect his cohorts for the final game which is populated by many a Warner Bros. Property (King Kong, The Iron Giant, The Herculoids, Space Ghost, et al) but also humans who will forfeit their lives if LB's team loses. Not really my cup of tea (it wasn't my cup of tea back in 1996 & I didn't come out for the Brendan Fraser/Jenna Elfman starrer Looney Toons: Back in Action either) but just as a matter of being that guy who needs to see what the fuss is all about, it's a box I just checked off but bottom line the final product isn't offensive or nausea inducing but as a product of studio synergy, it gets the job done & people plugged into the material (whether because of nostalgia for the first film) will find the same happy place here for them to prop up their feet & let their eyeballs absorb the colors.

reviews.review_title: This was better than "Good" it was "Good enough"
reviews.content: I'm grateful for Michael G(Goat) Jordan. I consider him the "Savior" of Basketball, an all-time great. Basketball was a dyeing sport and in comes this guy just flying and twirling through the air and taking down everybody like it's no big deal, all except his nemesis, John Michael Wozniak, his security guard. Michael paved the way for more players, more talent, more shoe production, more jobs, more money, just MORE. And just like anything we humans deem precious and or profitable to us, we want to keep it alive and keep it going but not only that, to add more to it.The title of this movie says it all. Michael left his legacy and movie for basketball and now Lebron gets to add to that. Just like the first "Space Jam," this one was just as nostalgic and silly.From all the trailers leading up to this, I was hyped, and every part of those trailers that got me there, experiencing it all made it that much better. Visually, I give it a 10. The Looney Tunes were still looney! There were so many movie and tv show cameos that brought out that nostalgia and smiles. Don't go in expecting to be wowed or anything. The acting was of course not the best but it wasn't the WORST. There was a heartfelt moment that Lebron had with his son which felt very real, so props to him for that.This is a great movie for kids and families..... so, Lakers fans.

The Looney Tunes are back for a brand new adventure. After more than twenty years, Space Jam returns to the big screen with another explosive installment. Even if it's not perfect story-wise, the movie has enough heart to entertain the younger audience. The humor is well-crafted and the characters are funny enough to make the viewer interested in what's going on. LeBron James works fairly enough as the lead protagonist, even when the world around him is totally computerized. The soundtrack is memorable, not as much as the original, but still good nonetheless. All things considered, this franchise can still offer a ton of exciting and dynamic moments, which is why I wouldn't mind seeing another one in the near or distant future.

Having not seen the first Space Jam & vaguely remembering it, I went to see this after seeing a couple of trailers. The film wasn't bad.The film follows Superstar LeBron James and his young son, Dom! The 2 get trapped in digital space by a rogue AI. In order to get home in one piece, LeBron teams up with Bugs Bunny, Daffy Duck and the rest of the Looney Tunes gang for a high-stakes basketball game against the AI's digitised champions of the court, a powered-up roster called the Goon Squad!I found the film to good, not amazing, but good! The laughs were alright as with the jokes & innuendos!The film did however, drag! The pacing wasn't great & the film overly long at 1hr & 48mins! It could've been 25-30mins shorter! LeBron James wants his son Domto follow his footsteps into basketball. Dom however has more of a passion for creating video games. One day an A. I. programme called Al G. Rhythm kidnaps Dom into what he calls the serververse; and the only way LeBron can save his son (along with thousands of other people/characters) is to play a game of basketball. Not any game of basketball though. The upgraded version created by his own son. To add to the craziness LeBron is forced to team up with the looney tunes to take on Dom himself alongside upgraded versions of professional basketball stars.Audiences who are fans and familiar with the various Warner Brothers intellectual properties would be delighted to see many of the characters they have watched before get a cameo in this film. There are literally too many of them to mention. There are definitely funny parts in the movie. The Looney Tunes cast certainly were one of those who delivered the comedic parts. Don Cheadle also had many comic parts as well. He actually fit in the role of a comedic villain. His character sucked, but you could at least see Cheadle was having fun making the film. From hybrid animation to computer graphics. The transformation of the Looney Tunes cast into 3D CGI was done well. The story was definitely supposed to be a hit. But what made it uninteresting was a combination of uneven pacing and rushed editing. The film ran for about two hours and yet it seemed like a rush of clips tied together to form the film. There were scenes that jumped from one point to the next without any context whatsoever. The film also seemed to serve as one long commercial showcase the various intellectual properties of Warner Brothers. It was great to see many of them on the same screen, but their cameos were a little off considering they were just there.Overall, Space Jam: A New Legacy might definitely please younger audiences because of its visuals and bright colors. But the story and the theme seemed to be buried underneath a seemingly infinite cameos that may distract the audiences.
