I have no single idea why low star raters or critics are being harsh on this movie, this is a fantastic movie! I love the plot and even though it doesn't sorta make sense, it's just part of the fun and nothing too serious, heck even the movie tells you in your face!It's all for fun, Lebron James did a great job in this movie, and I can't even explain the amount of stuff this movie has to offer, it's like a weird dream I never thought I wanted to come true, and even though I never watched the original space jam, I still loved this movie and get some references of the first movie and weirdly get the nostalgia feeling even though I never watched the first movie and never born in the 90s, which tells you something about how special this movie really is, it brilliantly takes fans who didn't watch the first movie into this, while taking old fans with nostalgia and old school childhood cartoons and references that could make old fans say "Hey I remember that!" And this movie does tease the fact that this is a direct sequel to the first movie, but they actually don't spoil new fans if they didn't watch the first movie, but the old fans might recognize the references about the first movie this movie teases, and even if people don't like this movie, you can't lie that this movie is just like Ready Player One and has tons and tons of movie references that you might've enjoyed, and seeing your favorite movie in this movie, oh yeah and the part when they turn into 3D is pretty awesome, I know some people aren't gonna like it but you have to know this is a New Legacy, this isn't the 90's anymore, this is 2021 now, but the movie does still keep the 90's nostalgia but still being modern, and that's how you make a sequel to a 90's movie.

reviews.review_title: Not as bad as they all say

reviews.review_title: Good where it matters, terrible where it doesn't

Plot is terrible, but who really cares about that in a movie with LeBron James and Bugs Bunny playing hoops. I was however put off by James' acting a little, and whilst I L. O. V. E. D the references to other Warner Bros titles, I did wish they kept it down a little bit with the flexing and plugging and focused more on the Tunes.Review:Good writing in terms of character, it's genuinely funny at times. A big plus were the Tunes living lives in other universes, great concept! Strong music selection and visually the movie was absolutely STUNNING, I can tell where the budget went. It's just bummed down by mediocre LeBron acting and a little too much flexing and plugging.6/10, have a laugh.PS. I got very confused thinking whether this is a reboot or a sequel because of the logic and mentions of this movie. Throughout the movie, it felt more like a reboot than a sequel since the first movie the world of the Looney Tunes lived underneath a golf course, and in this movie, they live in a self-aware computer simulation designed as an algorithm which made it feel like a reboot. But when we meet the Looney Tunes characters they mention the most obvious things in the first movie, like Bugs and Lola mentioning that they've done a basketball tournament before and all of the other Toons remembering Michael Jordan and Sylvester bringing Michael Jordan but instead brought Michael B. Jordan for an unnecessary cameo. Which makes my mind hurt like thunder: is it a reboot or a sequel?I believe Warner Bros. Relied on nostalgia too much in this movie, there are cameos and references to their movies but they don't do it right, they even made cameos of characters they don't even own like Rick and Morty, I think. I don't know how many things they own but they relied on it too much and don't have enough time to improve the story.The good parts in this movie are the setups and payoffs in it but some don't make any logical sense. The plot is good with the stakes, the goals, but some of the urgency doesn't make any logical sense as it was established before.The character arc of LeBron was a little cliche but all the other arcs from other characters were either tossed aside or replaced that doesn't fit with its thesis and we're never established in the first place.I understand that this is Looney Tunes where everything is crazy and fun but in cinema there has to be some rules that need to be followed.

Space Jam 2: A new Legacy
2021
U
Director: Malcolm D. Lee
Starring: Lebron James, Don Cheadle, Cedric Joe, Khris Davis, Sonequa Martin - Grace, Jeff Bergman, Zendaya, Gabriel Iglesias, Eric Bauza, Candi Milo, Bob Bergen, Fred Tatasciore etc
Space Jam 2: A new legacy is about a rogue artificial intelligence who kidnaps the son of the famed basketball player Lebron James. Who then has to work with Bugs Bunny and the rest of the looney tunes to win a basketball game in order to get his son back. I absolutely hated this film with a passion, and it was nothing more than an embarrassing cash grab from Warner brothers.My first of the few positives would be the nostalgia, the fun opening scene. The basketball elements and decent character background. The film did manage to achieve brief moments of nostalgia for me. Whether it was the basketball scenes reminiscent of the original, the soundtrack or just seeing the looney tunes back in action, it did manage to have some nostalgic moments that entertained me. I also thought the opening scene was fun and provided some decent character background. The film worked at its best when it focused on the characters and the basketball without all of the other bells and whistles. It was nice to get some background into LeBron's character and how he interacted with his basketball coach as a kid, it set up what he would be like with his own son in the present well.Now for my first few negatives. The set up was very generic, as well as the villain. The script and dialogue were terrible, as well as the performances and warner brothers using the film as promotion. The set up was so incredibly basic and predictable. Having the worn trope of having a son who doesn't feel accepted by his father for not wanting to do the same thing as him has been used so many times beforehand and didn't kick the film off in a good way at all. The villain was also incredibly generic. Think of the most simple motivations and reasoning behind a character's actions and that's what you had here, not even the charms of Don Cheadle could stop the poor writing behind this. The script and dialogue were also unfortunately very bad. It was forced, corny and never felt realistic. The dialogue was awkwardly executed, and you could tell even the actors were struggling to deliver the lines well, the script was simple and poorly constructed, it felt like no effort was put into making it even serviceable and it really effected the film. I do also have to say the performances were not very good. LeBron James seems like a likeable person, but his performance was terrible here. He delivered his lines in a forced and awkward manner and it all felt clunky and robotic, with no chemistry with the rest of the cast. I also thought this was just promotion for Warner Brothers. This didn't really feel like a space jam film. It felt like egotistical and desperate promotion of Warner Brothers IP. With no effort to even cover it up. Going as far as having some scenes within the studios really shows where the studio had there priorities with this film.My final few positives would be the animation, the voice cast and character designs, as well as the fun scenes with the looney tunes. I thought the animation here for the looney tunes was excellent, due to improved CGI and just more attention to detail the designs of Bugs bunny and co were drastically improved and it was interesting to see them so well designed. I also thought the cinematography here was great. It was largely used as a distraction, but the film bounced off the screen with its fun and creative worlds and futuristic visuals that were a visual delight. I also thought the voice cast was excellent, it was great to hear all of the original cast return in there glory, with a great new addition with Zendaya who bought Lola Bunny to life in a much better representation of her character then the original. I also thought the character designs for the looney tunes opposing teams were fun. Combining famous basketball players with different animals was a fun idea, they looked great and posed a good threat to the main plot point and the team. Finally, there was also a lot of fun scenes with recruiting the looney tunes. Despite Warner Brothers using the film as promotion, the scenes involving the looney tunes being trapped in different brands were admittedly very entertaining to watch and some of the best parts of the film.My next few negatives would be corny tone and humour. The rushed pacing, as well as the repetitive conflict and odd character decisions. This film rushed over so many things, any form of development or important scene introduced was just rushed over, never giving the audience time for any of it to connect or sink in, so therefore I just didn't care about the characters, I also thought the humour was terrible, I understand it's a family film. But the humour was incredibly forced, awkward and just fell flat. It was incredibly corny and was just trying too hard to be cool or funny and it just came across as cringy. I also thought the conflict here was extremely repetitive, having the son not feel accepted by Lebron was fine and it was clear his passion wasn't in basketball. But when the same lines and repetitive reasoning for the conflict was used so often without any form of development or just more to it, it just stayed in the same place and therefore it got tedious and repetitive. Plus, the son made some very questionable character decisions, the film made it come across like he hated his dad, without enough development between there relationship, so the son actually came across as naïve and extremely unlikeable, with illogical and harsh decisions throughout that made me even more disconnected to the relationships.My final few negatives would be the slow pacing in the second half, the lack of stakes or development to the plot. The awful 3D design of the looney tunes. And the messy final act. The film was easily thirty minutes too long, with a messy and clunky final act that dragged on for too long. The final basketball match was forty minutes long that's almost half the movie, and it didn't fly by it dragged along almost to the point of it being unwatchable. I also thought there was a complete lack of development or stakes to the plot. I never once considered the villain to be a threat or thought that there was a slight chance of the team actually losing, it was just predictably and simply laid out. With no development to the characters or further explanation into the villain. Finally, I thought the 3D designs for the looney tunes were terrible, I seriously don't understand why the creative team behind the film decided having 3D designs instead of 2D would work in the final act, because it didn't. Everyone looked poorly made and the designs were frankly off-putting and worked better with the original 2D designs. This didn't need to be changed and was a poorly executed creative decision.Overall, Space Jam 2 is mildly entertaining in parts, and it was nice to see the looney tunes back. And will probably be mostly entertaining for young kids. But it was an embarrassing cash grab from Warner Brothers. It was lazy, forced and completely cringy. Another failed sequel to a classic that should have never been made. Warner Brothers, there is a difference between trying and trying too hard and this fell completely flat.Overall rating 27/100.

reviews.review_title: Honestly Better Than I Expected. But Yeah, Obviously Terrible.
reviews.content: The Good: Maybe it was my lack of expectations, but SP2 had some surprisingly charming moments. The entire sequence with the Looney Tunes invading other WB properties was...actually pretty fun. Lebron James was decent as an actor (really no worse than MJ, stop pretending he was good, people). And, I have to admit...the shot of all these random WB characters all together on screen was emotionally satisfying, I cannot lie.The Bad: Too bad that this movie often feels more like a shareholder's presentation and less like...a movie. I honestly felt this entire exercise was (aside from $$) a thinly veiled attempt to show off how much IP Warner Bros. Owns. There's no reason Game of Thrones or King Kong should have so much of a role in this "Looney Tunes" movie.Not to mention the garish visuals by the end of SP2; bursting at the seams with reds and blues, loud noises, and complete nonsense. I assure you I am not 67 years old. I am a young adult, and even I got a headache from parts of this movie. It is not very visually pleasing.And, for God's sake, who told Don Cheadle this role was for him? He's so miscast as the snappy, aggrieved algorithm (creatively named, Al G. Rithim) character who is a poor stand in for the original film's Monstars. Even the conceit is needlessly complicated and stupid: he's trying to...get revenge on James for calling him boring by...wiping the Looney Tunes off the WB server? What?Speaking of the Looney Tunes, while again, there were some fun moments and it's nice to see them, in effect they feel less essential to this movie than they should. Really, WB could have made a version of this movie with Harry Potter or DC characters, right? They feel almost in this movie by accident.The Ugly: Remember back in 2012, when The Avengers came out and we movie nerds were excited to see the first genuine big budget crossover movie? Well, like many things, it took a few years to recognize how corporate Hollywood would drive the novelty into the ground. A New Legacy is that ground.

I'll just start it off here. It's not perfect. As a kid, I didn't really watch the original Space Jam but loved Looney Tunes. I just wasn't into the whole sports theme. I remember certain parts of the original, such as Micheal interacting with the Looney Tunes characters, and when I heard a film with some 2D animation was coming to cinemas, I was hyped. I love 2D animation and I don't understand why it doesn't do well in terms of the box office.I didn't go into this film expecting much and... I got exactly what I expected. It was a fun filled experience but I felt bored? I'm unsure how to describe it. The 3D models look off at times and the acting was mediocre at best (I could not take the villain seriously). I also didn't laugh much at all which is unusual as I still find myself laughing at Looney Tunes to this day.The cameos though were really fun and I loved seeing the Tune World come to life. At the end of the day though, this is a kids movie. I'm not the correct target audience for this film. And you know exactly what I would have though of this as a kid? It's ok. Nothing more. I would have went off to watch the original cartoons afterwards. It's pretty unmemorable and I can't even remember the kids name off the top of my head, considering I just watched it yesterday.It's a good movie and a fun ride, but probably one you'll only watch once unless you absolutely love Looney Tunes, 3D animation and basketball.

Space Jam: A New Legacy is a hot mess. Its story is an excessive cluster of ideas. The concept of an NBA superstar joining forces with the Looney Tunes is already bizarre, but A New Legacy adds elaborate computer elements and a father/son conflict. These devices are individually fine, but A New Legacy lacks focus which undermines emotional investment. It's difficult to care when scenes feel rushed and plotlines are forgotten for extended periods of time. Plus, a cast centered around athletes and pedestrian child actors only exasperates the script's deficiencies. Ultimately, this movie fails to mask its commercial intent.Meanwhile, A New Legacy has mediocre filmmaking. The camerawork lacks energy despite its cartoonish content, and the visuals are cluttered with effects and merchandising. The editing pace is chaotic, rushing through plot points but milking pointless comedy scenes. The music is occasionally helpful but mostly trivial. Lastly, the production is crowded and overdesigned. The only positives here are the exaggerated sound design and the diverse effects. However, those strengths are limited by insufficient creativity and restraint. In the end, Space Jam: A New Legacy doesn't do much well and is more of an advertisement than entertainment.Writing: 2/10
Direction: 3/10
Cinematography: 4/10
Acting: 2/10
Editing: 3/10
Sound: 6/10
Score/Soundtrack: 5/10
Production Design: 2/10
Casting: 3/10
Effects: 6/10Overall Score: 3.6/10.

reviews.review_title: Not As Looney As The First Film
reviews.content: Space Jam: A New Legacy is weaker than the first film, but it's still decent. It does have problems with a predictable story, pacing that feels way too long and the fact it would rely more onto LeBron James. But it can also have some fun moments with fantastic mix of visuals and 2D animation, impressive basketball powers and some likable charm from Looney Tunes and other Warner Bros properties. Of course, I could recommend this for those that grew up with Looney Tunes. But just like the first film, I would mostly recommend this if you're a basketball fan. The movie could use better ways with the writing, but at least it was decent after years from the first Space Jam. And at least it's better than the Tom and Jerry movie that came out earlier this year.

reviews.review_title: Solid children's movie, funny and lots of nostalgia.
reviews.content: This movie was exactly what I expected it to be. People who were expecting an Oscar award winning acting performance from Lebron are very delusional. Please do not forget that this is a movie made specifically for children with an NBA player as it's main protagonist. With the low expectations I had for Lebron's acting skills, he surpassed my expectations. But this movie wasn't just about Lebron, the Looney Tunes absolutely delivered a great performance. They were so good, the amount of nostalgia and comedy they brought was incredible. On top of that, there was a ton of other nostalgia aside from the looney tunes which I won't spoilt but it was so cool how Warner Bros brought it all together. The CGI and visuals of the movie were incredible and anyone saying otherwise clearly doesn't know a thing about good CGI. The main thing that I think stands out most about this space jam was how much I laughed. It wasn't a masterpiece but what children's movie is a masterpiece? I can't think of any. I liked it and my son liked it too. Better than the original.

This movie was ok, people just are negative no matter what today, our world is lost. It's entertainment, not a serious movie, take it as it is. Lebron was asked to do this movie, don't blame him. This is why I hate people, judgmental idiots.

Okay, the first space jam is not high quality, but it is fun. This one was so predictable and painful and the pop culture references DID NOT save it. Honestly, only watched it for the rick and morty reference and i only watched the whole thing because i kept thinking, it cant be this bad right?This movie is truly painful and lacking in a original story and jokes. Id say it ruined looney tunes, but nothing can do that for me. Skip this one itll save your sanity for a bit longer. Also, hopefully Don Cheadle, the nba stars, and all the other prime time actor didnt read the full script before agree to this monstrosity. Warner brothers really just trying to advertise themselves heavily. Its too late buds, you will never catch up to Disney, not even with Lebron.

reviews.review_title: Haters just want to hate. This movie is decent.
reviews.content: First off, like many others, I loved the original Space Jam - but everyone needs to take off their nostalgia blinders. Michael Jordan was a TERRIBLE actor. So for those giving this movie a hard time because Lebron isn't a professional actor need to get off their high horse. This movie is fun and has lots of personality.The negative reviews for this movie are stemming from the same nostalgia that makes original Star Wars fans so cynical about the new movies.This movie was entertaining and worth watching. Stop comparing it to the OG Space Jam that you watched as a KID and remember this movie, like that one, is for kids - not for jaded adults.

The negative reviews seem to be a bias against LeBron and not an accurate reflection of the movie. The movie is fun, exciting, joyful, heartfelt. It was a reminder of how fun Looney Tunes used to be. I hope we can get some positive reviews so the movie gets the recognition it deserves.

reviews.review_title: How do they let movies like this get made???
reviews.content: I'm not a fan of Lebron at all. I think he's a cry baby traitor. He is though usually a funny entertaining person. He was far from anything funny in this movie. If your gonna make a sequel to an original movie and make it similar to it. At least copy the good parts of the original. All the cameos in this one were terrible. They barely show the basketball players. They didn't have any funny random people like bill Murray. Then of course there's the problem with fhd story or lack of story. Just not sure how they let a movie like this even made. They're to worried about offending anyone they forgot to make s funny clever movie. I couldn't believe it was 2 hours long and didn't have anything interesting to offer. Please stop making movies like this if your not gonna have a good script.
I haven't cried this much from a movie in a long time, i don't understand all of these bad reviews... LeBron Haters !!

Its baffling how the movie realizes that this whole thing is a bad idea yet it's still pursues it and usually there's always one little good thing in every bad movie but in here there's none. This thing doesn't even sound like a movie. Its more like a 2 hour long commercials with a famous athlete acting halfheartedly.

reviews.review_title: Glad it was on HBO Max. Had good laughs at how bad it was
reviews.content: The movie was such a big ego feed to "King James," who was by far the worst the worse actor and character in the movie. Young kids may enjoy the movie for what it is, but the rest of us will either hate it or love it for how bad it is. I have lost a lot of respect for LeBron due to his attitude when things don't go his way. I can't wait to see how he reacts when questioned about this movie's reviews.

reviews.review_title: It's literally meant for kids and ppl who know about bad
reviews.content: Literally y'all clowns dropping bad reviews cuz you have to understand basketball and that's literally the point of the movie. Another thing it's meant for kids not you 50 yr old ppl... 🤣
Can't find the words...... Just why make this..... Its on the egde of being embarrassing...

reviews.review_title: Far from reach of the first movie
reviews.content: I finally saw the movie and it was dissapointment.Michael had a screen presence. Lebron Doesn't.Michael clearly had fun there, Lebron looks uinfit in it.To be fair, both athletes can't act, but Michael simply looked better and cartoons seemed more inline with their usual selves in the first movie.The best part is a cameo by Rick and Morty. That's why I added another star.

reviews.review_title: It's not a masterpiece but it's not a 1...
reviews.content: I saw the OG Space Jam maybe once or twice as a kid, so I wasn't as distraught over the idea of a remake as some people seem to be. My expectations were not that high. I was pleasantly surprised.It definitely starts off slow, but picks up eventually. I started off on my phone (watched at home) but actually watched the last 2/3 of it. The animation is worth paying attention to, if nothing else, and the crossovers and stuff are neat to catch.The 1 star reviews are unwarranted. James's acting is really not that bad. There are a few scenes where you can really tell it's not his day job, but I've seen other movies, with "professional actors" who did worse and nobody is ripping them a new one in the reviews.It is enjoyable. Appreciate the animation and the humor (there are indeed a few chuckles), and remember the fact that really, this is a PG movie and the target audience is like 8-13 year olds. You just will not get the depth and intricacies of plot that you would expect from a Scorsese, Spielberg, or Kubrick. I mean. Come on.It is a kid's movie, folks. For kids today to relate to and understand.This is a movie for children to enjoy. Not 26-35 year olds trying to relive their youth.If you want to see the original Space Jam so badly, rewind your VHS tapes and watch the original Space Jam.

reviews.review_title: Awful movie. But sort of fun to watch
reviews.content: God, this movie was TERRIBLE. But, I actually had a lot of fun with it just because of how clearly it was a cash grab. It was sort of self aware, and was funny enough because of that. Don't watch it if you can. But if you have to, don't dread it.

reviews.review_title: Summer movie for kids in the time of Covid
reviews.content: I took my son to see this yesterday to bust up some of the cabin fever. I didn't expect a lot, so I wasn't surprised.It's not a bad movie, it's just another movie right now. If you have $50 and 2 hours to spend, go see it. Or Mortal Combat. Or Black Widow.Guys, we live in a time when King Kong vs Godzilla is not only raking in money, but thumbs-up from critics and fans.If you go see a movie or go through a drive-thru at a fast food place right now, let's be honest...you're an adult and you know what you're putting yourself through.The only disappointments were the voice actor for Foghorn Leghorn and me finding out later that that wasn't Angela Bassett (one of my movie crushes).
Just another money grab/forced diversity. Another unnecessary remake nobody called for. Nobody will remember this movie a year from now.

Not a hater but it's crystal clear that he is not MJ and is quite questionable he deserved leading this second part of such an epic milestone, Besides,although his family values are on top of the table, his lack of charisma leaves a deep void. My kid had a good time anyway and that's been worth it.
Big chungus so funny. Make me laugh very much. Recommend watch. That is all folk. Do you get it? Like end of movie. Peace out.

reviews.review_title: A couple good jokes and references.
reviews.content: This movie is extremely simple, as excepted. It stars a bad actor that comes in and does not give a convincing performance. The set up is convoluted and not planned out well. The best parts of this movie come from it's sometimes clever jokes and references. It's worth a watch if you have young kids or love basketball.

The acting was horrible, the lines were horrible, the filming was horrible, the storyline was horrible. Even when it was just animations, the acting was still so bad. I enjoyed writing this more than the movie.Sorry Bron.
This is a kids movie. If you're a grown adult take your kids to see this.

reviews.review_title: It's like a really long commercial with bad acting
reviews.content: Obviously the acting is bad. But it's like the only purpose if this movie is to sell us stuff. Just not very entertaining at all. So disappointing!!

Yes LeBron is a terrible actor, but if you look past that the writing and jokes of the looney tunes were so funny, and I though the movie was very cute. I went in with low expectations and I was pleasantly surprised.

reviews.review_title: A Little basic but still fun
reviews.content: You know I get that the original "Space Jam" is nostalgic but it's far from a good film. If that affects your views on this film that's a little crazy to me. Having said that I can not whole heartedly call this film good, but it's fun. "Space Jam: A New Legacy" has good effects and a fun premise but despite LeBron James' best efforts it falls flat. This movie understands the Looney Tunes a little better than the original film (though not as well as Back in Action) and features a good character arc for Bugs Bunny of all. However the awkward delivery and shameless IP placements do nothing to enhance the viewing experience. Despite this we must all remember this movie is for children, and it's a fun ride that will be enjoyable for them. I don't recommend this as a Cinematic classic, but I'll gladly recommend it as a good time!
Movie is fantastic funny,hilarious and otherwise great movie.
Great movie for kids better than the previous space jam love it lebron james did very well for his first movie.

Is it time to wake up already? I was looking forward to this movie and was ready to overlook below average acting. Terrible plot development + bad acting = slow and boring movie. We shut it off a little past half way and took a big step up to an exciting show and watched the Waltons. Seriously, this felt like a Lebron biography with an attempt to be funny by putting cartoon characters in. Much anticipation, big letdown.
This was actually really good! Music was fire! LeBron James was amazing and the Goon Squad was great! Still, don't know why this movie got bad reviews! But, I like this movie good! 10/10 - Kohan64.

reviews.review_title: This should have been called King Labron
reviews.content: What a terrible adaptation. This should have just been 2 hours of people standing around talking "the horrible actor" Labron how great he is... ohh wait it was. King Labron we look forward to no sequels.

To all the LeBron haters giving this a 1 star review- show me where LeBron hurt you. I knew this would happen. All the low ratings were predictable even before the movie's release. I guarantee most of the low ratings are from Right Wing Trump supporters who hate LeBron due to his political views. The movies wasnt that bad, and kids will like it.
One of the worst movies I've ever seen. I stopped watching after 40 minutes it was almost unbearable to watch.
Obviously LeBron is not an actor so the movie is a little cheesy. Don't listen to all the other reviews on here hating just because its LeBron. It was overall a good, entertaining movie.

reviews.review_title: Makes the original Space Jam look like Casablanca
reviews.content: I'm a huge basketball fan and movie buff, so I went into this movie with a big opened mind, (I mean it's Looney Tunes of course) but this movie has absolutely no interesting storyline. I made the mistake of showing the first one to my kids, so their expectations were probably high for this one, and they were nearly falling asleep. I do not recommend wasting your time on this movie.

Somewhere deep in here, there's a nice message about being yourself and doing things your own way, but it's a shame that it's buried so far under endless layers of reference humour and pointless (sometimes insane) character cameos. Not to mention the over the top butt kissing towards Lebron.The Clockwork Orange one felt particularly inappropriate...

reviews.review_title: Hahahaha so many Warner IP placements inside
reviews.content: Just shut your brain and enjoy the movie. Keep comparing with classic you be more dissapointed. Watch it for what it is that is to have family fun time. Great movie but not worthwhile seeking the second viewing. Thank you king LBJ for stepping in MJ shoes.

Don't waste your money or time! Terrible acting, nothing entertaining at all throughout the whole movie. James is only good at acting like he's hurt on the court. Hollywood has went down hill catering to activists instead of the audience. Shame.

reviews.review_title: Mocking snyder verse ?? i could not connect to the movie after that
reviews.content: WB you want to make money it's snyder verse not server verse hope they learn the lesson soon :) wanna make big money #Snyder_verse this movie is fun by parts...2 hours too long this time know which movie to trim and which not to.

reviews.review_title: Don't listen to the critics this is a fun movie
reviews.content: The Good- This is a great return for the Looney Tunes characters. There are certain jokes and quirks that absolutely work in here and there isn't really any character here that falls flat. Everything about the Looney Tunes characters is amazing and I have missed seeing these characters on the big screen. The animation is great as always and the CGI works when it's needed to. The actual basketball match is great when these characters are going completely bonkers it is so much fun to watch. I smiled and laughed throughout the whole film which is all I was really looking to get out of this film. Don Cheadle was a lot of fun in this role as well.The Bad- I didn't think LeBron James was that good in this role his acting just felt very fake or forced especially in the emotionally heavy moments. I wish that it wasn't completely focused on LeBron and more on the Looney Tunes much like the original.Overall Thoughts- Space Jam: A New Legacy is a fun movie, it's not a perfect film but neither is the original. It brought the Looney Tunes characters back on the big screen and did them justice, although I'd have loved to of seen them to be more of the main focus of the story. I miss these types of movies and this brings back a lot of nostalgia. Overall I'm going to give "Space Jam: A New Legacy" a 7/10.

reviews.review_title: Great movie for the family! Don't mind the haters 🙄
reviews.content: I'm a fan of MJ and the original Space Jam, but I can honestly say that Space Jam 2 is better than the first one. The kids enjoyed the movie and that's what matters the most. The graphics were insane and the acting wasn't bad like most people claim. The movie lived up to the hype.(Don't make this about MJ vs Lebron. Don't use the reviews to hate on Lebron. You guys are pathetic!)

I was born in '91 so I know a thing or two about the original. It was great as a kid, but I don't care to watch it as an adult. This sequel though was made for adults to enjoy just as much as kids! It has an original story that pokes fun at itself and acknowledges how ridiculous the whole concept even is. It is a celebration of all things Warner Bros. And was an absolute blast from beginning to end! I'm looking forward to the next one in another 20 years!

The plot was far more convoluted than the Monstars from the original. It was still cool seeing the Looney Tunes back but it was sadly a disappointment and I won't be watching again in a hurry.

LeBum needs to move on and accept that he's an overrated guy who the league babies to make him feel better. Absolute dog water film and player.

reviews.review_title: Ignore the Reviews and make up your own mind
reviews.content: Saw this today, personally I don't think it's as bad as some of the reviews make out. It has a lot of WB cameos yes, but where is the harm in that? It's been done in a funny way and why not? Acting isn't as bad as others have made out. It's a little cheesy, but it's also funny. If you liked the first Space Jam you'll probably enjoy it. It's definitely not the worst kids film I've seen. It's also a good story about being yourself.
My 2.5 year old watched it and she loved it... she wasn't feeling the greatest either. My man and I both thought it was good. <3A.

reviews.review_title: Don't listen to these Karen's! The movie was good!
reviews.content: It was really good. Obviously not as good as the first one but it was still Good! You people are seriously so hard to please these days it's so ridiculous!!! I loved it, it was funny and had really shocking and funny cameos that I didn't expect! I suggest this movie if you're not a little ***** that's hard to please. 😊

reviews.review_title: Writing this from the perspective of a Lakers fan,,, but cmon now
reviews.content: Look, i will admit I am a Lakers fan and therefore I support LeBron, but regardless, I liked this movie as a basketball fan. I will add the disclaimer that I haven't seen the original Space Jam with MJ, but surely after this movie I enjoyed the hell out of it.If you go into this movie expecting a great story... thats on you, you're straight up stupid because this is Space Jam. Enjoy the movie for what it is. It has great elements for kids & adults to enjoy. All these other reviews don't have the brain power to realize that. They didn't expect Space Jam to be Space Jam.I'ma leave you with this... this movie made me laugh and cry... and it had nothing to do with me being a LeBron fan. Don't come into this movie with expectations of being Inception, but rather a run movie that you will enjoy.

reviews.review_title: Not as Atrocious as the Ratings And Responses, But It's Strangely Fun!
reviews.content: A sequel to Space Jam?, who asked for this?, well it's here so I dunno what to say other then Space Jam is actually kind of a bad movie, it's overrated unfunny strange junk that I do not get, but with this new sequel, maybe it could be better or worse?, well I saw it today and... wow I was pleasantly surprised by it, like it was actually kind of weirdly entertaining but not exactly solid good.The comedy is much MUCH better then the first movie, it has the right tone and right kind of jokes to support the feature, I did laugh more then once which is more then what Space Jam did, the animation in 2D is quite spot on with the Looney Tunes and I love the Looney Tunes design, it's quite wonderful and rather smooth, along with strong movements and big expressions along with extraordinary different worlds Bugs and LeBron go to, the 3D animation is pretty good as well as looks good enough to be decent and stylish, the Looney Tunes themselves are just themselves but with tones of personality and laughs which is more then enough for me to like 'em, even Lola is better, LeBron himself is kinda charming and the villains are fun too, the voice both from the voice actors and the physical actors are great!, the story and sequences are more fun and entertaining then the first film, along with a pretty dope soundtrack.However with all that said, a few things stop this from being great, as funny as it is, sometimes it does get cringey like the use of dabbing and a strange rap by Porky, which really makes this really insufferable at times.., which doesn't help, also the movie is quite predictable and very dull, but thanks to the execution it did work for the most part, also the first few minutes with James' family is boring and unspecial but not as boring and Jordan's in the first movie, speaking of, James is good in the movie but can be awkward in his deliveries but is mostly pretty good, sometimes the 3D on the Tunes can be cheaply odd but that's only the real complaint I have with the visuals.So yeah..., this movie was.., surprisingly passable, I liked it more then I disliked it, it's a visual treat with the animation and special effects, it's funny and super clever at times, the Tunes are fun along with great acting and a surprisingly easy to listen to music, but it's still not quite perfect since it's dull, a bit boring at the beginning and it can get frustratingly annoying fast along with James being too awkward, but it's a perfectly weird fun time that I definitely had, also there are camos that are both unexpected but also super awesome too, like I was kinda surprised..., so yeah, go watch it, I know it's been slammed (pun intended) but it's really not awful it's actually much better then the first movie in my (possibly unpopular) opinion, kids will enjoy it but they may need explaining of the references and camos since some of them aren't for kids.., you'll what I mean when you say it, it's not the best Looney Tunes movie, Back in Action is the best one but this is a close second, but waaaay better then the last Warner Animation Group live action movie with a certain cat and mouse...I'm happy to give Space Jam: A New Legacy a 6/10.
This could be the worst big budget movie ever made. Simply awful.

reviews.review_title: This movie is for Kids...not Adults
reviews.content: The problem with reviews is movies for kids is that they're done by adults. If kids rated our movies we wouldn't want to see them. This movie is not for the adults. It's for kids. You have to watch this from the perspective of an 11 year old and see how you would have liked it. My kids loved it and thought it was wonderful. It's heartwarming, funny and actually has amazing special effects. There are also good family values with themes of family, fatherhood and the important of being yourself. Will it win an Oscar? No, definitely not. But my kids laughed and smiled and ignored their tablets while it was on. It gave us great family time as we enjoyed it together.

The sequel to the 90's classic, is a train wreck of a movie with next to no emotion, despite that it is nice to see the looney toons back in action, but that doesn't make up for the poorly written script and complete rehash from the original. They even take the piss with the concept that this isn't the first time the looney toons have to assemble a team and play with one of the best in the sport. Obviously Lebron is an amazing player in his sport, but with the same situationen with Michael back in the day, acting is not their area of expertise, but at least the original had the 90's charm.Of course the surroundings and CGI look amazing, and I personally liked the realistic look of the looney toons, whom was nice to see back in action after being in the background for so many years, it was a nice nostalgia trip. I honestly think that's more of a selling point for both the older and younger audience, than the actual plot. The way they incorporate the different universes and properties of Warner Bros. Worked quite nicely, but it feels a bit like an add for every other property that they own. I focused more on the cameos in the background, than I did on the actual movie. The movie is also way too long and could easily have been shortened down to a comfortable runtime.In the end the movie has next to no emotion and the "actors" are straight up awful. What made the 1996 such a cult classic was the way it didn't take itself too serious and how the cheesiness of the 90's worked in its favor. In 2021 this just doesn't work and there is a lot of stuff you can't get away with anymore. The only positive is the return of the looney toons, whom will always have their charm.4/10.

In short, Space Jam 2, is what it was expected. A modern, colorful, chaotic kids' movie following the legendary vibe of Michael Jordan saving the Loony Tunes by playing basketball to an unforgettable soundtrack. You have everything, from nice graphics, kids oriented jokes, a modernized story using the streaming and social media universe instead of the old hole on the golf court and the hint for the parents in the cinema, that big data algorithms making entertainment might not be the preferred future. Next to a lot of marketing for the Warner Bros movieverse, you recognize that it was really tried to catch the never aging charm of Bugs Bunny and co within a faster changing world. You even see in the senseless story, that today's kids are expected to have less attention span, hence everything must be in a hectic and fast pace.But well, it will entertain kids and it will earn its cost. What it can't be called is a worthy sequel. The original is timeless as it caught the perfect timing. Michael Jordan was on basketball cards in every kids' room from wherever to even Vienna and Chicago Bulls were heroes without having seen one game. Cartoons were on the edge of dying out but still accepted in cinemas, and with "Believe I can fly" we have a song that is still played on parties today. Now we have a lead actor that only a few will know around the world (not talking about US), the hype is over, we have other major sports and trademarks to follow and with all the cameos and references, there is not one charming connection to the original, despite disappointing comments. In summary, a nice kids movie but a poor tribute to the legend of Space Jam.

reviews.review_title: Ignore these reviews, this movie is awesome
reviews.content: It's fun. Do people know how to have fun? Not every movie has to be perfect. This is finally a nice distraction from 2020. The Looney Tunes and the live action cast learn great messages on working together and self acceptance. The characters had so many great lines and jokes, especially Daffy. This basketball game was a treat to watch. Love the references to other WB characters and the soundtrack also!
Horrible film, nothing like the original. Lebrons role was very bad and I would recommend you just wait until you can rent it at home.Very disappointed, and I'm a lebron fan 😪

This is possibly the worst film I have ever seen. The most damning thing is that I was just bored, I don't even have the energy to hate it. It was a total mess, all over the place with no real structure. The attempts to reference the Warner Bros back catalog were lame at best, and the handful of decent ones were so old none of the target audience would get them. Truly awful, cringeworthy mess.
The visuals are good. Nothing else is good in this movie. I expected nothing and still felt angry afterwards. Don't watch this movie if you enjoyed the original!

reviews.review_title: I don't even care what people are saying about this movie this is by far The Best Live Action Movie of 2021

I really love this movie.

Lebron James is trying to ruin everything. Spare yourself from this travesty and watch the original space
Jam that actually has class and style. This movie made me want to never watch WB movies ever again.

reviews.review_title: Not as bad as people think
reviews.content: If you go in watching this movie for what it is.... And not for what your childhood nostalgia wants this to be, then it's absolutely decent.Nothing amazing. Nothing completely origins. But a fun spin on a family movie updated to a modern time.I'll not be watching this many times over. But it holds up for what it claimed to be.

The acting and plot were sub par but I figured this would be the case going in. Lebron's acting was so bad I found it funny and I think that that is part of the charm of space jam. While some people disagree with the use of CGI instead of traditional animation I actually thought that it was quite good. The colors really popped and some of the animation really blew me away such as the Wet-Fire goon. What I'm most disappointed with is the lack of references or cameos of other Warner Brother properties. Most of the time characters from other properties were just standing on the sideline and while it was fun to pick them out of the crowd I really wish they had done more with it. I think the Lego movie did an excellent job with this and I was hoping for more something like that. Overall, I think kids would really enjoy this movie and as for me I'm glad I watched it. However, I don't see myself ever giving this movie a rewatch and sadly my nostalgia for the original space jam combined with the other problems I mentioned make me a little upset with this film.
I cant believe how wrong they got this. So poor. Im ashamed of War Machine.

Don't judge this movie by all the reviews.Y'all are comparing it too closely to the original when we should just be comparing it to other kids movies nowadays.And honestly it was a little too much. reviews.content: This movie is pretty lame the story is unimaginative & basic but the thing that really makes this movie bad was all the references like that Rick & Morty scene was painfully cringing also really appropriate to put them in movie for babies & a bunch of characters made adults like the groods & pennywise I mean get you put then in to get money out of people but you could at least make it PG-13 at least that appropriate & I know cussing in the movie but are you gonna watch a movie for the cussing, this movie lame it's just a big advertisement & I will not ever again & hopefully Warner bros will take the hint that looney tunes don't work on a movie platform judging on how much the movie is being bashed.

reviews.review_title: The only movie I regret watching

The whole movie is either a.) telling us how great Lebron is or b.) showing how much intellectual property Warner Brothers owns. Good for kids under 5 because of the bright colors, which is the only reason I gave it 4/10. Somehow the first Space Jam from over 20 years ago has better graphics...I truly don't understand. It's all one giant advertisement with 0 originality or fun. I was already wary of LBJ due to his politics and conceited attitude, somehow I came away from this two-hour product placement having an even lower opinion of him than before.

LeBron James is trying to get his son Dom to get into basketball, but Dom is much more interested in gaming, to the point where he creates his own video game. When they go on a trip to the Warner Bros. Studio, they get into an argument and they find themselves in an evil computer A. I. known as Al-G Rhythm. Al-G forces LeBron into a basketball game with his own son and sends him to Tune World. There, he meets Bugs Bunny who misses his friends after they went to different worlds. Bugs agrees to help LeBron get his son back and the two gather the gang for the game.I have been waiting for this film for a long time. I am a huge fan of Looney Tunes and I have always wanted to see them on the big screen ever since I was a kid. For that, this was one of my more anticipated movies of the year just for its source material. It was the one movie that I told myself that I was going to watch in theaters no matter what news or reviews came about. All that said, the first film is not all that special to me, but it was a nice crossover between basketball and Looney Tunes. This sequel makes for a much bigger crossover. Is it a slam dunk, or does this big budget juggernaut miss the goal?Space Jam: A New Legacy is a mixed bag. The story is where the film falls apart the most. There are too many cooks in this kitchen. It tries to be about basketball, LeBron's legacy, Warner Bros' film catalogue, the big game inside Dom's video game, the Looney Tunes and the fractured relationship between LeBron and his son. There is so much happening in this film at such a fast pace, that it is hard to make out what is happening a lot of the time. It is over reliant on references and some of them are pretty bad. Did we really need an Austin Powers reference? Some of them are not too bad. Seeing Foghorn Leghorn ride a dragon in the GoT world was awesome and both DC worlds were great. One reminded me of the DCAU and the other was animated like a comic book. However, they come off as more of an excuse to show how many IPs WB has than to show how the Tunes got separated. The third act is when the movie finally regains focus and the game itself is quite exciting.The humor is hit and miss. There are some horribly cringeworthy scenes where they try to modernize the characters, but there are plenty of scenes that put a smile on my face. There is a scene with Roadrunner and Wile that made me crack up and almost anything Bugs did put a smile on my face aside from the one scene. When the Looney Tunes get to act like themselves, that is where this film shines. Some of the humor from LeBron and Cheadle cracked me up too. They know how ridiculous this film is and they give it their all. The best gag is one involving Michael Jordan. The emotional moments are unbelievably cheesy and sappy, but not to the extent of Tom and Jerry. There were a few scenes where I got a little sad. Seeing Bugs so deflated is just depressing for me. The ending made me even sadder. It helps that they are at least well acted and that the relationships between the characters are done decently enough to get some emotion. Yeah, I was into this film more than I should have been.As for the characters, I like the way Bugs Bunny is portrayed in this film much more than in the original Space Jam. He has so much more personality and wackiness while playing a bigger role in the story. The scene where he first meets LeBron and messes with him is one of my favorite scenes of the year so far. He is painting tunnels, he is tricking Marvin into taking his ship and he even says "this means war" at one point. He is also much tougher here than in the first Space Jam as he is the only one that sees through the villain's plan and tries to go against him. If you are not a fan of him, he also gets a couple scenes where he is the brunt of the slapstick so he is not invincible. He even gets a few emotional scenes that work such as missing his Looney friends. This is my favorite portrayal of Bugs Bunny in a Looney Tunes film so far and they nailed his character... except for the scene where he dances to a pop song that made me want to throw something at the screen. Jeff Bergman gives his best performance as Bugs. He brings this character to life any time he voices the rabbit and this film is no exception. I was kind of disappointed that Eric Bauza was not voicing him at first because I love Bauza's take on Bugs in Looney Tunes Cartoons, but Bergman killed it in this role by showing the range Bugs has in his personality. He deserves a lot more credit than he got. If there is one thing I will firmly defend about this film, it is the way Bugs was handled and voiced in this film.Unfortunately, the other Tunes are a mixed bag. The best cartoon characters in the film are Wile E. Coyote, Granny, Daffy Duck, Tweety and Taz. Wile in particular is really funny. He has no lines and yet he probably got the most laughs out of everyone. He also gets a few awesome moments that I did not expect. Granny does too as she goes up against this huge virtual basketball team. Taz has the coolest basketball play out of everyone. Daffy Duck makes for a funny coach while getting the most stylish outfit. Roadrunner actually gets a scene where he gets humiliated which is surprising because he is arguably the most invincible main LT character. A lot of the other characters are wasted though. Gossamer, Yosemite Sam and Elmer Fudd get so little to do. Gossamer does not even get a scene of him joining the squad! I am not sure if Foghorn Leghorn got to do anything in the game. Speedy could have been used a little more, especially when you take his voice actor in consideration. Sylvester gets hardly any screen time at all. Marvin does not even join the game. Even Daffy could have gotten a bit more screen time. The biggest wasted potential of all however is Lola Bunny. She is made more of an action girl than last time, but they give hardly any focus to her relationship with Bugs or improve on her personality from the first film. She is more supportive of her team at least, but I wanted to see more scenes between her in Bugs. The one good thing is that she does have a soft spot for family, but they should have done more with her character.Voice-acting wise, all of it is great from the talented voice cast. Eric Bauza voices Daffy, Foghorn, Porky, Elmer and Marvin and he crushes it. Bauza is a very talented voice actor because he can capture the voices of the characters perfectly, especially Daffy. In addition to Bugs, Bergman also voices Sam and Sylvester, but gets little to work with them. Bob Bergen is solid as Tweety. I really liked Candi Milo as the sassy Granny here. I also liked Gabriel Iglesias as Speedy and I would not mind seeing him voice the character some more. Then there is Zendaya as Lola Bunny. She is fine in the role, but I prefer Kath Soucie's take on Lola. Heck, I would have loved to have seen Kristen Wiig come back as Lola, but Zendaya gives a sweet performance as the character that fits the friendly tone of the character. However, she did not need to be the only voice actress credited in the ads. Overall, the voice cast is fantastic and they brought these characters to life.As for the human characters, they are not bad at all. LeBron James is fine in the movie. He has more fun here than Michael Jordan did in the original. He has better chemistry with Bugs and he embraces the silliness of the movie. I liked his arc with his son more than I thought I would. It has a good message about letting your child be them. Don Cheadle unsurprisingly steals the show as Al-G though. He does not give a damn. He just hams it up entirely and I loved it. He made for a much better villain than Swackhammer. I did not expect Cheadle to act this hammy in the film, but his presence makes it a lot more fun. He is also charismatic and easy-going when he needs to be. The goon squad is cool on paper, but I just do not see them fitting in the world of Looney Tunes the way the Monstars did. While the team does make for a fun antagonistic team for the Tunes to go against, the players themselves seem out of place.The visuals look fantastic. Just seeing 2D animation is exciting enough, but it is so fluid and energetic, that it felt like watching a Looney Tunes short. The expressions are fantastic and the slapstick works for the most part. Animated LeBron is a lot of fun and they did not waste his design at all. They put him at the brunt of slapstick and play around with his animated design the way they do with other characters. I wish the whole film was 2D. That said, even the 3D animation looks great. The Tunes look solid in their transitions for the most part, the goon squad have wicked designs and the court feels like a huge high stakes game. Again, the animation and expressions look great and there are even some funny jokes about their transitions such as Bugs' disdain for it. The basketball game itself is a ton of fun and every character from both teams gets to utilize their abilities to their advantage in the game. The soundtrack is good, but I like the first film's soundtrack better. Nothing popped out the way the first film's music did.Space Jam: A New Legacy is a tough movie for me to grade. On one hand, I had a good amount of fun in the theater and just seeing Bugs Bunny and Daffy Duck on the big screen is a dream come true for me as a fan of these characters. That being said, the movie is a freaking mess. It relies too much on references and there is too much going on in the story. I know that some reviewers have torn this film apart, but I cannot bring myself to dislike it because I enjoyed my time with it too much. That being said, it is hard to recommend this movie to pay money to see it in theaters because it has a lot of problems that cartoon to movie adaptations have along with heavy-handed crossovers. If for nothing else, I am happy that I got to see some of my favorite characters in theaters.

You know for a movie with six credited writers it's almost a miracle Space Jam 2 is as coherent as it is. I credit that to Malcolm Lee's assured direction and LeBron James' innate charisma. Although James isn't a master thespian he has screen presence, more so than Michael Jordan. The film starts with a similar framing device like the first film, where you have a quasi-autobiography involving the main character as a child. It establishes that he pushed his son to achieve and he's become something of an overachiever. He neglects his son and doesn't support his passion for video games. So the film has some emotional stakes before you get into the Looney Tune world. The Looney tune sequences are a lot of fun, and they get a lot of mileage out of the sight gags.There are some clever sight gags like Wile E. Coyote and Road runner in the Mad Max Fury Road universe, or Lola Bunny playing tournaments in the Wonder Woman universe. This film is very similar to Ready Player One, since that you have various characters interacting with various universes owned by Warner Bros. I will concede that this is Warner Bros advertising their IP, but none of this bothers me, since a lot of the gags were plot specific. Alas, not all the gags work like the Porky pig rap, or the matrix spoof, but the film doesn't linger on this for too long, and part of the reason this works for me is that the film is very self aware about what kind of film it is. So if you're a millennial like me, and you have nostalgia for the original Space Jam, you might enjoy this film since this has the same spirit as the first film. Space Jam 2 is far from masterpiece, but for what it is it's a fun family film.

The only person on earth that likes this movie is Lebron James. Horrible plot. Terrible Acting. Its basically a 2 hour long advertisement for Warner Brothers Studios. It epitomizes everything that is wrong with Hollywood today. Quick buck knowing parents will take their kids to see it. reviews.review_title: I love MJ over LeBron in NBA but SPJ2 is a Worthy Sequel
reviews.content:
I love MJ ...no doubt He's da GOAT,and Kobe,LeBron is next in line along w/Kareem,Wilt,Majic,Shaq,Bird,and so on.But I have to be honest and give a unbiased review that makes sense,'cause I'm a movie lover.LeBron might not get nominated for a Oscar but he did a great job considering its his first blockbuster Movie. reviews.review_title: Not as good as the original, but not bad
reviews.content: It's tough to review Space Jam 2 without considering who (and what) this movie is for. It's targeted for children, and nostalgic adults who love MJ's classic Space Jam movie. Space Jam 2 attempts to balance the line between the nostalgic, older generation of 90s kids with the instant gratification-seeking, fortnite-playing, younger generation. For the latter audience, the film is stimulating, constantly active, and (probably) satisfying. While SJ2 performs admirably with kids, it's misses a golden opportunity to achieve immortality alongside its prequel. Space Jam 2'a greatest downfall is it's lack of willingness (or ability) to be self-aware or nostalgic. A half-hearted shtick which employs Creed's Michael B. Jordan teases the possibility of connection to the original Space Jam film (wait that's not Air Jordan!), but any expectations of clever homage are aroused without being bed back down. MJ is not in this film. References or bits from the original film are extremely limited. Charles Barkley and Shaq don't make an appearance, though their TNT colleague Ernie Johnson plays significant minutes alongside consumer film staple, Rod Williams (Get Out). The centerpiece of the movie is, of course, the high stakes basketball game between the Tune Squad and the Goon Squad. Despite Lebron's stiff (but unexpectedly okay) acting, he plays the superhero athlete role admirably. Lebron's best moments happen physically on the court. The Looney antics of the animated players, as well as the suped-up video game elements simply add to the great entertainment. The game is just flat out fun to watch. Space Jam 2 is NOWHERE near as good as Space Jam, but it is a fun, positive movie for kids and basketball fans to enjoy.

reviews.review_title: About what you'd expect from another remake/sequel
reviews.content: I don't usually write reviews for movies I'm indifferent about, but I will say my bar was pretty low and it slightly exceeded expectations, at least compared to the Tom and Jerry movie. There were a few laughs, and the opening montage was nostalgic of the original Space Jam. And the people who said this movie was basically about showcasing LeBron's talent were right, but the original did the same for Michael Jordan. I don't expect basketball players to be phenomenal actors and neither should anyone. I did enjoy the Michael B. Jordan cameo and all the universe references which was a funny twist. Even some adult films like Mad Max and Austin Powers! Definitely didn't expect that in this movie. Some might call it pandering, but I guess I enjoy being pandered to.

reviews.review_title: It's a great movie to watch with your kids!
reviews.content: It's a kids family movie, just a kids entertainment movie. Don't listen to all the critics bad reviews, just watch it with a 2021 mind. It's not the best all-time movie, I do get all the marketing of WB in the movie, but cmon it's a WB movie so...However if your a LBJ hater and don't like him, don't see it because ur still gonna hate and that's not the purpose of the movie. LBJ is not the charismatic MJ, but I do believe he's a better actor. Movie has great effects and cgi, not the best script, but overall a good movie for your kids.
Not much else to say really. Part of my life I'll never get back.

reviews.review_title: Poor acting, poor dialogue, non-existent plot
reviews.content: JLB is a good basketball player, and he may have done a better job acting if the script had been better written. The script could have been phenomenal if they had done a better job with the plot design. But the writers, director, and producers were more focused on money-grabbing that there is no plot, and the movie was pulled into too many directions.The father-son relationship was so skewed by all of the different things the writers/producers/director wanted to do, that the underlying tension between them wasn't resolved. As for the Looney Tunes and LeBron, there is no connection between them, there is no respect shown, no give and take in their interactions.As for Don Cheadle, he did the best he could with what he was given, but his performance was lackluster because the dialogue was not well developed.
This movie is no masterpiece but it's extremely entertaining and you all salty.
This. Movie. Is. Epic. Pure epic for future generations.

reviews.review_title: Wow This Movie Sucks This Ruined A Classic Movie from 1996 Please Don't Watch This Movie Just Watch The original Instead This Movie Should Have Never Been Made.
reviews.content:
Wow This Movie Sucks
This Ruined A Classic Movie from 1996
Please Don't Watch This Movie
Just Watch The original Instead
This Movie Should Have Never Been Made.

reviews.review_title: Very fun for the whole family
reviews.content: Movie was fun and entertaining for the entire family. Fun little trip thru an adventurous world!

reviews.review_title: I read "unrealistic" in a number of reviews. Really?
reviews.content: This is a movie about the Looney tunes coming to life for God's sake! And people here are calling it unrealistic?! To be honest, I do not think there was much room to manoeuvre in terms of the plot. There was going to be a basketball game between the Looney tunes+LeBron and a set of mean characters, and I think they did the best they could with that. People are hating on this movie because they remember the Space Jam from their childhood to be much better, simply because they were 5 or 10 year olds at the time and were very easy to please. Just because you grew up, does not mean this is not a good kids' movie. I loves the original Space Jam, but I thoroughly enjoyed this as well!
Where do I begin? Lebron James... Nuff said!Why are they ruining everything? Because they can and they will, it's what they do best.Who's they?Who's Hollywood?

reviews.review_title: I'm going to keep it simple
reviews.content: My kids aren't the brightest. I know it sounds bad but they are just simple, sweet and loving children who are entertained by anything that comes onto a screen... YET they hated this movie and we didn't make it through it. We have probably watched 80 movies together. Avoid this garbage at all costs.

This was a great film, all the visual effects in the movie were amazing and they're simply awesome!I really loved the part when all the characters from others movies from Warner Bros. It's great to remember all those characters.I loved seeing the classic characters that were part of my childhood such as Scooby Doo or the Flintstones!The plot is the only thing that seem out of place. I consider this story very original and great but it could have been better.Good characters and great acting performance.In some parts, the movie has resemblance to the first one, but I loved it!!!A movie that you must see with your family this weekend. Highly recommend!!!
Great kids movie but the only thing wrong with it is Lebron acting but it kinda reminds you how bad Michael Jordan acting was in the original space jam.

This wasn't even a film, it was a 2 hour commercial for Warner Bros, and it was not very good.They're just throwing it in your face like "hey look at us."Fails to deliver in most aspects. Acting is dreadful. Direction was worse. Some decent animation but that's about it. Comedic aspects were so bad. In a theatre which was almost full, I didn't hear a single person laugh.
Absolute piece of garbage film, the direction was nauseous, the acting was minimal, and there were better effects in the dungeons and dragon's movie. Save your time and blow your brains out.
This is the type of film you bring the kids to. As someone who was 8 when original came out I watched this one with a very tough eye. I thought the cast did a splendid job. 10/10.
A great homage to its predecessor while bringing in some new aspects. Overall, a great movie.

This movie is epic and mind-breaking and ground-blowing and awesome and definitely on of the best you just have to watch this! It's amazing and clever and really jumps off the screen and blows you away on an amazing ride! I saw this movie at cinemas and it was amazing and thrilling the entire experience of watching this clever movie on that huge screen and definitely one of the best movies I've ever seen at cinemas! As well as one of the best sports movies, the best sci fi movies, the best American movies and the coolest movies of all time! I won't give away any more, you just have to watch this! IT'S HUGE FUN!!!

reviews.review_title: Good Comedy, Story Could Be Better
reviews.content: Looney Tunes is something better suited for shorts. They're only good with comedy. They can't handle long form storytelling or character development. Still, this movie is a fun way to kill 90 minutes. It's a bit better than the original Space Jam since it at least owns how crazy it is.
The movie was fun and like the referece to all WB universe... my daughter had a good time and thats enought for me for gave a 10.

reviews.review_title: 10 Starts for the Characters not the movie!!
reviews.content: The thing I loved about this movie was the characters that came to life.You have so many different cartoons in one frame and that's it.I don't hate it it's just for the kids to know how awesome our cartoon characters were!Rest the story and acting is bad.

reviews.review_title: Good family values, bad acting, ect.
reviews.content: The movie was basically a big commercial for every Warner Brothers movie franchise to the point where they sacrificed real substance. Basically a cookie cutter movie that you've already seen, but ooooo let's sell out a franchise and make a ton of money without needing much more than cgi and a couple modern day big names. Of course it's not The Space Jam you guys knew, and that's on you if you expected that level of quality. I just didn't expect it to be THAT bad. Lebron is awesome, no doubting that, but the reviews saying he can't act are spot on. It's like Michael Jordan trying baseball. We thought it was an interesting idea, but we all knew when it was time to move on....... it's time Lebron in case you were wondering. Stick to Basketball. Btw go back to Miami. ;)
Branding woke trash....just more hollywood propoganda.

When I first heard that a new Space Jam movie is coming I was excited, like super excited, because Space Jam was one of my favorites movies when I was little, and even now I'm 36 and I will watch it when it's on TV.But this movie I actually think it's a sham... It has no character, no plot, the actors try their best to make it funny but the actual plot is despicable it's just stupid! Like it's been done purely for money, and whoever came up with the plot needs to be shot in his balls! I demand a remake lol. On a serious note I'm very disappointed.

Now every says not to hate on Lebron because he plays basket ball and he doesn't do movies if he doesn't do movie then why do this is you are a bad actor now this movie is hot trash and we all know it like what's the deal with this not even about basket ball it's about some dumb dom ball and porky pig rapping?!?! Whats the deal with this don't waste your money don't waste your time watching a remake or sequel Watch the gosh dang original we didn't even ask for this movie. Its not that good in fact it's actually dog ****
Ya tricked me with the trailer and that's Turrible.
LeBron doesn't need the ego boost. He's already self proclaimed himself "the king" and this movie just show that a bunch of writers were trying to validate him. No charm. No imagination. No bueno.

reviews.review_title: It was able LeBron however I still enjoyed it
reviews.content: I do think the movie had to much focus on LeBron James. But I loved it and laughed a lot. I enjoyed how it had all the characters from other movies in Space Jam 2.

reviews.review_title: Take it for what it is
reviews.content: As a kid I watched the Bugs Bunny Road Runner show every Saturday morning. I know most of the episodes by heart. Space Jam is by no means A masterpiece; however, if you are a fan of the classic Looney Tunes cartoons, you will enjoy the Looney Tune references in this movie. It also has a lot of 'cameos' from various movies spanning the 1960's through today - off the wall cameos from old Warner Bros. Movies (not just cartoons) that see fun to spot. (Easter Eggs?).That being said, I took me, nephews, to the movies today, and my choices were Space Jam and Baby Boss. I was dreading either movie. Thankfully they picked Space Jam.I fully extended to hate this movie. If you can appreciate a movie for what it is, wait until it is released to DVD or streaming and give it a go.

reviews.review_title: DON'T WASTE YOUR TIME BETTER TO GO WITH ANOTHER MOVIE
reviews.content: It fail's in our expectations ,worst story,bad screenplay no drama nothing u will fell like you are watching toon with no logic.

reviews.review_title: Wasn't the worst- wasn't the best
reviews.content: So I gotta start by saying wtf were you all thinking WB?? Do you honestly think my 6 yr old son knows who Pennywise is? Or hell even Game of Thrones? Come on!!! That was my only beef. Otherwise it wasn't too bad. It's fun and entertaining. Would I watch again mehhhh maybe. I would watch the OG space jam before I watch this one again.
The original was 10x better. Don't waste your time or money on this one; nothing else to say!

I went in the theaters expecting this to be an alright movie. Now I can safely say Jorbald < King James.The cinematography was outstanding as well as the main cast. So much life was put into these characters through CGI and motion capture. The score was also fantastic through old themes and new.10/10 Sadly The Goat debate is finished 🤦‍♀️

reviews.review_title: A insult to a classic childhood film
reviews.content: Space Jam: A New Legacy is many things, but great like the iconic Michael Jordan film is definitely not one of them. When I heard Lebron James was going to be the basketball star in this sequel, I was excited, but also skeptical. Even when the first looks and previews came out I was skeptical about this film and after viewing it, I had every right to be. Let me just say, Lebron James was nothing like Michael Jordan was in the original film and by saying that I should go ahead and say this film is almost nothing like the original one. The only thing this film has in common with the original is basketball playing a major role in the film. His acting I felt wasn't the best at all in this film and I felt like every scene he was in, it was like he was reading off of a teleprompter that was close by. Don Cheadle was also not at his best in this film as the evil A. I. villain as he felt goofy and distracting at times which was disappointing, because I was looking forward to him in this movie. The Looney Tunes were probably one of the only best things about this film as well as all the cameos. Besides that, Space Jam: A New Legacy is a absolute disappointment compared to the 1996 iconic Michael Jordan film. Rating 3/10.
Absolutely terrible. MJ is laughing somewhere. As bag a Lebron fan as I am I just can't.

reviews.review_title: This is a good CHILDRENS/FAMILY movie.
reviews.content: Ignore all the hateful reviews. Majority of them come from people who dislike lebron. Most of them have never left a review on anything else, except this movie. But theyre all of a sudden some sort of movie critic. It amazes me how far people go out of their way to hate on this man. He's amazing, but anyway. I liked it, my kids love it. Good family movie, with great lessons. Funny one liners here and there. The soundtrack was better on the first one, but that's about it.

reviews.review_title: I expected it to not be like M.J's Space Jam, and it delivered.
reviews.content: We knew the LeBron haters/Jordan worshippers would be the first to come on here and thrash this movie even without watching it. We expected it. I would watch it again because it's that good.

reviews.review_title: I made an IMDB account just to leave this review
reviews.content: I was EXTREMELY confused when I saw the bad reviews after watching what I would say is literally the best movie I've ever seen. But then after reading them I soon realised that they have obviously been wrote by people with not the regular amount of brain or those who give movies like "A Haunted House" a bad review. You know... people with a sense of humour that doesn't allow them to find things funny? Boring people.If you haven't already; Go. And. Watch. This. Movie. It's absolutely brilliant, hilarious and what I love most is the power of Warner Bros is there's SO many Easter Eggs and cross overs. (Including the best cross over I've ever witnessed)It's very cleverly done and executed and works so well.Hats off to everyone involved in making this movie, including Lebron (who isn't even an actor, and played the roll very well)And to finish my review; this movie is absolutely brilliant, and I never do this but, I'd go and watch this again tomorrow. Peace.

Frankly, I don't know anything about basketball, I grew up with the first film, and at the time I knew the name of Jordan, but only because it was a little bit mentioned on television, an iconic name like Dali for boxing or Pelé and Maradona for soccer... Lebron, on the other hand, I did not know who he was, nor that he was disliked by half of the fans of this sport, so I did not automatically judge him as an unfortunate choice.I found the film itself a little inferior to the progenitor, which was already a simple film for kids, with a non-actor visibly struggling to talk to the void (even for real actor it is complicated). Lebron honestly seemed less awkward than Jordan, but the film falls on other fronts. There are too many improvised humans for too much time, and the emancipating diatribe between father and nerdy son, quickly becomes annoying. While the first film, in its mediocrity, I could still watch it every now and then, of this sequel, I think I just liked the recruiting part in 2d animation.Regarding the scandal for the flattening of the chest of Lola I think that the fans have exaggerated... a little, it is true that in the '90s she had a more aggressive appearance, but she never had an exaggerated body like Jessica Rabbit, nor even provocative like Berri of "Conker" or the Minerva Mink of the "Animaniacs". Lola has been made more generic, for small children, it is true, a pathetic choice for sure, but it is not all this great change and loss, she's never even been popular. I would have understood more if the fans had complained about how sometimes, the CG, does not render his face very well in the "three-dimensional version".
