On the other hand, regarding the exile of that loser womanizer of Pepè Le Pew for ravings of incitement to rape ... it reminds me of the silly polemics about japan robots in the 80s and against magical girls in the 90s. Luckily Pepé has never been particularly nice or funny, give a damn, but it remains a disturbing fact.As for the opponents, the first impact is negative, the Monstars were not very charismatic masses of muscles, but their being dull and brightly colored made them nice. These new mutants have less time to make themselves known and have to struggle harder because of the grim CG.The development of the challenge is rather confusing because in addition to sports, it mixes video-game rules with Looney's follies, and computer graphics complicates things. The Rap part sucks, but not as much as the excessive citation of the Warner properties, which used the film to get a mega publicity, even making many famous characters move awkwardly in the background, worse than a Capcom fighting game. Plus, other minor quotes that should grab the nostalgic, like the wtf Mc Hammer ballet. Even some regular scenes are a bit nonsense, like super Granny against Chronos.The quality hasn't really dropped, it's just that they tried too hard in my opinion. Simplicity was the winning weapon in the first film, the incipit of this sequel feels more stupid, both for the identity of the algorithm, and for the way in which technology is superficially treated, with an aftertaste of old "Serial Experiments Lain" that doesn't get your brain off the ground like a couple of unscrupulous cartoonish alien entrepreneurs. Obviously, the new generations will elaborate it in their own way, but I don't think they will diverge too much in opinion.In short, a film to be seen only once, there is a certain attention to detail, but... I doubt it will be remembered as the first with Jordan.

I tried to go into this movie objectively. The original Space Jam with his Royal Airness was a favorite for my kids growing up. This was not a return to good times. So much wasted opportunity here. At the end of the day this was nothing but a paid advertisement for the Queen of the NBA. Hard pass all day long.
Giving a 1 because there is no zero, total GARBAGE movie.
This movie was one of the worst of 2021 so far! The whole cast seemed disinterested in their roles, the effects were strange and the overall vibe of the film felt like a video game.

I'm British and I'm only marginally aware of Lebron James. I took my daughter to see this and she had even less idea what all the fuss was about. The way the film went on about him was stomach-churning, at one point referring to him as "the world's greatest athlete". I think that's what we might call Americano-centrism. He kept being referred to as a "king". The whole thing was nauseating.

reviews.review_title: Fun! and full of surprises and easter eggs
reviews.content: I feel sorry for all you sad people writing bad reviews on this movie its a fun movie with heaps of Warner Bros things thrown into it to give it a nosalic feel and make you laugh lighten up you sore losers its a fun kids movie not a movie master peace and give Lebron James a break NBA star going actor what do you expect haha f me. P.s the easter eggs they did put in were unreal Rick and Morty etc.

reviews.review_title: If you like nostalgia and product placing. Here is you movie.
reviews.content: It has a great ending, corny humor, all your favorite characters back in the day. It does send a msg about the story line. I didn't like it was a bit political.I liked the ending and a family, father and son story. That's it.

reviews.review_title: Inspired by Tron from the early 80s
reviews.content:
Maybe none of the writers or anyone involved in making this sequel to Space Jam part 1 saw Tron or they did and are too dumb to come up with something original, that's ok though because Hollywood is into remakes, reboots , soft reboots etc. The original Space Ham ... *Jam .. whatever wasn't anything I'd watch again let alone finish so why make this sequel with a plot line totally stolen from TRON then afterwards it's basically a long commercial and even a 30 second commercial is too long in my opinion. Do yourself a favor and spare some suffering by skipping this garbage...
The budget for this movie was 150 million and it made 152 million at the box office.The 1st movie had an 80 million $ budget and made 250 million.Don't think anyone wanted a sequel to Space Jam (which I'm no fan of either)

reviews.review_title: Not as good as the original but not as bad as most make it out to be
reviews.content: This is a fun, entertaining movie. It's certainly not one that you'd watch and come out of the theaters pondering the deeper life lessons this movie taught you, it's a popcorn flick. When an athlete is the main actor you should probably lower your expectations a bit. LeBron is obviously a top-tier actor but he wasn't horrendous. Compared to Jordan in the original Space Jam his acting is a bit better seeing as he actually seems to be showing some emotion like he would on the court in the actual games like when he talks to the referees in the real games. In the original Space Jam, Jordan looked bored most of the time and barely expressed himself.I liked how there was a mix of 2D and 3D animation which shows the different era we're in now compared to 1996 where 2D was king. However this movie unfortunately represents this new era in another way by littering the movie with constant references which can be a fun game for the audience to spot and recognize characters from other Warner Bros. Properties but this screams of the movie being a giant advertisement by Warner Bros. Starring LeBron and the Looney Tunes.Compared to the original, this is a bit worse but it's not horrible. I enjoyed watching the film and got to the end. Many of the reviewers claiming that the original Space Jam was much better make it seem like the original is some sort of Oscar worthy movie when in fact it's not. Most of those saying that are looking at the original movie through rose-tinted goggles. The original was better but not by much. On top of that, there are claims that this movie is basically LeBron worship as a god but it takes many cracks at his shortcomings in his career and legitimate criticism fans have of him such as switching teams too often and passing the ball to teammates at the last second instead of taking the last shot.If you're looking for an entertaining movie to watch with your brain turned off or with others I'd recommend this movie. If you happen to be a fan of the NBA or The Looney Tunes, this movie should be on your radar.
Love the changes they made! Overall great movie and had a lot of funny parts! I don't understand why.there's been so many bad reviews.

How come the first movie from 1996 looks way better than this?The style of animation looks terrible! The 2D part of the movie looks like it was made in Adobe Flash back in the early 2000s. The animation is choppy and the lip sync is laughable! How can you mess up the lip sync in such a high profile animation movie? The voice acting sucks, the actors suck and some scenes are so bad and cringy - I could barely watch! It's unfunny and most scenes are irrelevant for kids and extremely boring for adults! But hey! Big Chungus and The Matrix is in the movie! Is'nt that what kids like nowadays?Stay away and spare yourself from this soulless movie!
Won't say anything else. This is simply just a kids movie. And I feel any kid would enjoy this.
My son really enjoyed it! After all it's a kids movie.

reviews.review_title: Not horrible, but won't satisfy the lovers of the original movie.
reviews.content: As most of the users have written in previous critics, the movie has a lame/poor screenplay - and it is written by dozens of people! The movie is not very bad, still watchable, but won't satisfy the lovers of the original movie. I was a child when I watched the first movie; this one seemed like a pack of popular culture references overall. This is totally made for the gen Z or the newer one (Alpha). Loved the Michael Jordan - Michael B. Jordan joke, that's it. :)

Look, even if your not a fan of the original, this movie is far less superior and that's the truth. Not to trash on the actors and all the people that worked in this movie but they didn't do a good job, this movie lacks soul and originality. Just another pointless cash grab.

I watched space jam in 1996 as a 12 year old kid and having a sequel was a dream of mine being a basketball fan. I now have a little boy who's getting into basketball too and we loved it. Ok, LeBron is not as charismatic as MJ but all the references to the Warner Bros universe are just amazing and fun to those that grew up with it. Ok, it's not animation and it's CGI, who cares all you purists. Just stop the free criticism and enjoy something. I literally created an account at IMDB which I've neglected to do for a decade just to encourage people to watch this movie.

I expected to scoff at this entire movie and instead I only scoffed at the first third. The premise of Lebron's son being some NBA Jam inventing wunderkind, and Lebron being the regimented dad who couldn't see the literal genius behind him was just so dumb. It was the most paint by numbers "I think I know what kids are into" setup they could have went with, and Lebron's acting only made it sillier.But once they got into the Looney Tune world, there were some decent chuckles. I'm a sucker for the Looney-style slapstick and some of the references to other WB properties landed, even if most were lazy. People consider the gratuitous referencing/advertising to be ruinous to the movie, forgetting their was a scene in the original where Daffy kissed his own ass with a Warner Brothers logo on it. At least there was more effort than THAT in this one.The best parts of the movie are Lebron and Bugs gathering the Looney Tunes team together. The stuff before that was awful. After, the game itself went too long and there wasn't as much comedy as I was expecting there, but it was fine. Not nearly as entertaining as the original but I'd say it did it's job. And the ending was just there. Nothing to it.Overall though I think there is plenty of stuff here for kids to enjoy and JUST enough old school Looney humor and references to make adults not hate their lives watching the movie. I think it's overhated by the weirdos that can't stop with Jordan/Lebron debates. Just take the movie for what it is, and it's not "good" but it's enjoyable.Which is exactly what I would say about the original, by the way.

reviews.review_title: Even if you like James there's no way I'll like him this much
reviews.content: This was basically a movie saying how awesome Lebron is. Nothing was original, just like Lebron, and so manufactured. He can't act especially as a lead role. We get it Lebron you think you're amazing. He is never going to match Jordan in anything he does. He needs to stop trying it's coming off so desperate.

reviews.review_title: Worst G.O.A.T. movie of all time
reviews.content: This movie can workout but is absolutely worse than the original space jam. The development in the story leading up to the big game is poorly constructed and the game itself is not fun to watch, its cheap, lame, and does work well enough to promote the love for the game of basketball.

reviews.review_title: Boring and NOT funny and boring and Not funny
reviews.content: I'm only 20mins into the movie and I'm already feeling like I've wasted 20mins of my life.Nothing like the original first Space Jam. The first Space Jam was amazing!! It was full of good humour, it was funny, it had an awesome cast including Danny DeVito and Bill Murray!I mean how can they mess up such an opportunity to make another amazing movie so badly.I am so so disappointed in this rubbish movie made with a rubbish script and a rubbish story which is not funny at all. In fact is this even meant to be a funny movie anymore??Whoever wrote this second movie should be kicked out of Hollywood. Bring Danny DeVito and billy Murray back to breath some humour and life into the script!Update: manage to finish watching it. So it gets better once it all becomes a cartoon with all the great characters like bugs, daffy, Yosemite Sam etc. BUT the story is still a boring one. Honestly, when you had a good first space jam with real comedic a-list actors, there was an opportunity to make this amazing but instead it's some boring ass story which is just not funny.
What a shame this movie turned out to be. Poor acting, weird choice of effects and the whole movie felt dragged on and painful to watch! Don't recommend it to anyone!

reviews.review_title: Epic Movie! One of my top favorites!
reviews.content: The second paragraph of this review has spoilers, but the first paragraph does not. I really loved this movie, and for several different reasons! The reasons may be a bit hard to explain, but they're, of course, positive, and I'll try my hardest to explain in a moment! Most people don't like this movie mainly because they think it had bad acting, and because the movie was more like a ginormous commercial rather than an actual movie with story, but those are almost the only 2 major problems, and besides, it was more of just like showing ads in the background than like fully showing a commercial, therefore I didn't care and almost didn't notice until lots of people been saying stuff about it, and most people may not notice, too. But, or "and", this doesn't make it bad, at least not completely. There was still lots of great things about this movie, such as life lessons, comedy, action, adventure, other awesome and interesting things that happen, and so much more! There is even a large combination of live-action and animation with great CGI and special effects! This movie is family-friendly as well. Take a look at paragraph 2 for more examples, but they may have spoilers. The reason why I give 9 stars instead of 10 is because of a couple small problems, and I feel like the movie could've been a bit more somewhat better, but yeah.One of the reasons I love this movie is because of its surprising special effects, along with both animation and live-action with CGI combined! So if you only like one or the other, or both, this movie can be for all of them. And another, is that. In the movie, the main-key character of the movie, Lebron, goes on an epic adventure through a computer-like universe of many different movie and TV show planets and worlds, called the Server-verse with the Looney Toons characters to get the gang back together since they were separated, and once they were all back together, they later, have an epic whole-new-level game of basketball, and must win if Lebron is going to go back home and the Looney Toons characters not to get deleted, they play against an enemy team, called the Goon Squad, with each player in that team with their own elemental abilities and powers, and the Looney Toons characters using their abilities as well. So basically, has an epic and, somewhat, unpredictable plot (In some ways at least)! It is also like an enormous crossover of hundreds of different kinds of characters and cameos! This movie also has a fine amount of life lessons as well, like, for example, Lebron developing a better relationship between him and his son from certain things. This movie is full of all sorts of great things, but it has too much hate and I wished that it had more love, and that people would focus more on the movie's good things and elements it provides. I love this movie and may never forget it! (Please, God, let there be more love for this movie, or in the future or something, at least!!!!) It is NOT complete garbage.
The trailer of the movie makes it better than what it was. I like the first one better. I wouldn't waste my time watching this.

A film that was long awaited , it isn't a piece of art but it is nice to see. Any viewer who is not a loyal basketball fan will not understand the movie 100% because there are many nods to this sport. A very good twist that this film took, compared to the old one, is that Warner's world became more visible and in my opinion it gave it much more meaning. Despite the fact that Lebron is not an actor, he did very well. The CGI isn't the best but nothing too much uncomfortable to see.

reviews.review_title: Give credit where credit is due
reviews.content: The start was a bit dull but beyond that was a pleasant surprise, especially considering the negative reviews. Amazing visuals & some very hilariously unforgettable quips. Really enjoyed some memorable scenes.
Haters gonna hate as always! All these people giving a 1/10 rating for a movie just because of LeBron, they all need a life.

While the jokes don't land very often and there's way too much product placement (especially for brands that endorse LeBron), I can't deny that this movie is really entertaining. The fun novelty of it all just lends itself to a easy watch.
This movie flopped harder than LeBron in the finals. You gotta be higher than LeBrons hairline to think this is a good movie!

The ending was ridiculous and the endless pushing of Warner Brothers properties was tedious and meaningless to the target audience. Lebron James did a good job, though, as did both Cedric Joe, and Ceyair Wright in the less showy role of the older brother. And Bugs is always fun.I also thought that some of the popular characters had less of a role to play than some of the unpopular ones, such as Gossamer.

I think its incredible how much computer animation has developed over the years. Most people who have watched the old Space Jam are now around their thirties, but we should rate this movie as a children movie. I think its a great movie.

I'm giving it a 4 because of its nostalgia and childhood delight.Other than that, it's a meh.Yes, lebron can't act. We already knew that.But the movie is for kids. If the children love it, then it's ok.

reviews.review_title: Absolute Garbage - And that's an understatement.
reviews.content: I get it, LeBron is a superstar, no doubt.But his acting in this movie is absolute garbage.The best part of the entire movie was the Michael Jordan part. I'm not going to spoil it for those of you who wants to watch it, but let me warn you, don't waste your time.I want my 2 hours of my life back.

reviews.review_title: What WB couldn't fit into Ready Player One
reviews.content: This movie is bad if you are over 12yrs old. Not that the first was great, but this one is terrible. For one, it has nothing to do with space. The first 30 min is how much Lebron showcases better acting hurt on a basketball floor, than he does in a movie. The montage of rounding up the other toons is basically WB showing off their dvd library. The only realistic part of the movie is when the son realizes the Toons are going to win and he switches sides to be on the winning team. Classic Lebron James. Oh and don't mind the 100 or so Nike plugs in this movie either. They are not subtle at all. Just bad writing, bad acting and the majority is CG for some reason because I'm sure Lebron phoned this one in.
Yeah, times change and this new Space Jam evolved with it. Loved it.

reviews.review_title: Bollywood level movie with hollywood CGI
reviews.content: As I was a fan of the first movie, I thought what they will do, will they continue a first movie story with a new basketball star or what will happen.Well nothing happened.I am not that easily bored with movies, but this was won a Oskar for being so boring, that I could handle it only for 5 minutes.I tried watching it to the end, but had to have breaks, just like in basketball.Cause lack of story, lack of logic, lack of first movie fun parts destroyed everything I liked in the first movie.Rather call it James Jam, but not Space jam.Visual effects were pretty nice, but as a story is so poor it kinda made me remember Bollywood movies, who pretty much have same story quality.At the end everyone comes to watch this movie of James, but the funny part the part in the movie where James sits and reviews the movie project of WB and says wtf, well I guess many people can say about this movie too.

How can anyone relate to the arrogance and privilege exhibited by an ultra rich protagonist in this obviously not for "regular" people movie? Children under 5 years old may enjoy some of the animation and special effects. Other than that...this flick is disturbing.

People sleeping on this move it is good.the acting is
A little rusty but cgi and visuals are perfect.

Ok let's be real and see this movie with fresh eyes, my 7 & 11 yrs old boys loved it and we keep on freezing the scenes to figure out all the old school characters. The 1st Space Jam was unique and fun, this one is entertaining but should be looked at independently. We give it thumbs up 👍👍👍👍, hope you enjoy it too.

Ok ,so It was enjoyable and atleast I didn't fall asleep ,but the original is heaps better 100%. One thing I hated was LeBron ,he can't act ,idk if it was just me thinking it but God did he do horrible. I love the special effects ,and ofc the tunes but my favourite part would be all of the WB characters involved in the movie . Also loved how thoy used Michael B Jordan and mistkan him as Michael Jordan.

I found this movie to be enjoyable with plenty of laughs. Probably one of the better movies I have seen recently. My kids even enjoyed watching it. People are only gonna hate on this movie because it's Lebron James. He's no Michael Jordan and will never be, what he's done for the game though is unbelievable.

reviews.review_title: Nothing more than a flex of Warner brothers assets
reviews.content: If you love the original 90s movie, dont watch this - you'll find nothing but disappointment.99% of the movie is full of irrelavent nods to all the IP's owned by Warner brothers, I mean what child is going to understand the scenes involving mad Max and the matrix????Many adults will be watching this movie with their children hoping that the nostalgia of the 1st movie will come flooding back, but all you receive is 2 hours of utter nonsense, with some pretty animation.The story is broken, the actor's are essentially robots and the entire pace of the movie is all over the place.

The movie was soulless and the story was not convincing for his kid was kidnapped and he had to play a game to get him back, so boring and even bugs bunny's character was soulless and not like space jam one , most of the looney tunes characters on the film were soulless and cold,this movie project is so bad.

I am tired of reading all these hate comments. This movie is great. It has a great theme. I mean its 2021 of course it's going to be a more modern movie. People just find so many ways to hate on lebron on everything he does. He isn't even a terrible actor. This movie was for laughs and for family to watch. People just get mad that lebron is so successful (and well deserved). If you are thinking of watching this movie, you for sure should.

reviews.review_title: Fun movie, don't listen to these haters
reviews.content: I don't understand how this movie is getting the terrible scores it is, probably just losers upset that Bron wiped the floor with their favorite teams in real life. I wouldn't listen to that nonsense. It's a super fun movie and a nice progression for the space jam series for a new era. Yeah the plot is whatever but it's not meant to win an Oscar. Get rid of your bias and go in ready to laugh and see some amazing CGI. Stop taking movies so seriously and you'll really enjoy yourself.

Perhaps the only funny line in the whole movie was when lebron said the computer was black when they saw don cheadle. Other than that, my god this thing was tremendously boring, unfunny, and emotionless. Warnerbros just really wanted to show us how much stuff they own that we don't care about. Give me the OG space jam with MJ any day over this.

reviews.review_title: bringing more morals and good message
reviews.content: At first, i should tell that I AM NOT LEBRON FANS. I am trying to be neutral. Yeah most of real athletes didn't act as good as real actors so i didn't expect too much but this was good. Take back at space jam 1996 where the movies actually focusing on the comedy, the new legacy trying to show us more about parenting, trusting each other, morals and attitude. Is this movie belongs to kids? Or adult? Both are okay, this movies teach kids how they reach their dreams, respecting family while also teach adult how to parenting, how to be good "father" icon to their childs and of course not to be selfish both in family or teamworks.

You'll be hard pressed to find a an unbiased review as most either love or hate LeBron (will give a 10 or 1 just because). But unbiasedly, this is an atrocity.Unnecessarily long. 2 hours? Not sure you can expect 3-5 year olds to pay attention for the entirely of the film considering that's the only audience that will find this film enjoyable. Jokes were played out, stale, cliche and flat out cringe. CRINGE. Very difficult to pay attention. Was not captured there was no life or spirit it felt forced. 0 character development the "villains" had no character or personality you didn't even know who to root for in the game. Isn't that the point?You know "it's so bad it's good" that's basically LeBron. He is so bad that it makes for some unintentionally funny quotes. That along with terrific CGI is the only reason I won't be giving a 1. Even then it gets overbearing 95% of energy went into the animation.This movie can only be enjoyed by those in the single digit age because anyone with a fully developed brain can't possibly watch this abomination and say "wow that was great". WB completely neglected the audience that enjoyed Space Jam and who were excited for the sequel which is a damn shame. If they wanted to make a Mickey Mouse Barney kiddy movie don't name it Space Jam. Think of a different idea for that new audience you're trying to capture opposed to riding Space Jams coattail. Obvious money grab. Pathetic.

reviews.review_title: A lousy movie...and don't quit your day job, Lebron.
reviews.content: Basically a shameless 2-hour Warner Brothers commercial. And Lebron James - a great basketball player - is a truly terrible actor. He got no help from the script either: it's about as sophisticated as the movie's 7-year-old target demo. The kiddies may like it, but we pity the poor parents who have sit through this thing with them.
Not much spirit, distasteful graphics, and low quality lines all over, a few chuckles here and there.Lebron is not to be compared to MJ.The ads were a disservice to the spirit of Space Jam.

reviews.review_title: I didn't wait 25 years for this...
reviews.content: I loved the original Space Jam, it's not the greatest movie ever, but people of all ages can enjoy it, I loved the silly storyline, and it wasn't solely focused on Michael Jordan. For years after watching the original movie, I was hopefully they would make another sequel maybe with the next NBA superstar of our time.In the original we got to know Michael's family and friends. Michael was portrayed as a happy, humble and as a true family man. Lebron, although realistically, was not humble, not friendly, not happy, and not much of a family man despite the movie being about his son.In real life, Lebron James is the most unlikeable and egotistical basketball player of this generation. Unlike Michael Jordan who was genuine, charismatic, humble, and didn't let fame get to his head, the same can't be said about Lebron. Please don't waste your time watching this movie, the story line is ridiculously cheesy, Lebron gets his son kid kidnapped by the villain who comes from a different dimension, Lebron gets lost in the matrix, ending up in the Looney Tunes universe where he has to team up with the toons to play a game against his own son to get him back.The movie is filled with lots of homage and movie references like many things these days because there's not much creativity in movies it seems or at least people who have creative ideas aren't hitting the mainstream. The movie was boring. Lebron's acting was not very good, seemed like he hardly tried. The voice acting of the Looney Tunes characters were fine, but so much of their dialogue went to waste. Zendaya surpassed my expectations as Lola Bunny voice acting wise, it wasn't like the original or better but it sounded OK. All of the jokes I heard in the movie, in my opinion fell flat, there was no comedic timing whatsoever. The only good thing I could think about the movie was the good CGI and animation.I think this movie would have been better made if it was either made in the 2000s or even in the future with a different NBA player. Choosing Lebron was a mistake.

Wow, this movie was so fun and amazing. I love it a lot. Space Jam A New Legacy was really great and LeBron's performance with Bugs and the rest of the Tunes was amazing and awesome. This movie was way better than the original Space Jam, and also LeBron had a better performance than Michael Jordan. Overall this movie was fun and great. I love this movie a lot, it is my favorite movie of 2021 so far and everyone who loves The Loony Toons, the NBA and LeBron I highly recommend this movie. It is a must watch. I give this movie a 9/10. Don't listen to the critics on their negative scores on this movie, it's a Loony Tunes movie. What do you expect? Also they're obviously LeBron haters.

I don't care what other people think I think this movies is a masterpiece this showed a lot of excitement and enjoyment in it and it show how adult felt about it when they were kids the watching first space and the first space jam was also amazing!

It's fun, colour and a kids movie after all. Stop comparing it to the original and just enjoy it. It is a bit daggy in parts but the kids loved it. The visuals are pretty cool and the music was great.
Who said the movie had to be the same as the old one. I think the movie was creative and different brings back good childhood memories. Thanks it's was super fun to watch with my family.
Way to kill a classic movie. I knew it was going to be killed but cmon this was just horrible.

reviews.review_title: Campy looney family fun. Reviews are too harsh on this movie
reviews.content: Yes, most of the live action acting was bad, including LeBron.Yes, the movie was in some ways an expensive ad for Warner Bros and LeBron.Yes, the movie over-idolizes LeBron to a conceited extent.But didn't we expect all of this going in? "Epitomizes everything that's wrong with the film industry today"?? Really? Space Jam is the movie you use to make this statement? I'm confused, did people think this movie would actually be good?I went in with low expectations based on the subject and LeBron. All of the bad aspects of this movie were expected and, to me, comfortably in the realm of CAMP.The Looney Tunes themselves were fun and brought the movie up to being enjoyable at the end of the day and worth a watch.If you come at this movie expecting anything but campy looney light-hearted family fun, you will be disappointed.The movie is being underrated in the 4s right now dragged down by a lot of 1 star reviews. It belongs at 5 or 6/10.

I love Looney Tones! But its 2021 and they've lost their steam. LeBron James fell flat. The father/son rivalry was a decent start but I was still left wanting something more. The whole point of the film made the least amount of sense too. After everything, why does Don Cheadle even make LeBron play basketball to get his son back? He's got them both now; mission accomplished. But Cheadle says lets play basketball and I'll even use my cheat code to take away points..only once though. That part of the plot was weak. The original kept the plot simple. This one did too much. And I guess its "space jam" because of cyber space.. I'll stick with the OG.
It is a one time watch movie. You can see this on your free day. No need to specially take out time to watch this.

reviews.review_title: Painful to watch how did a director approve of this.
reviews.content: This for sure goes down in my top 5 worse movies I've ever watched it was so hard to watched this movie tried so hard to be funny and was just extremely corny. Complete waste of time do not watch this movie.

Watch the movie. You won't be disappointed. It's a family/children's movie. That's exactly what you got. All of the negative reviews should have been expected. It's LEBRON JAMES starring in Space Jam... The Jordan crowd can't contain their insecurity.

reviews.review_title: This is just a fun, goofy, fan service overloaded movie!
reviews.content: This movie is everything I expected it to be. A fan servicey, silly, fun movie. And it was just that.The opening did surprisingly get me invested in this movie. I like the cameos in this too!I feel like zendaya wasn't the best choice for Lola (still love her tho!)You can tell Don Cheadle was having so much fun with this role and it pays off. He's great!Lebron is feels a bit choppy but it's because he ain't an actor so I can't really complain.All the other voice acting in this movie is great!All round, this is just a fun, goofy, feel good, fan service overloaded movie! 6/10.
A 2nd rate film by with 3rd rate whiney bball player.

reviews.review_title: It's not a documentary, stop hating
reviews.content: Not sure why people are hating on this movie. It's fantasy and has many LOL moments and Easter eggs. If you think LeBron James is bragging, he deserves to brag; he's not called King James because it's a snappy moniker.Relax and let the movie entertain you. It's sweet and by the end James has an a-ha moment that changes his life view.

So much potential, i loved SJ1 growing up, even this New Legacy I liked all the looney tones scenes, but OMG why why did Warner cast LeBron, he is horrible, this movie was doomed since the casting!! So sad.

reviews.review_title: LeBron should just stick to basketball
reviews.content: This could of been something g good but unfortunately it was just terrible!!!

reviews.review_title: Save your money or just rent watch the first
reviews.content: What were they thinking? Things must be pretty slim in terms of talent and or ideas in the movie industry. I highly suggest reading a book, watching a documentary, or taking a nap. You will be smarter if you do so.

Obviously LeBron James is NOT a professional actor, but neither was Michael Jordan. I'm sure most of these negative reviews are from people who grew up with the original (like myself) and feel like this isn't as good. The original is on HBO Max too, go back and watch that one again, and see if it is still as perfect as you remember. I guarantee it's just as silly and fun as you remember, but far from a perfect movie.This movie is also far from perfect, but it's not supposed to be?? It's a Space Jam for this generation with this generation's most prominent basketball player. Yes there were some weak plot points, and less than stellar acting in some places, but it's still a heartfelt movie with a good message for kids and adults alike.The animation is the best part of the film for me. I loved seeing all the classic Looney Tunes on screen, and I loved the addition of Zendaya as Lola Bunny.If you have HBO Max, it's definitely worth the watch. I would not pay extra to see it in theaters, but it is a fun time.
I'm going to be honest I like this film y'all don't got to be a LeBron James fan to like it but if that's the case there's no reason to hate the film because of LeBron??? Like WTF.

reviews.review_title: Yeah Lebron sucks but I thought everything else was fine
reviews.content: I feel like people are being too hard on this film. It's not as good as the original, and lebron is most definetly the worst part of the film, but it's not the worst thing ever like some people are making it seem. I can for good 2d animation, vfx, and looney tunes gags. I believe the movie delivered on all those fronts. I'd even go as far to say that the voices and personality's of the tunes are intact, and even slightly better the space jam (except Lola, she was just ok.) in general, a decent popcorn flick that's kind of just a mindless watch that can be enjoyed for the cartoons, pretty much like the original in my opinion.

reviews.review_title: It's great for basketball kids movie
reviews.content: If kids are allowed to write this review they would just enjoy and be blessed for this emotional movie.

reviews.review_title: Should be titled "Space Jam: A Ruined Legacy
reviews.content: The movie absolutely flops (much like Lebron) and is just awful compared to the first one. I have no plans of watching this movie again. I recommend saving your money and just watch the original Space Jam instead.

reviews.review_title: I don't know why people so hate this movie
reviews.content:
I'm not watch the old space jam movie and I'm also not kinda basketball enjoyers
Soo in my perspektif this movie still enjoyable and entertaining
It's like bring the child memori and with the much warner bross character show up as a cameo it's so amazing...Idk atleast this movie could be in 6 or 7 rating
It's really2 the right movie for you to watch with all your families.

The acting is terrible, the jokes are dry, and it feels like such a waste of time. I had no reaction throughout the movie and nearly fell asleep halfway through. If you think time is valuable, don't watch this movie at all. Stay FAR way from it!

reviews.review_title: Burn this movie to the ground!
reviews.content: Storyline sucked. Hardly any character build up. Acting was trash. Humor was cringe. Warner Brothers trying to advertise themselves. Easter egg overload. Disgusting to the film industry. Hope this movie gets all the negative feedback it deserves.Rude comment to leave, but in all sincerity I mean it in a constructive way to help motivate Hollywood into creating fresh new ideas.

Let's face it, for all of us parents now wanting to treat our kids to movies in theaters again after such a long time where it was not possible, we'll basically go to anything family-rated at the bargain matinees. Literally, anything. However, 30 min into this, I couldn't figure out how the agents of Dom Cheadle and LeBron James talked them into this project. I've loved Dom Cheadle in everything I've ever seen him in, he's a wonderful actor, but he has nothing to work with here. His character has no depth - that's how he's written, it's not Cheadle's fault. LeBron playing a fictional version of himself seems natural and engaging in front of the camera, I'd like to see him in other things, because this movie is kind of a mess that didn't need to be made. The set up takes a long, slow time to get through - fictional LeBron has trouble connecting with his son, who would rather expand his talents for coding and creating video games than play basketball and just wants his famous father to accept him as an individual. He and his son butt heads, but later try to mend fences by going together to the Warner Brothers studio to hear a pitch generated by the AI heart of the WB "Serververse" (no, really, a serververse). LeBron passes on the opportunity, but the AI algorithm (played by Dom Cheadle) takes offense and kidnaps the pair in revenge, digitizing them into his cyberspace within all the WB vaults. He then separates them, manipulating the son into thinking the AI is his friend and basically threatening LeBron into assembling a team of Looney Toons characters to face off in a wild, crazy rules basketball game to be held later. Confused? Confounded? Not even sure why all this is our plot exposition? Yeah, me too. We then plod through LeBron recruiting different toons and then the day of the big game - where it's revealed his son is now the star player on the opposing team along with malevolent versions of the OPs he created for his own video game and the WB AI as the Goon Squad coach. Somehow, inexplicably, the AI has also managed to kidnap andndigitize thousands of people across the globe to be spectators, along with LeBron's wife and other children. He tells LeBron right before the game starts that if he loses, all these people will be trapped in the "serververse" forever (eye roll). Don't even get me started on the absolute slog that is the big game. It goes on forever. And ever. Needless to say, LeBron and his son reconcile, join forces and win the game against the AI, who is vaporized, and return to the real world. LeBron accepts and encourages his son's individual pursuits and later they discover the toons can now visit them in the real world. Snore. But, my kids were just happy to be out at the movies again, so I guess it's worthwhile for that.

Man, it's pretty hard to be excited about a movie with so many bad critiques, but after watching it I can confirm that it's mostly LeBron hate.This movie is very fun with humor for young adults like myself and I'm pretty sure that kids would like it too. LeBron impressed me to be honest, he was a very decent actor.My advice for other reviewers: stop being in your feelings so much and be objective, it's just a kids movie after all.

I really enjoyed the movie, It's a kid's movie I didn't expect a great movie. LeBron isn't the best actor but they make fun of that. I wish there was more enficence on how Bugs was alone on Tune World and wish we saw what movies or TV shows all the Tune Squad were in. Loved the cameos.
I liek lemon james. He shoot the baskentball an beat don cheadle. 10/10 best movie of the past decade.
Awesome , LBJ and WB greatness in one movie. The story is amazing and it's been a while since we have seen the looney tunes.

Some of these reviews are pretty harsh. If you want a fun, family movie that's been updated from the original, but still has little pieces to tie into it, then you'll be happy! Don't get me wrong, I love the original since I grew up with it, but thought this was a good updated version. Yes, some of it was a bit of a WB ad, but other parts were fun to see the various characters interacting. Give it a chance!

reviews.review_title: Lazy sequel but really with the 1 star reviews
reviews.content: First off I loved the original movie. It was a cheesy fun kids movie and featured some really fun set pieces.This sequel my expectations were low and yes I could guess every story arc and plot device going. Yes the film is rather lazy but I've seen so many movies that are worse.For starters this was always going to be a standard sequel where it crashes in on the original but doesnt come close.The main negatives from my side besides an original idea is that what made the first film good was the looney toons characters played a main part in the story, this film suffers a lot from sidelining them as a supporting role and instead focus on a boring villain.

reviews.review_title: Not what I expected but in an Entertaining way!
reviews.content: I have been extremely keen for this one for my kids, I loved the original Space Jam & was excited for this one & at the same time not sure what to expect...I was highly entertained & enjoyed Space Jam: A New Legacy. It's a movie and a movie is supposed to entertain you as an escape - does the job but it's not for younger children as it is very story driven. Younger kids will enjoy from the 35mins mark for Bugs & his crew! Loved all cameos.....especially MJ hahaha.
I can't believe how they make a movie with a person that acted so bad he didn't even try......what a waste of time !!!!!!
The people that rated this 1 star are definitely a part of the "shut up and dribble" committee. If it were anyone else it would be rated higher.

reviews.review_title: Space Jam New Legacy is NOT a complete dumpster fire
reviews.content: I'm going against the grain here in saying Space Jam: New Legacy was NOT a complete dumpster fire of a movie. It's more of a matter of perspective. Most people reviewing this movie now were under the age of 10 when the original came out in 1996 including me. That movie was a classic and remained in our minds as a cherished memory. As it should because it brought Looney Toons, which were still relatively popular at the time, and Michael Jordan who was a literal basketball legend known world wide, together in formula that was fail-proof. I feel most people already had a stigma coming into this film whether their personal dislike of Lebron, uninterest in the old school Looney Toons characters, or just not willing to like this movie because the original is the one we hold close to our hearts.I personally started enjoying the movie once the toons were introduced. Before that point, it was borderline unwatchable. You have to remember overrall, this is a movie geared towards kids of that age group in today's world. You can't take every movie so seriously.Yes, Lebron's acting sucked but so did Michael Jordan's in the original. The film IS a bit all over the place but sometimes you just have to sit back and enjoy a movie for what it is. If you go into it with that outlook, you might not have that horrible of a time.
Don't listen to critics make up your own opinion about Space Jam A New Legacy I really enjoyed it the 2nd time around and I would definitely watch it again.

The most uncomplicated film, more of a cartoon, for children as a target audience. It did not cause any indignation, nor did it participate in the struggle for depth and height of style. Jokes are quite within the bounds of decency, Bucks Bunny as a typical character in this regard. LeBron, played as best he could, and in general, the claim to the director for the beginning, where the character of James is completely "on the ground". After the middle of the film, however, he copes well with the level of "athlete-actor". And in the end it turned out just fine on there is nothing to say about the son, there is nothing to say about the game, there are several funny moments with the second son, and with the manager of the protagonist. Chiddle played quite convincingly, but they just would have taken an actor more attractive) the film is black in the frame, which for many will probably be non-camilleaux. But in general - a film that you can watch.

Here's what made the original "Space Jam" so much better than the new way-too-long, mega-budget wannabe: MJ was so much better (cooler, funnier) at playing himself than LeBron is at playing himself. LBJ tries too hard to ACT. Too often comes off unconvincing and uncomfortable.

reviews.review_title: Nowhere close to the OG movie
reviews.content: I grew up on Space Jam with Michael A. Jordan. And while this movie is visually stunning, Lebron James' acting is cringeworthy. And no offense, he's a basketball player, not an actor. There's hardly any emotion from his monotone lines.His son's acting was much better. His wife's acting was surprisingly impressive.Kids will undoubtedly enjoy this movie.
Literally couldn't finish it. It's so bad. The acting, the story everything about it is a disgrace.

reviews.review_title: Lebron needs to stick with basketball
reviews.content: This movie was bad. Lebron trying to ride Jordan's coattails, and failing all along the way.
No real story line to follow, shocking and terribly over thought. Destroyed everything the original stood for.

I have no idea why people are not liking this movie. The quality was well done and one of e best family movies I have seen in a while. My 16, 17 and 10 year old all loved the movie. So entertaining. Yes Lebron isn't the best actor obviously but who cares Everyone else did well. So great!
If you want nostalgic, Looney Tunes humor with NBA star power then this movie is for you.

reviews.review_title: This movie is as unlikeable as LaBron
reviews.content: LeBron James may be the most unlikable athlete in America and this movie did nothing to change that opinion. He will always be chasing Michael Jordan's shadow, never to be caught. I would've never paid money to see this in the theater, but I figured since I could watch it on HBO I would go ahead and check it out. Not the best decision I've ever made.

It took me like 6 times to get thru the movie. I finally finished it. I went back and watch the original space jam. I must say the original is way better than the newer version. LeBron should have just left the legacy of Space Jam along.

Definitely Doesn't deserve the low rating ...The movie was fun and entertaining but also not a perfect movie ...the good things in it is the CGI and some of the jokes were funny and i enjoyed this One more than the original space jam.

The movie was entertaining! The plot was thin and predictable, but before watching, I knew that would be the case based on the first Space Jam. I appreciated and enjoyed the nods to athletes and coaches like Bobby Knight, Vince Carter, Bill Belichick, and so on. The CGI and visual effects were great. I respect the art. A lot of people are comparing LeBron and Jordan. They both are not actors so to expect either to be good is unrealistic. I enjoyed the movie for what it is and would suggest others do the same. Enjoy it. If you are looking for Academy Awards level acting, then this is not your movie. If you are looking for a fun and entertaining movie, this fits the bill.

reviews.review_title: Toilet hollywood untalented low IQ Film!
reviews.content: This is by far the worst film untalented lebron james cant act! The story is like watching teletubbies.

Now before anything else. This is not about Lola Bunny, I just want to make that clear.This movie just starts with a bad idea at the very start. An Algorithm wants to use LeBron to make their products (shows, movies, etc.) better. Question? Why LeBron? Why him specifically? Because he plays basketball? LeBron was right, that algorithm is busted.

reviews.review_title: I'm feeling so nostalgic and have fun whole film!!
reviews.content:
First of all, WHAT"S WRONG WITH THE SCORE??This movie is REALLY GOOD man!! You just only need to enjoy it, man!I really love to meet many of my childhood character, i'm 32 now, omg the nostalgic..
the movie is fun ride! You got live action, 2d, 3d, and sooooooo many easter egg!!The basketball itself is sooo funny and absurd!! You will think like WHATTT? Then laugh it off. Just dont think too much, this is CARTOON and you should be having fun watching this!!But yeaaa there's also flaw ofcourse. I really want Road Runner to have more screen time, because he is my fav character. And also we dont see many speedy gonzales act here.The relation of dad and son is a bit awkward, but you get their points. Ad the movie also has life lesson in it, as a parent.I will still give this movie 10/10 tho xD reaaaaaally fun ride for me!!Love the easter egg so much!!

reviews.review_title: A movie that was not needed
reviews.content: This movie has a weak story and terrible acting. If it wasn't for the looney toon characters adding craziness to the overall story, it would be a complete disaster. It ruins the legacy of the original.

I love the original Space Jam. It's like they whipped this up in 5 minutes using every cliche from every bad family movie.LeBron's acting is tough to swallow, it's stupidly predictable even for a kids movie. There are some good ideas though. Like involving the WB universe was cool. But overall it just didn't work. Massive let down.

reviews.review_title: Let's be honest about the movie 🍿🎥
reviews.content: Let's start with the elephant in the room. Most adults want this to reflect the original Space Jam and are comparing the new one to that. That's why most reviews say something to the respect of "Not as good as the original" or "Lebron is trash and not a role model". (Liking his basketball game is one thing, but there's a whole city of kids that will beg to differ on the second) When You do that, you're already preparing yourself to be disappointed. Take all reviews with a grain of salt and realize the hidden bias that is naturally engrained.I was fortune enough to catch a sneak peek courtesy of the I-Promise School and Warner Brothers. I gave it a 7/10 and I'll tell you why without getting drug down into the weeds with this review. The movie starts off slower than I would of liked, but it's important in setting the tone of the movie. Let's be honest though, who remembers the first part of the original Space Jam, it's all about the basketball game. This movie does not disappoint. The graphics are better, the game is entertaining and if you watch and judge this movie on its own merit, it's entertaining for adults and kids.Lebron isn't the best actor, and some of the early part seems stretched and forced, but the kids are charismatic and in the end, it's a story about family and dreams.Try not to compare this to the original film because nostalgia has a way if distorting your perception.

reviews.review_title: You know this is a kids movie right
reviews.content: I see a lot of grown adults who were children in the 90s acting like they expected an Oscar nomination from this movie?. Its not gonna have great acting and it's for the kids to enjoy it. If you enjoyed ready player one then you will like some of the things they did with this. I actually enjoyed all the call backs to other WB movies as I grew up watching them as a kid as well.

reviews.review_title: This movie is for the kids, and the kids will love it!
reviews.content: I see a lot of adults complaining that this movie was terrible and then make comparisons to the first space jam, they are quick to forget that they loved the original because they were kids when they saw it, I'm sure if their parents went with them to watch the original space jam their parents would have hated it. This movie is a great kids movie and if we gave kids the opportunity to review this movie on here they'd give it a great review.I think most people reviewing this need to be practical, this wasn't meant to be an Oscar winning piece. Was it goofy? Yes. Was it fun? Yes! Was LeBron a terrible actor? Yes! But all these are the same ingredients that made the original a hit.All in all, take the kids to watch this and they'll love it and love you more for taking them.

After finishing this movie, a friend whom I was watching the movie with commented at the same time that whoever wrote this movie or was responsible should be shot. Just sad to see a pitiful reboot of a childhood classic and beloved film for a shameless exercise in brand placement and needless pop culture references. Save yourself some time and don't bother watching this.

A sad attempt to rekindle the popularity of the original. Lebron James just wants to be Michael Jordan but he's nowhere near as authentic and doesn't have even half the talent or charisma. The film throws in Superman, Harry Potter, The Matrix, and every other nostalgic thing from Warner Brothers in order to distract you from just how bad it really is. It doesn't have nearly as many laughs as the original, and just tries too hard to be better and crams so much into it that it just becomes visually overwhelming and noisy.

The best part of this movie was the Looney Tunes, and they barely got any screentime in favor of LeBron. He was boring and not entertaining, and I just wanted to see more of the Tunes wrecking other Warner properties.

reviews.review_title: Good Looney Tunes Movie, Mediocre LeBron James Movie
reviews.content: I'll keep it brief, but let's just say that LeBron James is definitely not actor of the year. When he finally meets the Looney Tunes after he and his son, Dom, get into trouble with the Warner Bros AI, the film's antagonist, then it gets interesting since the Looney Tunes characters were fun enough to carry the film.With that though, they should've taken cue from the first movie and introduce us to the Looney Tunes characters earlier, and point out the stakes through the AI character.The ending also could've been better, longer, and covering more than one real-life location. The closest we got are the photos in the credits.

reviews.review_title: i enjoyed it, but it felt like a huge ad.
reviews.content: I quite enjoyed the storyline, i think it was a cute movie and the animation was good, but i wouldn't watch it again. I hated how it just felt like a huge ad. Instead of like a 30 second ad, it was like and hour and 45 minutes or whatever. Warner brothers has brought so many amazing movies, and i love to see them here, but not ALL. THE. TIME. I do think it's worth watching, but not multiple times.
Loved the original. LbJ should stick to reading the first pages of books. Complete waste of time.
Don't waste your time. One of the worst films I've ever seen. I asked for my money back but was told no.

reviews.review_title: The start of the movie and the middle of the movie was alright
reviews.content: When LeBron entered the cartoon world that's when the movie turned pathetic definitely does NOT beat the original but Space Jam 2 wasn't the worst movie in the world but its absolutely not the best movie made only watch it if you have alot of free time on your hands I'll say it's worth a view.

My brother and I just got through watching the film, and we really like it. It was crazy, adventurous, and surprisingly poignant, at times. LeBron James may not be the best actor in the world, but he was great in this. Don Cheadle did a great job playing the villain, and I actually hated him. All of the actors did a great job. The animation and CGI in the film are great. I didn't think that I would get used to the hyper realism animation that the Looney Tunes turned into halfway into the film. It was well done. I just wish that they would've had Pepe Le Pew in the film and showed Lebron bonding with The Toons. Still, that didn't stop me from enjoying the film.Also, yes, most people don't like the film and that's perfectly fine. Everyone has their own opinions.7/10.
I'm sorry to say but it really sucked not really enjoyable by children they don't know who to target a audience sorry but it was totally horrible would not recommend.
Movie was not bussin. Like actually not bussin. Least bussin movie i ever saw.
Lebron's acting is even worse off the court! This makes the first Space Jam look like 10/10.

First one will always be iconic, this one will most likely be forgotten once seen, maybe one or two good laughs lebrons acting cringe at best tunes CGI was gorgeous, don cheadle CGi at the end just laughable. If you have nothing else to watch why not this.

This was actually a great movie! The Bron's acting is well, good enough, that's the only downside of this movie. But overall I loved it! Super fun and hilarious! Don't trust the low ratings! I don't even play sports, and I mean any kind of sport, not LeBron's fan either but this movie succeed in keeping me entertained!Must watch with your kids!

The overly negative reviews on Space Jam 2 are just unfair. All I can imagine is just a bunch of negative, angry middle-aged adults sitting in a kids movie with their arms folded and mad about everything before the opening credits even begin. What did you expect? Titanic?No, it's not better than the original Space Jam, but how many sequels are better than the original? No, the acting is not great, and yes, a lot of the plot makes no sense whatsoever. But it's just a hokey little kid's movie people. The special effects were amazing, and it put a smile on my kid's face. It ended up being a good little outing for me and my daughter, who wasn't born for the original Space Jam, but I've watched it with her many times. I knew the remake wasn't going to be epic, but it was cool to watch something with my kid that was a part of my childhood, so to speak.I'm not saying everyone should fall in line and love the movie like sheep, but people on here are being way too harsh and looking at this the wrong way. This isn't the best movie of it's kind, but far from the worst.
MJ is the one and only. This James character is so eager for attention at the end of his career.

I went in to this movie with low expectations and high hopes! When I was a kid Space Jam was the Jam! MJ was everywhere. Even after his early retirement. The original had a great original story with lots of NBA cameos and Bill Murray. It had probably one of the best soundtracks of any movie in the 90's. I still have all of the action figures from the movie including MJ. With that said. This movie was missing most of the things mentioned above, but it did have a lot of movie cameos, like ready player one, and also I have never been a huge fan of lebron, but I will say because of this movie I like him a little more. It was still fun to watch, and was entertaining. It will never be MJ's Space Jam, but then again Lebron will never be Jordan.
Among us was in it. Sus sus. Awesome! Medbay he is scanning.
LeBron James one of the greatest players in the basketball history and GOAT. This movie is very excited movie. Respect to MJ and LBJ,this players is GOAT. Love it.

If you are a 6yo sure best movie ever, but as the mother of said 6yo please please can I go back in time and not watch this? Space Jam OG is a classic...no sequel can ever touch it. 'King James' must never act again. His son in the movie was definitely 100% better than him. Wow the product placement was overwhelming. They must had to pay him a load of money.

reviews.review_title: It's good for what it is: a silly kids movie
reviews.content: SERIOUSLY!!! Why is everyone giving this movie a bad rating. It's literally just a kids movie. It's cheesy. It's silly. They do a lot of homages. The storyline wasn't that bad. Okay maybe Lebron's acting could use a lot work, but hey it wasn't bad for this being his first time on the big screen. Don't listen to these negative comments and check it out for yourselves. Don't expect anything except a little cheesy fun movie.

reviews.review_title: Y'all trippin in a sad way
reviews.content: To many people are criticizing this movie, and it deserves better so I'll boost my score from an 8/9 to a 10 and I don't like leaving reviews but feel like I'm a true fan of basketball and theater so I'm here to set the record straight, I saw the original space jam about 30 times in my youth and I shaped my life and damn near who I am as a person no lie. So of course I probably have a biased opinion but I have a feeling the people rating this film at a 4/5 are just wanna be critics and not true basketball enthusiast which is sad if you ask me cause some opinions shouldn't count, I'll also add I appreciated the dad jokes and work ethic vibes from Lebrons first main man role (by the way I'm a warriors fan). Anyways this movie was bound be a difficult sequel to even be considered as good as the original that said don't believe what you hear see or read about this movie it was made for and by somebody from the 90's kid era, lastly I think it's a strong/based on truth story that will be build a positive outlook for right viewer not to mention an awesome cast, check it out and appreciate that this was even a possibility. All love -cb.

Last weekend 8/13/21 we went to the theater with the kids to watch Space Jam A New Legacy movie with LeBron James and honestly it was one of the worst movies I have ever seen. Very disjointed and not an interesting story. The following weekend we saw Paw Patrol: The Movie, at the same theater and by contrast it was awesome. Space Jam A New Legacy was boring and just a bunch of noise and lights.

It is a fun hilarious movie full of cool movie preferences, highly recommend i think people are saying its bad because they expected way too much from it, but if you watch the movie without thinking that you will see a fantastic sequel to an iconic movie from the 90's.

reviews.review_title: Really you replace a alstar mj with a has been
reviews.content: Let's just say I want my money back. I grew up with loony toons and space Jane with mj was amazing. To destroy everything with a washed up pos player. You can find a better basketball player in a pickup basketball game at the Y. All around horrible job.save yourself time and money skip this trash. 0 stars.

reviews.review_title: Broken Back Due to Heavy Shoulders!
reviews.content: This movie was carried by one person and one person only: Don Cheadle. If it weren't for him (and of course my kids) I wouldn't have given this movie a passing glance. It had potential "okay" moments that lasted a split second, only to be torn from poor writing, coattail riding, and whiney actors (LeBron James). Poor writing is just that: poor writing. However coattail writing speaks of the first one being so great that they banked on its success bringing this one good profits and supporting ratings. LeBron James, well he whines about everything (pay, politics, playing time, etc). I feel bad that Don had to carry this movie for a bad rating payout!

reviews.review_title: Part 1s are usually better than Part 2s
reviews.content: Good acting in basketball court doesn't mean it goes the same with movies. Atleast he tried.🙂
It was really entertaining and was made for all ages.Much better than the original.

reviews.review_title: Haters gonna hate. It's a fun movie.
reviews.content: Enjoyable kids movie. People hated on the original too.

reviews.review_title: Was excited to watch it after not caring much about it leading up to it and I was not disappointed.
reviews.content: Fun movie, great animation, great music and the GOAT LeBron. Me and the family thoroughly enjoyed it. A bit cheesy at times but I guess you can expect that for a children's movie. Had fun watching it and was better and funnier than I expected.

When the movie started, it started with a very weak LeBron performance, but that's normal. LeBron IS NOT AN ACTOR. For me, the movie has fulfilled everything and more. I love all the references they have added from Warner movies. 100% recommended for the whole family.

reviews.review_title: Possibly the worst film I've ever seen
reviews.content: Enjoyed nothing about this movie. I got free tickets to watch it and I still think that was over priced.
It was a good movie for kids and family, and a lot WB shows was there.

reviews.review_title: Crazy enjoyable, better than the original
reviews.content: Incredible flick, Lebron solidified his legacy on and off the court. Looking forward to nominations, I expect Cheadle to be getting some accolades for his supporting role.

The movie did start slow, and to compound more problem on the already slow start, the story line was predictable from the start of the movie to the end. I literally slept twice while watching the movie. They should do better. They had a good cast, however the writing, and probably acting didn't do justice.In any case, you can see the movie, but don't expect anything extra.

Personally I don't care about the LeBron, Jordan problem, all I wanted to see was the looney toons play basketball in their own looney way, this movie did exactly that perfectly, the 1st space jam did almost nothing with the looney toons (just note I watched the 1st space jam 2 days before legacy came out), Legacy used all of the character's perfectly, coyote being the mvp of the match no doubt, roadrunner doing a tornado, Lola doing her thing, grandma beating the heck out of Damian, the bird (forgot his name) dunking the ball which was amazing lol, I thought LeBron's acting was a bit better than Jordan's but they were both basically the same. The 1st movie did almost nothing with the looney's during the game, so stop crying you LeBron haters, and just enjoy the KIDS movie.

reviews.review_title: Great for what it's supposed to be.
reviews.content: I don't understand you weirdos that expect an Oscar performance from a basketball player... It's a kid movies, it's not supposed to be a great film.

reviews.review_title: Not the classic and I'm happy it wasn't
reviews.content: Thought the film was great. Loved the story, the look and feel. Lebron's acting was on par of Jordan's so no need to compare. Gave me just as much excitement as the original when I was a kid... Realized it's not for my generation right away so wasn't hard to let go and enjoy a family flick. Overall gave it a 10 for fun story, cgi, classic characters, Easter eggs and overall good time!

This movie was awesome. Don't get me wrong, growing up in the 90s I loved the original, and this movie not only makes it's own stance but brings accolades to its predecessor. This is not a reboot and does not pretend to b, but draws on the original and builds upon it. I see a lot of people criticizing this for not having heart like the original, however, rewatching the original and comparing to the sequel, I would argue this had a lot more heart to it.The original, was so focused on how great Michael Jordan thought he was, that he was the only one that could save the day. On this movie, it was not only about saving LeBron's family but also about being who you are and pursuing what you love.There were a lot of great throw backs and references to the first, not negating the first movie. But there were also a lot of great references to the WB universe as a whole. Anyone who enjoyed Ready Player One could relate to all of the Easter Eggs and could see past the anger for the sequel.I get that not everyone is a fan of LeBron like they were of Jordan, however, unlike the first movie, I didn't feel like this was a LeBron fan movie, like the first was a Jordan fan movie. This movie had a lot of heart and I enjoyed watching this with my son.
Good family movie, better animation. Get the jokes.

reviews.review_title: not the worst or the best
reviews.content: There was a big build up for space jam 2 and just doesn't hit the mark really in any way. Some scenes were so good/funny but then others were just so boring/unwatchable at times. Compared to the first one this movie felt like they were just fast forwarding and everything was so rushed, needed time to build up at the start. 3/10.

This movie is the definition of the movie quantity over quality. Technology is the focus of the movie, and not much else. The acting is horrible. The looney toons act like a 3 year old who was born in 2017 would assume them to act like. Lola the bunny and Bugs DID NOT flirt with each other ONCE. In fact, Lola's entire role was just being the "team player" and inspiration for the team. The "we can do this if we put our hands together!" classic POS conceptualization. They say movies have become more sensitive to the audience. This movie is the definition of tailoring to the general audience. It is so "average" that it makes me gag a little. This is not looney toons, this is "let's make sure our 3 year old gets exposure to inspiration figures that can teach valuable lessons" tunes.
Tf is wrong with people. This was an enjoyable kids movie. Just sit back relax and just enjoy!!

reviews.review_title: Reminder: movie is for little kids
reviews.content: This movie was loved by every single kid I've seen and is only meant for children, all these adults are hating on a movie meant for 7 year old children jokes are cheesy and movie was predictable but it is all meant for children. I haven't seen a single kid call the movie any less then amazing which is what the goal was.

reviews.review_title: i never watch this film but i will give it a ten
reviews.content: The reason i give it a ten cuz it contain rick and morty in it.

reviews.review_title: My thoughts on space Jam a new legacy minor spoilers
reviews.content: I want to start off this review that I have a huge fan of the original space jam. It has a place in my heart. So having said that after it was announced I was not very optimistic of this film. I went in not trying to compare this to the original and go in with an open mind. So after viewing the film I have to say I did not enjoy it . It was very lackluster and the acting was horrid In my personal opinion. It made me really want to watch the first one. Lebron isn't that good of an actor and I really wanted at least a Jordan cameo. One good thing was that there was a lot of Warner bros cameos and references which I found pretty cool. Overall it's not really that good maybe a kid might like it but fans of the original will not enjoy. I was expecting a micheal Jordan cameo and I got really excited went they alluded that he was coming to help. But they turn it into a joke with micheal b Jordan and it left me with a sour feeling. Having said that I really think it was not a good film no where near the original there were some really good jokes that made me chuckle a bit but other than that the jokes fell flat mainly it was aimed towards kids not fans of the original. So I give space jam a new legacy a 3/10. Let me know what you thought of the movie.

reviews.review_title: Thank God I didn't listen to the bad reviews
reviews.content: Is it just popular now to bash every movie and over analyze and criticize every little thing. I almost didn't bring my kids to this movie cause of all the bad reviews but I listened to my gut and ignore the over criticism. It's not a perfect movie but it is a fun movie. I mean come on its amovie about a basketball player playing with the looney toons stop criticizing these movies like they are Oscar contenders. I say go see it with a mind set of having fun with the family.
I couldn't get past on how bad the acting from everyone was. Even the well known actors were awful. The story was boring and predictable. This movie will be forgotten.

People have forgotten how silly the original Space Jam was. Michael Jordan was a terrible actor. The plot was just as simple and full of plot holes. Do people think WB was going for an Oscar nod with this movie? It's exactly what it's supposed to be. A nod to the classic with a ton of improvements. We're so numb to effects today we've forgotten how far we've come from the original. The FX and sound were amazing. LeBron was way more animated and invested in his role than Michael ever was. The jokes were incredibly cheesy. But good lord people...it's the LOONY Tunes. It's always been this way. Watch this movie as the 10-year old that watched and grew up with the classic and you won't regret it. Watch it as an ogre wannabe movie critic who has no business watching kids movies, and you will be VERY disappointed.

If you're giving it a bad review solely based on personal feelings for LeBron James, your "review" isn't a "review" but an opinion piece. The movie was entertaining, although it Amy not have captured the same magic as the original, we enjoyed the character crossovers. Enjoyable.

reviews.review_title: Unless you hate yourself, skip it
reviews.content: LeBron James vanity piece. I'd rather watch a Progressive Insurance commercial on a loop for 2 hours.
TRASH. They should've never made a sequel. Extremely disappointed!

Just another way to ruin a classic film, nothing special about this movies besides the WB Characters... lebron ruined this film with his terrible acting! Maybe we can wait another 25years for a good Sequel.

reviews.review_title: Turned it off after 40 minutes of run time
reviews.content: Absolute garbage. Turned it off after 40 minutes and rewatched the original instead. Don't bother wasting your time watching this.
Lebron is a great voice actor! He can use some work on screen lol but the movie as a whole was very enjoyable and entertaining. Nice writing, execution, and cast! I'll rate it 7/10!

This movie was terrible from start to finish. There were exactly 8 people in the cinema for this, 4 left before the end, not a single laugh or a snicker the entire movie, literally enjoyed my popcorn helluva lot more than this garbage.Oh, yeah - You will never live up to MJ and Kobe, Lebron, get over it.
I thought the movie was awesome. I liked it when they went through Warner Bros movies. Great family movie.

reviews.review_title: A New Legacy Doesn't Drop the Ball
reviews.content: Must a film be lauded by critics to be loved by the common folk? Must a film be a depressing tale of Oscar winning sorrow to be considered good? I think not. Space Jam: A New Legacy certainly doesn't add up if you think about it too hard, but is a delightful romp in looney goodness.

reviews.review_title: A Fun Movie About Basketball and Cartoon Characters
reviews.content: I understand why many people are not very fond of LeBron James, I'm not a fan of him either, but that doesn't mean we have the right to discredit what he has done for the game of basketball and what he has brought to the game. Do I think he's a perfect human being? No. Do I think he's the GOAT? No. But I respect him, 'cause he's a great family man and a great player. And this goofy movie about basketball and cartoon characters is just that, a goofy movie about basketball and cartoon characters. What did you expect? Oscar-worthy acting and screenplay? I think if there was a God of Basketball in Greek mythology, it would've been Michael Jordan, but it annoys me how some people act like he was the greatest actor of all time. This movie is different from the original, and I liked that. I personally think it's better than the original, but that's just my personal opinion. It's not a movie you'd watch alone to give you food for thought and make you contemplate your existence, but it's very fun to watch with your family and I respect that.

The new movie is packed with special effects, but it doesn't compare with the original version and its story. It's not a matter of LeBron vs Jordan: It's a matter of not being original. The movie felt forced and a mere attempt to glorify LeBron. As much as I like him, I didn't really like the film. I guess I expected much, much, much more. I liked the cartoons more than the actual "actors", and that says it all.

reviews.review_title: Every bit as flawed as its predecessor
reviews.content: People really like to hate this movie apparently. I don't see what makes this movie a 4.4 versus Space Jam's 6.5 though.The animation in both is great. There's product placement. The story is sloppy. The acting is mediocre at best, at least from the main character. Voice acting is fine. They're both completely watchable, in fact they are fun movies.I'd say the main thing that separates these is time. We have more realistic CG animation now, which makes this movie look higher budget than the original. I was surprised to find out that the difference in budget is not /that/ large (when accounting for inflation). It's about a $10M increase.I think this movie deserves to be criticized but not to the point of completely glossing over its positives.I recommend this movie to anyone who enjoys cartoons, and doesn't take movies like this super seriously.

I gotta Say Lola Bunny in this Squeal as more Character development Which I like and she Represents the heart of a movie For the audience As well building a father and Son moment between Dom and LeBron Visual facts hands-down by Industrial light n magic ILM Do a very good job on the visual effects on the CG characters outstanding and also I do love the soundtrack as for Looney Tunes they do What they're know best for The jokes in the movie Are very clever as for the villains very creative the goon squad they look pretty cool and pretty scary and threatening on screen I give this movie All day son Best movie of July and Summer of 2021.

What disappointed me most about this Space Jam movie was the lack of a decent soundtrack. The original space jam soundtrack was iconic. This movie had a terrible (and almost non-existent) soundtrack.The movie itself was bad. There was hardly any focus at all on the "Goon Squad" villains and their motivation. The main villain (Al G Rhythm) was awful.Put simply, this movie should have never need made. I bet I have watched the original Space Jam over 50 times growing up.
