I was really hoping for a fun, heartfelt successor to the original Space Jam movie, but all we get is 2 hours of disappointment from a Hollywood money grab. But hey, I'm sure they'll sell plenty of merchandise/toys. Way to go.

The animation,action,comedy are all top notch. People are saying its not like 1996 you need to understand thats 1996 and this is 2021. Everything changed. This is a cartoon movie, looney tunes playing basketball not a long marvel series You dont need a oscar story for this type of movies.just enjoy it.

The movie was far better than the first creation. LeBron did a much better job at acting than Michael Jordan. The animation was excellent. Plot line was authentic. Most people giving bad reviews were going to give bad reviews regardless. Like Granny said, "Haters are gonna hate."

reviews.review_title: Space Jam: A New Legacy THOUGHTS
reviews.content: When I first heard there was going to be a new Space Jam reboot (sometime after watching the 1996 film for the first time during the 2020 pandemic), I became convinced that Hollywood really tries to play up the classics by rebooting EVERYTHING. Star Wars, Halloween, Jay & Silent Bob, the list never ends.It goes without saying that the original Space Jam is a Warner Brothers classic. It's a funny throwback film with a sense of fun and escapist wonder. My first viewing of the film was a smooth and unique experience that I often have with cult classics.Fast forward a year later in the pandemic's aftermath, and I'm with four other friends watching A New Legacy in theaters. Like many reboots, it incorporates tropes synonymous with the term Generation Z. It involves smartphones, technology, groundbreaking Computer Animated Imagery (CGI), and what better way to incorporate Basketball than to put a big shot like LeBron James on the big screen (in the same way Michael Jordan filled the role of an iconic basketball superstar in 1996).Spoilers ahead, this is your final warning. So let's talk about the plot. It begins in 1998 with a young LeBron James becoming distracted by video games and learns that he needs to "apply all" of he wishes to play basketball. He throws out a used original Nintendo GameBoy his friend gives him and we cut to a montage of James's career playing over the opening credits like the first movie. In the present day, James has a family including two sons, one who plays basketball often and his other son Dom (who loves video games) who is a child prodigy that can actually program and homebrew his own video games.James and his family visit the Warner brothers studio and Dom takes an interest in the studio software known as Al-G Rhythm, who traps James and Dom into virtual reality. Al-G takes Dom as a prisoner and attempts to use him to beat his father (the LeBron James) in a basketball game, where Al-G instructs James to assemble a team of players for a basketball game in the span of 24 hours.James meets Bugs Bunny in Tune World (and only Bugs, as every other Looney Tune left Tune World thanks to Al-G convincing them to explore other realities by being in crossovers of properties such as Mad Max, Wonder Woman, ect), and essentially reunites the original Tune Squad (sans Pepé Le Pew due to the Culture Wars), and once the Tune Squad is reassembled, Al-G kidnaps every Warner Brothers properties (including R-rated films like It (Pennywise)and A Clockwork Orange) and kidnaps people from the REAL WORLD on their phones to watch the game, the James family withstanding.Al-G then "upgrades" the Tune Squad by rendering the Looney Tunes in an astonishing CGI. Tune Squad goes up against Goon Squad, consisting of video game characters Dom designed led by Dom himself. During the first half, Goon Squad outnumbers Tune Squad heavily, and as if that wasn't bad enough, the biggest letdown occurred. During the halftime break, Sylvester attempts to recruit former Tune Squad member Michael Jordan (from the 1996 film) but accidentally locates Michael B. Jordan instead. I genuinely fell for that, and I have no idea why they did that. Yeah it was a funny joke and all, but at least have Michael Jordan give LeBron James a little wisdom to bring strength to the group, ya know?So in the final half of the basketball game, LeBron tells Dom that he no longer wants to stand in the way of his dreams, and Buggs welcomes him into the Tune Squad with Al-G assuming control of Goon Squad. The Looney Tunes use their cartoon physics to make a comeback and the Tune Squad ends up winning when Bugs sacrifices himself by pulling a glitch maneuver that deletes him and posterizes Al-G, basically offing him. The movie then ends with Bugs actually surviving and walking off into the sunset w LeBron.When I walked out of the theater, I felt that the movie, while not as good as the original (for a few reasons),can still pass as mindless entertainment the first time around. It's a pretty funny movie that's worth a watch, despite the negative reviews. One scene in particular that had me laughing in my seat was when during the big game, the Tune Squad turns into a group of rappers with Porky the pig roasting Al-G, it came out of nowhere and it was pretty hilarious.The characters, while not memorable to the 1996 film's degree, were still fun. LeBron James and his family dynamic intertwining with the current state of Looney Tunes (both literally and figuratively) attempted to make a stronger story out of the original while introducing modern themes. I'm almost under the impression that the title A New Legacy can be a reference to Gen Z.In conclusion, I walked into Space Jam: A New Legacy with fairly low expectations (sans hoping Michael Jordan shows up), and I walked out mostly satisfied. Not one hundred percent moved (like with It (2017) and The Iron Giant (1999)), but satisfied. I went out to the movies with my friends for a fun night, and the Looney Tunes came through.

reviews.review_title: LeBron: A Loony Toon Love Fest shoudl be the title of this movie.
reviews.content: NOT SPACE JAM. Everything about this movie is wrong from the title on. The first Hour is nothing more than making LeBron James a god, the king of basketball. Look, LeBron James may be a good basketball player but he is by no means a king let alone the greatest. This movie is NOTHING compared to the Original Space Jam with Michael Jordan. First off, it has NOTHING to do with space. It's the interweb, or more accurately, a Warner Bros.'s Server that's connected to the internet and has a very powerful AI system known as AL-G- Rhythm or something like that. Lebron James wants his kids to excel in basketball and thus, must work for it at all cost. In other words, all work and no play regardless of how unhappy it makes his family. Basketball is everything and the ONLY thing. His youngest son would rather create video games and go to a video gaming creation camp but LeBron has other plans to send him to basketball camp. His youngest created a Basketball Video Game and has scanned players using a software program on his phone. Though while showing his dad the game crashes and Dom (Lebron's Son), loses his character. WB's Studio's AI comes up with an idea for LeBron James to.join the studio but LeBron has other ideas. This ticks off Al and so Al kidnaps Dom and the movie begins.Okay, actually the movie has been playing for an hour with nothing really happening. The Loony Toons are cameo's in mostly really bad movies like Mad Max. This really is more about WB's trying to put a bunch of old movies that they've made and splice them into the Loony Toons with an Hour and 20 minutes dedicated to worshiping LeBron James. You're sick of hearing LeBron James within the first 5 minutes of the movie. Kids were so bored and though this was so stupid they hated it. Even the cameo's of the different movies were horrible interpretations of them. Like The Mask, The Matrix, Superman, Batman, Wonder Woman and the list goes on. This is really horrible special effects and bad makeup of the recreation of characters.If you think you must watch this movie, fast forward to the 1 hour and 20 minute mark and watch the last 30 minutes because nothing else is worth watching. Took us 4 days to finally get through it because after 15 to 20 minutes of watching we were all so bored we lost interest. This is a VERY LONG AND DRAWN OUT MOVIE. Pretty sad and LeBron is definitely NO MICHAEL JORDAN. It's very narcissistic and really makes you hate basketball. When the Toons end up playing in the game to save Dom, they do a weird cross between realistic and animated skin which is a lot like The New Loony Toons where everyone is deformed and cheap looking. In this case, OVERLY animated.It finally had a decent moral but WB's totally missed the mark on this one and should change the name to "LeBron James: A Loony Toons' Love Fest.

I've watched it five times now. I thought it was cute, funny and my kids and I even played a game to see how many other characters we could spot in certain places.

reviews.review_title: Better than the original in most ways
reviews.content: I am surprised how low this has scored, its not a bad movie, not even a bad space jam. It works for those who it is aimed at (kids!)I have enjoyed the original Space Jam since I was a kid, but had no particular attachment to it, nor a huge desire to see the new one.As my kids have recently been introduced to the looney tunes (via the golden collection dvd boxset) and really enjoy them, they wanted to see the new film.Although they had seen the original once, it was a while back, so we watched it again the night before.Both the children and the adults enjoyed the new film at least as much as the original. My main criticism of the new one is how long it is before you see any looney tunes! My daughter (5) was getting restless, so they should have shortened the back story a bit and maybe had more incidents of the looney tunes popping up to remind the kids they were watching the right film.The kids particularly thought the new one looked better. The adults enjoyed the story more, although I wonder how much sense the children made of the slightly abstract concept of a computer world and a personified algorithm - a very topical theme but possibly a little deep for younger ones.I think that a particular merit goes to including more of the looney tunes characters in the game, and being quite creative with the game, something that doesn't happen much in the original and is limited in who you see. My children have their favourite characters, but my sons (roadrunner) makes fleeting appearances in the original, but plays a much more major role in this one, as do many others.I would also like to comment how it's nice to see a mainstream kids film with a majority black cast. Living in a very white area, my children have asked why some people are brown, because they are so rare, so I think it's good they can see films about things they like (cartoons), rather than the all too common tokenism of minor parts being filled by black actors.
Kids loved it and were laughing the whole time. Not sure why everyone is hating on this movie. It's a kids movie, not an Oscar contender.
Just plain trash. Doesn't even deserve a detailed review. Don't waste your time with this one.

I have watched this movie twice with my 4 year old who knew nothing about Looney Tunes or King James. He loves it. I grew up watching LooneyTunes cartoons so this is a treat to watch in modern day. It's a relatable story line for any father or parent trying to balance the art of listening and teaching their child to follow their passion with a plan and work ethic. #blackfatherslovetheirfamiliestoo.

reviews.review_title: It just goes on and on and on
reviews.content: This movie looks like they took the original Space Jam as an example and remade every scene, but added the extremeness of it by about 200%. With about 45 minutes of movie to go, the game starts, and it will take those 45 minutes to actually wrap it up. There is no training montage, before but a small compilation of scenes of Bugs and 'King' James where they get back all of the Looney Tunes from the other franchise planets because... Well, I don't know why they're on other planets, actually. They tried to explain, but it was such a weird explanation, it was the most cheap plot device ever.So, no real training can be seen (they even acknowledge the fact that Babs is the only one who can play basketball), and a second before the game starts LeBron angers everyone by making the Tunes actually play like him (and failing). Creatively, it all feels really cheap. The best jokes are Daffy turning into CGI and saying "Oh, I feel expensive!" and Sylvester saying "It's been 25 years, I thought he aged gracefully!", that's it. This movie wasn't needed. I didn't need to watch it.And how could they kill off Bugs Bunny with such an emotional tearjerker like that? It's like they took the scene from the original where Bugs saves Babs and gets slammed doing it, but now turned it into something where he could actually die. Bugs Bunny shouldn't die, he's a fricking Looney Tune!

Space Jam: A New Legacy is a SLAM DUNK!!!! I loved space jam 2.Me, My dad, And my sisters enjoyed it too, I loved all the cameos.And everything else. I saw a lot of hate for the movie, and i don't know why.At the end of the day: Ignore all the haters, It is a great movie that i would recommend.

This movie actually is terrible.This movie sent me to a dark place where the only feeling I could ponder was existential dread. I had read a review on letterboxd of a man who had seen this movie. The review itself was several long paragraphs that explained the despair this film caused him. The reviewers vocabulary and grammatical prowess was beyond anything i've ever seen for a mailman review before. My friends and I found this review kind of funny, being that it was about Space Jam. We decided we were going to watch the movie just to see how bad it was.WARNING:
IT WAS AWFULThis movie is 2 hours of burning hot garbage. I respect Lebron James as a basketball player, but he cannot act. The visuals in this film are jarring and overwhelming, even the 2d animation hurts my eyes. Throughout the entirety of this 2 hour film I could not retain more than 1 or 2 plot points. The whole movie was essentially a Lebron James and Warner Bros advertisement. I've never found a film that's more of an abomination than this one, I genuinely never wanted to turn off a movie more. The reviewer on Letterboxd was correct, I can hardly hear the word Space Jam without having a panic attack. The dread this film caused me is still effective days later. Please, don't watch this movie. Tell your entire family to not watch this movie. The only people that will like this movie are toddlers.THIS REVIEW IS NOT SATIRE.

Grew up with the first one and while I acknowledge that it has plenty of faults- I feel that the first movie was more fun than this one.Lebron's acting is on par with or a smidge better than Michael Jordan's, but somehow they managed to make the story STRANGER in this one. Yes- stranger than cartoon aliens challenging an abducted Michael Jordan to a basketball game. An A. I. in the basement of Warner Bros can digitize humans into the virtual world- which no one seems to bat an eye at in this reality for some reason.I love that they atleast had SOME 2D animation in this- although, ironically, the animation in the '96 version is objectively better. More fluid atleast, for the most part, than in most of of this new version. But hey- budget. On that note- the 2D Nerdluck aliens make a cameo at the final game and they look like they were literally ripped from the first movie. And they were the only 2D characters in the scene where all the toons were turned 3D by the AL-gorithm. I would've liked to see the nerdlucks in CGI for the first time!I didn't expect much and got maybe a teensy bit more than that from this. reviews.review_title: The storyline is alright but Crossovers between Franchises is a highlight of this film
reviews.content: For a starter, I am not a fan of LeBron at all as I only want to see this for a couple of reasons; I am a fan of Looney Tunes and crossovers. So, I wish that they shouldn't have included a real-life celebrity as a leading star of the film and just focus on Looney Tunes characters traveling across the Warnerverse by saving it from this film villain as it would work best for me. Anyway, I was blown away by a cameo appearance by a pair of the titular characters from an adult animation in a FREAKING kid film which is insane to me which kids watching this portion wouldn't get it at...all!!! Well, aside from Lebron stuff...this film is pretty enjoyable and I admired how animation style from other franchises like Rick and Morty and DC marge with Looney Tunes just like in Live-Action crossovers, and it was a blast. I would recommend this if u want to just see Looney Tunes traveling across the Warnerverse.

reviews.review_title: Warner needs to realize making a movie/animation is more than just filling the 2-hour period of your audiences
reviews.content: I just want to start with what was wrong and then I'll mention the good parts at the end* TBH, I'm not a Lebron hater at all but man this dude should stick to his basketball. I know he tried to do it but in my eyes he failed as an actor. The first 20 minutes of the movie felt like a documentary to me. There was nothing special about it and well it took 2 minutes until you would realize about the father-son problems.* Another thing is the looney toons appearance. I appreciated the fact that they included most of the iconic characters in looney toons but I feel like the only ones who mattered were Bugs & a bit Lola. Daffy and Porky and many other characters were not in the spotlight. They just used coyote & mig mig jokes many times during the game and I guess the writers forgot other characters do exist too. The funny thing is I don't remember seeing speedy doing anything on the field even though he is supposed to be the fastest one :)* Being predictable is another problem but since this is just a family friendly product that you might watch it once for laughter (if you found anything that much funny throughout the movie) , I'd rather cross this one out.Overall, There are many things wrong about Space Jam 2 but still, it might bring some joy to you. Especially kids who will probably find it good too. But Warner missed an amazing opportunity for having a cool cross-over movie. There was many easter eggs and of course the appearance of other iconic characters out of the looney toons universe too but in reality, none of them mattered. I tried to not care about the reviews when I was going to watch it for the first time but I ended up having the same idea as 90% of everyone in here.

Grow up snowflakes.

reviews.review_title: Wanted to like it, but couldn't look past big issues.
reviews.content: Space Jam - A New Legacy - 4/10 - Very meh, but it was somewhat entertaining, probably more so for the kids. There were little nods to the original - yes it is a sequel and the first movie did happen - which was kinda cool. I thought they might act like the original never happened, but they acknowledge it in several ways. Some surprise appearances were funny, like Michael B. Jordan and the original monstars in the crowd, but wasn't a fan of a similar intro about Lebron's life. Should've done something new. It felt at times as a worse reboot of the original, but if you see it as just a movie on its own then it did have its moments.I liked the reverse of the original where Lebron was a cartoon in their world as opposed to the original where they made the Looney's more human / 3D like. The morale of the story is good, the story itself not that much, but the original also had a silly setup. Don Cheadle tried his best, but lacked the villainous traits to sell his character. Lebron is probably the worst in terms of acting, which I expected, so that's another reason I like the cartoon. Unfortunately this changes for the game itself and the Goon Squad didn't look good or cool in my opinion. Dame Times was probably the worst scene of the movie. The biggest issues I had with it aside from Cheadle and Lebron are: the lack of certain Looney Tunes, lack of side stars and the basketball game.Let's start with the game, which didn't feel like a basketball game but just lots of gimmicks and fast paced scenes to show off animation. This ties in with the lack of Looney Tunes, as WB showed off a lot their own films and characters, which I didn't really have much of a problem with since the Looney Tunes still had a big part of this film. A common critique I disagree with is that the Looney Tunes don't play a big part, which was my worry, but that's not the case at all. There is however a lack of certain characters to shine, in my opinion Speedy Gonzales - voiced by Fluffy Gabriel Iglesias - should've gotten way more lines and while's he really tiny, him not appearing for long stretches was odd. The back and forth between Tweety and Sylvester lacked as well and Taz would've thrived in the craziness of the game, but they didn't capitalize on his 'talent'. Side stars in terms of people appearing as themselves or comedians to make it funny, like the original, was lacking. A certain NBA legend in terms of broadcasting making a significant appearance was cool though. That is another reason I would've loved more Speedy since Fluffy's lines are definitely the funniest of the movies.All in all, for children probably entertaining enough, but Lebron lacked MJ's charisma to really make this memorable, the Looney Tunes had their moments but could've been better, casting was a bit of a disappointment and the basketball players as the Goon Squad barely left a mark. Glad I was able to download it and not waste a few hours going to the theatre. Since I'm not a fan of WB and given how poor some of their own characters looked, it did feel a bit cheap to make all these references to their own products. The message of the movie was good even if poorly executed due to bad acting, but I managed to sit through it, so a 4 is in some ways very forgiving. Looney Tunes saved it from being a 2 or even a 1.

reviews.review_title: While having it's moments, "Space Jam: A New Legacy" lacks the personality of its predecessor.
reviews.content: *Some spoilers for the original "Space Jam," and "Space Jam: A New Legacy."When I was eight years old, my younger brother and I fell in love with the original Space Jam. We had grown up on watching "Looney Toons" every morning before school and on the weekends, and seeing that combined with the greatness of Michael Jordan was something to behold. I've seen the movie countless times, and I still enjoy it to this day. As I've grown, I've been able to recognize that "Space Jam" is, in fact, not the perfect movie I once thought it to be. Let's be honest, MJ isn't a very good actor, the writing is funny at times, and the story is lackluster. However, the things that carried "Space Jam" to cult status were:A. That absolute banger of a theme song.B. Solid replication of the original "Looney Toons" magic.C. The authentic message and overall heart that the movie has.The same cannot be said about "Space Jam: A New Legacy."To me, and probably a lot of audience members, extreme corporate influence takes away from the authenticity of a film. It felt like non-stop, Warner Brothers were constantly reminding me about all of the things that they own. There's moments in the movie that make you forget you're watching a movie about one of the greatest basketball players of all-time playing the sport alongside a group of zany, iconic characters, and feel like your HBO cut away to a five minute commercial break where they show you all the other things you could be watching instead. It left a bad taste in my mouth, as if Warner Bros. Were gloating that they had the rights to all these properties. The cheapest way to try and mooch points from your audience is to hit them with non-stop nostalgia instead of coming up with original scenes. Instead of trying to etch iconic moments into the "Looney Toons" lore, they just throw out the "Foghorn Leghorn is in Game of Thrones gag" or "Speedy Gonzales and Granny are in The Matrix gag." Frankly, it's insulting and cheap to try and act as though those jokes are funny or original. Those properties have been parodied millions of times, and by adding on to the pile, you're just beating a dead horse.In the original "Space Jam", Michael Jordan has a great chemistry with the toons. While it is a bit silly and cheesy at times, it absolutely captures the essence of "Looney Toons." The jokes are genuinely funny and it feels as though there is substance there, with or without Jordan. In the original, the Toons have quotable moments that have stuck with me for years. However in this movie, the Toons lack their iconic personalities except for in little, forgettable bursts. There isn't a single moment or quote from the toons that I remember, and I just watched the movie 30 minutes ago. I felt genuinely robbed of seeing some of my all-time favorite characters come back to life on screen. Just because Bugs Bunny says "Eh... what's up, Doc?" doesn't make him Bugs Bunny. It felt like nothing more than a shallow interpretation of the characters that are so profound and lovable. The original was Michael Jordan AND The Looney Toons. This movie is LeBron James (and the Looney Toons are kind of, sort of around.)The message portrayed in "Space Jam" was genuine. People idolized "His Airness." He's one of the, if not the, most prolific athletes in American History. There is a reason the phrase "Be Like Mike" was used. People wanted to be like Michael Jordan. He's successful, charismatic, and the definition of a man who would do anything to push his team to the top. The Toons come to find out that they can't beat the MonStars if they try and replicate Jordan, but instead find themselves discovering the individual things that make them unique and special to access their true strengths. The message was to believe in yourself and be confident in your own abilities to be the best person that you can be. The movie never directly spelled it out for you, but even as a child, I fully understood the message. I think the writers for "Space Jam: A New Legacy" wanted to make the message as clear as possible, because it was though every five minutes there was some dialogue about 'I don't want to play basketball! I want to be a gamer!" or LeBron saying something about fundamentals and making his kid do something he didn't want to do. Being hit over the head with the message the entire movie really doesn't make me appreciate the lesson that they're trying to sell.To say this movie was unwatchable is false. It's no masterpiece, and it certainly isn't the original, but it has it's enjoyable moments. I found that there was little moments that made me genuinely smile or laugh. LeBron poked some fun at himself here and there in reference to old memes which were funny at times. I've seen a lot of people in these reviews talking about how "LeBron is the worst actor they've ever seen" and things like that. No, LeBron doesn't give an Oscar worthy performance in this movie. But, if you look back to the original, neither does Michael Jordan. It's not really about that, and to me, it's unfair to judge either of these movies based on the performances of James or Jordan.As a fan of the original, I will most likely be seeing this movie again. I'll put it bluntly. The story is uninteresting, the writing is mediocre at best, and the corporatism is so blatant that it's nauseating. It's not a good movie. There was more times I laughed because of something cringeworthy over something legitimately funny that happened in the movie. Would I say it was a bad experience? No. Even though many of the aspects of a good movie were missing, when you watch this movie, you can honestly tell how much fun LeBron, Don Cheadle, and co. Are having during the production. Don't take it too seriously, and you might find yourself enjoying the experience like I did.Just a few recommendations:A. Don't see this movie in theaters. Watch it at home with friends or people who enjoyed the original. Being able to poke fun at some of the cringeworthy moments really added to my experience.B. Keep at least five bottles of Pepto Bismol on standby, just in case the sheer amount of cheap nostalgia goes straight to your stomach.Bonus points for the "Big Chungus" joke. The meme is beyond dead, but I respect that you left it in there.4/10.

reviews.review_title: Underwhelmed - The 1996 Original was Much Better.
reviews.content: Nike wins an Oscar for gratuitous logo placement in almost every scene.The plot is boring and drags along. Doesn't really go anywhere or get to the main event until the last half hour of the film. At least it gets remotely interesting from that point. (About halfway through, my 4yo restlessly piped up "Why is it taking so long?")Too many side thoughts become distracting from the main thread as Warner Bros tries desperately to cram in a reference / cameo to every franchise in its massive arsenal.Almost nothing is funny or humorous - which is disappointing for a movie based around looney tunes characters.The "acting" is cardboard and feels scripted. (I suppose that's what you get when there's nothing left in the talent budget after paying for the main elite athlete star.)If you are a Le Bron fan, this might just be passable.

They over used some cheesy after-effects tight focus blurring throughout all of the live-action + 3D toon scenes (which is most of the film), where only one character is in focus at 1080p and all the other characters look like they're 144p resolution. This is not just in a few key scenes, this is throughout the majority of the entire friggen movie! Even characters doing the talking or main action are often blurred out with focus placed on someone else. As if we're only allowed to pay attention to that character that's in focus and noone else. No bueno.I hope they do a new cut release with no blurring so I can enjoy the film in HD.Otherwise, the art was very competent and visually appealing. I just wish it wasn't all blurred out all the time.

The only thing I liked about this film were the references to other Warner bros stuff. I loved the scenes where they were recruiting the looney tunes, and they had to go into the other Warner bros properties, like DC, DC comics, casa Blanca etc. That was fun . The storyline was very bland. I honestly got bored with it real easily. The motivation for the characters wasn't very convincing. It was very one note and cliche. So this is more of a "play in the background, while you fold laundry/do chores" sort of movie.

reviews.review_title: I'd rather watch The Room on repeat for 2 days straight.

However, what I did mind was the fact they took away the classic 2-d animation and made the cartoons real. That was terrible. I did mind when they basically made every freaking call back they could to the first movie while also throwing in every other product that WB has in their pocket. And I did mind that WB decided to go with freaking Lebron James, China's superstar and all around dipstick. There are so many better, more refined basket ball players then the Loser of the Lakers. You want comedy, go watch the original. You want love between a father and son, go watch The Judge. You want Looney, get HBO MAX and watch the classics, it'll be cheaper then spending the $50-60 it'll cost to take your family out to see this doodle disaster.

In the first one, Michael Jordan played because they hitted Tweetie, in this one, its just for LeBron's Son. And the jokes... uuuuh i dont want to mention them. That's it. And the end was kind of bad to be honest. And also ¿Why are fans so mad at lola bunny's new desing?

The actor who played his son was authentic and great! Kept my eyes glued to the screen and not my iPhone! Would definitely recommend a watch!

reviews.review_title: It was actually really good for what I expected.
reviews.content: The movie is gonna do bad because people hate LeBron because he's better than their favorite player. I mean you guys are 40 year olds crying about a movie directed for kids. You're not a kid, you're going through a mid life crisis. It was great, and the repetition with Warner Bros was organized great. Because he was at Warner Bros talking to Warner Bros reps. I mean you guys have to be kidding, one of you guys really said "unrealistic", really... There is an unreasonable hate against LeBron and sadly their ignorance and stupidity might screw the rest of the casts and directors reputation a little. Great Movie, I recommend you watch it, and put your hate against LeBron down.

reviews.review_title: Ignore the haters and go see it, totally worth it.
reviews.content: 30 year old average joe here went to watch it with my 11 year old bro, and we totally loved it. The jokes are funny and the story has a big heart. The story is ok, i mean obviously its unreal and whatever but c'mon its the Looney Tunes, i mean taking into consideration the original one, both stories are completely unrealistic and what else. However, i dont go watching cartoons expecting and inch of reality and sense. I go to have a good laugh and have a great time and that is precisely what it delivers.Lebrons acting was ok, Jordan had more charisma yeah but LB performance is not bad. The rest of the characters are well done, specially his son Dom, i think he was also quite good and other family members had a coulpe of funny jokes and situations. Don Cheadle was great as the bad guy, he gave it all and was very pleased with the acting in general.Now for the laughs and jokes, i personally liked them a lot. I liked the fact that they placed the movie inside the Warner Bros universe, which compiles movies and subjects like DC, Harry Potter, Matrix, and Casablanca, to name a few. I had a laugh with the scenes involving the Looney Tunes appearing in all those classics, we all have watched over and over, it was very original and a good twist. The effects of course are waay better than the last one, the 3d models looked amazingly great.To finalize, i was very glad with the overall message of the story, which revolved around LB accepting the fact that his kid is different and that all passions are worth it. I think it is very meaningfull in this day and age, when we have kids more focused on electronics and videogames and we adults criticize them, just like our parents critisized us in their time. However, as LB puts it "you do you". I personally identified myself with LB and his son; when the 1st one came out i was a little Dom living on my world doing my things, now i feel like a LB trying to guide the youngers to my mentality and all, and it is here where we forget how we where the same, its all a cycle. In the end what matters most is family, and loving each other. The movie pictured this issue beatifully, it made me tear up a bit tbh.Anyways, ignore what other say, the movie is very enjoyable and has a great message. Take your kids with you or your siblings cousings, whatever. They will enjoy it and you might learn something about yourself too. Not as good as the original but still worth it. 7/10.

reviews.review_title: Look, we made all those movies! So what?
reviews.content: A disaster. I think the special effects team grabbed the first script from the drawer named "Rejected" and said "No one will notice". Another poorly written story with more commercials than a prime time TV show. I think WB desided to show all of its movies and characters here just to fill the minutes emptied by the lack of a story line.
Better than the first space jam, that one was awful.

reviews.review_title: The Citizen Cain of our Generation
reviews.content: This movie gave me reason to keep going on in life, it made me forget about my troubles working minimum wage. It has Oscar worthy acting and stars kInG lEBRoN! It was well worth the $80 in bringing out the FAM to movies. My only wish i could unwatch it, that way i can rewatch it again and again and recapture the magic johnson every time i'm feeling down.

I haven't given him the nod for the GOAT just yet- I still think MJ gets the nod for now... but I can smell the stank of Lebron haters. People... Rate the movie- not what you think about the person. This movie was wonderful, and my kids who just watched the original and enjoyed it, enjoyed this one just as much- if not more! Good movie. Well done. I would actually rate it a 7 or 8 but given the hate- I'm making it a 10. If you forget the unfair critics noise you will enjoy this movie! Good job Lebron, and all that put in the work to make this a reality 25 years later!

reviews.review_title: This movie is just a long advertisement
reviews.content:

LeBron dabs... yeah.

reviews.review_title: A bigger budget does not make a better movie
reviews.content: I personally find this a very difficult movie to summarise. It's really not good, but there are some entertaining aspects and ideas here despite what many reviews are saying. Yes, it is true it's basically a 2 hour ad for WB, but their visiting the various franchises to find the Looney Tunes was a nice idea - the problem I had was that this part was far too rushed and just not funny. The execution is a mess. There's just too much going on. It flits from franchise to franchise and it's just tiresome. You can tell the people in charge of the visuals and animation tried hard, but it feels exhausting to watch.There were surprisingly few moments involving the Looney Tunes that I cringed at, but at the same time they weren't particularly memorable either. In fact, they kind of felt like an afterthought as they're not directly involved in the main plot. Whereas in the first movie they need Michael Jordan to help them, here they just happen to be LeBron's team for no real reason. Speaking of LeBron, he's about as charismatic as a brick. No, Michael Jordan wasn't outstanding, but he at least had some screen presence. LeBron's acting is dreadful, and that includes his voice acting. He's just a complete and utter bore to watch, and just not entertaining enough to carry the movie. There were some amusing moments here and there, but this movie takes itself too seriously. The first movie is a lot simpler but I prefer it that way - it pokes fun at itself and the actors looked to have a good time. This movie was visually chaotic, and it all seemed so lifeless and fake. It had a needlessly convoluted plot that made no sense, and it was far too long. At almost 2 hours in length, I wish they'd have spent more time on introducing the Looney Tunes characters than the tedious basketball game itself. It's basically a big, soulless cash-grab with some funny moments.There was more 2D animation than I was expecting, and this was nice to see, but the movie overall was lacklustre. It very obviously had a much larger budget than the original, but that definitely doesn't make it a better movie. If you see this movie at all, see it for the visuals and animation. Otherwise, it's pretty terrible.Oh, and I'm also confused as to why they didn't have Bob Bergen voice Porky Pig in this movie. The guy who replaced him is okay, but Bergen's Porky is by far the best. It's just odd to me since Bergen is in the movie voicing Tweety when Porky is his speciality.

reviews.review_title: An A list lead wouldn't have changed how bad the movie was.
reviews.content: The animation was well done and fun to watch but everything else about the film just isn't worth the time.
What a disappointment. Sometimes it's better to leave a movie without a sequel.

People are getting so hyped in there heads that they are bassicly telling themselves its good when in reality the whole movie was poorly executed.If you look at the structure of the movie or lack of it misses the mark completely.Has little to no humour in it the movie dragged out and lebron was socially awkwardI wanted to love this movie so bad but all it ended up being was a huge mess and a huge shameful plug for WB and blatant advertising.

I thought this movie was good.It had its own storyline and was very good with the pop culture references .Of course all the "haters" are going to tear it apart because they think lebron is something he is not .Good movie I quite enjoyed it.

Not a slam dunk or even close. LeBron James is great as the main character.But Al G. Rhythm? Maybe this role should've gone to Chris Tucker or Ryan Reynolds or someone who can speak ironically but still be likable. Someone who can play against LeBron's personality type.This movie has no replay value.
All the horrible reviews are true, major pass on this one, my kids didn't even like it who are 5 and 2, worst movie ever.

Start watching this with my kids and their friends ages (15, 12, 12, 9, 8, 8, 5, 4), 15 minutes in they begged to watch something else. From the poor production to all the acting this was absolutely the worst movie we have attempted to watch.
The kid's love the movie. If you over 15 year's old and complain about this movie you just a big child the little children's love the movie.

I am so surprised that this movie has so many bad reviews. This movie was truly great and engaging! I think it's awesome, my family is all ages, they all loved it. Throughout the movie, there were jokes and references that filled the theatre with laughter. I think we can agree that always makes a great and fun movie experience. There is amazing acting and you can tell that an incredible amount of effort was put into editing and creating the movie. Definitely recommended and worth the watch!

Seriously what is this garbage, we watch for the WB cast not some goof that spends his time on Twitter. Should have been marketed under a different name, just a slap in the face of the original.
This movie makes me so angry. Jordan was so good, lebron terrible. However i dont know what was worse the writing or the acting.

Look...this isn't the best kids movie of all time, but it most certainly is not the worst! I am a 90s kid and 100% grew up on and LOVED the original. But honestly, I don't know anyone my age who didn't. We literally used to watch this in school! Please remember this was back in the day when movies (especially kids movies) were not so readily available and at our fingertips. And of course anything that included Michael Jordan at this time was an absolute home run (unlike his baseball career). See what I did there....I feel like there are more Lebron James haters than there are Space Jam 2 reviewers.Keep in mind, this is coming from a now, mid-thirties, Space Jam 1 enthusiast, but I really did enjoy this. Maybe it is because I was with my 6 year old daughter, who I constantly observed laughing and smiling from ear to ear while chomping on gummy bears, but I personally felt very entertained the whole time. The filmmakers really did a great job stuffing in "adult jokes" and throwbacks to the original. Not to mention the bright yellow suited 'Mask' character....what a fun treat.In summary, is it as good as Space Jam from 1996?? This "old man" says no. But is it worth checking out? You better believe it. Even if **SPOILER ALERT** sadly, there is no Bill Murray cameo :(

reviews.review_title: People have been way too critical
reviews.content: This was fun. Well worth a watch. Some aspects of movie are funny but main completion part of movie is the disappointment.As a hole it is a ripoff of TronHead algorithm (master control program) commandeers and modifies programs to suit its need, has Tron all over it. Even the part of using a type of scanner to digitize an actual person into digital space, and lets not forget the referee guy (bit)also has a little Ralph breaks the internet flavor showing a bunch of the entire WB scope of characters.

Cute, a good number of the jokes got me. I loved seeing the Warner properties in 2021, not to mention 3D. The plot was kinda trash, but for the most part I had a pretty good time with it. It's obviously not the original, but i think it did enough to separate itself.

I really looked forward this being that i absolutely loved the original. I was soooop disappointed in this movie.It has nothing like the feel of the original...the story doesnt flow...its only a commercial for Lebron it seems.I really hated it. Will stick to the original space jam for viewing.

Hold on, I'm getting up from my bent knees which have spent the last 60 minutes worshipping Lebron James. The movie takes him way too seriously. Very much in need of humorous self deprecation or SOMETHING that alludes to a shred of self awareness.Don Cheadle does well but is literally drowning in CGI.The original was endearing and capturing with lovable characters and an authentic Jordan. This knock off manages to turn Space Jam into Space James, who doesn't offer anything beyond his name. And the CGI is suffocating.

I love the jokes and all the inside jokes, it is however not going to be good unless you are old enough to get all of them it's filled with em, but I do agree the acting was loony, and it sent a good message to kids and dads.

He is taller, stronger, and faster than MJ. Better rebounder, passer, shooter, more skilled, and a more versatile defender. He has the body of Karl Malone and eyes of magic. He lived up to the hype and exceeded insane expectations. He deserves 10 stars for the 9 straight NBA finals he made. He absolutely ran the eastern conference. Won chips with 3 difference teams. Wil probably be the leading scorer ever as a pass first player.

It appears my feelings about this Space Jam are not exactly shared among quite a few users on this site, but I actually loved it. Does my love for LeBron bring a little bias to this? Sure it does, but no more than the back in the day Space Jam had people (myself included) wide eyed and holding our breath to see the basketball phenom of that time, Jordan, play himself alongside an equally preeminent cast of Looney Tune characters. I have seen more than a few comments about LeBron's acting and let's just say he's no DeNiro, but I also find it silly that people were expecting him to be. Jordan was awkward and clumsy with his delivery of lines in the original and, let's be honest, struggled even in commercials for taggless Hanes tees. That really was not the point though of Space Jam and mattered as little then as it does in this latest revival. LeBron actually does a surprisingly good job and in my opinion has better acting chops overall. Many have also pointed out the amount of advertising...and oh yes...it is shameless in this one as it seems someone got a bonus in the writing room for how many times they could put the words Warner Brothers in the script. But the first was no innocent and was borne literally out of a commercial for Nike. The plot is cute and relatable, although any sports fan might find it implausible being LeBron's son and not wanting to take advantage of that elite coaching. But, I digress. It is a self promoting studio project and has the feel of one as a steady stream of film critics have pointed out and so it relies heavily on people's good memories of Looney Tunes, childhood movie character cameos, and the hope we are all giddy to see how many we know and cheering when we see our childhood faves. At 50, though, I guess I am at the age where I actually found that enjoyable and nostalgic. One downside is the heavy use of CG which make the aesthetic kind of rough compared to the 2d moments, but Don Cheadle as AI G. Rhythm, King of the Serververse, is so good it makes you forget a little. This movie is family friendly for sure and it features not only other NBA stars like Anthony Davis, but it has some WNBA stars like Diana Taurasi as well. It was truly fun revisiting this basketball-tune wonderland again.

reviews.review_title: Just turn off your brain and enjoy the nonsense
reviews.content: Well, that movie wasn't as bad as the others are saying but it's not going to win any oscars anytime soon either. The movie is ludicrous as to be expected, as the plot is razor thin, but if you just came to watch just the Looney Tunes like I did and just wanted to see how this one fairs to the original then you might actually be able to enjoy the movie a bit.The Plot: What plot? The plot is so barebones that it might as well not exist. If you've seen the trailers then you know what to expect because there's no twists or turns to speak of at all. LeBron goes to a Warner Bros. Meeting, they pitch him to be the face of the brand, he doesn't like fun CGI, his son gets abducted because he's smart, and to win him back from Don Cheadle he has to get the Looney Tunes back in action. That's it. The plot is actually funnier if you imagine the woman playing his wife in this movie as just Michael Burnham going into a Looney Tunes holodeck program. The story stunk so bad that when my co-worker asked if it was worth watching, she told me that I wasn't selling her the movie well enough to go see it.What I Liked: I liked the cameos of the various Warner Bros. Brands including Superman, Wonder Woman, and even Rick and Morty (didn't know they belong to them?). The Tune Squad broke up since the first film and went to the other brands to branch out on their own, leaving Bugs by himself in the Looney Tunes world (Daffy is in Metropolis, Speedy and Granny in the Matrix, Lola in Themyscira, etc.) There's also the hilarious puns on the Goon Squad antagonists (Klay Thompson as the splash man and Damian Lillard as a time god with Dame Time were my favorites.) LeBron himself is even parodied as being all work no play (even though anyone who watches him can see that he plays with finesse), and they poke fun at the fact that he's obsessed with forming superteams and that he's always abandoning his old ones if they're not good enough.What I Didn't Like: There's an awful lot of pandering for LeBron, so much that it'd make MJ blush. He's constantly referred to as the king and the antagonist wants to merge with him or something solely because of said title. At one point someone refers to him as the greatest athlete in the world (I respect LeBron and love his athleticism but, c'mon). The CGI Looney Tunes were a bit creepy to look at when I first saw them in the trailers and even in the movie I still didn't like them (they didn't like their look either which I found amusing). Also for a kid's film there's quite a bit of swearing so you've been warned. The acting from everyone except the Tunes was awful.What I Thought Was Weird: Zendaya as Lola was a weird casting choice but she did a good job regardless so can't really complain. Pepe Le Pew missing will always get me upset and it still feels weird that he's absent because the cancel culture didn't like him. Also Ernie Johnson as a play-by-play commentator (did Kevin Harlan and Marv Albert turn this role down?) Don't expect a cameo from Jordan or any other player from the original film.The Verdict: If you liked the first Space Jam, chances are you'll either like or dislike this one. Don't expect anything mind blowing (except for maybe how dumb the plot is), and just watch the Looney Tunes do their thing, and you'll be just fine. At least I can wash my Space Jam shirts now.

reviews.review_title: You can hate LeBron's bad acting but you gotta' love the cameos.
reviews.content: Everything in the movie that has human beings suck but all the cameos save the movie.

Porky got the best moment in the whole movie!What a great movie! So much fun! We don't have kids, but we loved it. This is not just a kid's movie. It's for people who are young at heart or love Looney Tunes or just fun family films! My husband isn't up on all the pop culture references and internet slang, but I loved it all. I'll have to watch it again to find more little inside jokes, there were soooo many, so fast!Cyber space gave the toons a really cool CGI look. So this was a different era, but just as much fun as the original!

reviews.review_title: Straight up Love This Movie! The kids loved it too!
reviews.content: Truly an enjoyable movie, that brought back many memories from back in the day. If you love basketball and are a LeBron James fan you will definitely love the movie. And who doesn't love looney Tunes! The movie has some pretty awesome effects and LeBron did a great job.It's comical how many LeBron James haters who still watched the movie lol. Then jumped online right away to chirp nonsense.

To be honest, I am not a big basketball fan, but the first Space Jam was fun to watch as it had a simple plot with Michael Jordan and the Tunes playing basketball! This however, was an unneeded sequel and honestly even the Tunes were lacklustre in this presentation!I know LeBron James is not an actor and I expected his acting to be subpar, but wow, his acting is worse than I anticipated. At least Michael Jordan showed some emotion in the first film. LeBron is only in it for the paycheck. The plot is a bit wacky, as it involves LeBron James signing a deal for a movie with Warner Bros, but his "son" gets kidnapped by WB Studios's AI named Al-G. Then LeBron teams up with the Tunes to save his son. The plot is messy and inconsistent with the first film as the Tunes have to learn how to play basketball again.Also, get ready for the references Warner Bros is gonna throw at you in this movie. They try to copy scenes from the first movie such as bringing in Bill Murray as a cameo, but it feels shallow and a shameless copy/paste.The only joke that I did find funny is the Michael B. Jordan scene. That did receive a chuckle from me.Not a good film and honestly do not waste your time with this one. Go watch the first film instead.

reviews.review_title: At least it was free with HBO Max
reviews.content: I watched this with an open mind but I could not help myself but to skip through parts of the movie and not finish it. Everything about it was not as fun. My nephews didn't even like it. Makes me think WB has really turned dumb after the Justice League 2017 release. Overall I'm not surprised but still disappointed.

Everyone involved should be ashamed. LeBron can't act and they really mess with the looney tunes I've grown to love. Also they ripped off Ready Player One on so many levels and tried to mask it as their own creation. Bad writing overall and a huge woke let down ,when are writers going to learn.

reviews.review_title: Fun movie expanding on concepts of the first movie
reviews.content: I saw Space Jam in theaters as a kid and really enjoyed it. I took my kids to A New Legacy and laughed throughout the whole movie. Are there plot holes? Yes. Is LeBron an Oscar level actor? No. But that didn't make it any less fun for me and my kids seeing the Looney Tunes at it again.I really enjoyed how they took the concept of bringing in other WB movies like Mad Max, Matrix, King Kong, etc. I wasn't expecting that.Don Cheadle was a bit melodramatic, but hey, he's a villain in a kids movie. If you're expecting a dramatic performance from people acting across from cartoons, this isn't the movie for you. If you want to just shut your brain off for a bit and laugh at cartoons, you'll enjoy the movie.

reviews.review_title: A fun movie for the bois
reviews.content: So this movie on its own is just not fun to watch but if you're friends and not really taking things seriously it's honestly a fun time.
We waited all these years for this ? Let's never make another space jam movie , I feel like lebrons " acting " hurt everybody else's acting.

A lot of grumpy people who need to share their narcissistic opinions so just trying to give the ratings a boost lol. Honestly I had a fun time watching it and I laughed out loud quite a few times. There were definitely things about the "algorithm" that didn't make sense and I would have changed quite a bit in the script but I know it's a kids movie so I just let that go and had fun. Also loved a few of the WB universe tie ins!Not sure if I would have spent money to see it in a theater but glad I had HBO streaming. Your kids will love the movie! If you're an adult hoping to have the same nostalgia as the original movie, skip it or let that go from your head before going into it. The animation is also an adjustment.(This genuinely comes from a Chicago Bulls fan/LeBron hater...give him the benefit of the doubt, he means well 😂)

reviews.review_title: It was a space jam movie
reviews.content: This was good for the animation they did like it was looney for sure but toony idk about that. Plus the whole E3 camp made most people sigh and cringe so that's a plus. Also Lola could have been way cooler btw just sayin.

reviews.review_title: Did not live up to expectations
reviews.content: Michael Jordan will always be the GOAT, along with the original Space Jam. My children wouldn't even watch this all the way through, which says a lot considering they will watch the original in its entirety, and have multiple times.

Let me start of by saying I hate this generation of people who leave reviews based off of hate. Lebron haters are the worst kind of people. Space Jam 1 was horrible on every level and the best thing about it was R Kelly and Bugs bunny.... This movie is everything Space jam should have been. Was it the best movie ever??? Not at all but it for sure hands down was better than the first one in every way. There were actual jokes in this film and not just cartoons running around in circles. I like that the movie did not go over the top and kept it simple.Conclusion: These movies are for kids and I know for sure kids are not leaving reviews trashing a kids movie so adults in this world need to grow up and stop being petty it's that simple.

The worst remake/sequel of all time. Loved the 1st one. Absolutely gutted with this one. Story line was ashambles, made zero sense and tried to be to clever. The whole thing from start to finish made me angry.

So I did like it. But not enough to watch it again. I'm glad it was streaming on HBO max and I didn't necessarily spend money in a theater for it. I think this movie would be great for KIDS. Some cheap laughs that keep them entertained, but nothing beyond that. I loved the original one as I grew up watching that movie time after time. This did not live up to that expectation, HOWEVER. I think people are being alittle too harsh on it. We can all agree that lebron is definitely not an actor, and his acting skills serves as easy ammunition for the lebron haters out there to chop this movie up. I'm no lebron fanatic OR a hater, I just think people are letting their emotions take over their review of the whole movie. Again this was not a great movie nor would I want to watch it again, I just don't think it's as bad as everyone is making it sound. BTW yes, there is a lot of obvious advertising lol. I personally don't care too much, but it seems to get under a lot of peoples skin.

I honestly tried to like this but it was so painfully obvious how much LeBron just used this as a way of showing everyone how rich and successful he is. The first 25 minutes we get a ton of majestic views of LeBron's house and hear him go on and on about how hard he worked to get to where he is. It's not done with any substance or charm. It's just shoved down our throats for the sole purpose of exalting LeBron James. It felt like a cash grab and yet another example of James trying to match up with the legacy of Jordan, but failing miserably, and I'm not even a fan of Jordan.
The designs are cringey, the first half of the movie is slow and the second half makes no sense.

reviews.review_title: Sharing my childhood with my child
reviews.content: No need to harshly criticize this movie. If it's fun and enjoyable for 90s babies who watched it and for kids today then it's a slam! It's not an Oscar worth movie and it's not supposed to be.
Save your money and just go watch the OG with Michael Jordan. LeBron absolutely destroyed this movie, and not in a good way.

LeBron needs to stick to Twitter and the court. This was a long running ad for WB. A whole lot of cringe throughout. They had some huge shoes to fill, making a sequel this long after the original. They put an infant foot into a Shaq shoe.

I expected this movie to be a complete blast and was hoping I would be happy throughout the entire film as I was with the original Space Jam regardless of how many times I watch it.The Looney Tunes in the film were a blast. Believe me, they're charming, they're cute, they're funny. They're entertaining. They did butcher Lola, Granny, and Marvin severely but outside of those three the Looney Tunes maintained their charm and cuteness they've historically had.Had the movie not made Lebron's child the antagonist and romanticized Lebron the entire time it would have been significantly more enjoyable and as a result of that I can't justify giving this film more than a 4/10.Lebron was cocky, awkwardly romanticized and put on a pedestal the entire film.. this wasn't the case with Michael Jordan in the original and that's why he was so fun to have in the film. In the original Michael was just "He's great!" "We want to learn from you" and besides that it was focused on EVERYONE and their importance.

reviews.review_title: I wanted to like it... but
reviews.content: The original wasn't great.. but at least was watchable. I could even go back and watch it today and it isn't terrible.This movie is almost unwatchable. From about 10 mins in I felt like turning it off but I powered through it for my kids sake hoping maybe they saw something in the remake that I didn't. After they movie they agreed it was horrible...It wasn't even worth the free view on HBOMAX. I feel really bad for people who spent money watching this in a theater. The storyline was bad. The acting was bad. You had no connection with any of the characters. I almost felt bad for Don Cheadle that he put time and effort in this movie as much as I like his other work.

Honestly people hate too much..The movie was funnier than I expected, and the plot was just average and predictable, but it was a fine movie, and I found it funny.Everybody is complaining that the acting is bad, but like.. what would you expect? An oscar performance? The dude is a basketball player, not an actor. In this case, the subpar acting made it funnier for me. But ya'll just hating.
Very entertaining, funny, animated visuals are very cool and modern, I as a fan of the Bugs bunny character and friends really like it.

reviews.review_title: Did anyone expect it to be good?
reviews.content: Queen Lebron ruins everything he touches. Look what he has done to the NBA.

I honestly very much enjoyed this movie so much, I had a fun time, I laughed a lot and I enjoyed the looney tunes so much.I am aware of the how cheesy the film is and I know the acting is not the best, but this isn't what the movie is trying to, it's not trying to be this amazing Oscar worthy film, it's just having fun. I had a great time! I also gotta say the this movie is visually beautiful, the effects were amazing the looney tune look beautiful with the 3D animation style. It's not the best movie ever, it's not amazing an incredible but it was joyful it was fun! I had a lot of fun and to me, that makes for a good movie. There are movies that are meant to put a lot of focus on, movies that are well Oscar worthy, attention to the story but this isn't one of those films, this is a film where you can just sit back grab your snacks, lay back forget about all the crisis in this world and have a great time!
This movie is terrible, one big product placement for Nike and they completely forget about the base of the movie.

I thought the movie was fun and definitely enjoyable time watching. The thing about the first movie is no it wasn't good the plot didn't make a lot of sense and that's part of why I loved it so much but this movie wanted it to make sense and added that Lebron wasn't a good father which makes for an uplifting story at the end but I just felt like it wasn't needed. I wanted to just be able to enjoy myself while watching the movie but the dad dynamic made the movie too serious in my opinion. It is a pretty forgettable movie but I enjoyed watching.

The movie just feels like a giant advertisement. The third act is really the only part of the movie thats "good," and while LeBron James performance was good, it's completely overshadowed by how much advertising there is.

reviews.review_title: A unexpected very fun and funny film
reviews.content: Reading the reviews prior to watching this almost got me not to watch it but I'm glad I did.This is funny, filled with references and cameos, a good family related story and quite heart warming yes it has product placement but that does seem to be part of the joke and no different to the original Space Jam.I would honestly really recommend it.

reviews.review_title: Take off your nostalgia goggles folks.
reviews.content: This is not the first space jam and that is perfectly fine! If you saw space jam for the first time as an adult, you'd realize how stiff and robotic MJ's acting is. Granted, this is not as funny as the first film, but it does what it's supposed to do: entertain kids that like basketball, cartoons, and video games.
The movie was okay.This was a movie that continued to speak about importance of family.Lebron wanted to be a good father and they constantly brought it up.

I don't get the hate it gets from different people. It's a fun movie and alot of crossovers and easter eggs to keep your attention.This one was even better than the movie with Michael Jordan in my opinion.LeBron shows he can act better than his loyal Airness.If you think it's not for you, then don't watch...
If you can relate to anything Warner Bros., this is your kinda flick.
I found it very boring. The storyline doesn't seem to entertain my 8 year old brother or me.

reviews.review_title: genuinely is the only reason this isn't 1 out of 10
reviews.content: I genuinely would rather see my entire family burn in a fire than watch this movie again.

Ok, in my mind, there will only ever be one space jam. This movie never needed to happen. Granted, i did chuckle a few times (cause the looney tunes always make me laugh) and zendaya is always a win for me. Overall, it was fine. It was colorful, and the plot was alright. I probably won't watch it again, though.

reviews.review_title: Somethings are just better left alone...
reviews.content: It's very simple...not everything needs to be redone or reimagined.
It's a really fun movie to watch. Beside all non-sense plots, ignoring that its amazing.

When i go to watch a movie with my kids, I don't really care about the plot and actors, it's all about having fun.Did we had fun? Yes actually my kid's enjoyed it and immediately downloaded the game on my Xbox.I'm sorry for all Michael Jordan fan's who might think the movie isn't good enough for them, but as I said, we had fun time.

Very bad acting from LeBron James. The cartoon character of James in the movie was a better actor. Also the writing and story line was horrible. It was very generic to help LeBron James's acting. Also Don Cheadle is a great actor and this film did not do him justice.

reviews.review_title: Not A Good Movie But A Really Fun One
reviews.content: Now if you are coming into this movie expecting top tier acting, please i beg of you don't watch this, because if I'm being honest the acting is horrible voice acting even worse and the cgi at times looks disgusting. But with all that being said it is definitely one of the most fun movies i have ever watched, with all the easter eggs and characters this movie keeps you entertained throughout the whole movie. Now another bad thing about this movie is the plot makes no sense and the motive of the villain.So in overall i give this movie a 6/10 now it's optional to watch this in theaters I don't recommend, it's more like a family movie, but if you want to nobody's stopping you.Thank you so much for reading my review godbless.

This movie was adorable. It was exactly what I was expecting. I was a kid for the original movie and was so excited to watch this one with my 9 year old. He was cracking up at the Looney Toons and got SO invested in the plot. If you're ready for Space Jam 2, it's a must watch. If you're hoping for some sort of a docu-drama about basketball then you're going to be disappointed. This is a half cartoon/ half live-action movie with Lebron James and the Looney Toons. Know what you're getting into. For a kids movie, it's great!!

People are really exaggerating in the reviews. Some ppl are mad over a literal BUNNY'S BODY. Some are mad over a character not showing up. And yes, Lebron's acting is a bit off but don't blame him!!😒He's a basketball player. I saw space jam about a month ago and saw the new one a few days ago and both of them were pretty good. This sequel though, I loved!! I loved the character's designs(which is hard to animate and ppl don't appreciate it😔)when they were 3-d form. Me and my little sister were on the edge of our seats throughout the whole movie. It was amazing!!!And to the people saying they were "sleeping" through the movie: Stop exaggerating. This is made for kids specifically so it doesn't really matter if you slept through it or not. I really dont know how u slept through all that energy😔🤷. It was good!

Trust me I've seen worse.... Definitely not at the top of my list, but it's not at the bottom either.Yes there were corny jokes, yes it's NOTHING like the original, yes lebrons acting is very meh and yes my KIDS loved it. They've watched it twice now, and it's kept them quiet and happy for a total of 4 hours now....any kids movie that can achieve that is ok in my book!!! They loved the looney tunes in this movie!I look at this movie as nothing but purely a kids movie and if your turned off by the previews and the reviews then don't watch it.

Production wise underwhelming. LeBron's acting horrendous. Storyline was ok. Message was very positive. Overall meh. 1st one is in a class of its own. This will connect to today's kids so it hit its mark. They will cash out on this one forsure. I'm 28 years old born in the 90s. It's no comparison to the original.

I'm not sure what movie these people on here watched. This film is as good as a sequel movie can get. Hilarious and the acting is what is to be expected by an athlete. The numbers don't lie, it's a box office hit. I suspect there are just a bunch of Lebron haters giving bad reviews.
I know LeFlop is doing all he can to chase MJ but this was a bad idea. The characters in the crowd were more interesting than the plot.

This isn't about LeBron James being a terrible actor. This isn't about them changing the look of certain charecters. This isn't about Warner Brothers stuffing every single property they own into this film. Space Jam: A New Legacy is simply a terrible movie. It's dry with absolutely no life to it. It feels like the movie was made by a soulless AI.
LeBron cannot act worth anything the original was way better.
This movie doesn't deserve the hate it was quite funny and I loved seeing all the different characters from different movies.

It was ok movie. A movie that family can sit down and watch and enjoy, the humor and the WB characters. People know and lebron even said that it doesn't go well for athletes and acting. So you shouldn't blame lebron James.

Not sure what film other people were watching but this was a really good movie. My kids loved it (aged 9 and 6) and it kept me entertained too (45).Ok Lebron James is not the best actor in the world but he was likeable and definitely not cringe-worthy. The musical numbers were great fun and got my kids tapping their feet. They were thoroughly entertained throughout, often laughing out loud, and we all came away from the movie buzzing.If that's not a sign of a good movie - I don't know what is.

reviews.review_title: It's nothing amazing but it's not that bad!?
reviews.content: Had to write a review based on how many pointless other reviews are done just bashing LeBron James.This movie is like a mix of the original Space Jam and Ready Player One. There are lots of inside jokes within the movie that reference to other WB movies & basketball (obviously).Brons acting was okay. The storyline of movie was also okay. I loved the pop culture references and the digs movie had at LeBron. It was nice and easy to watch. I wasn't the biggest fan of how they changed up the basketball storyline when it turned into bonus points etc but I'm a gamer so I didn't actually mind it as much.Overall, I'm happy that I saw it and enjoyed it but I wouldn't go out of my way to watch it again.

reviews.review_title: Not bad but could be more
reviews.content: The film has successes such as the change in attitude of lola bunny and Bugs bunny, but I feel that it fails a lot, a story that does not matter because it is the typical family conflict, heck, I came to see Bugs and his gang playing basketball, not to LeBron complaining because they did not let him play with his Gameboy, and personally I feel that it is more entertaining to look for references than to watch the game, in addition to the duration, almost two hours, in a normal movie nothing happens, but in one for children. It seems a sin to me.

reviews.review_title: Light hearted family fun! Great film.
reviews.content: I absolutely loved this film! This is a light hearted family film and it took my back to my childhood when I watched the first film. I really don't understand what people are expecting?!? It had all the well loved looney tunes from the first film and it had all the well known characters from my favourite films and shows which I thought was a good take. Overall If your looking for a bit of family fun then go and see this. Try not to listen to all the wannabe film critics and see for yourself if you enjoy it. To be fair to the actors I thought they where brilliant and I thoroughly enjoyed it.

reviews.review_title: It's a new take on our 90's jam
reviews.content: Look let's be real just as in the first space Jam, we don't watch this talent or take it seriously. We watch this for entertainment and it's definitely entertaining! We made a huge family night out of it and thoroughly enjoyed it. It has slap laughs and nostalgia all packed together for both generations to appreciate.

Not a good movie. Leflop< mj
not a good basketball player but a good actor and businessman.

Space jam would have been such a great movie but lebrons acting was terrible even his voice acting and they also used this movie to promote there company because there were so many Warner bro. References I couldn't even tell what was happing.
This movie is nothing close to the original and is a sad attempt at showcasing Lebron and Warner Media.
This is looks like some knockoff version of space jam called SHPACE YAM!

reviews.content: Marion D. Ray (marionray76@gmailcom):My review of facts about AL-G Rhythm:i always know, remember and like Don Cheadle, the MCU actor of Colonel Rhodey Rhodes, a.k.a Iron Patriot and formerly known as War Machine, the only true best friend and ex-sidekick of the ex-leader of the greatest and mightiest superhero team, The Avengers, and late inventor, engineer, philander, womanizer, philanthropist and superhero, Tony Stark. A.k.a Iron Man. Also called the Invincible Iron Man and Iron Avenger himself from the past by last movies ago in the Marvel Cinematic Universe.And he played AL-G Rhythm himself in the whole sequel too, the sentient, autonomous, self-aware, evil, malicious, dark, arrogant, egotistical, short-tempered, envious, bitter, vengeful, abusive, dangerous, threatening, deceitful, manipulative, tricky, traitorous, Ching Chong, fame-seeking, attention-seeking, recognition-hungry, power-hungry, power-mad and truly god-like superpowered artificial intelligence with a variety of truly god-like superhuman powers and truly god-like abilities of his own, true omnipotence and true omniscience who is always so bent only on and always been trying to achieve fame, attention, recognition, world and machine domination, power, technocracy, robotocracy, machine supremacy, machine control and machine tyranny.AL-G became and was so sad over how humanity are always unaware of and not acknowledging him and what he does with his powers and abilities like hard work.And now he hates and reviles humanity for ignorance and always trying to richly force humanity to be aware of, pay attention to, acknowledge and respect him and acknowledge what he does and then conquer and rule the world just like both Master Control Program and Ultron from Disney and Marvel always plan and try to do and achieve in TRON, the 1982nd Disney sci-fi movie i always watch online and Marvel's comics, animated series, animated movies and Marvel Cinematic Universe movies.Because he's like Master Control Program and Ultron similarly for trying to achieve machine domination in evil, malicious, dangerous, threatening, vengeful, abusive, power-hungry, power-mad and tyrannical ways.And he doesn't want and want to conquer and rule the social media space and only always does want and want to conquer and rule the world of our universe because he became and was so sad over being trapped in the Sever-Verse and how humanity are always unaware of and not acknowledging what he does with his god-like powers and abilities like hard work.Steps of AL-G's attempted achievements of his present and future goals:Buttering up and manipulating the Looney Tunes and all the other Toons in Tune-World into moving out to, residing and exploring other universes and blasting them all off to other universes with the rocket just in case if they all ever get and stand in his way and the way of his plans and goals.
