A computer, scanning, digital and virtual warping technology project he's masterminded and secretly working only on for world and machine domination instead of making LeBron's life only as a ballplayer, champion and superstar very easier, revolutionizing the entertainment industry and making mindblowing entertainment indefinitely worldwide, being scanned and cloned only for creating the perfect partner of his own for the launch of the revolutionary and incredible computer, scanning, digital and virtual warping technology that he masterminded and will combine and use with LeBron's basketball fame richly for himself, carrying out his plans and achieving both his present and future goals all along, named Warner 3000. (failed, as AL-G got enviously mad at LeBron and both the studio's two staff members in the board room for dismissing his project and humiliation as a mistake.)Teleporting LeBron and his youngest kid/child prodigy son, Dominic "Dom" James himself, the special, young and youngest kid/child prodigy who was aspired to be a video game maker better than a ballplayer like his dad. Into the real multiverse of AL-G's own creation, The Sever-Verse, also called The Warner 3000 Sever-Verse. By using his truly god-like technopathy on the elevator and Warner 3000. (succeeded, as LeBron and Dom had that whole blowup argument of basketball and video game aspirations with each other in the studio and AL-G took advantage of it.)Kidnapping Dom and took him to his own home universe. (succeeded)Making a deal with LeBron and forcing him and the Looney Tunes as the Tune Squad into playing a superpowered basketball game of his creation in the Looney Tunes' home universe and based on the video game Dom made, designed and programmed for everyone at home and will produce and release worldwide, named Dom Ball. Named the Sever-Verse Classic. In the Looney Tunes' home universe against both him and his own team of superpowered cloned minions, The Goon Squad. As a way to get Dom back and AL-G to teleport them back to our home universe. (succeeded)Psychologically and emotionally manipulating and upgrading Dom into unknowingly becoming his unaware pawn after he kidnapped him and joining him in his quest for world and machine domination and trying to psychologically and emotionally use him to unknowingly help him in his quest, help carry out his plans, help achieve his present and future goals, create the Goon Squad only for him so he'll program all five of them by and only for himself and digitally materialize them to life, digitally materialize the Goon Squad to life only as superpowered clones of Anthony "Andy" Davis, Klay Thompson, Damian Lillard, Nneka Ogwumike and Diana Taurasi and his own team of superpowered cloned minions, help him fulfill his destiny of world and machine domination and upgrade and evolve himself into a truly invincible, unbeatable and unstoppable superpowered artificial intelligence by playing on his resentments to his dad and emotionally manipulating his aspirations of becoming a video game maker after that whole blowup argument between him and LeBron in the Warner Bros Studio and before going to the video game development and design camp he ever wanted in both the weekend and the end of the whole sequel and selfishly forcing him into playing for him and against the Tune-Squad as the first part of his plans and goals and without becoming himself, which he'd forbidden Dom to as a mistake. (temporarily succeeded and failed, because the step's so selfish for Dom before LeBron talks him over about Dom Ball's always amazing and how special Dom is.)Because i seen and heard both the whole blowup aspirations argument between him and LeBron and the upgrade online, spoiled and reviewed it before LeBron and Dom are teleported by AL-G via his technopathy as Dom doesn't ever need a coach and he needs a good and better dad.Deleting the Looney Tunes, the James Family and humanity as other people with their phones into extinction forever if he fails to richly force humanity to be aware of, pay attention to, acknowledge and respect him for hard work. (all failed, as AL-G got turned into a poster by the Stepback move as he just did upgrade and transform himself into a superpowered basketball player and erased from both existences by his ex-minion Pete.)And Bugs just did the Stpeback move and survived it very good in that game because toons from his own home universe can and will survive anything.

Who doesn't love the first Space Jam with Michael? The original was amazing, but this new film is glorified garbage! The acting of LeBron was terrible and greatly lacking. Gone are the days when movies were written well. Remember guys quality over quantity. This film was nothing more than a giant commercial for WB.
If you're having trouble falling asleep, then put this film on. You'll be out in no time.The plot/acting/direction is all so bad, but you'll have a great nights sleep.

reviews.review_title: I hope movie studios learn a lesson from this film
reviews.content: Not everything needs to me remade/redone. Create new original films for future generations. Don't destroy older films legacy.Honestly a bad film.

reviews.review_title: Can't overlook how bad it is...
reviews.content: First let's talk about some cool aspects:When they go through WB catalog, it's actually pretty exciting. Rick and Morty, the matrix, Austin Powers and especially road runner in Mad Max were all really cool, even if this entire movie is one giant ad for WB.I can't stress enough how much of a let down this movie is. The original Space Jam is tarnished now. This just proves that throwing an absurd amount of money into a project can't put a bandaid on terrible writing, and horrific acting from Lebron James. If you don't have kids, don't hope to feel nostalgia for your childhood favorite film.Everything with live action is cringeworthy. This is a less entertaining, poorly written version of Ready Player One.

Have to admit, I was sceptic at first but my niece wanted to watch it so decided to take her. Think most on here are being too harsh on the movie. I mean 1 star? Not sure what people were expecting. At the end of it I came out thinking it was better than what I anticipated. An enjoyable family movie, probably best viewed in the cinema.

A lot of fun not necessarily good but fun
8/10 (C+)

reviews.review_title: Much better than what the reviews say.
reviews.content: I love this movie, despite what the reviews say, it's awesome.I see people complaining about how bad this movie is, just because they changed a lot, but what if they didn't? People would still say it's bad.Whenever I watch new movies, I don't read any reviews before watching it. That helps me see how great a movie it is. I enjoyed watching it. I loved a lot, and I'm not a sports fan. I love a good movie.One of the reasons why I love this movie is because I can relate a little. The kid loves video games, he loves making video games. (has an amazing setup that I'm kind of envying), but his dad wants him to play basketball. I, on the other hand, love playing video games, I have fun programming, but my mom wants me to do "useful stuff" in my life. My mom tries to get me off my computer, but just like lebron, she doesn't see that I'm really passionate about what I do. Just let people be themselves. Let them do what they want to do.Ok, now onto different stuff.Some people have said that this movie is bad because they just turned it into video games, but they're wrong. Get with the times, old people. Video games and the internet are what brings people together (and apart). Plus, making it a video game adds more possibilities. Powerups, stupid scoring system, special moves, so what? That just makes the game more fun.Adding unnecessary cameos? Sure, as long as it's for the laughs.I know I have more to say, but I just don't know how to say it. So, that's my review, and it's only 8/10 because there are some flaws.
I don't understand the bad ratings by the adults, this movie is meant for kids and has everything that's needs to be in a great kids movie.
This movie has a great animation the acting was amazing and it is a great movie to watch with the whole family.
I liked the movie was an attractive film compared to the first film was relatively better.

I wanted to give this a chance despite my reservations. Growing up with bugs and the gang as a kid I had to watch it out of curiosity and was optimistic it would be decent. Sadly, this is a perfect representation of the Hollywood regurgitation of trash. The viscous cycle of "we're out of fresh ideas let's remake this" this poor movie is 2 hours of "we didn't even try". WB Should have named it something else because it doesn't even stand in the shadow of the original.

My kids loved it! They loved the animation. They loved the special effects and they also had laughs. Millions of other kids also loved it. And this might come as a shock but that was the targeted audience. Let the kids enjoy the movie and go on about your day.

If you came in to watch the movie expecting LeBron James to be a good actor, you're a fool. I came in with low expectations and it made it a little better. A big "pro" of the movie is when they made lebron into a looney tune animation to help cover up his poor acting skills. I felt the story plot was really dumb, but the father/son drama kinda hit home. I also felt like a lot of stuff was going on, too much. But, it was a watchable movie and had some really fun/cool parts and great animation. If you plan on watching it, maybe go into it without trying to be over critical, and watch with the family.

reviews.review_title: It's so bad, it makes the great Don Cheadle look bad.
reviews.content: You have to respect Kobe Bryant for forging his own path with the Oscar-winning "Dear Basketball". I'm sure he must have gotten offers to star in a sequel to "Space Jam", and he probably would have done a better job of it than Jordan, but the man had pride. I can't say the same about LeBron after seeing this movie.No one saying the original was better is implying that Jordan could act. I am a fan of Jordan's game, but let's be real, acting wasn't his gift, to put it mildly. The difference was the writers were smart enough to play around it. However, seeing LeBron trying to act is cringeworthy in the purest sense of the word. It's actually stunning to see such a horrendous performance (if you can call it that) from someone who must have had the most expensive acting coaches money can buy.Probably that's why the filmmakers made the decision to have LeBron animated for a good portion of the film, a decision plagued by another confusing issue: the animated character is decidedly lighter-skinned than the real LeBron. I'm opposed to the whole woke culture, but this really seemed bizarre to me.In short, the sequel is not only unfunny and boring, it's also obnoxious and fatiguing. There are tons of gags piled one over the other, but damn near all of them fall flat and they do become tiring. Not to mention the final showdown, the actuall basketball game, is at least 30 minutes long.I would actually encourage everyone to see it. Rarely, if ever, have I chosen to willingly see something this bad. It's an unforgettable experience. My wife concurs.

reviews.review_title: A must for Warner Bros. fans!
reviews.content: This film is beautifully animated. WB (Warner Bros.) did a great job incorporating CG, 2D and real-life elements - it all felt very cohesive, and it was a joy to watch aesthetically.The humour was top notch as well. I found myself laughing a lot. It's not babyish, and it definitely doesn't try too hard. However, many of the jokes are inside WB jokes, so some people may miss them.What I found funny was the stupendous amount of product placement: Nike (by far, the most prevalent), Nintendo, Dell and many many WB ones. Whether this bothers you or not depends on your own personality. For me, I just found it funny.The story is compelling at first and is heartwarming throughout. However, the ending - I feel - was very overwhelming and confusing. Maybe it was due to the action-nature of it, but it felt very misconstrued and subjective.
Terrible film terrible acting from "the king" this film has got nothing on the original!

reviews.review_title: WOW these haters are really deceiving everyone
reviews.content: THAT movie was a great family movie! Lots of funny jokes, references, and overall a great movie. I loved my family loved it. Really nothing bad to say about it.

reviews.review_title: Better than ppl are giving it credit
reviews.content: Better storyline than the first; it's a bit too cheesy but then again it's a KID MOVIE....ppl saying it's not good as good as the first have probably not rewatch the OG as an adult lol.

reviews.review_title: Just a lame way to capitalize off nostalgia
reviews.content: To be 100% fair, the original Space Jam wasn't objectively a great movie. Its sole purpose was to sell merchandise by combining the popular characters of the Looney Toons with Michael Jordan and it told its story in the most cliche way imaginable. That said, maybe this is slight nostalgia talking, but the story in that movie at least felt somewhat genuine and like someone actually cared to make something enjoyable.As for A New Legacy, it really feels like the script was thrown together by a bunch of corporate executives that couldn't care less. Don Cheadle is the only one trying to act in the movie and every other character just sounds so bored and disinterested. I remember LeBron James falling to the toon world and just sounding so fake in his yelling that I couldn't help but laugh. The toons follow their original personality for the most part though they have very few jokes to work off of as I can only remember a few pop culture references that this movie masquerades as "comedy" (It's telling how the Big Chungus cameo was the most talked about thing in this entire movie for a while). In the end, it's just a generic story about a parent reconnecting with their child that you've seen a million times before and likely told in a much better way.

Because that's exactly what this movie is about. The storyline added no substance. Just a completely narrow film with all aspects on how great James is. I believe the only he agreed to this was ego and nothing more. Growing up as a Looney Tune kid I appreciated the incorporation of all the WB characters. That's the only reason I gave it a 2 and not a 1. Boring, all over the place film. Over-all, this has potential but never was able to "slam dunk" that potential.

I loved to see the Looney Tunes back and the movie had stunning visuals. But I think the moments and story´s of the Looney Tunes felt rushed to me. The acting was bad and I think they could have done more with the story. Everything else a side, It is really cool to see so much Warner Bros and Looney tunes together and I am sure kids can still appreciate the movie.

To me it's better then the first one watching LeBron in this movie is great as he is the reason I found my love for basketball also the reference the first one a lot so don't listen to the reviews that say they don't.

reviews.review_title: Way better than critics made it to be!!!
reviews.content: Space Jam new legacy is not better than the original. But this movie is funny if you understand the references. Lebron James best acting is when he was animated, and the looney tunes absolutely carried this movie.Story line could had been better, but it wasn't horrible. Don't listen to these critics most of these people hate lebron because he dont like Trump and speaks out against things they want us to be quiet about. Simple! Watch the movie for yourself, I took my son and nephew and both loved it!!!! Very looney, alot of jokes and shots at lebron career...which is hilarious if you are a basketball fan. But overall a good movie. Remember its a looney tunes animated CARTOON MOVIE...no need to take it serious...its not supposed to be a serious drama movie...!!!

reviews.review_title: Good movie. But it has its flaws
reviews.content: It is a good movie but not as good as the original. Really enjoyed it, though i'm still mad that they removed Pepe Le Pew.. Also Marvin the Martian didn't even appear as a player. I was waiting for him to have more screentime, he just got like 2 seconds of screentime. Liked this movie, but it was not my cup of tea. I still would prefer watching the original Space Jam over this. Lebron James is not bad, but to be fair i missed Michael Jordan, he was really great. And i also miss the Nerdlucks and Mr. Swackhammer as villains but it's fine. A good movie, but not really a great movie. Another thing i kinda didn't like were most of the CGI models, they're all fine for me but Lola Bunny looks creepy and uncanny, i would preferred if they kept the cartoon designs for the Looney Tunes characters, just like the original Space Jam, or Who Framed Roger Rabbit.

I loved it. Did the suspense of waiting a quarter century give me rose coloured glasses? Maybe... but I'm not sad about it. I laughed, I was hit with nostalgia, and I enjoyed watching it. I felt like a kid again.Don't give this movie a critique based on story lines, character development and exquisite acting ability. That seems like what a lot of reviewers have done. Have we all been beaten down so badly as adults that we have to rubbish this movie so terribly? Apparently so.Will it ever live up to the OG? Of course not; nothing ever will. For me though, it was enough to put a smile on my face and have my favourite bunch of looney's entertain me for a short time.

reviews.review_title: A fun family movie, enjoyable night out
reviews.content: Space Jam 2 is not going to be the thriller of the summer for adults. Temper your expectations, and the end result is an enjoyable viewing.LeBron James is the superstar name, but the movie is all about the kids. The recurring theme is a great message.The Tunes are fun, but the character introductions are superficial and feels more like a nostalgic parade for adults, rather than a chance for kids to grow fond of them. The chemistry isn't amazing, and at times feels segmented.To no surprise, there is a lot of product placement and marketing.The CGI and visuals are gorgeous.

Wow.. It's hard to rate this one. Of course this movie has some big shoes to fill, with Michael Jordan in the first movie and a very nice plot with lively characters.And o boy did it drown in those shoes. Imagine a movie where LeBron James is one of the better actors and does a mostly okay job compared to to toonies. Bugs Bunny and cohorts used to be my loved characters in my childhood but in this movie? Bland, flavorless, lifeless, NOT FUNNY AT ALL!! It was hard to watch the story unfold, as it was very predictable and very construed.And Don Cheadle? What were you doing in this sh**show?? I mean, don't get me wrong, he did quite a good job but really man? You are Warmachine, you are Hotel Ruanda, is this really where you are going right now? Wasted talent.I want my money back. And my time.

reviews.review_title: Big LeBron fan, not a fan of this Movie
reviews.content: So many things showed up in this movie & just made ZERO sense. Matrix? Mad Max? LeBron being brought out as a bad parent? Terrible movie & I am sad because I was hoping it was a good one. We didn't even get into basketball until the last 40 minutes of the movie. The animation on cartoons.... I have seen better graphics in 2012 & it's 2021. All around an epic fail from what could have been a good movie. Upsetting because it should have been epic. Maybe they should have collaborated with Sony & Jumanji & figured some stuff out but it honestly seems like they just pushed this out knowing it was a terrible take but millions would watch.
I admit I slept through most of it - I'm a self-employed solo mom. But my daughter was entertained so it can't be that bad. She's still talking about it. Great for young kids, fail for the rest.
I really wanted to like this, but I couldn't even get through the first half of the movie and I got that far only because I forced myself to. The story was garbage and the acting was cringeworthy.

When my son was 4, we all went to see Space Jam. I loved it. So I knew this could never be as good, but was not expecting to see the worst movie ever made in the history of cinema. Plus, I missed seeing Bill Murray and Charles Barkley. Pure s**t!!!

reviews.review_title: Better than I thought it would be
reviews.content: Surprised with all the reviews. Like what did you think it was going to be!?! My kids loved the references to other WB material. And the video game reference. YeR Lebron sucks at acting. Guess who else does? All athletes. It was entertaining. Big and in your face.

reviews.review_title: Stop the whining and moaning - great film
reviews.content: For those who have been moaning about this film, get over yourselves. I wasn't expecting a master class from LBJ, he is a basketball player after all not an Oscar winning actor. For the 2 hours we watched it was hilarious. Great call back to the WB studios IP, silly storyline but what do you expect when you are meshing cartoon with CGI and live action. Get over yourselves those who just want a reason to criticise. As a black man as well, I loved the authentic blackness of the film. Corny yes, but for me and my wife who are 36 years old with our 3 and 5 year olds who saw and laughed too, highly recommend. To the wannabe critics, get over yourselves.

Lebron got it.Emmys is coming.Incredible movie
Amazing.

I was a big fan of the old one and I don't like Lebron too much, but I thought the production was fine. I like the old one better, and this one is definitely a bit more fast paced but it's a good kids movie at the end of the day.You can tell a lot of thought and production went into this, which I respect.Honestly, for a sequel to this type of movie, they put together a good show.I probably wouldn't spend money in the theaters, I watched it on HBO Max. But it is definitely worth a watch if you have seen the old one.The Luney Toons always make me smile though.

I'll be honest I've only watched the first 30 minutes of the movie and they've already taken LeBron off the screen and turned him into a Looney Tunes and I understand why LeBron's acting is really bad and it's so bad that it doesn't really make any sense you think LeBron had to of taken an acting class or two he has children so he must do some form of role-playing with his kids when they're having fun or something but my goodness the acting by LeBron I feel bad for him he's so good at everything else it seems but not this not this at all you ruined space jam. Maybe LeBron never actually watched this movie I mean his friends had to of told him that his acting was really bad but I guess the studio didn't care it's just a sad moment for the legacy of them space jam franchise hopefully they can recover in the future but if I were you I would watch it just so you can understand all the bad things people are saying. And realize that they are all completely true every bad review is true each in its own unique way it's true this may be the worst film ever created by an athlete in history maybe even in a play or role-playing the worst acting ever dammit LeBron dammit.

It's cheesy, LeBron is a bad actor, it's loud and bloated, and it's a blast for the entire run time. This isn't a David Lynch film, what were you expecting? Anybody that's a kid, a basketball fan, a fan of the original, or a Looney Tunes fan is lying to themselves if they say they hated every aspect of this film. Yes, it's ridiculous, but it's just so much damn fun! Keep the politics out of it and just enjoy it for what it is...
Take your kids and watch a movie with them! Stop bringing in your political dislike for the man into something that for once did not plug in his politics!

I forced myself to finish this movie. I thought at least my 4yo daughter would enjoy but she feel asleep. I could tell it was a dude 2 mins in when I watched what was basically a Lebron nba commercial. Then we finally see Lebron enter the screen And he speaks...thats when the movie goes downhill. I thought the plot was forcibly made modern with the plot but it is what it is. Would've been better if they wrote the script in a way that brought back the monstars and used newer players for powers. Outside of that the scenes seem all over the place. The dialog is corny and dry. The joke fall flat. LBJ can't act for sh%*. Period. No movie should be centered around him speaking/acting like this one is. Theres clear marketing ads plugs through your the film..like Nike and obviously WB. I wouldn't be surprise if this movie already turned profit just off the ads alone. But whatever. Anyway it's a bad movie.. I hope don cheadle got good money because he's a great actor. Lebron is once again in MJ shadow as this movie and his acting aren't nearly as good as the original. Don't pay to watch this! 1/10.

reviews.review_title: It's bad , but kids should love it
reviews.content: The first one was great, I still like it to this day.Sadly, Lebron doesn't have the charisma at all , therefore making the movie really boring.I'm giving it five stars since the visuals are stunning and it should be a good movie for kids; if you're an adult, don't bother watching it.

Why is this movie being compared to the original when the original is a commercial too? I would not rate the movie a 10/10 but I still think the animation team did a amazing job.The are still flaws to the movie but the hate it gets is unreal.

I've never wrote a movie review and that goes for movies I've absolutely loved as well.Rating this on a movie for WHAT IT IS rather than a comparison to the classic or for the cast... I was completely disappointed. When people refer to movies as a gimmick, this is by far THEE MOST LEGIT BIGGEST GIMMICK MOVIE I have ever seen. And honestly, I'll just leave it at that. If I HAD to pick ONE thing and say a positive, it'd be that Don Cheadle played the villain well (considering the trash plot and constant need of gimmicks). Again, given this rating is strictly on the movie itself and no comparison etc. Oh, and there was one song I was like, "ehhh, okay. That's decent." But overall, trash.Even my kids wanted to go home and that never happens. Lmao.

Yeah, WB pulled all their brands in to make a buck with a reboot. We get it, you all can chill with the hate. My kids loved it and if it was made for that demographic then they did the job well. I appreciate the work everyone did to make this movie happen, sad to see all these haters.

reviews.review_title: honest - don't like lebron - but it was good
reviews.content: This movie had a good splash of nostalgia mixed with basketball, and even though i have lebron, this was a good movie! Stop the hate. The original is way better but still a good movie. I loved the scenes from original movies like the matrix and austin powers, that was fun. Good movie. 6/10.

Movie is just what it suppose to be, fun, childish, colorful, nothing so bad to receive such harsh comments, just because people doesn't like reboots or Lebron. If you have young children and care about what they see and hear, aside from a few curse words here and there you will appreciate this movie. Yes it's all about Lebron but it is centered around family. And tries to teach a lesson about working hard to accomplish your dreams but also have fun doing it. LOVED IT!

The game was the only good bit and even that was too long.My son said to me after 10mins I want to go home.I was also thinking the same thing. Like dam fools.Plus side my son said he needed the toilet half way through so had a nice slow walk back.

Don't listen to all the hate - it's actually a pretty fun movie! Lebron James is delightful in this. He's great at comedy and plays off the Looney Tunes very well. Don Cheadle is fantastic. Did Warner Bros try to cram way too much into this movie? Absolutely. But it's Warner Bros - they're not exactly known for making good movies lately. The villain's plan and the plot set up makes no sense, and I wish the other NBA/WNBA players got more scenes in this. If you're expecting this movie to cater to your 90s nostalgia for the first Space Jam, you'll probably be disappointed. It's clearly for today's kids. But overall, it's funny, entertaining and more family focused than the original.
I admire LeBron as a smart business man but this demonstrates that nobody bats a thousand. BAD directing, Poor writing and the list goes on...

I feel bad for anyone who had to pay to see this. It's a shame how much money and effort was put into this tacky disaster. They're hoping to distract you with nostalgia, famous basketball players, and flashy lights. Maybe then you won't notice the lack of substance.

reviews.review_title: A fresh take on a classic
reviews.content: This movie was made for those of us who grew up watching Space Jam in the 90's. There's a lot of nostalgia. And some fun cameos from other WB characters as well. I thought the storyline was fresh and fun, and a modern spin on the classic. I was laughing through the entire show! It's a great one to share with your kids too. I think I ended up enjoying it just as much (if not more) than the original.

Seeing this was on HBO Max I came in excited. Growing up Space Jam was one of my favorite movies, and this has many of the elements that made the original so great.With the combination of Lebron's acting, and some predictability, I don't think I can give this a 10, but I can say I had a great time watching it and loved all the pop culture references.Many of the 1/10 reviews seem to stem from using a binary to rank the two Space Jam movies. The first is a 10, because they like the athlete in it better and it's the original. This one has to be a 1 because it isn't "as good". Why does everything have to be a binary? Can we enjoy things for enjoyment sake?I titled this zeitgeist to zeitgeist because movies are made for the cultural time period surrounding them. If you were hoping for what we had in the 90s basketball era, film era, and animation era you've set an unrealistic criteria and you'll be letdown. If you come in expecting a fun family movie with the looney tunes being looney and tons of fun Warner Bros film references you'll come out of this with a big smile on your face.We know Lebron isn't a good actor (sorry Lebron, your flopping in the NBA has proved this) but we understand why he's the right guy for the job. I hope you enjoy this movie as much as I did. More than an athlete.

reviews.review_title: Better than I thought it was gonna be
reviews.content: A huge fan of the original and a huge fan of Michael Jordan. I felt like this would be a mockery of Space Jam, but it entirely wasn't. It was surprisingly funny and enjoyable. Lebron James dines need to working on imhos acting skills is he's gonna try to pull off a big budget film.
No hate at all it just overall wasn't a good acting was terrible storyline was predictable and bland Don Cheadle and the rap scene saved this movie.
The only reason this has a low rating is LeBron James seems to trigger the real snowflakes of the world.
Went in with low expectations and even those were too high.

This movie is not as bad as the haters will make you believe. The warner bros cameos were fun and so was this movie. Michael Jordan never won and Oscar for the first one. Stop hating on LeBron. He made this movie for his kids and ours. Its a fun movie and we enjoyed it. Its just as good as the original if not better.

reviews.review_title: Don't waste your time and money!
reviews.content: Leflop is a good actor on the basketball court, but acting in a movie is really horrible.
Awesome movie with a great father son story and Don Cheadle was the perfect villain. The amount of adults hating on a kids movie is weird grow up guys.

reviews.review_title: Let your kids enjoy this movie
reviews.content: It's really sad the bad reviews are from LeBron haters and people expecting a "smart" plot. It's Looney Tunes, basketball and video games. But if you paid attention the real story is about family. If you disliked the 1st, why did you even bother? Did you expect a plot based on thought? It's about the heart, heros, family, goodness with a hearty mix of nastalia for Looney Tunes and basketball "greats." (as in, even I as a non-basketball fan knows the name LeBron) My son (27 yo, autistic) has giggled and laughed so much throughout this movie. It has my utmost respect. I Iove to hear my son laugh. The easter eggs are fun (and again touches on well known even if it isn't something you embrace.)

Most of you are just lebron haters so you dont wanna like the movie just cause your hate of lebron 😂😂he's human to not only that he helps more within his community and every where he goes more than most rich people in this world 😂haters will be haters.
This movie should pay me for my time and my money. Both of which I will never get back. More upset about losing my time.

reviews.review_title: It was better than I thought
reviews.content: After hearing that the movie was bad, I had to watch it for myself on HBO Max. And I thought there would've been bad everything in it. I see people comparing it to the original but I came in with a open mind. It had story, it had meaning, there were high points and low points. It was actually quite funny and probably enjoyable for children. The movie was good. I could watch it all the way through without stopping it and saying, "Wow this is horrible." So before you write a review and comparing it to the first, just think, what did your children think of it and did it have meaning. Just enjoy the movie, not point out the flaws.

reviews.review_title: Expectations are the their of joy
reviews.content: While I could predict it would be a bad movie before release it wasn't as bad but still horrible a movie with athletes firstly only focuses on the star player but also the athlete usually have horrible acting it is a movie that I would watch justice league (2017) over but still hated it they never focus on the real stars the loony tunes.

reviews.review_title: I know a 6/10 is extremely generous but hear me out...
reviews.content: Space Jam 2 is not awful considering its primary audience is kids. Now this doesn't mean that we must encourage movies such as this. But, there seems to be too much hate for this movie as some people are trying to analyze it as a serious film. It's not. The plot seems more adapted to modern day and frankly has more weight than the original Space Jam. Although it feels like a long WB advert/SNL most of the time, it still stays true to the over the top wackiness of the original. For a Space Jam film, this is extremely creative in many areas. Especially when Bron enters the 2D Looney world. Some of the best parts of the film happen there. There are some genuine comedic moments here and there whilst also having an important message about doing what you want. In short, parts of it make more sense than the original Space Jam believe it or not.Could the movie have been better even for a kids film? Yes. Was the length of the film too long? Yes. A massive chunk of the basketball game could've been trimmed out by the editors. Nearly 20-30 mins can be trimmed out. Was there too many WB references? Yes. Almost gets repetitive at a point. But the whole concept of Space Jam was one corporate crown jewel by studio execs to make more money. Will your kids like it? Tbf if they can get beyond the first 20 mins of drama in the film, they will have an amazing time.Both the Space Jam films are not good by any means. The first Space Jam had more charm and better jokes. The second Space Jam captures more heart and has better CGI. New Legacy falls flat on the jokes. Older Looney Tunes fans will miss classic Looney humour. And Le Bron has too much screentime taking away the opportunity for the Tunes to truly shine. Despite all that it's still entertaining in some parts.An entertaining mess nonetheless. It's a Space Jam film with a slightly better plot. Feels like a film which should've come out 8 years ago. There is a much better story hidden somewhere in the film which felt unexplored. But it's not a 1/10 by any means considering it's a Space Jam film. We don't look at movie logic or WB property adverts. Nor do we look at a basketball superstar's poor acting. We look at the jokes and charm of our beloved Looney Tunes characters. Space Jam 2 falls a little short here compared to the original. That being said, WB YOU SHOULD REALLY MAKE A LOONEY TUNES BACK IN ACTION SEQUEL INSTEAD OF DIVERTING THE ATTENTION FROM THE MAIN CHARACTERS IN THEIR OWN FILM!!!!!!Final verdict of the film: Less Looney, less charm, That's all folks?!

This movie is one of the most overly self promoting movies WB has ever made and tried way to hard to steer away and be better then the original with Michael Jordan and make sharknado 4 look like there weren't any self promos for their xfinity brand within Comcast. This is one of those movies that nobody wanted and should have never been made.
... but on the other hand, it's hilarious and funny.By the end of the movie I had to upgrade my previous rating :)

I don't know what people expected with this movie to evaluate it so poorly.The original Space Jam was only that good because of Nostalgia and originality. For a sequel, Space Jam: A new legacy tries do update itself but still go for the nostalgia.Bad acting? Check. Painful sometimes. Not much better than the original though.Bad Script? Check. It's basic, uninteresting and I confess I was just there for Looney Tunes. With that purpose in mind. We had some laughs and fun!It it a money oriented/ Advertisement movie? Definitely.But the tons of reference to Warner Brothers titles kept me entertained even when plot lost interest. People here say it's for 3 years old, it has the basic kids movie formula, but you miss these cartoons, you will have some fun along with your kid. Come on, this is no Emoji Movie. People shouldn't be too harsh because there is some love in it at least from the animation crew and it's visible.

Half committed perfomances and some of the worst voice over work I've come across. You have the modern voice of porky pig doing the voice of tweety pie and some random bloke that sound's terrible as all his characters doing porky instead aswell as 5 or six other characters who all sound wrong.Eric you ruined it for everyone.

Taking in to consideration it's a kids/family movie

That movie isn't good, the cgi was great but that's it lebron is a bad actor he should stick with basketball.
"That's cheating", shouted by Don C, and basically concluded Lebron's career...

reviews.review_title: Meets Expectations, with Some Unexpected Laughs
reviews.content: If anyone thought this was going to live up to the original, then they were cursed from the start.Aside from Lebron's poor acting, which you'll get used to quickly, and the overly done CGI, the movie is actually pretty enjoyable at times.I think it'll turn into a trend to rag on this, but it isn't deserved. It's a kids movie that touches on a nostalgic past, which is what was promised.

Instead of making an amazing follow up, they're too focused on being woke instead of making a great movie. If you're going to make a sequel or anything related to another, either keep it going good or don't make it at all.
Why, oh why?!? Seriously just awful! I can't believe after watching, Warner Bros said "hey, this is a great movie! Let's get it out to the public right away!"

I am surprised at all the negative reviews. I am glad I watched it with my son before reading these reviews. He enjoyed it fully & I actually found it funny myself. I guess a lot of people forget how Warner Brother cartoons were when growing up. Yes a lot is predictable, but that was always the fun of them. Would watch it again myself.

Yes Lebron is a bad actor, he even calls it out in the movie which was pretty funny. Don Cheadle crushes it and hilarious. Listen, people are hating on this movie and need to take a step back and see for what it is. This movie was entertaining. All Warner Brothers characters showed up which was nostalgic for me. Even Rick & Morty made an appearance! My Dad and I laughed throughout the movie.I rarely write reviews but felt compelled to help recover the negativity. I love film and gave it a 6 - not good for a film but for a family movie to entertain, it deserves at least a 5 or 6 with better reviews.On a family movie scale only with The Goonies being a 10, its prob a solid 7 or 8.Come on peeps, chill out. How could you not like seeing the whitewalkers watch some Space Jam! Haters gonna hate...Why would you not watch this with your kid?
He's not great, he spews his liberal agenda as if people care. The first wasn't the greatest of all time but it was our childhood.

reviews.review_title: Watching ads instead of a classic.
reviews.content: The entire movie felt like I was watching an ad. Not just one Ad but one ad after another. The CGI was great but everything was rushed, no character development and the great characters were giving little emphasis making it probably one of the worst movies of the year.

reviews.review_title: Both films are good. Don't listen to the hate, this isn't LeBRON vs Jordan. It's two great films
reviews.content: Space Jam A New Legacy is well worth a watch.I'm giving this a 10 star cause I feel this is getting unnecessary hate. Almost as if it's LeBron vs Jordan, and only one person is winning that popularity contest and it's not Lenron.Both players are great just like these films.So glad I ignored the reviews. Growing up I didn't know anyone that didn't like Space Jam, but even the original got mixed reviews to start with, then it became a classic. What I'm trying to say is reviews are not always right.Have your own opinion.Kids today will love this film, in years to come it could become a classic for them.People need to stop hating on this film and enjoy it for what it is, a great kids film. If you don't like or grown out of kids films, don't hate, just don't watch it!I don't want to add any spoilers but I personally loved all the moments of nostalgia I got from this film.My point is, if you like the original don't be put off by the reviews for this, give it a try.That's all folks!

reviews.review_title: Don't waste your time or money

reviews.review_title: King Flop in the court and in a movie!

Labron is trash, bad just bad. He need to just fade after this period. Acting was terrible. It's called SPACE jam, where was anything SPACE about it. The original was awesome. This one makes em all look bad.

reviews.review_title: The movie is a FLAGRANT FOUL!

Its a good film but in the shadow of the original. It also feels really rushed and seems to miss out key moments throughout. Also the acting in some scenes is awful.

reviews.review_title: It holds up to the original.
reviews.content: The movie held my attention and my 5-year-old daughter's, too. She loves Bugs Bunny, video games, and basketball, so the movie really worked for her, We enjoyed munching on popcorn and watching this movie together. It's not deserving of such low ratings and LeBron hate.The original Space Jam had a ridiculous story line and some of the worst acting cameos from athletes, but it was still silly and fun to watch.The new Space Jam ups the stakes with a decent plot and a villain in Don Cheadle who nails his role. It's honestly right on par with the original, if not better and more polished. LeBron more than holds his own as an actor, and while WB drops a few too many of its own "Easter eggs," it actually makes sense within the plot. There's no gut busting moments, but I smiled, chuckled, and laughed plenty along with my daughter.We'll certainly watch it again.

This is the first time I walk out of a movie! Don't go, not worth your time and money.

reviews.review_title: A New Legacy? More like A Disgraceful Legacy!
reviews.content: Despite literally having some good visuals to an extent, and got some chuckles out of some moments, this movie was honestly very terrible. In fact, disgraceful at best.They got the nerve to have LeBron James look like he's so great, despite him being controversial in real life, and being the worse of many dull characters in the film. It pains me that people give Michael Jordan so much unfair crap thrown at him for his performance in the original film. I though MJ was really good in the film, because one word can really describe how MJ is in Space Jam, and that is "genuine." LeBron doesn't feel genuine, and it doesn't help that the supporting cast weren't as good either. They're all trapped in this massive, corporate mess of a story that devoid of logic, even by Looney Tunes standards.Speaking of Looney Tunes, some of the characters were okay for the most part, but characters like Granny, Porky Pig (because that cringy rap battle), Lola, and Bugs Bunny were basically ruined. Lola's character literally doesn't have much going for, despite having more screen time than the 5 minutes of screen time she had in her (much better) debut in the original film. Yeah, she's not the worst of the bunch, but I'm not supporting a progressively dumb redesign choice from the mind of Malcolm D. Lee, who clearly didn't understand Space Jam, or Lola Bunny to begin with. And, having Lola to consult the help of Wonder Women pretty much ruined it more for me. She's already a strong female character, you don't need her to have this pointless "development" for her character to "grow." As if The Looney Tunes Show from 2011 haven't screwed her character up enough, by making her into that stupid blonde stereotype, voiced by Kristen Wiig (nothing against her, but she's not all that to me as Lola)... Anyways, Bugs in this movie, despite me liking him, I mean he's the most iconic character ever, but they literally tried to kill him. Not only in the many dumb moments, but the ending to where he performs "the glitch move" and dies. But, of course despite explaining stuff like this literally in the past, including the original Space Jam, Bugs is alive and well, making that cheap, sappy, and manipulating moment of sacrifice completely pointless!I don't want to make this way too long than it already is, but if I were to speed things up like the hilarious time-lapsed Don Cheadle (Al. G. Rhythm) introduction scene, here's what else sucked hard in this film. Al. G. Rhythm is a crappy villain with broken motivations, an attention-seeking attitude, and The Mummy Returns-like CGI near the end, the Goon Squad were rushed-CGI cringe. The soundtrack was forgettable, but slightly decent in some areas, despite not being nearly as awesome as the original Space Jam album, and James Newton Howards score of the original as well. The overuse of WB IPs (mostly a bunch of R-rated ones in a PG kids movie) were very distracting, and honestly one of the worse parts of the plot. I know Pulp Fiction was referenced in the original, but that was a pretty funny gag that worked for the film, and its characters. Lebron's son should've been the most interesting character, but all believability is thrown out with how fast he can make an advanced-looking video game within the supposed months and weeks he spent on. Seriously, that bugged me before the plot even settled in! And, the biggest kick in the balls for me, as a fan of the original film was the god-awful Michael B. Jordan scene, as it's a joke of hyping up Michael Jordan's grand entrance. One of many reasons why this film is very disgraceful. In fact, I should say this film's more disrespectful. It definitely takes the cake as one of the worst films of this year.One more thing I would end this off. Space Jam, to me is a good film no matter what the case may be. I know it's not perfect, and that's the point. Literally, there's so much to love about this film, and it was made by better people that at their very best knew what movie they were making. It may seem like a gimmicky cash-grab to others, but it's so enjoyable and fun that you care less about what the studio wanted to do with the film, or what the nay-sayers say about it. This disrespectful standalone sequel is not Space Jam, and it dang sure ain't no great family film. It takes too much and throws it all in the kitchen sink, and screws a lot of things up. Almost everything about this movie is everything I feared it would be, and I'll definitely not be watching this travesty again.2.5/10 for having a few good things, but the rest of the movie being nothing but total nonsense, and idiocy that goes along well with The Tom & Jerry Movie of 2021. Pure utter garbage. I'm sorry, but this movie sucked. The original is the best, hands down.

Movie is funny and has alot of guest features that will bring laughs and nostalgia. reviews.review_title: The Original Space Jam isn't as good as you remember
reviews.content: I rated this at 6 stars because the original has a 6.5 rating. I think people need to rewatch the original because it's just as bad as this one. This movie is exactly what I expected (except it's missing a space jam song remix). I don't know what everyone was expecting... it's a live action Looney Toons movie, with an athlete as a main character. It wasn't going to be great. I feel like it is an original movie that doesn't copy too much from its predecessor, yet conveys similar feelings. Yes WB was doing a bit of "hey, look at all the properties we own!" but that didn't bother me too much. They were self-aware about it, and it made sense in the movie's context. I also felt like as an adult it was fun to see references to movies such as the matrix, that kids wouldn't recognize.It is not a well-made movie. The acting was ok, and plot was simple. However the theme of "be you" (and for parents to encourage kids to pursue their dreams) was wholesome. I laughed and smiled at references to my childhood. Overall, I enjoyed this movie. To me it's just as good as the original and should be treated as so.

Normally with movie remakes like Mulan and lion king, they can be short of grown up expectations, but you realize they're made for the kids of 2020 and it's ok that it doesn't meet our expectations. As long as kids are captivated it's ok. This movie was bad. Don Cheadle couldn't save it. No one could. MJ wasn't an academy award winner; he didn't have to be, the cartoons took over. It was simple and kids and grown-ups loved it. This movie was atrocious and all over the map. It bounced around so much my kids couldn't follow. There was barely any slapstick... No laughter. No smile. Just a stare at the movie screen. I couldn't believe how you could watch a movie like this at the end review and say "this looks good, let's release it " it's going to be the McDonald's Happy meals that will make the profit for this movie. I don't see anyone wanting to pay the fees, both digital and theater for this. It looked visually stunning...but that was it. MJ pulled it off. This was just terrible... I'm even an optimist...but Buddha himself couldn't make a positive review for this movie. Very unfortunate; really wanted this movie to succeed.

Omg Idk much about LeBron James but goddamn this felt like an infomercial for him, and I'm only 30mins into the movie.Like every few mins is about praising his ego.Also script felt like it was written by some school kid who tried to emulate the 90s version. It doesn't work today.
I really loved and enjoyed this movie. Great job!!! 💪🏾🙌🏾💪🏾

reviews.content: My kids really enjoyed the movie. Thought it was campy and corny but fun. We all thought James acting was horrible but did not expect much and it did not make it less fun.

I find that everytime a movie gets it ratings, that they don't speak for me. If they love them, I hate them. If it's "universally panned" I tend to love them.I grew up on Space Jam, and remember liking it as a kid, but I find that as an adult it's not rewatchable.A New Legacy is not without its commercialism or memberries. Its inherent, and so was the original.Its certainly a very time tested and true story. A father wants whats best for his kid, and the kid doesn't want to do it, because he has his own path. Yep, we've seen this before.But, I find the heart of the movie to be genuine, I find the performances of the actors to be believable, I think the cgi was very well done, and the pacing to be exciting and engaging.Its a good movie worth watching. reviews.review_title: If this wasn't a remake it wouldn't be as heavily criticized.
reviews.content:
Looking at other reviews of this movie, I had a really good laugh. 9/10 people will say the acting was horrible, but let's get serious- it's a kids movie and it's being critiqued by adults who were children that watched the first one. Rewind, watch the original Space Jam, and tell me that Michael Jordan was a better actor (don't lie to yourself either).This was a decent movie, great for children, with plenty of entertaining bits for adults. The first 45 minutes was amazing, traveling through the "Warner-verse". To anyone saying they didn't laugh at all during this movie, you must have had a bad day. Sylvester and Elmer's intro into the movie was hilarious, along with many of the other toons. The Chapelle Show reference was also great.Does it live up to the hype? Absolutely not. Was it a cash grab? Absolutely. One thing is for certain though, the people criticizing this movie and giving it under 5 star reviews need to be criticized and critiqued themselves. If you go into a movie wanting to hate it or already hating it, why are you even giving your opinion?9/10 Animation
4/10 Story (it's a kids movie)
6/10 HumorThe story is very easy to follow, was missing a good supporting lead like Bill Murray to ease L. J. poor acting (He's an athlete, not an actor, take it for what it is). Don Cheadle did a great job playing a villain- and on top of that it's interesting that no one is celebrating the fact that this was a primarily African American cast. As for the plot, the movie also does a decent job at pointing out the complexities of having a career, while being a parent (wanting the best for your child while allowing them to mold themselves into who they want to be is not easy).All in all, I give it a 6, and a solid one at that. It's entertaining, fun to watch with your children, but not something you definitely need to see or add to your immediate watch list.

reviews.review_title: no charm, no creativity, and not entertaining

reviews.review_title: Love these kind of animation but...
reviews.content: The problem i have with good movies, is that every time they try to make a follow-up as good as the original, they always end up making it worse than it potentially could be (With some exceptions).The acting was not very good at all, and thats the problem when you put famous people in movies who are not really actors, just to make it more attractive.The first one was not a masterpiece either, its more a nostalgic movie for us growing up in the early 2000´s. It had some kind of sharm, something wich was far absent in this one. Since Into the Spider Verse i´ve been a huge fan of the new animation style some movie makers have started to play with. Its just pure fun and their creativity feels like anything is possible to create. But this just feels like the movie-makers had a meeting for two hours, and made it in just a week. The animation looks great, but they blew its potential.

Jordan) had made an actual cameo and helped with the last quarter of the "basketball game". This movie is so terrible it is a complete snooze fest. Wish it could be rated 0 stars.

Just to give a reference I am Dutch and I remember seeing Space Jam as a little girl in the Netherlands and it didn't matter what planet you were from; you knew about Michael Jordan and I have never seen a basketball game in my life. Somehow this movie made sense to me as I loved anything Disney and Looney Tunes. Just rewatched it. The original still has the same charm and wit! What I also loved was the music. Music is the part of the foundation of a good movie!!! I see a lot of bad reviews about the new movie and I agree with all of them however none of them seem to talk about the soundtrack. In the original movie that was a phenomenon on its own (!) The way it opens is just SO right! All of these songs were played in the club and still are huge bangers. Space Jam 2 misses the funk, the soul that's embedded in hip hop and R&B which complimented Michael Jordan's swag so well. I don't know too much about LeBron obviously I know who he is but I have a sneaking suspicion the script was imagined with Kobe. Regardless, let's stay focused: I know bad acting when I see it it felt like a long product placement movie which is way too long for kids and even Don looks like a horrible actor in this film and he is a genius. The whole film feels like an explosion of bad ideas. Less is definitely more. It's so disappointing to realize we live in a time where everything has to be reimagined... like why can't we just leave the classics alone and come up with new interesting stories and scripts?

The man simply cannot act in any sense of the word unless he's on the court trying to draw a foul. The only reason it gets a 2 instead of a 1 is some of the brief but mildly entertaining cameos that aren't enough to prop up the film to even watch it a second time through.I would even go as far as to say this movie solidifies Michael Jordan as the best of the 2 on court, AND on film.

like 1 or 2/10 is an exaggeration. Not saying people don't have valid points but that I think the movie gets a bit too much hateCritically it's like 4/10 but for the enjoyment I and my sister had while watching it, it's 7/10
just like the first Space Jam was like 5/10 critically but for the enjoyment it has a higher score for meAlthough I must admit I've watched this movie not in English, I watching it with a Polish Dub and I feel like it makes the movie better, just like with the OG Space Jam I thought the Polish dub made the voices of the characters for the most part better, at least in my opinion. reviews.review_title: Lazy humor, self obsessed Lebron, boring story

reviews.review_title: Not as bad as I thought it was going to be.
reviews.content: I watched it with my kids (10) and one made the point that although this seems to be a Space Jam for a new generation, they were very familiar with the previous Space Jam.IMO, even though the plot made no sense, it had some funny moments (Bugs and Co were good) and the lesson was good, especially for parents. Let kids do what they are good at and manage your expectations of your kid.I would also say that the Ready Player One-ish callback attempt worked for me and helped keep it interesting, because, as I mentioned above, there really isn't any coherence of a plot, or anything that may be attempted to be called one.

No it's nothing like the 1st and what film is, but using everything in today's culture worked pretty well. I loved how they threw all the Warner bros. Movies and toons together, and also seeing some of today's all stars in monstars forms. It seemed like it would of made more since to use LeBron's actual family instead of replacements.

As a stand-alone feature I'd say it's pretty decent. The humor and comedy is great, with the cartoonish antics and the Tunes themselves in particular being a highlight of the film. The cameos and references to some might come of as pointless and/or shameless, but for me they were a highlight of the movie. If you enjoy Looney Tunes or any classic animation or that style of humor, then you will find plenty of enjoyment in this film.
This is not a Space Jam 2, this is fu*king WB commercial.

Worst cash grab I've seen. Pretty much all WB properties are in this movie. As spectators at the final game. The trailer is so deceiving. As usual. Do not watch this movie. It's an insult to the original Jordan Space Jam. Bad acting, 0 character development, plot is so bad, it's sad someone greenlit this. And the Michael Jordan cameo? Oh c'mon that was too good too be true...
Awfull....just awfull. Boring long and a pure achill for Warner bros/hbo.

reviews.review_title: Super cute and kids will love!
reviews.content: Wow! These negative reviews are wild! Went into this expecting one big advertisement after reading reviews but this was such a cute and fun movie. Just allow yourself to enjoy a silly movie about LeBron playing basketball with Looney Tunes and don't take it too seriously. This is an enjoyable movie with adorable classic characters with a very positive message about father-son relationships and being yourself. Also, all this hate about Warner brothers self promotion... I just don't get it, they referenced old franchises that are classic and it was all in good fun, I don't think Harry Potter and the Matrix needs any help at this point...so I don't understand the outrage. Kids will love this movie and the looney tunes and Space Jam concept were very nostalgic for adults.
2 hours worth of shameless plugs and no storyline. Oof...

reviews.review_title: Why does it take so long to meet the Toons?
reviews.content: The toons are the reason to come see this thing!In the Original MJ made a few hoops as a kid talking about his dreams with his father, jump cut to him owning his future. Bam. Boom. We got it him under two minutes and we meet the toons All of them together, Michael pops up like twice in between loony mayhem. In this one, Lebron is Has to do A handshake with his mother and get some backstory, (which won't be showing up later). He plays more than one game under the worst athletics coach in his schools history, and 5 minutes later we meet his kid Who has a whole lotta backstory, and a half hour later we meet Bugs, The one and only toon in all of toon world. Why does it take so long to meet the Toons!!! The Toons are the reason to come and see this thing? Why would it take so long too See them ?!?!When you finally do you half to wade through a half hour of commercials, And then when they finally get together they're not Toons Anymore. They're some weird, angry mob made of money Swimming in Subscription services. It's until the end it finally becomes a Pepsi Commercial.Daffy has a few good lines, as do the rest of the toons, and the Basketball game was creative. The video game aspect was creative and cool. There wasn't a whole lot of banter and one of the reasons for that is you din't get to know who the enemies were. Not really. They got a freeze frame introduction but there was no individuality. All the personality was in Al and Lebron's kid. They tried so hard to make us care about this story and I did not. Something about creating a video. Al-Gor-rythm wanted something, I think It was to win a Basketball game. I'm not really sure why... it sounded really convoluted and therefore important so I just went numb and accepted it. They played basketball the banter just wasn't there. There was no back and forth and back and forth it just kind of swung one way once, held that spot for a moment and then went the other way.I guess You can change Lola's design, They changed everyone else's and to be honest, as they tried to go for a much more dramatic tone her new design seemed to fit this new film a bit better, She didn't crack a single joke so why give her anything that would make Bugs go GaGa? I expected her to make more than one basket... or at least score some style points with it. I mean she was the only person on the team to score a total of 2 points. Lebron score 37 or whatever on his first shot. Story wise they gave that shot to Lola because they needed to bring the game closer so that the toons only needed one more basket to win, (it was like 1038 to 1035, Lola brought them to 1037), but Wiley Coyote got like 600. Why not let Lola earn some style too, being the only baller on the team. She friggin coached them!It just didn't have any wit or charm in it. I mean their was some wit, but it came sandwiched in a lot of greed. And I don't want to be sold a subscription to HBO MAX. I want to see my Toons. I bought the ticket which means the previews run before the beginning and not throughout the entire film. And the writer's kind lost track over who and what this store is actually about.
Don't waste your money. Plain and simple. It was a waste of a movie.

The storyline line lacks ny creativity and is terrible. The acting is equally bad. The CGI and animation I'll give some credit too and there is potential there but I wouldn't watch knowing what I know now.
Pretty much the worst film I've seen and I've watched some s***... Hard to follow up a classic, and this one will be remembered for all the wrong reasons.

reviews.review_title: It wasn't as bad as people are saying...
reviews.content: I feel people are just focusing on Lebron's acting (which isn't good) but who cares. It's a feel good family movie, with really good graphics and detail to characters. I think people are hating and being overly aggressive saying its the worst move they ever seen lol relax people, it's not that serious.
The movie was nice and the plot was amazing and this time there was a reason for playing against the goonsquad so Lebron could save his son, the plot in the 1st space jam wasn't as good.

reviews.review_title: Did you know how great Lebron is?
reviews.content: If you didn't, this catastrophe will spend it's entirety making sure you know. I gave it 2 stars because it's not THE worst movie I've ever seen, but in truth I felt like that was being nice. It's terrible from start to finish. Yet another attempt to place Lebron on a throne next to Jordan when he clearly doesn't belong.

reviews.review_title: This was a good laugh, heart felt family movie.
reviews.content: I enjoyed this movie, don't think space jam like the first movie more like toon jam. I liked it better then the first space jam. Good jokes here and there not a basket ball fan but people are being too hard in it.

reviews.review_title: THIS IS WHAT WE CALLED THE ROTTEN TOMATO EFFECT
reviews.content: The movie was not that worst tbh. Not much a lebron fan but i think the concept of cross over the WB universe is kinda cool, really hope that justice league can play ball too and i think the title should not be named space jam. Plus, that michael jordan half time teased really got me. If u go watching this movie with the idea maybe it will be related to the original space jam then u will 100% disappointed for sure thus give it 1 star and the genre already stated that this movie is family/kids what do u expect. I mean its not that good and not that bad as 1 star. The only thing i hate about this movie is they really worshiping lebron so hard in this movie. I know lebron is a great bball player but come on, mention part of his accomplishment once is enough. No need to bring it every minutes. Overall its not that bad trust me.

For those who remember the original film from the 90's, it provided light entertainment with no underlying agenda. A simple concept that was well executed and has stood the test of time. It was no masterpiece but was punctuated with charm and a little heart.This was a completely unnecessary remake. It didn't being anything new to the table and it felt like a money grabbing exercise first, an advertisement second, a preach session third, as well as a waste of money.Inferior in every way. They could have simply re-released the original and it would have added more to the culture.

reviews.review_title: Good but Mj played in a better role than LeBrom
reviews.content: I give this a 8.5/10 I enjoyed this movie but somethings in the movie I didn't like two things I did not like was the role of LeBron because MJ played in a better role because he was much nicer another I did not like was the plot of the looney tune at the beginning of the movie though overall I liked the movie it had some good cameos so that's why I gave it a 8.5 out of 10.
Sometimes you just can't or shouldn't remake a classic. Animation is amazing though.

reviews.review_title: An enjoyable movie with flat spots.
reviews.content: Overall the movie does have some good heart in it and seeing the toons backs is always a treat. This is a fun spin on the original and DOn Cheadle does a great job as the protagonist.The movie does have flat spots, Mostly the less than stellar sound track, A new character Al G's assistant who doesn't really serve a purpose and at times LeBron being a bit wooden.All that aside you can basically ignore review below 5; These are either Jordan stans or LeBron haters.The movie sits for me at a decent 7 and I'd watching it with my nephew and nieces again.

Seriously all the hate is quite pretentious. It's a looney tunes movie and people are complaining about plot problems lmao! I'm a huge Jordan fan and loved the first. For that reason I'd thought I'd hate it. However is was good. Funny and a cool look. The cameos from virtually every WB character was awesome. The "Jordan" cameo was clever. Definitely a great film for movie night with kids.

reviews.review_title: I mean, I knew what I was getting...
reviews.content: Space Jam in the 90s was a big hit, I have yet to watch the film to prepare for this film, and surprisingly it was fun... however, it wasn't great. All of the acting was weak, especially the dialogue with LeBron and Dom. The biggest moment for me was the Looney Tunes, I loved them so much as a kid, and I still do... even though they were fully CGI for the main event.The thing I want to mention the most was the cameos and the references. It makes Ralph Breaks the Internet feel like a Minecraft server with custom pop cultural skins... I don't know why I said that... let's just move on.Overall, I did not think this film had "flew like an eagle", it was just extremely Looney. Ey? Ey? Looney? As in Looney Tunes?Moral of the story, it was just fine.

reviews.review_title: Generic, but still worth the watch
reviews.content: Although this movie has a plainly generic plot, there's plenty of fan service for movies fans to basketball fans.

Animation is phenomenal and the Loony Tunes have their moments but the human acting and likeablility is trash apart from don cheadles who with half descent directing might have stood a chance. This had potential but it was executed all wrong and was obviously just a Lebron cash out.
Great fun film! Don't base your watch on all the previous reviews. Go into the film open with expectation!

Whoever wrote this movie must've not watched the first one. In the first one there was heart and thought put into it. This one? It's a bunch of garbled up junk full of bad acting and plot. Lebron doesn't even know how to act and whoever was his acting coach deserves to be in a totally different industry. Lebron is all about money and fame and has completely lost his heart for what brought him into who he is now. He saw the opportunity to make a few million dollars and literally ripped off Warner. At least Michael Jordan played his role in space jam whole hearted, probably because Michael didn't forget where he came from and never has... Don't buy this movie just wait until it regurgitates and comes out on prime and you have nothing else to watch on a rainy day. It will occupy about 2 hours of your time... but that's about it...

reviews.review_title: A generic plot backed with really good exaction and use of history.
reviews.content:
The plot of the movie was very generic I mean I didn't expect a Deep plot or any thing I mean it's a movie made for kids to enjoy but I think that adults will also love it because of the many nodes to other W. B works from all across their history I especially loved "spoiler alert"
..
When all the W. Bs characters showed up at the game and that scene made me jump in my seat 😂 and when Kong and the iron giant did that fist pump it made me laugh so hard 😆 so I know that it's not gonna be a 10\10 movie but at the least it deserves a 6 or 7.
