There's a scene where he needs to be emotional and I'm embarrassed for him and his acting. One of the worst heartfelt moments I've ever watched. I expected more from Warner Bros and was very disappointed. Don't waste your money unless you really care about how Lebron thinks he is.

reviews.review_title: That was tough to get through
reviews.content: Wow, that was tough to get through. I can't believe that I was able to sit down and actually finish this movie. As a kid who grew up in the 90s, I watched the original space jam dozens of time. Thought it would be nostalgic to watch the 2021 version, but I was wrong. If you're like me and want to feel nostalgic watching a childhood classic remake, this is not the one.

reviews.review_title: I don't know if you know but the film is from the WB
reviews.content: Not even in prime time did I see so much publicity. I would like to know when the ads end and the movie starts.

Sadly disappointed with the movie... Lebron did terrible acting and every like was cliche. Weak plot. They had a a great opportunity here, but lebron's acting killed it. Everything seemed so forced, or a promotional video for him or product placement of his brands.
I grew up with most of the cartoon characters in this so it was nice to see them all bright together in one film. I enjoyed the storyline and again, the classic characters from my childhood.
People rate it low but me, my partner and kid enjoyed it. Its not a remake more an upgrade, the technology side appeals to the youth growing up now. Worth a watch.

reviews.review_title: A Decent Movie to Watch for Fun
reviews.content: I had a pretty good time watching the movie. I think some of the low reviews are comparing this movie to the original and many people may have a nostalgia bias. This film is definitely not meant to be taken too seriously as a sports film and is supposed to just be a cartoony kids film to watch for fun. I will acknowledge that most (if not all) of the live-action acting is pretty bad, but the voice acting was good and the animation was phenomenal (except for Al-G Rhythm's transformed design). Some moments were a bit cringey, like Porky Pig rapping or Granny being cool and sassy, and at times it felt like WB tried to forcefully shove in a lot of their properties. But aside from these flaws, the movie is fun to watch if you don't take it too seriously.

This movie was just terrible. LeBron is the worst, why would they cast him. He has absolutely no acting ability, it is just painful to watch. The first movie was great, Jordan was great. This movie is clearly a money grab that has a story that is just plain stupid. Do not waste your time.
Horrible. Just horrible. LBJ is no Jordan and this movie just goes to strengthen that aspect.

reviews.review_title: Don't listen to these brainwashed people
reviews.content: Go and see it for yourself without bringing your bias in. It was a great movie for basketball fans. It was funny throughout with a LOT of cool scenes.

reviews.review_title: I could have given it a 7 but its a 6
reviews.content: It could have been little more serious . There were some funny warner bros. References and the whole idea was funny , but they could be funnier . Overall it was kinda refreshing but some of the acting had room for progress .

So, it was my boyfriend that put this movie on for him to watch. At the same time, I was sitting next to him cruising on my phone because I had no plans whatsoever to watch the movie with him. But it caught enough of my attention once I figured out what he put on.Well, I ended up watching the entire film. It actually was quite enjoyable. Easy and understanding plot, typical Toon humour, and just the intrigue of watching LeBron on screen.Did I care that he can't really act? No. He's a basketball player, not an actor. Did I think the whole movie was cheesy? Sure, but isn't that the point?Then I came onto IMDb and just read facts and trivia and maybe a glance at the reviews, as I'd typically do after watching something. Wow, that's a lot of negative reviews. I felt bad!My opinion is to watch this movie with no real expectations. I think some viewers just hyped themselves up for the movie. Listen, I do not believe they produced this movie to try to win Oscars. I believe it was just for plain entertainment and with that, it succeeded.So, bring down all those standards and watch the movie for what it's really for. Entertainment.
I did not see it but my two younger brothers liked it so much.

This is a film for the whole family.Sure I also don't get why pennywise was in it and all the other character, but it had some cool jokes for the new tech generation as well as the 90s kids with all that cartoon jokes on the side.I can recommend this movie !

reviews.review_title: As good as the first one
reviews.content: All i am gonna say, this is a good tunes film. You can watch it with your family full of fun and joy. Aside from everything, core of the story have solid message. All you have to do letting out yourselves to flow of it and enjoy.
Lebron Is Goat. I don't like the LeBestofalltime slander.
Good movie. I like it.Much fun and also good music.

reviews.review_title: Only worth it for the Easter Eggs
reviews.content: The two stars are purely for the Easter eggs and other movie references in this over hyped and over budgeted "All that" Nickelodeon skit.But then again, what else would you expect from a Warner brothers project. A studio that has no idea what it's doing in any genre they produce.This movie is centered around a terrible "actor" in Lebron James and that terrible acting stands out when his entire supporting cast acts circles around him. I've seen better acting from this guy on the court during one of his flops.As for the actual premise... well it doesn't make sense either. At least in the original, the tunes had a reason to be involved in this movie. This time, they were just thrown in there for nostalgic purposes catering to the fans of the original. I honestly found myself dying to do chores around the house, than watch this movie. If I wasn't a father with kids at home and didn't have HBOmax, I probably would've never seen this movie. I wish I hadn't now that I think about it.

reviews.review_title: Too much marketing of lebron too little toons
reviews.content: Ok I'll say I neither love nor hate "king James" but when I go to the theater expecting a loony toons movie that's what I want and nothing more but aside from a few good toon moments this was focused on lebron and that's not what I payed for I did however enjoy the movie.

I have never written a review on here until now. It was eating at me to give a review just because how bad the movie was. I fell asleep before the game started and that's how bad it is. I never fall asleep during movies, never. I did wake up when Michael Jordan showed up and for that I give my 1 star to. If I could put 0 stars I would but I can't. DONT WATCH IT, SAVE YOURSELF!!

Decent enough the kids enjoyed it that's what I care about. The original was god awful bill Murray saved that movie lebron just didn't have a bill Murray. Acting wise he isn't very good but I mean neither was Jordan. Animation was nice though. I can't stand to watch the original as an adult but I can enjoy the animation quality on this but probably won't watch it again.

reviews.review_title: It's not winning any Oscars but did you think it would?
reviews.content: Look, this isn't a well thought out dram with character development and plot twists. But it wasn't trying to be. It delivers on the note that this is big, entertaining, and yes, sometimes stupid. But so is the original. I'm a 90's kid and I love the original space jam. When we all first saw that movie it hit all the right notes for the person we were at the moment in which we watched it. But it was also ridiculous. I won't ask you to rewatch it yourself because you'll love it again and again the same as me. But I challenge you, get someone who hasn't seen the movie and is generally on uninterested. Have them watch the original and then have them watch the new one. Understand that this movie wasn't made to behoove those who saw it as a young individual. This hit the notes for the target audience and sure the acting isn't great. He's not an actor. Neither was Michael Jordan. But that's the fun you get out of a movie like this. Stop critiquing it like it was supposed to be Casablanca. Relax and watch a fun filled, ridiculous, stupid movie and stop pretending like it ruined your day.

Production looked liked it tried with all of the cameos but the writing could have been better and directing could have been better
All in all I liked the message in supporting each other in being ourselves and not forcing someone to be who we want them to be
Sure LBJ acting wasn't the best but there's was some good moments.

1 start only because of Rick and Morty appearance in the movie. Meaninglessness plot with a lot of issues in it, too much advertising in every minute and too long in overall.

reviews.review_title: I actually enjoyed it a lot
reviews.content: I'm reading a lot of bad reviews about Lebrons acting and that it should have been old school. Honestly for a basketball player who isn't a actor I thought he did a great job. The looney toons characters were super cute. I dunno I thought it was really entertaining. Not what I expected but not complaining either.
Once again working to destroy my childhood. Don't waste your time.

First off ppl are saying lebron acting was bad wen u only wen his face like for half of the movie which is a cartoon where it supposed to b goofy corny and funny but I won't say is better den the first one but is not that far of like I give dis a 8/10 and the regular one a 8.5/10 and the plot was better den the regular one if we being real bc aliens vs a video game is way more better so yall last me with dat one but I see y'all just b saying stuff trying to hold the movie to the highest Standard of all time I see lmao.
OFC is a LeBron James fan movie, he will be never be Jordan, but we have to let it go... If we want a movie 25 y later for adults this is not for you.
Not bad based of the first space jam, just didn't like how Lebron was forcing jokes at times that weren't funny, but other than that it wasn't bad.
Worse movvie i ever watchedprogamming knowledge 10000)00000))00$$$$%$**"!"*

reviews.review_title: Don't believe the bad reviews, a good romp to watch with the kids!
reviews.content: I was gutted to see the poor reviews here, and was a bit trepidatious about taking my 8yr old niece. I shouldn't have been, we both really enjoyed it! Really great music (hip hop, new and old), amazing graphics / animations, old school characters from my youth - bugs, daffy etc, Don Cheadle was really great as the baddie, and ok LeBron maybe not the best actor but i've seen worse actual actors! The pacing was great and i even shed a little tear at the end. We were both energised after the viewing and I would definitely watch it again.Ok bad points I guess shoe horning in every film / show Warner Bros ever made, but it was actually quite fun looking for the different characters from films gone by! I laughed a number of times and we were dancing in our seats.I only watched the original once and it was so long ago i can't remember it, maybe that's important so as not to tarnish watching this!If you can bury the cynic in you and go for a good time then you shouldn't be disappointed. Ignore the negative reviews here and give it a chance you never know you might just enjoy it!

reviews.content:
I wanna watch the film and if it is fun I rate to 10
and I have 2 phone to rate.

reviews.review_title: Why do you guys hate it?
reviews.content:
This movie is 1 million% a masterpiece. Although I personally don't mind Lebron James in this movie, there's just so many good things about it! The soundtrack, the exciting scenes, the epic moments, and I'm also surprised to see some emotional parts in this movie, such as the halftime scene and Lebron reuniting with his son. However, I have one complaint. Marvin the Martian getting a minor role in this movie was something I wasn't too happy about. Seriously, would it kill the director if we, oh I don't know, PUT HIM ON THE TUNE SQUAD?? Aside from that, the movie was really amazing. The ending where Bugs Bunny was dying was really sad and actually made me cry when I watched this in theaters. Who ever thought that a looney tunes movie would have such an emotional and tearjerking ending? I seriously cannot watch the death scene without crying...
Overall, I give this movie a 20/10 and 1 million stars. And for the toons, thank you for being apart of my life.
Nothing but stupid plugs. A movie you didn't think that would be good anyways is even worse than thought. All it is is stale internet catch phrases.

Movie was cool Lebron can't act jus like Jordan can't .. people gotta chill, the original wasn't amazing either but I love it any way this movie was jus different soundtrack is cool, def a good watch wit family. People say it's bad because the nostalgia associated with the first one an it not living up to that level .. a cool black family who gets sucked in to the Looney Tune universe good lessons of being a father an also growing up being your own person .. positive message positive images of a strong black man doing well for his family.

reviews.review_title: Way better than the first Space Jam movie
reviews.content: For a kids movie this was really entertaining. A lot of Lebron haters gonna rate this low but as a movie enthusiast this was a fun movie to watch.

Saw this movie in theatre. I did not think it was as good as the first Space Jam, however it is definitely worth watching! It took a while to get going, but once they started playing basketball, it got better. There were some funny moments and easter eggs throughout. I just wish it had more to do with the first movie. I thought Lebron did great and that it's definitely more kid friendly than anything.
This movie was so boring and way to new for a space jam this gaming stuff it wasn't even a real game at the end. It was such a shame I was waiting so long and now it was TRASH!
Great visual animation. A few comical references but overall fell flat, not quite enjoyable could have just played on my phone.

The producers were like, "let's just get Lebron's name on something and sell our garbage." There's little to no real basketball. And, the game is like Who's Line Is it Anyway--the points don't matter. So, the whole movie falls apart. WB fills this vacancy by throwing in as many WB characters as they can. Save your money and watch paint dry. The movie is as good as Lebron's acting.

I thoroughly enjoyed this extremely refreshing non gratuitous family friendly movie. This is the first movie in a long time that did not require me to fast forward past distasteful scenes.Don Cheadle was absolutely brilliant as always. Definitely one that I will enjoy with my grandchildren for years to come.

Space Jam: A New Legacy is about a basketball game that the king Lebron James has to play to save his own son, because he has been catched by the ALG. In the middle of all this he found the looneys, and is with them that he plays.
I would give 1 but there is big chungus.and big chungus is big chungus all pray to big chungus.

Two hours of Nike advertising, this is what I dreamed of (no)

This was for real the movie they decided to put out? Like ok yeah I get it's aimed at a younger audience but it was basically a 2 hour commercial for Warner Bros.Was lame, I'm glad I watched on HBO max and not in a theatre at least. I could turn off and watch something else when I wanted to.
Wasted my money and time in this steaming pile of garbage. Lebron tries so hard to be Michael Jordan and miserably fails. This movie is a cringe fest and no one should watch it. Period.
Oh man guess Lebron can't be better than Jordan at anything what a joke of a movie complete waste of time.

reviews.review_title: Feeble plot, bad acting, no substance
reviews.content: The first thing I noticed right away was Lebron's acting, which is obviously not his best skill but I thought: 'hey, he's a ball player so I can let that go.' His family did a good job despite it not being their forte either but I wanted to like Lebron more and I just didn't. He wasn't as charming, humble and comical as Michael Jordan was in the original so overall I found his presence off putting as much as I don't hold it against him.The villain... so here, they were trying to make it 'current' but they didn't need to do that. Really. Not every movie has to talk about social media and followers and gaming and be over the top with CGI. But for this movie, it had to be a thing and it all further bled away the hope of a decent plot.

Nothing I was expecting from a Space Jam movie! Don't waste your money to go to the cinema, if you want to watch it, download it from somewhere or watch it online. I'm so glad I didn't go to cinema to see it!

reviews.review_title: Can I get a refund for this garbage?
reviews.content: Would have given it -1 stars if possible. It offers nothing. You'd be better off staring at a trashcan for 1.5hrs.

NOT WORTH PAYING IN THEATER!One of the worst movie I have seen this year, LeBron's acting was terrible, Plot was awful , I can't believe 25 years later , someone made movie this bad with advanced technology. Please don't waste your time watching this moreover no kid will ever relate this garbage to their childhood so don't make your kids watch this either.
There was no element that we can call "new," it won't generate a legacy and it wasn't a jam. I will not waste my time writing a longer review as this movie already wasted 2 hours of my life.
Let's all be honest here, this isn't a great or even good movie. You could've done so much better. Acting and direction were basically fighting to see which was worse.0 out of 10.
Just one big commercial for Lebron James. Boring, over done "storyline". Not worth your time.

reviews.review_title: One more think MJ is better than LeBron at, acting!
reviews.content: I would rather watch the emoji movie than this terrible movie.

I very rarely write movie reviews because I feel that everyone should approach each film with a clean slate and open mind. What entertains some might not entertain others. And don't get me started on "critics" whose opinions I rarely agree with.However I felt compelled to help counter these downright hateful and biased reviews for Space Jam: A New Legacy. I had a ton of nostalgia and remember loving the original as a kid. When I go back to watch it as an adult it mediocre at best and not good acting. I had my children watch with me to get them excited for the new one and they hated it so much they couldn't sit through half of it.However they have watched A New Legacy at least ten times and I'm sitting here as it plays on the TV yet again. It's targeted for kids and it definitely succeeds in that way!Some great things about the movie:
All of the WB references and cameos that the whole family will love. Harry Potter, DC Heroes, Scooby-Doo, Lord of the Rings, Austin Powers, even Pennywise just to name a few.Family theme. The storyline highlights that everyone has different interests and talents and they should be celebrated. Even if they are different than what you want for them. This is a good lesson for parents. In the beginning LeBron is trying to force basketball on his son, but realizes that there's more to life than basketball in the end.Modernized story. Instead of villains who possess players in their sleep, this story chooses a plot that appeals to today's youth. Technology and video games gone wrong.Looney Tunes. The Toons are so well animated and so funny! Their shenanigans are just as good as the first movie, arguably even better. Lola is a strong and fearless female. Bugs is great. Granny is hilarious. Wile E Coyote and Roadrunner are still going at it. Every Looney Tunes character is in their element and adds great comedy and entertainment to the film.Comedy. Even if LeBron is not a trained and award winning actor, he does a fine job of delivering those comedic moments. There were a few times I giggled, and several times my kids always laugh out loud.Minority cast. All of the main characters in this film are black and that is something to be celebrated. Representation matters.Feel good ending. Who doesn't like a good happy ending? There are lessons to be learned about family, priorities, empathy, and individuality. I can get behind all of that.Overall this is not a 10 star film. More like 6-7 perhaps, as others have said. But I definitely can see that, as anticipated, LeBron's haters jumped on the opportunity to attack him via this film's reviews. Even that is hard to understand, since in real life he is a stand up guy, a family man, a good father, a faithful husband, and is doing countless acts of charity for his community. I don't watch basketball, ever. But stats are stats, he's one of the GOAT. I feel bad for the people who took time out of their day to trash talk a KIDS movie because of their own biases.To those of you trying to decide if you want to watch this film, I say ignore the haters, give it a chance and an open mind, and make your own judgements. If you are expecting an exact remake of the original, it's not that. It is modernized and adapted for current times. Give fun a chance, you might actually enjoy it!

There is a "Michael Jordan" twist that hits its mark. Also, the father-son relationship was compelling. Don Cheadle nailed his part as the villian. I just wish the producers had paid attention to the little things. This is a first, in that, it got all of the big things right, but screwed the pooch on the little things. The background characters, a motley crue of WB characters, were terrible! So much so, that it was distracting. Same moves over and over, terrible "just act like you're cheering and we'll cut you a check" acting. This could have been a great movie had they paid attention to the little things. That being said, my son and I enjoyed it as a little "boy time" together. Also, and I can't stress this enough, Don Cheadle is a truly great actor. He is the best part of this movie!

reviews.review_title: Can Legoat be like his airness, or will he flop?
reviews.content:
Space Jam: A New Legacy is the apparent sequel to the cult classic Space Jam starring Michael Jordan, but can this movie be a jam like its predecessor or will it flop like LeBron? This movie seems to understand what it's about, a silly kid's movie with Looney Tunes characters and the NBA's biggest star, but is that where the similarities end for this sequel? Unfortunately, yes, as Space Jam: A New Legacy just seems to have a lack of flow and consistency (like Khris Middleton). Whenever the movie seems like it's going to develop something, it seems that the scene transitions or the entire atmosphere is completely altered. This movie's pacing is too fast and nothing seems coherent, which seems great for a looney tunes short, but not for a feature-length film. The fast pace makes the movie seem lost at times with new characters being added for no reason and a plot that is easily
forgettable and, at times, unfocused. This movie doesn't make LeBron LeGoat or LeBum, just LeAverage. This movie gets a 6/10 😐

This is, without exaggeration, one of the worst movies I've ever seen. My review has nothing to do with my opinion of Lebron - I think he's a very talented basketball player, but this movie just flat out isn't enjoyable for adults - especially if you are planning to watch for nostalgia or as a basketball fan; I strongly recommend that you reconsider. I can't even comprehend these reviews with scores over 5. To put this into perspective: I have never wrote a movie review before, but this film was so insufferable that I felt the need to share my horrible experience with the internet with the hope that anyone who reads this won't make the same mistake that I did.Where do I even start; the story line doesn't ever command interest or emotion from the audience at any point of the movie. Worst - most of the ideas don't have enough depth to make sense of... it gives the impression that this script was rushed and scribbled onto a bar napkin at 4am.Theres no real logical flow or plot development at any segment. It seems like a chore to watch this movie unfold; it forces itself as a comedy directed at older audiences based on the references (or those familiar with Lebrons history) but with only a few jokes landing throughout the 2 hours.The game itself is furthest thing from actual basketball. If you are watching this as a basketball fan you will be cringing during this extended portion of the movie.No interactions throughout the entire movie are believable, and worse off, everything that happens is very predictable.To give my silver lining: The CGI is impressive, and the theme of the movie could be a positive influence; but neither of these factors are even close to making this movie enjoyable.Overall, I feel like I could go on and on about how hard this movie is to get through; especially if I used spoilers and gave specific examples but I will instead, digress; I feel like I've wasted enough time just watching this movie and writing this review. Adults need to avoid this movie at all costs - there is only one space jam movie in my mind.

That's all, folks!

So outlandishly bad that it demands to be watched through till the end, if only to see where its rock bottom truly lies. This new iteration of the 90's nostalgia cannon featuring Michael Jordan lacks all the original's wit and charm. Instead, it chooses to substitute those elements with product placement and IP crossover elements that cheapen the film immensely while doing a lousy job of distracting from how poor the plot elements are throughout the film's much too long runtime. The entire film seems like one big, self-initiated pat on the back for Warner Brothers as they finally find a way to cash in on their every property simultaneously. It didn't work for Spielberg in Ready Player One, it certainly doesn't pay off for director Malcolm D. Lee either. It's also a self-indulgent showcase for Lebron James, who's acting is atrocious throughout, in a way that it never was for Jordan. The whole thing winds up feeling more than a little masturbatory. It's a love note written to Lebron James and Warner Brothers, written by Lebron James and Warner Brothers, and featuring Lebron James and Warner Brothers.

It's worth exactly one watch.
 
Reasons to watch:
1. If you're a basketball fan
2. If you are a millennial and want to see a Space Jam movie that's made for the modern era basketball fan.
3. If you have kids.
 
Any or all of these are reasons to watch the movie.
 
Reasons to never watch this movie again:
1. It's a cash grab (like the original)
2. It failed to be the cultural staple that it's predecessor was. Heck... it isn't even THAT relevant to modern era basketball culture. "Monstars" remains in the Basketball fan lexicon... "Goon Squad" isn't.
3. You can just tell it was written by committee. Everything from the pro-tech message, the villian algo-rhythm, Lola Bunny being redesigned... it's as though it were written for just this one moment, which is unsurprising, but it definitely dated itself.

LeBron James worked hard to be the greatest and he's not about to let his son Dom be a slacker. Instead of basketball, Dom only wants to be a video game designer. WB's new computer algorithm Al G. Rhythm (Don Cheadle) wants to use LeBron's popularity to dominate the social media space. After LeBron rejects the offer, Al G. Rhythm kidnaps LeBron and Dom into the computer world. LeBron has to play a basketball game to win freedom for himself and his son. LeBron is sent to Tune World where he finds a lonely Bugs Bunny.

LeBron is a functional actor and I like the older style Looney Tunes cartoon world. I love the Michael B. Jordan bit. I like some bits in this movie but it's way too long and too much of this is below par. The best part of this movie is Bugs Bunny in his Looney Tunes world and then they go off to various franchises to search for the rest of his friends. I like all of that. I like the animation style. Quite frankly, an animated LeBron James allows him off the hook for his acting. His voice is unique and works well for animation. Turning him in cartoon is a good thing. He doesn't have to act. He should stay a cartoon until he wins the game.

His son Dom is a big problem. He's a brat. The excuse is that he gets enticed by Al G. Rhythm but it's a sorry excuse. At no point is he concerned about being in a computer simulation or about his father. The solution lies in Al turning Dom into a monster. When LeBron has his big emotional speech, Dom can slowly turn back into a boy looking to hug his father. That is much better characterization and progression in his story arc.

Finally, this movie is hella busy and way too long. It is almost two hours long. The game is almost an hour long. They need to cut out at least fifteen minutes if not more. There is so much chaotic action that the long game section grows tiresome. People are excusing this for being a kids movie. Some of these references are going right over those kids' heads. They are not going to get A Clockwork Orange. For people who get all the references, this is bad for them. For kids who don't get the references, there's no point to it. This movie has fun bits. I love the Looney Tunes animation section. I don't like them digitized into computer animated. The plot is bad simplistic writing. The father son conflict could have been done better. This is way too long and that pushed me over the edge.

I am not sure what was worse, the poor acting, the grade-schooler script or the fact that it was a two hour infomercial for LeBron James. The plot was very poorly written. Do not waste your time on this one!

Space Jam: A New Legacy is an entertaining sequel.  Because it came more than a decade later, it had way better graphics and special effects. The flashy, almost psychedelic visuals can be over the top though. The plot is simple with a moral lesson about family relationship and acceptance. The Looney Tunes characters are funnier here than in the first movie. They were also given an upgrade from 2D to 3D animation in the latter part of the movie. Some people might not like Warner Brothers' shameless branding, but I love how they featured some of their most well-loved movie characters from different fandoms. As expected, the basketball games were wacky and hilarious. It's understandable that LeBron James' acting was bland because he's not really an actor. But Don Cheadle was terrific as the main villain. I also like how they included Sonequa Martin-Green from The Walking Dead, because she's a fine actress. This sequel may not be as innovative as its predecessor, but for me, it's funnier and the visuals are way better. I think kids and LeBron's fans will enjoy it the most.

I thought the movie was stupid.

The original Space Jam is obviously an advertisement, sure, but it still top lines as a Looney Tunes movie. This, above all else, feels like a motion billboard for HBO Max with a runtime that overstays its welcome by about a half-hour.

Warner Bros seems to have used this as an opportunity to chase what makes Fortnite a fun experience but by being entirely hands-off it takes away from what gives that game its sandbox magic. Added to that, the story in Space Jam: A New Legacy is straight up Hook. A villainous character kidnaps the child of its adversary and pretends to support their interests to turn them against their father. LeBron James is Peter Pan and Bugs Bunny is Rufio.

It's not entirely surprising, considering both the director and cinematographer left due to creative differences with the studio after filming had already begun - one could assume they wanted to be creative - and roughly thirty people ended up touching the script. Another case of "too many cooks," it's so over-saturated that it became bland. Mixing every color of paint will end up neutral no matter how much heavily contrasted neon accents it.

Gratuitous background usage of Hollywood Boulevard-esque takes on characters when you're inside of WB's IP universe is one thing but who are some of these old gag references for? Why is there a U Can't Touch this break? Was that from a draft of the Tony Hawk or Jackie Chan sequels that never came to fruition almost thirty years ago?

I do appreciate the Friday Night Lights reference, so props to that, but I'm also thirty-six.

Looney Tunes has a history of referencing older media but what's happened here is more like Family Guy's "This reminds me of..." breakouts rather than reverence and homage to things that, at one point, were contemporaries of Looney Tunes. Their brand-loyalty was also self-aware, making fun of themselves instead of looking at the WB water tower and placing their hand over their hearts, which is how I saw the characters in this movie.

Space Jam: A New Legacy could have successfully tapped into nostalgia with sincerity and heart but its rehashed and half-hearted story, off-the-mark references, and gluttony of "Hey look at this show! And this movie!" end up resulting in more of a brick than a slam dunk.

It's significantly more realistic that somebody's conscious is transmitted digitally than being pulled into Looney Tune land through a golf hole. Since when did realism dictate whether a children's movie is good or not? Secondly, yes, LeBron's acting is mediocre, but so was Michaels. In fact, I would argue that Michael's acting was even worse. I found this to be an incredibly long movie, but that's at least half my fault. I went to see it at a drive-in theater with our 2-year-old in tow because the place had a playground and a business model of showing a kid's movie first and then an adult movie past when they would likely fall asleep. It worked for about 30 minutes, but then I learned that I was supposed to keep the car engine running or else the a/c would kill my battery. The car died and managed to play sound out of the radio for about 10 more minutes before we were stuck listening to the last ~hour of the movie through a distant speaker while we sweat in the car and the kid became fussy. Granted, I had went into this expecting a brisk experience since the first Space Jam had came in under 90 minutes; I didn't know this was almost 2 hours long when we started. Anyway, Bron's acting was no better than Jordan's was but there was a lot more obfuscation available with the improvements in animation over the last 25 years. There was far less comedy and I didn't like any of the videogame aspect at all; they treated this like a remake rather than a sequel, but didn't respect the original enough to realize what had worked well the first time. It wasn't a complete waste of time, and it wasn't the worst sequel to a beloved original I've seen (that would be Zoolander 2), but the room for improvement was massive here.

This review contains spoilers.
I have neither grown up nor idolized the first chapter back in 1996. And indeed, I already knew that I would not see the new Zootopia.
But if there is one thing that has kept me away from the film until then, besides the Italian language, it is the bad reviews given to the film. And after having seen it in the original language, I will tell you, many are absolutely justified.
The film features a MASSIVE presentation of the brands held by Warner in sometimes suffocating and blatantly propagandistic quantities. It is not that I did not appreciate the cameos, for heaven's sake, but they are just cameos without real substance and usefulness.
Speaking instead of the plot, it is in fact the first space Jam, with only small tricks such as the fact that this time it is the ptotagonist who is looking for the Looney Tunes and not vice versa. Tricks, however, that give more meaning to the plot. But let's not deny that the father-son relationship is one of the most predictable and clichéd things I've ever seen in similar contexts: there is no outlet for originality or deviation. Moreover, the near-death of Bugs does not work, since we are talking about immortal brands.
The acting skills leave a lot to be desired: LeBron is clearly seen that he is not an actor and his expressions are plastic.
The jokes are funny, but only in part: some are based on pop culture that has already aged or will soon get old.
But now let's move on to the more positive sides of the film: the animations are spectacular and brilliantly mix live action, 2D animation and CGI. I also have to say that I really admire the Looney Tunes design in CGI and honestly I would have liked to see them more like that.
The references in the middle are great and for the most part funny.
My take on this film is almost identical to Sherlock Gnomes: both are undoubtedly bad films, but they have redeeming qualities that make for decent experiences.
In general, the film has poor writing, acting skills that define skill is overkill, and a noticeable cash back on Warner products
BUT
nevertheless, it is fun and the animations are among the best seen in recent years.
If you are a fan of the former, you will surely love it. And that was all Warner cared about.
With top animations but mundane and weak story, Space Jam: A New Legacy is okay

I adored this movie with my whole entire heart! That last half a star was only left out because I am well aware a lot of my love for this movie is nostalgia fueled. But, if you are a fellow lover of Looney Tunes, this is a stellar movie to watch. Even if you aren't, it's still a ton of fun! The movie itself looks wonderful- all of the colors, animation, and CGI are beautifully done. The soundtrack of the movie is insanely good, pulling you into the movie, setting the correct mood, and overall just being a collection of really good songs I could not help but have on repeat weeks after watching the movie. Considering who the main cast consists of, its inevitable that there's a few not-so-well acted scenes, but those take up barely any time compared to a lot of the other really good scenes. The humor is also great! I died of laughter, and could still list them out laughing if I weren't trying to keep this review spoiler-free. Overall, go watch it! You, your kids, your family, your friends- it's great for all!

The bar was set so low from it's predecessor that I came into this film quite unenthusiastically.

Aptly named "A New Legacy" this film is clearly a G rated product intended for parents to take their children to see. The plot is structured around classic familial themes and leans heavily on a "video game" premise to cater to the smart-phone generation. However it's also disturbingly obsessed with flaunting WB's many owned IP's.

I don't know if drowning the audience in referential humor and cameos was the way to go but I guess you can argue WB literally is the only company that has the right to do it, so why not?

A lot of reviewers argue it diminishes and pushes back the Loony Tunes cast but if you actually watch the film it's pretty obvious they don't. Bugs and friends are constantly asserting their personality and putting their own whacky or zany context on other IPs. I would even argue they play a bigger role than the original where Roadrunner didn't even get screen time on the court.

I think the only huge missed opportunity of the project was not making Bill Murray the main antagonist (Al-G Rhythm), that would've been golden.

Space Jam: A New Legacy is good enough, it's visually engaging (classic 2D animation is great and the 3D is up to industry standards), the story is a serviceable family themed narrative and it's at least interesting to see the Loony Tunes cast trounce around in the world of WB owned IPs.

space jam a new legacy is worth a watch but in comparison to its predecessor its a crying same

- the story- the story was quite lacklustre not bad necessarily but its clear the spent way more time and money on including pop cultural references rather than developing the story properly. the stories main issue is that it focuses on getting the loony toons in pop cultural situation like Lola in wonder woman and Taz with Rick and Morty, if they had just left them all in toon town this would give more time for a better more well fleshed out story.

-characters- the main villain Don Cheadle as al g rithim  was one of the few good characters, as a villain he was a cartoon villain but had more depth than the main character of LeBron who was in fact a bland character, there's very little reason to care past basic human decency matter of fact i sort of hated him at the start he was a cantankerous old fart of a father who was pushing his own dream on to his kids despite him living his own dreams. the loony toons again were boring not being loony in any real extent till the end of the film.  

-over all- despite the overall negativity of what i just wrote would still watch it if its on any steam services on the near future. while the story was bland it wasn't bad there was a reason for it to happen in universe and the rogue AI element was done well, in addition to that none of the loony toons acted out of character for there character it just expects you to have seen the original cartoons. I would say if you have some extra change and you have a while to spare its worth a watch but don't go out of your way to see it.

I don't understand why they even bothered, the first Space Jam movie wasn´t great (In my opinion) but, at least the people behind the film, knew what it was doing, it was a simple plot, and in a new Legacy they complicate the plot, they though that, just for the fact the movie will have popular WB characters (In the background), the film will be a succeed, but I gotta say that, despite the film is 2 hours long, it´s not a super boring movie.

From the sublime, to er, well, Bugs Bunny. Back in 1996, I remember being enthralled by Space Jam when I watched it on VHS. I was only six, and hadn't had the pleasure of seeing Who Framed Roger Rabbit (1988). Somewhat shamefully, I still haven't. But Space Jam was lunacy at its best, using Michael Jordan at the height of his powers to launch a film alongside the Looney Tunes. So why the need for a sequel twenty five years on? Well, twenty minutes into Space Jam: A New Legacy, the answer is obvious. ££££££££ for Warner Brothers. It may as well be called Warner Brothers: A New Legacy. It's a two hour advert for the company. LeBron James is the NBA star at the centre of it, and to be fair to him he does a perfectly fine job as the star, losing his son to baddie Don Cheadle inside the 'serververse' inside WB studio headquarters. Mad enough for you yet? At almost two hours, SJ2 is way too long, considering the attention span of the age group it's mainly aimed at, and it takes around twenty minutes to see a Tune on screen. Thankfully, once the Tunes are introduced, the film does pick up, it's fun just to see them on screen and some of them remain as amusing as ever. As we travel through various WB worlds to track down some of the tunes, including Matrix world, Harry Potter world, Metropolis (yes, really) one begs the question are Warner Brothers on the brink of some horrific collapse we don't know about? Or is it just crass commercialism of the highest order? We all know the answer. For the kids there is plenty to enjoy; presumably the plot that centres around a video game designed by James' son is to attract the millions of youngsters who spend all their free time glued to screens. But I did laugh several times; there's an excellent gag involving Michael Jordan towards the end that makes it almost worth it, and LeBron James certainly convinces you that he cares for his family, and that the reason behind all the mayhem is family. I believed that in a way you simply don't when Vin Diesel tries to persuade you of the same thing in the Fast & Furious films (that I'm a big fan of I might add). So it's pointless, it's crass almost beyond belief in its monetary ambitions, but there's enough in it that held both mine and my three year olds attention for two hours. Just.

It's a Looney Tunes movie for kids, better than the original Space Jam (I'm not blinded by nostalgia like other viewers, the film only had a Bill Murray cameo to offer for entertainment value and completely wastes the Roger Rabbit aesthetic.) This sequel isn't great, yes it is still an advertisement for other Warner Bros. properties, just like The LEGO Movie, Ready Player One, and other films before it, but like those, it's seductive in it's bizarre presentation style. It's funny, most importantly pertaining, and it respects the Looney Tunes brand by featuring an ACTUAL cartoon segment of the film that feels like Looney Tunes! It's definitely still got problems, but I still enjoyed it even at two hours. It's more for adults than kids with it's referential humor though. It's a surreal see-it-to-believe-it situation. That's all, folks. 6/10.

Space Jam 2 is in (Theaters and HBO Max) is a hard film to review.   The screenplay is wonky - with old movie references (many of which are R rated or adult skewing films...Matrix, Casablanca, Fury Road, and Training Day)  My 11 and 13 year old found it funny (but were aided by knowing some of the references from Simpson parodies the films (as opposed to the films themselves).   The looney tunes stuff mostly worked. Lebron struggled but it was hard to tell whether it was a lack of acting talent (he has been fine in minor roles in the past) or the fact the screenplay makes him mostly a pill for most of the film.  The movie fails to use the idea of the Warnervese well (except for the crowd at the big game) and I think pulling from that IP catalog would have worked better for the goon squad (II) than what they ended up with animal/nba hybrids.  The film is super flashy (and those with epilepsy should avoid it).  For me it was a 2 1/2 out of 5 but my kids would rate it slightly higher. I would note that really young kids (under 4) were struggling in the theater and the film seems aimed slightly older.

You just need to have fun with it, not take it seriously, and it ends up being great. Yes, we get it. The movies are a huge marketing campaign. You know what? Who cares? I hope to see a new Space Jam movie in another 25 years! Let it be the century for Space Jam, WB.

Twenty-five plus years ago some advertising executives thought it would be entertaining to mix a famous basketball star with some cartoon characters to sell shoes. Apparently this concept was "good" enough to make a movie. Now, take that concept, age it 25 years, throw in a ridiculously large budget, use a plot from any 80's family sitcom and then tie it all together with images of every property license WB has at its disposal and put them ALL on the screen at the same time. That list of points is literally the experience of watching this "movie." It's not a movie, but it's not really a commercial either because most properties displayed don't really have anything in production at the moment. To further complicate things, Looney Toons are not even popular with children at the moment let alone the majority of the properties displayed in the movie's background. This means that the movie fails at capturing children's attention and there is not enough nostalgia to keep adults' attention. This is just a mess through and through.

When you see a movie with 2 directors and 6 screenwriters, you can figure things will be a mess. That many different voices can’t be a good sign of a unified creative approach. Sadly, this lives down to those expectations. LeBron James is asWhen you see a movie with 2 directors and 6 screenwriters, you can figure things will be a mess. That many different voices can’t be a good sign of a unified creative approach. Sadly, this lives down to those expectations. LeBron James is as stiff as his predecessor Michael Jordan in this reboot of the 1996 film. He and his young son (played by an actor) get trapped in a digital world where they’re pitted against each other by AI (Don Cheadle, desperately trying to bring the funny). James enlists the classic Looney Tunes characters for his team, which should be where the comedy comes, but alas, their wisecracks never land…they just play to their physical gag stereotypes. Not only is the movie never funny, but in an attempt to add a family friendly heart, there’s too much time wasted on the father/son relationship. Young’uns will be able to enjoy the animated whimsy, but anyone with any standards will just yawn or stop playback early.

I understand this movie was made for kids however as a parent I am the one who has to endure these kid movies. I don’t know about some of you parents if my kids want me to spend time with them watching a movie then I’m spending time with them. Not only that with all that’s going on I wanted to be right there to make sure they weren’t trying to push some ideas onto my kids. With that being said this movie was terrible. I gave it a chance I really did. Don Cheadle carried the movie which says a lot since Lebron was the main character. I cringed the whole time they referred to him as a king. My kids actually thought he was a king and I of course had to explain to them that he in fact wasn’t. The voices of the Looney Tunes sounded like cheap knock offs. Zendaya being “a great actress” couldn’t even pull off a cartoon voice as always because she can’t act. The only funny parts about the movie was when they referenced GOT “Winter is coming” and when Daffy thought Michael B. Jordan was Michael Jordan. Other than that my kids got bored and we put on the Space Jam with Michael Jordan. They ended up having more laughs with that one. They’ve been watching that one on repeat ever since. Overall I give this a generous 1 for the king.

A ironically hilarious film but an absolutely terrible film none the less. Everything about this film doesn’t work. The story, the acting, the CGI, the references, the script. All of it feels terrible compared to the first film. The firstA ironically hilarious film but an absolutely terrible film none the less. Everything about this film doesn’t work. The story, the acting, the CGI, the references, the script. All of it feels terrible compared to the first film. The first film isn’t that great either but at least it was self aware. This isn’t. The film doesn’t understand when it is making fun of itself and it shows. I enjoyed the references in the first film as they felt natural but this was Ready Player One on steroids and if you don’t like Ready Player One like me, then this will be a nightmare. Sometimes there are cool Easter eggs in the background but some of it feels weird. I love A Clockwork Orange but it still feels weird to see a bunch of characters from that movie watching a Basketball Game. The humor is unintentionally funny. I never laughed at a joke they were trying to make but I laughed at almost everything else because it was so bad that it’s funny. I enjoyed watching this movie but that was probably because I was with friends. I feel like watching this on your own is a painful experience. I did find myself being painfully bored during points but the jokes my friends were making and their reactions helped keep my interest. All of the performances are AWFUL. Lebron James did an awful job. Michael Jordan wasn’t great in the first film either but his performance felt intentionally funny but this was just painful to watch. Don Cheadle was really weird as well. The only reason I kind of enjoyed his performance was because I was joking about him the whole time. The script is the most predictable boring story ever. The first film’s script was predictable as well but the journey to get there was fun and this wasn’t fun. The visual effects look kind of decent at times except Live Action Lola Bunny. Her eyes look really really weird for some reason. I would really only recommend this if you watch it with friends. It’s a lot funnier to watch this with other people than on your own.

rt_summary: When LeBron James and his young son Dom are trapped in a digital space by a rogue A.I., LeBron must get them home safe by leading Bugs, Lola Bunny and the whole gang of notoriously undisciplined Looney Tunes to victory over the A.I.'s digitized champions on the court: a powered-up roster of professional basketball stars as you've never seen them before. It's Tunes versus Goons in the highest-stakes challenge of his life, that will redefine LeBron's bond with his son and shine a light on the power of being yourself.
